text: At the end of the twenty-first century, half a million people have gone to live in orbit around the earth.  They live in forty-one satellites (each called a World), some to get away from religion persecution, and others trying to create the perfect ‚ÄòWorld‚Äô.  The largest of the Worlds is New New York.  New New (as the inhabitants call it) is a captured asteroid that has been hollowed out.Each year, a few candidates are chosen to be sent to Earth for a year.  In that year they learn about the economics that exist between the Worlds and the major earth countries.  Marianne O‚ÄôHara has been chosen because she plans on being an Earth liaison specialist.  During her stay on Earth, she gets involved in two movements.  One group is contemplating declaring the Worlds a Republic; the second is planning a third American Revolution.The power in America is concentrated among a few privileged families.  Because of this oligarchy the average citizen has little or no control over their own life.  There are many groups who want to overthrow the government but their plans for a new America are at different ends of the political spectrum.  Should this third revolution take America‚Äôs eye off the SSU (the successor to the Soviet Union), there is a chance that the SSU will strike against their age old enemy.Thinking that Worlds have gotten to independent, there is also a group who want to ‚Äòteach the Worlds a lesson‚Äô, and put them in their ‚Äòplace‚Äô.  Marianne having grown up in a closed World, is a naÔve waif on this planet of radical politics.  She is unwittingly brought into a conspiracy that could be destructive to both America and the Worlds.Much of this book, the first in a trilogy, is spent explaining to the reader the relationship of Earth to the Worlds (both economically and politically) and between the Worlds.  It‚Äôs well thought out and explained, and is reasonable to a point.  I‚Äôll have a better opinion after I‚Äôve started the second book.Zeb Kantrowitz  zworstblog.blogspot.com

Bertolt Brecht (poet and lyricist) and Kurt Weill (composer) collaborative (B&W) relationship; the three women in their lives ‚Äì Helene Weigl (Brecht's actor-wife),; Elisabeth Hauptmann (Brecht's mistress and collaborator) and Lotta Lenya, Weill's actor-wife. Pamela Katz tells the story of these five people, their friends and other collaborators that produced an amazing body of work during the interwar (Weirmar Republic) years in Germany.Probably their two most famous (and remembered) operas were ‚ÄúOff to Mahagonny‚Äù and the ‚ÄúThree Penny Opera‚Äù.  ‚ÄúMahagonny‚Äù was written first and was ready for the stage in 1927 as a ‚ÄúSongspiel‚Äù (or concert work) that included the songs ‚ÄúAlabama Song‚Äù and ‚ÄúBenares Song‚Äù.  The full opera was first presented in 1929, with Lotte Lenya the main soprano part of ‚ÄúJenny-the whore‚Äù; it was banned by the Nazis in 1933 .Unlike traditional operas of the eighteenth and nineteenth century, love doesn‚Äôt conquer all nor does divine intervention enter to save the day.  Corruption and vice prosper as do the criminal elements.  Brecht presented it as a satire on the ‚ÄúWeimar Republic‚Äù where behind the fa√ßade of normalcy, Germany was degenerating into a cesspool of corruption.  As a tip of the hat to Marx, B&W see prostitution as a result of society and lawlessness, not of poverty.B&W‚Äôs masterpiece, ‚ÄúThe Threepenny Opera‚Äù is based on the 1728 opera (‚ÄúThe Beggar‚Äôs Opera‚Äù) by the Englishman, John Gay.  Gay wrote the play in opposition to the current French and Italian romantic style.  It was the first ‚Äúsatirical ballad‚Äù opera, using popular music, folk tunes and church chants as its‚Äô musical basis.  B&W decided to write a modern version in honor of its‚Äô 200th anniversary.Set in Victorian London, the play focuses on Macheath (Mackie Messer or Mack the Knife), an amoral, anti-hero.  He marries Polly Peachum, whose father controls the beggars of London.  Her father isn‚Äôt happy about the marriage and tries to get rid of Mack.  But Mack‚Äôs old Army buddy (Tiger Brown) is now the Chief of Police.  But Peachum manages to get Mack arrested and sentenced to hang.  But at the last minute (in a deus ex machia moment) is given a pardon by the Queen.  The score was one of the first operas to use jazz as an influence on the music.Katz does a marvelous job in explaining how the details of the opera mimic much of what goes on between B&W and their own lives.  All of the women are given a thorough and honest biography including their involvements with both men, each other and the rest of the Weimar ‚ÄúCabaret‚Äù crowd.Zeb Kantrowitz  zworstblog.blogspot.com

Bishop who is one of Britain‚Äôs best known military historians wrote this book with the additional title of a ‚Äòtrue detective story‚Äô.  In pre-independence Israel, there were three main liberation armies: the Palmach, the Haganah and the Irgun.  The Irgun was the most militant of the three.  Stern was originally part of Irgun, but left to form a more radical retaliatory group.  Stern believed that the only way to win independence was to make it too difficult for the British to stay.As part of this strategy, Stern‚Äôs Group planted bombs, robbed banks and murdered Arabs and British Officers. The detective story relates to the controversial death of Avraham (Avi) Stern, former member of the Irgun and head of the ‚ÄòStern Group‚Äô (later known as Lehi) in Tel Aviv before and during WWII.  Avi Stern believed he was destined to be the Jewish liberator of British Palestine.  He was known by most Jews for his poetry written in Hebrew.As the leader of the Stern Group, later known as Lehi, he masterminded a series of high-profile terrorist attacks in this pursuit, becoming more militant as Britain shut down immigration to Palestine in the 1930s.  Having been in post-WW 1 Poland, and with the rise of the Nazis in Germany, he knew of the danger to the Jewish people of Eastern Europe.  Hunted by the Palestine Police Force (PPF), he had a bounty on his head.  Stern was living in an attic apartment, in Tel Aviv when he was killed by Assistant Superintendent Geoffrey Morton, a British colonial policeman assigned to capture him.Morton claimed Stern was shot trying to escape (sounds familiar). But witnesses insisted he was executed in cold blood. He was unarmed, the building was surrounded, there were four cops in the room and there was no way out.  His death/murder radicalized many in Israel and inspired a cult of martyrdom.  It was the straw that helped to destroy any hopes the British had of working out a compromise between, the Arabs, and the Jews.This is the story of Bishop‚Äôs quest to discover the truth about Stern‚Äôs death. Intensely researched, including access to Morton‚Äôs private archive and eyewitness interviews, it reconstructs the event.  It is an even-handed account, placed within the context of the times. Using a timeline type structure, Bishop documents the events that lead-up to the meeting on the building roof, and described the impact of Stern‚Äôs legacy on modern Israel.Zeb Kantrowitz  zworstblog.blogspot.com

This book was the first novel ever written by the Nobel Prize Winner, but it was rejected by every publisher he sent it to.  It then sat in a drawer for thirty years, until after his death when his wife found it and decided it should be published.  It doesn‚Äôt read like one of his famous novels but is worthwhile to read to see how his writing progressed from his first try to his later world appreciated style.This is a very standard type of novel for the 1950s and one of the styles that was popular at the time.  The situation is a six apartment complex in a working area of Lisbon during the post-WW2 Salazar dictatorship.  Salazar ruled a ‚Äúcorporate‚Äù state from 1932 to 1968 and upon his death the First Portuguese Republic was established.  His rule is known for its‚Äô invasiveness into all part of society and the unswerving loyalty of the military and bureaucracy to Salazar‚Äôs rule.The apartment building is full of working class people trying to survive to the next month.  On the ground floor is a cobbler and his shop where he and his wife rent out a room to a ‚Äòtraveler‚Äô.  Across the hall is a husband and wife who recently lost their only child.  Upstairs, on the first floor, is a ‚Äòkept woman‚Äô and another family where the husband and wife vie for the love of their son.  Above the single woman are a salesman, his wife and their single daughter.  Lastly are four woman, two sisters and one of the sister‚Äôs two daughters.The book follows these people as they interact with each other, other tenants and the people of Lisbon.  We watch as their lives weave from the mundane workday of a housewife, the busy times of the cobbler, the quiet days of the ‚Äòwoman‚Äô and the interactions of the four woman.  Most of these stories are banal and wouldn‚Äôt make a ‚Äòbad‚Äô telenova, but keeping in mind when the book was written, parts of it were very progressive and dangerous in a dictatorship.For those readers who know Saramago, it would be a way to compare his later works to his original start.  For the rest of us it‚Äôs just not that interesting or exciting.Zeb Kantrowitz  zworstblog.blogspot.com

This is a story that could pass for the preliminary draft of a comic cross between ‚ÄúGuardians of the Galaxy‚Äù and the ‚ÄúDirty Dozen‚Äù.  It‚Äôs written so tongue -in-cheek that the person next to you will need to duck so they don‚Äôt get poked.  It all very light hearted, and you know that they are going to get done what they need to get done even though they only have a three percent chance.This happens in the galaxy of the ‚ÄúBirthright‚Äù timeline that Resnick uses in most of his books and series.  The Universe is divided into the Democracy (the good guys, us) and the Coalition (the bad guys), with a small no-man‚Äôs land in between.  The job they are to do is to replace the despot who runs the Coalition with a clone that‚Äôs working for the Democracy.It‚Äôs the same set-up as the A-Team or Mission Impossible (the TV show), with the wise-cracking leader whose got more scars than brains (Colonel Nathan Pretorius). A tech expert Tony Levi (called Pandora), a break-in artist named Snake, a muscle who is 75% cyborg, an  empath (who can tell when you‚Äôre lying.  Also along is the clone and his trainer, and an alien who can look like anything, but only in your mind and can‚Äôt effect security systems.To get to where the Despot is, they will have to sneak into the other empire by way of the no-man‚Äôs-land and then through a large portion of the Coalition, where humans are shot on sight.  They then have to land on the most secure planet in the Coalition, kidnap the Despot and replace him with the clone and get away.  Oh, did I mention they only have a 3% chance?But it‚Äôs all in good fun, and if you suspend your brain and just read it, it‚Äôs actually a lot of fun.  Well, sort of.Zeb Kantrowitz  zworstblog.blogspot.com

Lukyanenko is from Kazakhstan but lives and writes in Russian. He is the author of the ‚ÄúNight Watch‚Äù series.  This book was originally written in 1999, and is part of a sort of trilogy of which this is the middle book.  Sergei (it‚Äôs faster than his last name) has said that it should be read first and then the prequel and sequel.  Sergei is an odd guy.‚Ä¢ Alex Romanov ‚Äî pilot-spesh, ship captain.‚Ä¢ Kim Ohara ‚Äî secret agent-spesh.‚Ä¢ Hang Morrison ‚Äî pilot-spesh.‚Ä¢ Paul Lurie ‚Äî engineering-spesh.‚Ä¢ Janet Ruelo ‚Äî spesh, five specifications, ship's doctor.‚Ä¢ Pak Generalov ‚Äî navigator, natural, homosexual.‚Ä¢ Danila C-third Shustov ‚Äî guide-spesh, third clone of Danila Shustov.‚Ä¢ Zey-so ‚Äî Zzygou female. Heiress to the throne of Zzygou.‚Ä¢ Sey-so ‚Äî Zzygou female. Zey-so's companion.‚Ä¢ Peter C-forty-fourth Valk, AKA Sherlock Holmes ‚Äî detective-spesh, forty-fourth clone of Peter Valk.‚Ä¢ Jenny Watson ‚Äî doctor, forensics expert, detective's assistant, natural.In this universe (the humans live in ‚ÄòThe Empire‚Äô), parents can choose a career for their child before it‚Äôs born.  The child grows up normally but around the age of fifteen, the child goes through a metamorphosis to the specifications that will allow it to proceed with its‚Äô life work.  These children are called ‚Äòspesh‚Äô and non-gene-manipulated children are called ‚Äònaturals‚Äô.  Some jobs are reserved for ‚Äìspesh because they can‚Äôt be done by normal humans.Pilot-spesh have no emotions so that they deal with the dangers of space travel and the loneliness of long missions.  A detective-spesh has analytical skills like a computer that help them see myriads of possibilities and to choose the best or most reasonable.Alex has just gotten out of the hospital and is looking for a job.  When he meets Kim he finds out that she is on the run from her home planet because of something she stole.  Kim is just going into metamorphosis when she literally runs into Alex.  Alex helps her though her transformation.  When he finds a pilot‚Äôs job he hires her as part of his crew, as he does with all the characters mentioned above.Peter C-Three is the guide for the two Zzygous who are passengers.  When Zey-so is murdered on the ship, the Zzgous give The Empire forty-eight hours to find the killer or they will begin a suicidal war.  This is a great ‚Äòclosed room‚Äô mystery.Zeb Kantrowitz  zworstblog.blogspot.com

Israel was not the only land that was proposed by Jewish groups during the years before it became a reality.  Nineteenth century Jews also looks at places such as Grand Isle, NY; Uganda, Angola, Madagascar, Australia and Suriname among others to relocate the mass of Jews in the Pale of Russia.The first attempt was to settle Jews on Grand Isle just down the river from Niagara Falls.  This was at the time when the Erie Canal was just being finished.  But many of the people in the area were afraid that the Jews would try to become a separate country and the possibility fell through.Prior to the Great War, it was suggested that there should be some ‚Äúempty‚Äù place in the British Empire that could be set aside for Jewish emigration.  Not all the people who were behind this were Judeo-philes, Poles and Russians felt it was the perfect way to get rid of the Jews.  The plateau in central Uganda was thought to be perfect place for the immigrants.  It had a fertile soil, mild climate, and a newly built railroad.  Of course no one asked the indigenous people how they felt.  But it didn‚Äôt work out.In the early twentieth century, the Zionist movement split over whether they should only concentrate on emigration to Israel/Palestine or for a ‚ÄòFreeland‚Äô for the Jews.  The second group became known as ‚Äòterritorialists‚Äô because they were willing to accept any land as a ‚Äòhomeland‚Äô for the Jews.  These groups were to be at odds during the rest of the first half of the century until Israel was founded.With the ‚Äòpogroms‚Äô, life in Russia for those in the Pale of Russia became more and more dangerous as the century went on.  After 1929, the depression caused more and more economic pressure being put on Eastern Europe‚Äôs Jews to emigrate.  The Polish government was willing to help their Jews to emigrate, if a place could be found for them.  Unfortunately, areas in Angola, Australia and Suriname (Dutch Guiana) would not satisfy the Zionists, who did everything they could to dissuade the colonial countries not to approve emigration.Except for Palestine, no other ‚ÄúJewish‚Äù state ever became more than an idea whose time never came.  Interesting pieces of Jewish history that are seldom mentioned.Zeb Kantrowitz  zworstblog.blogspot.com

Charles Witter Kirwan‚Äôs family has lived in Brooklyn (at 409 Witter) for so long that the street he lives on is named after his family. He lives in an immaculately kept twelve room private house (the last one on the block) on a street that is now full of run-down apartment houses.Once, this was a neighborhood of country estates and farms. That is until his grandfather built the first apartment house at 407.  It was a modern marvel when it opened, but now it‚Äôs seen better day.  Kirwan has grown to hate the minority people who are now his tenants because of their lack of respect for him and the building.The former infantry Captain and Professor of History, at a local college, has found out he is dying of cancer.  He seeks revenge for all the slights and imagined slights he has suffered over the years.  He has decided not to wait for death, but to kill himself and all of his tenants in a cataclysm of destruction.Having learned demolition during WW 2, he is going to wire the building with dynamite and bring the building down on them and himself.  He has left a collection of tapes explaining his psychotic reasoning behind what he plans.John Milano is a PI who is working on a case involving stolen paintings.  He gets involved with the receptionist (Chris Bailey) of the gallery where the paintings are being prepared so that they can be smuggled out of the country.  Milano could have been a ‚Äòwise guy‚Äô, but decided to work on the ‚Äòright‚Äô side of the law.The receptionist is a black actress who just happens to live next door to Kirwan.Milano is trying to convince Chris that inter-racial dating is not a big thing in 1980s New York City, but Chris isn‚Äôt convinced.  She thinks he‚Äôs just in it for a cheap thrill, but he‚Äôs serious.  Once he finds out about Kirwan‚Äôs plan, he has forty-eight hours to stop him, and keep the painting from being exported.Zeb Kantrowitz  zworstblog.blogspot.com

DS Mark ‚ÄòHeck‚Äô Heckenburg has been reassigned from the SCU (Serial Crimes Unit) of Scotland Yard to the Lake District.  Think of being a New York Homicide Detective and being transferred to western Maine or eastern Montana.  Not only is this an area with few town, separated from each other by country roads, but except for the summer hikers and vacationers, you can lie down in the middle of Main Street without inconveniencing anyone.  To say that Heck is bored is to like saying a hermit is lonely.The years before, this district had been terrorized by ‚ÄúThe Stranger‚Äù, a serial killer who killed ‚Äòcouples‚Äô in lover‚Äôs lanes.  He would kill the males, then torture the females, and kill them by stabbing them in the eyes.  When a young girl is found by one of the locals, wandering around in a daze, she is covered with cuts.  All she remembers is being stalked by someone and hearing them whistle ‚ÄúStrangers in the Night‚Äù.  The whistling by the killer was never let out to the media.  Could the Stranger be back?Hecks onetime girlfriend and boss at Scotland Yard, Gemma Piper, was the one who ‚Äòcaught‚Äô the Stranger.  On a decoy assignment, she fought with him and shot him in the shoulder, but lost him in the area swamps.  His body was never found.  But everyone considered that he either died from his wound or drown in one of the bogs.  Since then Piper has had a meteoric rise and is now a Detective Superintendent.When Heck hears the girl‚Äôs story, including the clubbing to death with a stone of her girlfriend who was with her, he knows he has to alert Piper.  The only help that Heck has is the local constabulary made up of a ‚Äòshiny new female constable‚Äô and a ‚Äòloser‚Äô (Read drunker) who has been posted to this backwater where he can‚Äôt get into any trouble.Just as Piper makes it up to the District, the town is hit by a blizzard and a frozen mist settles on the valley.  Nothing can move in or out of the valley as members of the community are found murdered in their isolated houses.  While Heck and Piper begin to concentrate all of the townspeople in the local tavern, the Stranger blows-up the local police station and now has the town under siege.Can Heck and Piper keep these people safe while they wait for reinforcements and the fog to lift, and can they catch the Stranger in time?Zeb Kantrowitz  zworstblog.blogspot.com

On December 15, 1944, over 300k soldiers, 1200+ tanks, and thousands of other armored vehicles and weapons,  backed  up by over 1000 planes, attacked the US First Army through the Ardennes Forest.  The German Offensive was in the exact area where the Germans had attacked in WW One and at the beginning of WW Two.  But even knowing this history, the Allies were totally unprepared for this onslaught.  The Offensive had been delayed multiple times, while the Germans waited for a time when there would be heavy cloud cover to keep the Allied Air Forces on the ground.If the Germans could make it over the River Meuse in two weeks, the would break out into flat country and attack through to Antwerp, thereby taking the largest port north of Cherbourg and cut off the English Army in the southern Netherlands from the other Allies.  With that victory, the Germans felt they would be able to force the Allies to sue for peace and split them away from the Soviet Union. With the war in the West over, the Nazis could then turn the full Armed Forces against Stalin, and hopefully (for them) stop the Red Army in its‚Äô tracks.Because this was considered a ‚Äúquiet sector‚Äù many of the troops at the Front were new divisions that had just finished their training and been fed into the front lines for their first taste of battle.  Many of the German front line troops were veterans of the War on the Eastern Front and their experience of fighting in cold weather was another issue in their favor.  In addition to their experience, these German soldiers were motivated to end this battle quickly so they could go East and saved Germany proper from the approaching Soviet Army.Another major point in the Germans favor, was their material.  The Allies had nothing to compare to the German heavy tanks, Panzer IV, Panthers, Tigers and King Tigers.  They were superior in weaponry and armor.  Shells from American Shermans and Stuarts were seen to bounce off the German tanks who would then blast the medium and light tanks to pieces.  (During the battle the Germans had a ratio of over four to one in tank kills.)  Coming from the Eastern battlefront, the German troops were dressed in white winter clothing.Many of the Allies were in ‚Äòlight‚Äô cotton olive green uniforms without winter boots or white camouflage clothing.  (Some Allied troops took to wrapping themselves in bed sheets to better hide in the snow.)  Without Allied Air Forces to provide close air support to take out the larger tanks, the Allies were at a major disadvantage.  With the Allies split in half this made coordination of counter-attack difficult to work out.Almost half of the tank brigades (Panzer Korps) were Waffen SS, and though they were not as good as the Wehrmacht at strategy, they were fanatical at fighting.  Where other troops would have withdrawn from a fight, the SS would cause casualties way out of proportion to what would normally been expected.  They would be almost suicidal in holding conquered  land that had little or no strategic value.Except for the Paratroopers of the 82nd and 101st Airborne, few units were able to stop the attacking Germans.  The hold-out at Bastogne proved to be a thorn in the side of the German attack, and blocked the bringing up of replacements and supplies to the troops that had by-passed the city.  This more than anything, else slowed down the offensive and allowed the Allies to recover and begin to counter attack with the Third Army under Patton and the Seventh under the control of Montgomery.  With the clearing of the skies, the German Panzer armies were decimated from the air sealing their fortunes.Christer Bergstrom has gone into the archives of all the participating Armies and in his narrative, inserts after action reports, news reports and personal interviews with soldiers from both sides describing the conditions they fought under.  Bergstrom‚Äôs reporting is so detailed that at some battles we have the names of the tank commanders and the officers (and enlisted) men who fought there.  Most impressive is the number of maps showing battles for two or three towns at a time and the movements by units in support of these attacks.Though some will take umbrage to Bergstrom‚Äôs description of some famous Generals and their competency during battle, in most cases this is a well balanced view of the battles and their outcomes.Zeb Kantrowitz  zworstblog.blogspot.com

I wanted a digital scale that was easy to read.  I had never heard of tempered glass scales and thought about which scale to try.  I am glad I bought this one.  It is very easy to use--just step on it and it identifies which user you are out of up to 8 users and then gives your weight in pounds and tenth of pounds, i.e. 139.4.  You can adjust to give your weight in other measuring systems also.  You can also program it to not give your weight but to simply tell how much weight you have lost, or gained, since the last time you used it i.e. -1.7  or +0.6. And you can download an app to track your weight with your Smart phone--if you choose. The blue back-lighting is pretty and looks just as bright as the photo.  The scale is simple and sleek.  My ONLY negative is standing on the glass feels cool to my bare feet.  The company who sells this has great communication and stands behind their product.  They even include the batteries so it is shipped ready to use. I would recommend this scale.

I start every day by using Sterilid on my eyes and lashes, and John Masters Organics Rose Foaming Face Wash for my face and neck.  My eye doctor recommended the Sterilid and it is so gentle, yet really cleans my lashes and eye area--very refreshing.

This vest goes so well with the burgundies and wine reds and muted reds of the season.  Lovely, cozy layering piece and very flattering.  Very cute Carhartt styling--love the zip "map" pocket --and flattering seams.  Nice thrown over a long sleeved top in autumn, and great for warmth under your winter coat.

I have fair, dry skin. I woud never wash my face with soap.  For years I used a good cold cream, tissued it off, then rinsed with warm water.  This rose face wash is very rich and gentle.  I am on my second bottle --the first lasted ten months--you just need a little of this cleanser.  It leaves my skin very clean but not dry.  I follow it with Advanced Night Repair and Very Precious Night cream as well as an eye cream.  Have my third bottle in the linen closet so I won't run out.  Try it.  And I like the subtle rose fragrance.

We use this at the lectern for speakers.  Our previous light would blind the audience.  This LED light is perfect--the speaker can see and adjust the brightness, but it is gentle on the audience.  Everyone who uses it is impressed with the touch on and off and the LED lighting.  We like how it clips on the stand , or how sturdy it is when the legs are open.  The battery or plug-in choice is good also.  We had a problem with the first one we bought on amazon, but when we contacted the Seller they immediately replaced it with one that works perfectly.

Purple mustard?  In an adorable retro jar with embossed daisy glass.  Even the lid with the triangles is cute.  The packaging was attractive.  Decided to try it.  Spread some of this on my reduced fat provolone cheese sandwich and voila!  Wow!  Is it good.  Fewer calories  and fat than Veganaise / mayonaise on cheese. Loved the texture of the densely packed mustard seeds and the slight sweetness of the grape must.  I will be reordering this. Yum.  HPSepicurean was so nice to deal with, and they have other intriguing flavors also as shown in the photos.
Influential man who changed the course of many lives for the better over the past hundred years.

Couldn't have been more entrancing.  Slow at first, but give it a chance.  One of the best Masterpieces ever.  Worth watching a few times as it is so richly written you will find more with each viewing.
Trash dressed up as history.  Wasn't worth passing along.
Trash.  Shiny pretty garbage cavorting as history.
Love the stars.  Story too depressing.  Not what I expected.

Have had this jacket for about three years and have loved it.  It can be dressed up a little with career pants and a good bag.  I can not stand coats, or anything, with collars around my face and with the hoodie and zipper this is quite flattering if you are the type who lives in v-neck tops.  I had this in size 3X and it always was generously sized except a bit snug around the bottom hem.  I have lost 45 pounds and was so happy to find this in smaller sizes.  I was guessing I would need an XL until I read the reviews about the jacket running small.  Then I couldn't decide between the 1X and the 2X.  A few reviewers said there was a big difference between the 1X and the 2X and that the arms of this jacket run small.  Thank you Amazon reviewers, you were right!  I just tried on the 2X and even with the 3X being way too large and the 45 pound weight loss, I needed the 2X in the upper arms and hips.  The rest of the jacket is roomy.This is a nicely styled jacket with the zipper and the velcro closure over the zipper for extra protection against rain, and the attached hoodie was the deal-maker.However, many of the quality details of the older version of this coat have been eliminated.  The style is the same on the outside where it counts, but in a side by side comparison the fine details I loved are gone.  This is more a reflection on quality control than whether you should still buy this coat.  Yes!  You should still buy it, just see if any of these smaller details will bother you:  where the older jacket was detailed with a snap closure at the top and the bottom and three easy velcro closures, the newer jacket has no snaps, but 5 velcro closure points on the flap over the zipper.  The jackets though purchased 3years apart are mostly the same with other small differences.  Sadly, the roomy zippered security inside pocket is gone.  I miss it because that was a safe place to keep items if you were out for a walk and didn't want to carry your purse.  The entire lining is not as well made as before:  the older jacket's mesh lining is much finer and softer, the inside of the hood had the same lining, and at the outer pocket level, for the bottom 8 inches or so, the mesh ended and the interior of the coat had the same, more durable fabric as outside.  That supported what was carried in the 2 outer pockets and gave the coat more substance.  Now the hood has no mesh lining.  The body of the newer coat has a more open, coarser mesh from the shoulders to the bottom of the coat.  My coat is black and the mesh lining is black over a white, or gray, lining that is labelled "OMNI-TECH".  Both exterior "hand pockets" are still zippered and lined with mesh, but once again, you are putting your items into double mesh pockets without the fabric reinforcement the old pockets had.  The old hoodie had an odd flap with velcro at the back--?? must have served some purpose--but I do not know what.  The coat does have an inner hanging loop that is nice in restaurants and places to hang it on a hook to dry.  Booth coats have sleeves with a little elastic at the cuffs and a great velcro storm strip at the cuffs to pull the coat very tight around your wrists.  The Columbia embroidery and the Omnitech stamp on the left cuff are identical.  The hood drawstrings are similar but the old hood had a metal grommet at the opening and a longer, more secure tunnel that the cord pulled through at the end, as well as other minor features being finer on the previous hoodie. The drawstring around the hips is also inferior. All told, you have to wear the jacket for your size.  I am grateful they are still making the coat.  You would never see much difference in the outer appearance, but it is sad the way producers eliminate the quality details and think the consumer won't notice.
Wonderful for air-drying socks and small items indoors in tiny spaces.

Have ordered Maja soaps many many times over the years.  I use them for scenting the linen closet and drawers.  I put them in "winter'  or "summer" handbags when I store them out of season.  I put them in the bag with blankets or quilts I am storing.This is the second time I ordered these Maja round soaps from Amazon, recently, and both times they smell very fresh.  I had ordered Maja rectangular soaps from a different page/ vendor on Amazon and they had little scent.  Amazon Customer Service was great and directed me to these.  The box does say made in Mexico, not Spain, but I am pleased with them.  I suppose Maja has different companies distributing and producing their soaps and scent quality may vary, or some vendors may ship old packages.  Don't accept "stale" soap.  Contact Customer Support at 1-866-216-1072.  Amazon stands behind their products.
Every season is wonderful.  One of the best series ever.

Wonderful book that shifted my outlook from worrying ("meditation on what you don't want") and "preparing" myself by always thinking of what's the worst thing that could happen.  I thought that was protecting me, but that kind of What If Down thinking has really held me back.  Thanks Mindy for such a clearly written book and well explained book.  Wonderful to read outloud and share with friends.  The members in our book study group say they like this book.
Wonderful positive book.  On page 91 there is a wonderful self-healing guided meditation that works. There are some things MDs can't help you with, but this book and meditation can.

This review is from: Derma E Vitamin E Intensive Therapy Hand Creme, Aqua, 2 Ounce (Health and Beauty)My hands have gotten so dry the last two winters the skin on the side of my index finger cracks and then no hand cream would help. At that point I had to cover it with a band-aid for a couple of days till the crack healed. This hand creme is ok, but just after it absorbed,it left my hands feeling unpleasantly sticky for a couple minutes. I had been using Crabtee & E for about fifteen years, but since they changed their packaging it hasn't worked very well for me. What I am using now, and highly recommend is Bach Flower Remedies Rescue Cream. Bach Flower Remedies Rescue Cream It is expensive and I have only found it in a small 1 ounce tube,, BUT you just need one application and it actually relieves severe dryness, is not sticky at all, absorbs quickly and lasts for hours. I also have had success with Herbalind's Glycerin Hand Cream.Herbalind Glycerin Hand Cream 200ml cream

Ahhh, National Geographic.  You know there will be crystal-clear amazing photos.  And reliable text.  To a fault.  The photo stock paper is of such high quality the book is rather hefty for its compact size, but contains nearly 400 pages.  Many nice features in this guide, including: easy access inside front cover fold-out map of France and inside back cover, fold-out graphic of the Paris Metro. Nice introductory pages on charting your trip, and brief summary of French history and culture.The book is organized and color coded by geographic regions of France, making it visually easy to jump from region to region.  Each region starts with a greater than half-page map of that region and small inset map of France highlighting that region within the context of the entire country.  Each region has a brief overview and  sections on the major cities in the region.  There is a list of "off-the-beaten-path excursions" and "not-to-be-missed" lists.  Suggested driving routes are given on pages with a light chartreuse background; "A drive along the Indre River"(Loire Valley); "Drive down the Cote-d'Or" (Central France + Alps);"Drive the Cathar Trail"(South of France) etc.Some regional restaurants and hotels are recommended.  Regarding Paris, this Traveler offers over 50 pages just on Paris and the Ile de France, with coverage on major museums, Notre Dame Cathedral, shopping etc.  There are "insider tips" throughout the guide.If you are new to France this is a beautiful, well-organized, good introduction to current day France and you will feel as if you are in the hands of a very competent guide.  If you are looking for more in-depth coverage of a specific city or region you will need additional resources.

Fits true to size and also comes in W and WW (wide and extra wide). My elderly mother has trouble with her foot swelling and could barely get her older pair of these on.  She loved them so I bought the next size up.  They were too big on her foot.  When I got her the same size, just wider, she could get them on easier and the fit was perfect.  It is hard to find this style in WW so I bought an extra pair for her, which will be her 3rd pair.  She loves them because they are warm and easy to slip on and off.  At first she was concerned that the back of the shoe would not be secure when she walks.  They may look low cut in the back, but inside the heel cup dips low, and this is a most comfortable style. Even in Illinois-Wisconsin, this style will get you through most winter days if you are mostly just out in your car and in the parking lots.

I love Maja soap.  I use it all over my home in place of potpourri, or air fresheners.  I often find when I buy it online, although it is less expensive, it also doesn't have much scent to it.  I figured Sellers are sending out their older stock to online customers...One Amazon reviewer said not all Maja is made in Spain.  She recommended buying the round 4.9 ounce versions, saying those are made in Spain and have the most long-lasting scent.  I took her advice and bought these, but was very disappointed upon opening them.  Yes, they do smell like Maja, but very weakly.  When I looked at the labels it said made in Spain AND it also said Hecho en Mexico/made in Mexico.  These will go back to Amazon as a return.  Wish Amazon would clearly state which Maja is made in Spain....

Great to see this clip of the legendary beloved Temptations.  I miss the Tempts.  What a great group, here putting their sweet spin and steps on the # 1 hit of 1982, Eye of the Tiger, from Rocky 3.  Commissioned by Sly Stallone, written by Jim Peterik of Survivor,(and Ides of March, Chicago's favorite local band of that time) nominated for song of the year by the Academy Awards, here as performed by the Temptations in Atlantic City, this is vintage sweet stuff.  And those Rocky movies with Stallone are still a great series. Enjoy.

The first time I tried wiping my "almost clean" face with a cotton ball with this cleanser, I could not believe the amount of impurities that came off on the cotton. Almost as much as the first time I ever tried a Biore pore cleanser strip on my nose. Kind of shocking that skin we think is nearly clean, is not. I would never put soap on my face, but I do recommend the Weleda for nightly cleansing and the Simple Radiance wipes for dead tired fall into bed nights and a hot weather pick me up.  Be sure to rinse it off and then I use Estee Lauder Advanced Night Repair and a good moisturizer.
This looks like the new Weight Watcher's collapsible steamer colander that comes in the Simple Start set. Great for transporting meals and steaming veggies at work.

This was a wonderful tour of the art and architecture of Florence. For a greater introduction and history of the city and the art of Florence during the renaissance watch the four parts of Empires - The Medici, Godfathers of the Renaissance The DVD on the Medici is fascinating and explain how the Medici were great Patrons of the arts in Florence. It is a well-done drama interspersed with PBS experts explaining and putting all in context. This video enhances what has been learned and adds to it. If you are a renaissance history buff there is a wonderful complex board game about to release its second edition thanks to Kick-starter crowd sourcing support. It is called Florenza Florenza Board Game There is also a card game which is quite similar Florenza: The Card GameAnother fascinating DVD is Monty Don's Italian Garden [Import anglais] This one also includes a lot of history in the narration; a note of caution-check if the copies available are suitable for U.S. DVD players--may be hard to find for Region 1 (US). The gardens are breath-taking. May I also recommend two books? The Stones of Florence and Brunelleschi's Dome: How a Renaissance Genius Reinvented Architecture

Recently developed an interest in Florence, Italy.  People and places and artworks I had heard of all my life, suddenly fit together in the context of this city.  I had heard of places such as the Duomo and the Ponte Vecchio; their images are emblematic, I had seen photos many times, but did not know their names or location. I had not understood that Dante, Galileo, Machiavelli, Botticelli, Michaelanglo and the Medici,etc, were all from Florence and lived there around the same time, and many of them interacted.  For years I had a copy of the 1883 oil of "Dante Meets Beatrice at Ponte Santa Trinita", but I did not realize they both lived in renaissance Florence.  I recently learned one of the largest hospitals in modern day Florence was founded by Beatrice's father. Little by little, as I read works such as "The Stones of Florence"  The Stones of Florence, and "Brunelleschi's Dome" Brunelleschi's Dome: How a Renaissance Genius Reinvented Architecture history began coming to life to me.  And Florence has so much interesting history, architecture, sculpture and art. And so many museums even beyond the Uffizi.  For an overview I recommend the PBS DVD from the Empires series, called "The Medici: Godfathers of the Renaissance.Empires - The Medici: Godfathers of the Renaissance This DVD is actually a very good introduction to this game, as the game's players are five elite Florentine families including the Medici.I came across this board game on Kick-starter online.  The producers of Florenza posted a project so they could release a second edition of this game.  The project was funded and a second edition will be out around December 2014.  It will be basically the same with some improvements in game pieces and card stock.  There was an event I was involved in and needed the game sooner, so I purchased one of the few new first editions of the game still available.  I like the game, but it is very complex.  Our group went very slowly through three rounds of the eight rounds in a full game.  It took a long time because none of us were familiar with it.  One person in our group did not play; he just kept checking the instruction booklet step by step helping us figure out what to do and which pieces to use.  The group was composed of all adults, but none of us are frequent "gamers".  I think this is the type of game I will enjoy more and more as I become familiar with it.  If you have a good imagination and a love of Florence and history I think you may appreciate this also.  I could imagine it being a wonderful game if you have a lot of time to play it--say during a cold Midwestern winter.  Or if you have a houseguest  staying with you for a few days or longer. The game is designed for two to five players. Each player represents one of the patron families of Florence, such as the Medici family.  You will assign and pay workers to build workshops to develop your income and resources.  When you have acquired resources, such as textiles, spices, gold, marble, you will assign workers and actual historic artists of the time to build or create actual artworks, statues and buildings in your palazzo, District, or city, earning more income, resources and prestige points. Being Florence, human jealousy and intrigue come into play by one of the families serving as District Captain and Bishop in each round. These two offices give them political powers to detain you, or your artists, so there are  strategy twists and turns in the progress of the game.  Be aware, if you plan to start the game and continue it in the evenings after work as time allows, all the wonderfully detailed pieces do take up a lot of table space.  There are the city game board, the "Life in Florence" 8 vertical rows of character pieces, representing historical figures (with a description of each one in the rulebook), the Prestige Tracking board,each Family's District card containing workshops and art commissions and the Building information cards for each family.  This afternoon's game took up much of a rectangular work table that normally seats eight-ten on folding chairs.  There are many small tiles and cubes and playing cards and board pieces to set up and look after.  I love the complexity and depth of it.  Just be aware it is no Candyland game, it is for 14 year olds and up. Ciao!

Wow.  This toy is a certain hit. Matchbox did themselves proud.  The concept of Rescue Ship really gets the imagination going in a good way.  This ship is colorful, well-made and nicely detailed.  Even the two matchbox cars that come with this are waterproof.  I love that the ship rolls on the ground and also floats in water.  It has a floating raft, a squirting helicopter (with landing pad) and squirting water canon.  There's a crane and front and back ramps for the cars.  And there's also the shark and shark cage.  The shark's mouth opens--how cool is that?  You might want to reinforce your child's interest in this with a couple of children's booksThunderbirds: Meet the Thunderbirds (Festival Readers) and Ocean S.O.S. (Wild Rescue) or Seldovia Sam and the Sea Otter Rescue Great appeal and fun!

Rolling suitcases have changed since the 1990s. The most important change recently has been the weight of the suitcase. My c.1990's 29 inch roll-aboard weighed twenty (20) pounds when empty! It was too big and too heavy to lift into the trunk of the car taking me to the airport. I got a lot of strange side glances from struggling airport taxi drivers thinking they didn't get paid enough to lift bags like that. Both the Travelpro Marquis Expandable 25 inch and the Travelpro Maxlite 3 Expandable 25 inch weigh only eight (8) pounds when empty. Much better on the back.The other major change is how it rolls and stands when packed. These are both spinners, which means there are 4 wheels vs roll-aboard (tilt and roll on 2 back wheels). Roll-aboards often tip over when fully packed and rested on the front feet. The newer spinners are designed to distribute the weight better, even when expanded, so there shouldn't be as much tipping. Spinners can be pushed, glide at your side, or pulled. This is easier on your shoulder, arm and wrist. The 360-degree spinners are more maneuverable in entering elevators or trains and rotate on their wheel base in tight areas. The Travelpro has two locking extensions to accommodate different user's heights. Because you no longer tilt the suitcase the telescopic handle needn't extend as far. Please note that this can effect how you stack another bag on top of your case; if you are short and use the first locking position the telescoping handle's extension is considerably shorter than on a roll-aboard.Also, the spinner wheels in the Marquis have not only the unique bottom tray to stablilize the wheels like the Maxlite 3, but the Marquis also has Magnatrac, which uses magnets to keep the wheels aligned. Although this listing says the Marquis's wheels can be removed and replaced with a simple screwdriver, I believe that may only apply to the roll-aboard Marquis models, not the spinners. The Travelpro Maxlite 3 being very similar to the Marquis, does has the bottom wheel tray, but does not have Magnatrac. The lining in the black Maxlite 3 is black with blue trim, while the lining of the black Marquis is all blue. There is a little stylish black trim on the Marquis.However, the important features such as 2" tapered extension and corner guards and wheel crashguards are the same. Also they both have wonderful top, side and bottom cushioned handles for lifting, and carrying up stairs. The bottom handle is important in lifting the suitcase into the trunk of your car, or onto a packing / unpacking surface. They are made of the same, or similar, water- and puncture -resistant fabric, both inside and outside.The zippers on my Maxlite 3 worked very smoothly. The pulls on the zipper to the inner suitcase do cross-meet and have holes that line up for a safety lock to be threaded through. I prefer the outer pocket on the Marquis. The Maxlite 3 outer pocket is very big, almost as long as the lid, but shallow. Travelpro describes the outer pocket of the Maxlite 3 for stashing a coat when traveling from warm to cold locales, or newspaper/magazines, or a few files. It unzips on both sides and there is only an inner safety gusset along the very lowest part--again for weight distribution so it doesn't tip forward. One could open the Maxlite 3's outer pocket carefully by only unzipping one side at a time so smaller items do not fall out. The Marquis's outer zip pocket has a smaller top zip pocket. Both cases came out in late 2013, or 2014 and I am so grateful for the user-friendly improvements. Recommended.

Looks even nicer than in the photo. The laser lace is gorgeous.  This bag is classic, feminine and versatile.  It can take you from a day luncheon to a dressy evening out on the town. Larger than an evening bag, this clutch also has two clip on straps.  The shorter one is shown and can be held in the hand or over the arm. It is both modern and slightly retro- reminding me of the fifties and early sixties, when ladies carried their bag over their arm, elbow bent. The other strap is very practical.  It's adjustable and can be either shoulder or crossbody length.  My only issue with the longer strap is that it is only secured at one point and it tends to separate and not look neat.  I am working at straightening my long strap by hanging it with a heavier purse on it until it straightens out.  Then I may ask the shoemaker if they can add something to secure the adjustable part where the strap is doubled.  Also, I recommend keeping the cardboard insert that comes with the bag to store in it and help keep it's shape. There is a removeable sueded liner bag inside the purse that protects the laser lace from tearing and helps the bag hold its shape.  This one I will love for years.

For years my friend has been trying to convince me to buy a Garmin.  I would rather read maps and know where I am.  I did notice that whenever service people came to my house, they never asked for directions, not even the cross-streets, anymore.  When asked if they need directions, they all say no, they will just tap my address into their Garmin.  I thought if all these repairmen and delivery men rely on the Garmin and because I am going on a multi-state road trip I finally took his advice.  And I love this Garmin!!  When I took it out to the areas around here that I am familiar with (basically a 90 mile x 100 mile area of rural and suburban and city roads) I found lots of new roads and ways I had never tried before.  I just set it to my 90 mile destination, but would purposely turn off the road I was being directed to.  The Garmin just keeps naming other roads to get back to the main highway.  It was fun to try these new backroads and I loved how the GPS lists the name of these backroads.  Out here most of the backroads are rarely posted with signs--you have to pre-map them out to know.  Besides showing the names of the roads, I am impressed how Garmin labels exactly what the speed limit is and exactly when you have entered a new speed zone.  Also, very impressed by how it times entering road ramps and tells you just at the right time to enter the ramp, after having given a little warning first. Only thing I did not like, when I was in the state capital, Garmin told me the incorrect name of streets 2-3 times.  The directions were always correct, but the names of the street the Voice said and what was printed on the Garmin was different than the street signs I was seeing in town (2 or 3 times).  It also was not a matter of saying it was Highway 30, but in town would be called 'Washington Street"---no these were short streets ( a few blocks long) in incorporated areas of the state capital.....Otherwise --this is easy to use and I am very glad I have it.  Also, my friend told me not to buy the extra stand.  He said it takes up too much room for stashing in your glove compartment, and potential sticky fingers looking for cars with GPS, don't really notice the empty Velcro strip.  Instead he told me to order a few pieces of Velcro tape and place the Garmin right near me on the dashboard.  It is ok if you need to cover a part of your vent, or CD slot, etc because you just pull the Garmin off the Velcro to access what you need.  I used about a 2 inch piece of Industrial strength Velcro, that I bought on Amazon.  I put the smooth backing on my Garmin and the fuzzier backing on the dashboard.  Caution: be sure you have the Garmin plugged in before you position your Velcro, because the cigarette lighter plug-in goes on one side of the back of the Garmin and effects how you position it for the Velcro. So now, around home I not only know where I am, I know more and more of the back roads and alternate routes to learn even more of my home area.  And this will be super on the road trip to new areas. It makes driving more fun to find these new ways to go.

These are wonderful.  They stack and store well, due to the magnets.  I love the 2 differently shaped ends for measuring, depending on if you have to measure from a narrow bottle...or one end for liquid ingredients and the other for dry herbs and ingredients.  Also you can measure each spoon twice without stopping to rinse off.  So far they worked well in the dishwasher too.

Something is wrong with this product.  I used to use Revlon emery boards always and forever.  Now, one side of these files is too damaging to nails.  It is like coarse sandpaper.  I can only use the finer side, not the darker colored main side.  The finer side used to be for refining and smoothing the finish after you had used the other side to shape your nails.  It is the shaping side that is just too coarse and damaging to fingernails.  I can not believe this is the second package I have bought hoping these were like the old Revlon emery boards.
Nice fusion of Mozart, the mystic, spiritual vowel sound Om.  I like this.  Rather original.
Beautiful peaceful music, too short! The soundtrack for this film was nice.  The film was actually a tale, trying to get at the spiritual side of life.  I enjoyed the tale acting and this music.

This design is called the Eneko.  It is the first of five Buff headbands I purchased.  The colors in this are beautiful.  Vibrant shades of orange to golden-yellow to deep olive-green.  This will be awesome July through Midwest Indian summer and Thanksgiving, as the fields and harvest golden, and the leaves change colors. And, of course, anytime it blends... or clashes !! ...with what you are wearing.I have never been able to wear headbands-they never fit the shape of my head.  Until I found Buff.  The flexibility of the fabric and the width of it somehow does work for me, although I still need two bobby-pins crossed on the back of the band, behind each ear.  Just me I guess--most people won't need this.Since I have been wearing by hair pulled back in a twist for years, the Buff gave me a style lift.  It fits close to the head, so do not look for volume, but that no volume sleekness is the style now.  This keeps my fly away layers under control.

After a while you know what works for you.  Here's what I like about this crossbody / shoulder bag--The strap is wide, soft, cotton webbing (not nylon webbing which is slippery) and the strap won't slide right off your shoulder.  The strap is adjustable; you decide. The bag is waxed canvas and holds it's shape.  Zipper top with quality zipper, so you can get right in without unbuckling / unfastening.  Yes, there is a black leather flap in the front that gives this a lot of style.  The flap does not get in the way of the top zipper access.  Because it is magnetic, the flap just lifts up, and you simply release it and the magnet automatically closes the flap.Lots of pockets:  Under the FRONT flap is an open pocket for your smartphone: it easily holds my Samsung Galaxy 3.  Under the phone slot is a pocket as wide as the bag, with organizer holders for 3 pens/ markers/laser pointer and one more small pocket that looks like it could hold a Passport, or hotel room key, etc.  This section under the flap is top-gusseted so it expands on top, but the floor of the pocket doesn't expand.  Also, if one tried to over fill this the magnets on the flap wouldn't close.  But it does make for easy access and gives you a bit of emergency room.On the BACK of the Tumi is a large pocket that starts two inches down from the top and runs the depth and full width of the bag.About 9" deep and 10" wide.  This BACK pocket is magnetic closure also (one center magnet). The top edge of the BACK outer pocket is nicely trimmed in leather.  Inside this BACK pocket is another smaller pocket which also could be used for phone, possibly Garmin, or camera, etc.  Again, my Samsung Galaxy fits width wise into this pocket, but since it is not as deep as the FRONT organizer pocket, part of my Samsung sits above the pocket, but still totally within the overall large BACK pocket.The CENTER of the bag, once again is the top zip access. Inside the CENTER is another very large zippered pocket on the back wall.  On the front inner wall of the CENTER of the bag there is a loose piece of fabric that serves as a space divider.  You could probably put something like a Kindle or notepad either there, or possibly in the large zippered inner pocket--I am not sure because I don't own a Kindle or notepad.  On one side of that fabric divider are three more sewn pockets for pen-marker-laser pointer, etc and a final small open pocket about the size of a pack of Kleenex tissues.I like the vintage look of the weathered pewter hardware.  Tumi tracker is included inside the bag, so if it's ever lost and called in, Tumi will contact you to get it back. Currently Tumi is even offering monograming.  I keep calling this a bag, not a purse, because I may have found it listed under men's travel bags.  Don't let that fool you.  It makes a sturdy elegant handbag for women too.  Being a decades long vegetarian, I like that this mostly a waxed canvas bag.  I will admit the leather trim gives it an expensive sophisticated look.  I like the size of this bag, it's just right if you don't want to carry a ton of stuff around.  The only thing I didn't like is because this is waxed canvas, the bag has some slight markings.  They seem to be going away as I handle the bag.  I might order another one of these-- I love it.

Never heard of Bell X1.  Don't mean to sound ignorant, but I was on Amazon shopping for Velcro strips for slapping on my new Garmin GPS and this popped up.  So I listened and watched.  Like them well enough to look up their CDs and digital music.  Good music, cute band.  I'll be your velcro...hmmmm...doesn't sound romantic, but the concept is intriguing....

Wonderful actors.  Glad Kevin Spacey and Robin Wright are nominated for Emmys.  Why wasn't Gerald McRaney (Mr. Tusk) nominated for an Emmy also??  The first half of this is better than Season 1, and the rest just as good.  I think this show is so popular because right now John Boehner's do-nothing Congress is a joke and a sham.  Doesn't Washington get it?  For six years Congress has barely done a thing for the people it represents.  What a travesty. Like the exaggerated vision of "House of Cards".

My much-loved Sony DVD / VHS combo recorder has stopped working. I came across the Magnavox HDD/DVD Recorder  (Black) and the Magnavox MDR533H/F7 HDD/DVD Recorder. The sad part is I gave up on the VHS tape recordings at this time. Sad because I still have a few unique VHS tapes from Conferences which I won't be able to replace to DVD. The good part is the MAGNAVOX will record from the TV to DVD, and play DVDs, and NOT need an external tuner, also called a cable box. I ordered the MAGNAVOX HDD/DVD Recorder, Model MDR535 or MDR535H/F7, because it has both analog and digital internal tuners. Internal tuners mean I do not need the cable box from my cable company. I have no room for the cable box, and there is monthly fee I won't have to pay. The Magnavox HDD/DVD Recorder, has a hard drive disc with 500GB of HDD so you can record to the hard drive OR record to a DVD-R OR record to your hard drive + then to a DVD-R or DVD+R. Amazon also sells the Magnavox MDR533H/F7 HDD/DVD Recorder with 320GB of HDD for $50 less. Except for losing the ability to play my old VHS tapes, this seems like a great update. What you also gain from these units is they are like a DVR or TiVo (except the TiVo I looked at only has 75 HD compared to the 500 HD on the Magnavox) :you can pause live TV etc. And you do not pay the monthly cable fee for a DVR.Don't want to get in over my head trying to explain TiVo, because I am such a novice!! I am just trying to make sense of all the electronics out there and what would work for me. I thank all the Amazoners who write reviews--they sure do help in trying to figure all this out. Also, Amazon has a guide that came up while I was researching this. I think it is called 'How to cut the cord' or something similar and it lists exactly what products you need to get away from cable and stream (ex. Netflix, etc) I was surprised at how few products they listed... You may need WiFi I have forgotten, but it is an interesting Amazon guide to search for.

My much-loved Sony DVD / VHS combo recorder has stopped working.  I came across the Magnavox HDD/DVD Recorder  (Black) and the Magnavox MDR533H/F7 HDD/DVD Recorder.  The sad part is I gave up on the VHS tape recordings at this time.  Sad because I still have a few unique VHS tapes from Conferences which I won't be able to replace to DVD.  The good part is the MAGNAVOX will record from the TV to DVD, and play DVDs, and NOT need an external tuner, also called a cable box.  I ordered the MAGNAVOX HDD/DVD Recorder, Model MDR535 or MDR535H/F7, because it has both analog and digital internal tuners.  Internal tuners mean I do not need the cable box from my cable company.  I have no room for the cable box, and there is monthly fee I won't have to pay. I have sensitive skin and can not tolerate anti-bacterial ointments.  My dermatologist told me to use this in place of Bacitryn or medicated ointments.  It reminds me of petroleum jelly, although the Aquaphor will eventually soak into your skin and not be greasy.  My doctor said it forms a protective layer over skin injuries and it has always worked for me for over seven years.  Sometimes, in the winter, my skin gets so dry it actually cracks on the side of my index finger.  Aquaphor is the only thing I have found that will allow the cracked skin to heal.  Does not have any funny scent.  Great product.

What a find!! I have a friend who has read every book  he can find on astral projection.  He's studied it for over twenty years.  He said Von Braschler's book breaks much new ground and has many helpful secrets.  He said to check out p. 62.  Here Von Braschler describes a visualization exercise.  What's different is he tells you to first create a detailed picture of what you want in your mind's eye; then he has you visualize what you've created as having already taken place.  Giving your visualization life, the second part, is the subtle difference leading to the real magic of creation.The book also stretches the idea of astral travel, or astral projection, into the larger concept of time travel.  This concept is not only broader than that of astral projection, but also serves more of a purpose in clarifying the kind of experience you are about to undertake.  Friends, there is nothing like a good book written by one who has gone through the process of learning a new skill and explaining how to do it to the rest of us.  Von Braschler shares many of his early experiences in his writings.  The book is quite interesting to read and I thank the author for sharing his many insights. May I also recommend another very good author on astral travel:[[ASIN:B00GA420FS The Multidimensional Human: Practices for Psychic Development and Astral Projection [Paperback] [2010] (Author) Kurt Leland]Von Braschler and Kurt Leland, two newer authors worth checking out.

First of all, Glucosamine and Chondroitim and MSM are a huge, huge blessing for my knees.  A friend told me to try it almost 2 years ago and I can tell the difference if I stop taking it.  It really helps my knees feel better.  This is a new brand, and this formula is very similar to what I had been taking, except the Jarrow is capsules.  It seems to work just as well.

Another new product to get to know.  First I couldn't find the directions.  Haven't you noticed a lot of new products come without any manuals?  Like printers, even all-in-one printers, copy, fax, and scan only have an online manual.  So I spent at least 20 minutes trying to visualize how the light fits into the dock and outlet plug.  Then I read and highlighted the Important Safety Information which comes in multi-languages.  Still didn't see any directions, but the lawyers who wrote the Safety Information scared me some more about the unit exploding and starting fires....Finally, since I couldn't really figure it out, I opened to the other side, where the French Safety Info was and found Using the Chargelight.  There actually are directions and they aren't too bad.  I still don't get how to attach the wrist strap, and if I am supposed to charge this now or wait until the red LED light shows up.  I am not bonding with this.  Feel like I have gotten along without it and feel leery about carrying it around in my purse (is explosions, fire, thunderstorms...oh, my)  Well, I get the feeling for most people that want to be around their Smart phones when out and about, this is a nice battery backup, so they can stay in touch.  Also, it is nice to have extra charging cables and all.  And the flashlight/ strobe light is good to have handy.  I think once I bond and get used to it, or if you are comfortable with all the new technology, you will like, or love this.

M. B. Peeke was a dedicated Traditional Martinist Order Initiate and Officer. She wrote this book in the late 1800's. TMO is affliated with the Rosicrucian Order AMORC and it's founder Louis-Claude de St. Martin, the Unknown Philosopher. Be you Seeker or Mystic, this book is a classic.As I appreciate information from other Amazoners -here is a bit of info gathered from the Forward to "Numbers and Letters, or the thirty-two Paths of Wisdom", signed by Grace Carew Sheldon, 1908."Margaret Bloodgood Peeke, b. April 8, 1838 - d. November 2, 1908. Christian mystic, Initiate,teacher and author who traveled and presented, in Persia, Holyland, Egypt, Patmos, Madeira, etc. Beloved son, E. C. B. Peeke."Born of Flame" was her entering wedge, and "Zenia the Vestal" her heart's story, this tome [Numbers and Letters] and those to follow will accentuate the living power of the Masters. As a teacher of Hermetic philosophy, Margaret Peeke was unsurpassed. Her joy was to interpret, not to mystify...As Inspectress General in America of the MARTINIST Order of France, she did a voluminous work. She was also an ardent Behaie (Baha'i), a member of the Rose Cross Martinist fraternity, and the treasurer of the Light of France Hermetic Society of France. ...In her own dear words we give "The greetings of universal peace to those who love the law of use and seek after truth and knowledge. To them shall all things come, even powers and dominion and light; for nothing that thought shall grasp or the human mind conceive is impossible. Love and light are the birthright of the human race and free to all. The echo of good words once spoken vibrate in space to all eternity. The portals of the temples are open. Enter thou in."This info comes from Sandusky, Ohio historical archives:Margaret Bloodgood Peeke was the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Garry Peck. She was born in Mechanicsville, New York on April 8, 1908. In 1860, Margaret married Rev. George H. Peeke, a Protestant minister. Rev. and Mrs. Peeke settled in Sandusky in 1883, where George served as the minister of the Congregational Church. Rev. Peeke later served a congregation in Cleveland as well. Rev. and Mrs. Peeke had six children, one of whom was well known Sandusky lawyer and local history author, Hewson L. Peeke. Hewson L. Peeke wrote in his book, A Standard History of Erie County, about his mother, "She had a remarkably bright mind and wonderful conversational ability."Robert H. Stockman wrote in his book The Baha'i Faith in America, that while Margaret B. Peeke had been raised as a strong Protestant church member, her interests changed, and she became a Martinist. Martinism is a form of mystical Christianity. Margaret was the author of Born of Flame, Numbers and Letters: or The Thirty-Two Paths of Wisdom, and Zenia the Vestal.A book reviewer stated that Zenia the Vestal was a book which embodied "the occult laws of spiritual development, as given by the wise men of other lands..."An advertisement for two of Mrs. Peeke's books appeared in The Metaphysical Magazine in 1901.cording to Ohio Authors and Their Books, Margaret Bloodgood Peeke traveled widely, teaching Hermetic philosophy, with her largest following in the northern Ohio area. Margaret Bloodgood Peeke died on November 2, 1908. She is buried in Pomona, Tennessee near her daughter Grace Peeke. Grace Carew Sheldon wrote in an article in the Columbus Medical Journal shortly after Margaret's death, that "The loss to her myriads of friends in every part of the world testifies to her international value, for she was beloved both at home and abroad."A copy of Zenia the Vestal is located in the local authors collection of the Archives Research Center of the Sandusky Library. The book contains an inscription from Rev. George H. Peeke to Miss Hazel Maud Morgan, the daughter of local Sandusky businessman, T. T. Morgan. The inscription reads:Wisdom is the principal thingTherefore get wisdom. -ProverbPOEM: ONE STEP BEYOND.Margaret B. Peeke.Whether my future will be dark or brightI do not know,I only ask for enough lightWhile here below,Always the step beyond to plainly see,Knowing that thenThe next will come to me.What matters it though friends I hold most dearAre called awayTo fill another sphere?Both they and IAre part of one great plan,The everlastingUpward growth of man.What difference can it make to you or meWhether in thisWorld or eternityThe next few years are spent?Nearer to Him let us but strive to grow,Looking not backward on the things belowBut upward, ever on God's will intent.Whatever comes of good, by us will stay;False doctrines,Though fair, will surely slip away.What matters howThe summit we have gained,Since far belowUs lies the barren plain?

Ok, so the artwork is a bit cheesy, but it's Halloweenish and fits the spooky mood of fall, and I love it.  The music is solid, surprisingly good.If you like the collection of classical music pieces featured you most likely will like this.  The pieces are well performed.  Some lesser known pieces in the collection.  Personally, I am not feeling the romance upon listening, a bit much melancholy....A few seem more mad than romantic, like the Bach Toccata BWV. This organ Toccata belongs in a fall Haunted House parlor.  More Gothic than immortal, more classical than romantic....

Second to Elvis, this a great song.  Very nice guitar work in the introduction and throughout. The lead singer's voice is quite unique and the song builds as the other singers of the group enter the arrangement.  Love all the vocals--lead and backup.  Liked the strings, horns, drums, guitar, and general arrangement. Elvis first, then FYC.  Hey, it's hard to compete with the King's hit.

I remember Tennessee Ernie Ford's deep baritone voice booming from the radio in the 1954.  This is a dramatic rendition of a great song.  Ford's ocean deep voice is accompanied by both feminine high-pitched back-up voices and a few male back-up singers.  There are also '40s sounding muted-horns and some other-worldly sound effects. Stylized but worth listening to.I also like the piano and pop orchestra cover by Clayderman. My favorite version of this sad but beautiful song is by Slim Whitman with its steel guitar.  Ah, romance.,.

This is my favorite version of this lost-love hit from the 1950s. Whitman sings it simply and well. The arrangement is very nice and features wonderful country steel guitar and doesn't overpower the great lyrics. It's a sad, yearning, lost love song.I also like Tennessee Ernie Ford's dramatic vocal and Clayderman's instrumental versions, but if I had to pick one it would be Whitman's classic.  This is a great addition to my library of favorite songs.

This is a beautiful, flowing and gentle instrumental version of a popular 1950's song. Clayderman on piano is accompanied by a pop orchestra.  Clayderman's piano arrangement is very simple and carries the melody above the orchestra.  There are also vocal versions, my favorite being Slim Whitman's with its great electric guitars.  Tennessee Ernie Ford had a huge hit with his dramatic vocal version of this love lost song.

What would I do without Downton Abbey?  I am wishing the show was on all season.  All-time top ten TV series.Wonderful characters and interaction.  Interesting plot.  Well written, acted and produced. Moves fast and leaves one with a lot to think about.  All four seasons are outstanding and can be watched over and over for fresh insights.

This is just what I was looking for.  I spend way too much time daily on the computer and this really supports my wrist nicely.  It is a tad high, but not enough to need to do anything about.  I think it will be perfect once it breaks in.  I love the fabric--soft dark marled gray on one side and black on the other.  I am using it with my laptop and wireless mouse and not having difficulty with it sliding around. Love it.

FYI This arrived with a WARNING label on the package.  "WARNING:  This product contains a chemical known to the State of California to cause cancer and birth defects or other reproductive harm."When are corporations going to stop manufacturing items that are known causes of cancer?  Amazon was excellent about letting me return the item, which I immediately did.  I am going to reread the product description, but I certainly did not notice any mention of any warnings when I purchased it.

I knew they were there, but they seemed so distant, they were easy for a teenage music fan to ignore.  I didn't sing, they were black and extremely exotic to white bread, twinkie suburbanites in the sixties and seventies.  Before the internet, before American Idol, all we had was our transistor radios under the pillow after bedtime and maybe a shot at seeing a group perform on American Bandstand, or Shindig.  "20 Feet from Stardom" makes me feel I either missed, or ignored something happening in music back then.  These female vocalists were amazing singers.  They  could sing and they weren't "readers"--they felt the music.They brought the song to life.  At one point in the film, we're shown how flat a song can come across without the response of the back up singers. Think of Ray Charles' "What'd I Say" calling out..."Hey!" and Ray not being answered back with a confirming, (Hey) ..."Ho"...."Say it one more time right now (just one more time)".Back-ups also shift the music, and bring a new dimension to the lead's opening.  Near the beginning of the film we hear the great Lou Reed singing a restrained solo "Walk on the Wild Side"-  "...and the colored girls go 'do -  do - , do-  do-tah-do- do - do'....." The refrain opens up with the gorgeous backup voices singing with him.These voices were behind the greatest rock songs. They embellished the song and gave it layered interest.  Think of Phil Spector's "wall of sound". Think of Merry Clayton who did the soaring, and emotional female vocal behind Mick Jagger in "Gimme Shelter."  "Rape, murder, it's just a shot away, it's just a shot away."  Imagine Jagger at the height of his popularity, during a late night jam at a recoding studio, being told by the producer they need a female voice.  Merry Clayton tells about getting the late night call and going down to the studio in her curlers, silk pajamas and a mink coat to do back-up for the Stones.  We're still thrilled by what she added to that classic, and many, many others.  All along the way these talented young singers sadly were taken advantage of as were many in the music biz: not only the back-up singers, many lead singers, as well as producers, and other behind the scenes musicians.  This film entertains, answers a lot of unasked questions and opened my eyes.  I hope to keep them open to what is really happening around me. I loved this documentary and give it 5 stars, but feel the production could have been a little better.

Takes crime dramas into 21st Century and looks at our workplace issues.  Not in chronological order, but in staging, we have had, among many others, many renditions on police work:  ............The Andy Griffith Show (Mayberry)......Colombo .......Rockford Files ......Cagney and Lacey... ...Monk......Foyle's War......Inspector Lynley .....The Mentalist.........Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries.... The Closer.........Law and Order......The Fall ......CSI .......Nashville.........Detroit ......Criminal Minds ......Prime Suspect.......Inspector Morse.........NYPD BLUE ......and my two favorites:...  Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy (TV)......and ......The Wire .......in other words, we've watched crime as entertainment from Sherlock Holmes to Elementary.Line of Duty is a compelling show, but not so much an entertainment.  This series is centered on an internal investigation of an exemplary Officer. I loved how this series looked at the complexities and gray areas of what has gone wrong with the system.  The award winning Detective Chief Tony Gates has been lauded as the top cop of the year, even as internal affairs is questioning his unrealistically high rate of case closures. They are sure he is laddering-cherry picking the cases that he can solve and also add additional charge and case-solutions to at the same time. Gates is not the only one who sees how the system really works and uses it to advantage--a female officer hears of a job opening and refers to her high chance of being hired due to "gender balance" quotas.  Another states, "I'm next in line...I'm a quarter Romany."The senior officers lament with all the initiatives they have forgotten what the job used to be.  With all the audits, paperwork, etc another comments, "I want to work for a unit that actually fights crime."The mood is serious, the acting tremendous, the story quite current, and  I do recommend this thriller for adult audiences.  Also, enjoyed the music that ends each episode.

Best sized swaddling blankets we bought!  If you're a Happiest Baby reader, you know that swaddling is like the baby cheat code.  A good swaddle gets you to level 5 sleeping in minutes.  You can use swaddles made just for this purpose with velcro/zippers, or swaddling blankets, or a combo of the two.  We opted for the last option.  Our little girl is like a swaddle escape ninja, and make quick work of the smaller Aden and Anais blankets, wriggling her little arms out and looking right at us from her bassinet as if to say, "haha."  These Yoga Sprout blankets, though, are big enough that we can really wrap her up tight and get an awesome swaddle on her.  Joke's on you, baby!
