Really, though, she looks at us like, "thank you, finally," and then goes right to sleep when she's swaddled properly in these.  They've also held up extremely well upon repeated washings, leading these to be our favorite swaddling blankets by far.  If we don't have these two in the rotation (due to volcanic spit ups), then I prefer the Swaddle Me velcro swaddles, or the Nuroo.  Only as a last resort will I use the smaller Aden and Anais blankets on my ninja.  Oh, and the colors are pretty cute for these Yoga Sprout blankets too.  Win.

I love the design of this cover, but I've been through two already as the zipper has broken in the wash on delicate cycle.  Luckily, Amazon has replaced it for me each time (yay), but I wish they'd fix that!  Still, it's WAY softer than the other Boppy covers, easy to put on because it's stretchy, and super cute with the gray polka dots design.  It's also a lot easier to keep this clean than I thought it would - it comes nice and clean in the wash, even if the zippers come apart.  I would definitely buy it again in a heartbeat.

This has to be one of the cutest books I have ever read for babies and parents.  I read it in the bookstore and instantly teared up.  I particularly like that it references all of the "annoying" and jarring things babies do (rooting, crying, etc), as animal behaviors, and offers things that the mommy did to help solve the baby's problems.  I think this book would be especially great to read to older children when they are about to become big brothers or sisters.  It can remind them that they did these "annoying" behaviors too and place the baby's actions in context for them, as something all animals do, and as actions that mommies and families need to help soothe.  The illustrations are exceptionally cute, too.  I've ended up purchasing three more copies to give as presents to my new parent friends, all of whom had the same teary reaction I had.  Love!

Bought these to label breast milk bottles for pumping, storing, and feeding.  I am SO GLAD I did.  These are really clean, easy to use, and way better than the paper wrapped grease pencils!  I can jot down the time on the outside of a bottle if she didn't finish it too, so no more "I wonder how long this bottle has been sitting out."  And I love that there is a little clip.  I clip it onto the side of my Medela Advanced Pump in Style so that I can label each bottle with a quick date and time, and it doesn't get messy or all over the place.  I decided to use white instead of black so that if it rubbed off on clothing or other surfaces, it would make less of a stain.  These Listo pencils aren't super greasy though, and the writing stays put till I wipe it off with a dish sponge.  Might have been the best baby parenting idea I've had yet!

Does not fit the Halo Bassinest, unfortunately, so it had to go back.  Way too much clearance room on the sides made this extremely dangerous for baby if used in the Halo.  Probably would be appropriate for a smaller Moses basket, though.

Adding two remote entry keys for my 2009 Fit was literally the easiest thing I've ever done to this car besides fill it with gas.  If you don't need the key to be cut and you're in possession of your master key, just google "Program remote entry Honda Fit" and devote maybe 5 minutes to programming this after watching the YouTube video like once.  It is so easy and I can't believe I was going to pay the dealership $$$ to program the remote entry.  Works like a charm and was so ridiculously economical.  I should have done it years ago!

Very nice thank you notes with lovely art.  These look great and are not hard to write on!  Very good quality paper.  I especially like that they aren't micro tiny like some thank you notes, but aren't so huge that you have trouble figuring out what to write in the rest of the card.  Just enough space in there to say, "Thank you for the gift.  We love it!  And you!" and maybe one other detail, then sign.  Perfect.

I tried Medela, Avent, and Lansinoh's bags for storing my liquid gold riches.  Lansinoh's bags are clearly the best.- Only one with accurate measurements.  Medela is off by about 1.5 to 2 oz, Avent is off by about an ounce.  Since I'm EP, I like to be sure how much my daughter is eating each day so I can keep up.- Easiest to seal, open, and pour.  Medela is designed as though someone wanted to torture pumping mothers.  Who puts a gd hole at the top??  I know, I know, it's for attaching to the pumps, but come on.  Watching that milk spill makes me want to cry, literally.  And the seal on Medela's bags is laughably bad.  Avent's seal is great but it doesn't stand up on the counter as well as Lansinoh's.- Easiest to store in the freezer.  Here's where Medela's bags are actually pretty nice (they are quite compact in the freezer standing up), but Avent's are a real pain because of the long flap on top.  Lansinoh's are like a nice medium between the two, and fit more than Medela bags.- Economical.  Because babies are expensive enough.  Save those pennies for daycare and extra bottles of wine for mommy's days off (your reward for having pumped so diligently!).

Very nice towels - these held up well in the wash and can withstand a lot of abuse in the kitchen without completely falling apart. I like that they are white and not too expensive, as it's easy to bleach them clean until they need to be thrown away. I also like that they are textured for easier cleaning.
Easy to put together and my friend's son loves it!  If you know a kid who loves transformers and all things transportation, this has lots of features to keep them happy.

Got the 200 pack of size 1 diapers and it's not only a really great deal but also good diapers. I like that you're not getting individually wrapped small packages of diapers - you're getting large "tubes" of diapers instead. These little things absorb a lot and are MUCH softer on my baby's skin than pampers swaddlers. Pampers swaddlers have a mesh covering on the inside absorbant area that keeps sticking to my daughter's skin. So badly, in fact, that it left marks before. The huggies liner is soft and does not have anything to sick to her skin. If you feel them side by side, the difference is night and day. Highly recommend the huggies.

Great bike/trike for kids - perfect for around 2 years of age. Just know that it is not a motorbike. As other reviewers have mentioned, there's no motor component, so your tike makes it "go" with their own leg power. That being said, I can't imagine an actual motored bike is safe for toddlers, so I heartily endorse not having one. Assembly was easy and didn't drive me too insane. Always a plus. Colors are nicely unisex. I like that it transitions from training wheels to two wheels pretty easily.

I have severe knee pain from tight T bands, so I've tried out several different foam rollers. I really like this one because of the nubby points, which make me feel like it's getting between muscle bands. I also like that this is a manageable size, so I can store it somewhere easily accessible instead of stashing a giant foam cylinder away somewhere. My only complaint is that this arrived partially deflated, which meant I had to take out the (included) inflation needle and hook it onto my (not included) bike pump to add air before even using it. Not sure if this is common with all of the products in this line, as I experienced the same with the gaiam massage ball set that I purchased recently. Would be nice to be able to use this right out of the package, and some people might not have a bike pump available. Otherwise this is a great pain reliever and good to have around!

Assembled easily but the top toy bar did not have the described button in the attachment area to let it click into place. It's clearly shown on the directions as clicking into place and several safety warnings on the device say the bar must be secured that way. I had my husband and a friend both look at it because I thought maybe I was missing something or not catching on to how to click the bar in.  Unfortunately I cannot rate the functionality of the item when it is unsafe.

Setup for this was exceptionally easy - much easier than I'd experienced with other repeaters, primarily because of the quality UI of its admin page and setup wizard. It's definitely boosted performance considerably in our bedroom (furthest point from the primary router), and looks nice while plugged in to boot. I particularly like how easy it makes it to just add it as another router point by putting it on the ssid of your primary network rather than having it as a separate ssid. Great to have!

Does not stop hiccups as quickly as mother's bliss gripe water, but baby seems to like it as much. I tasted it and it's very sweet, which seems to be he norm with these colic waters.  Does seem to have a positive effect on her gas bubbles though and does not cause her to cough like some people have said they've experienced with gripe water.

Baby likes the taste (apparently at least, since she eats it). I like that it doesn't rely on rice. I'm trying to avoid rice in her cereal because of the arsenic issues as of late. Quinoa is a nice alternative and high in protein. I also like that this isn't loaded with sugar or artificial colors and flavors.

Great little ultralight carryon - love all the separation provided by the interior pockets and the thoughtful touches on the outside. Note that this doesn't have rigid sides, so is very soft all around. All the better for me to fit into overhead bins and under seats, but keep that in mind if you expect a tradition big-a#% American style carryon that's practically the size of a small closet. Includes a lovely tumi luggage lock too. Looks so sharp!
Smells awesome, very portable, and is even covered with little things to read should you find yourself requiring some reading material. Makes life's necessities a little more civilized.

These are a great bargain for Turtle Bay quality. They have pretty amazing game amplification (tested on Destiny for Xbox One) and the features like being able to hear your own voice and whisper hearing are truly helpful for serious gamers. In addition, if you run any multimedia through your Xbox one (Netflix, cable tv, etc), you have the added bonus of being able to listen to the sound through these earphones, thus preventing say, your new newborn baby from waking in the next room. The construction of the headphones themselves is great - very comfortable to wear and they don't look like cheap telemarketer headphones like the Xbox one oem headset. The mic also cuts down on room noise considerably when doing group play, helping with communication. Can confirm this is compatible with the new Xbox one controller and setup is a breeze. Definitely a good price and a good buy.
Love the magazine. Have no use for the dinky, lame hat.

Very nice set that is great for this price point - they feel great in your hands, cut extremely well, and have not shown any of the issues with rusting that some other reviewers have mentioned. Keep them out of the dishwasher and don't put them away wet, of course!  The block is lovely and fits a full set in a small area - good for smaller kitchens like ours. I'd love to be able to take half a star off, though, for a lack of a full size serrated knife. It includes a small serrated knife but that won't do the trick if you're cutting something like a watermelon or squash. Otherwise great set of knives.

Wonderful fabric, excellent attention to details (love that the Velcro tabs all have counterparts to tuck into just for washing), and I like the new package design. My only complaint is that there really should be more Velcro on the bottom section and a bit larger fastening area for the shoulders, as my squirmy 2 month old can still get out of this one a bit at these locations. My favorite is the nuroo, but I prefer the fabric on this one as its cotton. Whatever swaddle you use, just remember swaddling is like the baby cheat code!

This thing is like the magical baby straightjacket.  It's also the only swaddler I found that fit our petite premie (but EXTREMELY active) baby and still held her tight in the early weeks.  The Summer Infant Swaddle Pod also fit her, but it was so loose that it didn't do much to soothe her crying.  Once we put her in the Nuroo smallest pocket and closed the velcro, a look of peace went over her face and she went right to sleep - for reals.  She's now 2 months and around 9 lbs, and we just transitioned to the second pocket in the swaddle.  I love love love that it has several different size options.  It also comes in extra cute colors, although I'd put my baby in a poop-colored paper bag designed swaddle if it made her happy and kept her safe.  The elephant design is darling and unisex.  I would take off maybe 1/2 a star because this swaddle is polyester.  We just went through a heat wave and I had to use the less effective but more breathable Summer Infant Swaddle Me because it's 100% cotton.  Other than that, this is a miracle for us.

I want to like this swaddle - it has a lot of details that are thoughtful, such as a two way zipper, cover for the zipper, and those cute and functional hand pockets.  Unfortunately, it's no where NEAR tight enough to make my little one calm down, which I could see immediately upon using it for 20 minutes.I've tried lots of swaddles out (we have an active one!).  My favorites are the Nuroo grow-with-me and the Swaddle Me.  The Nuroo would be perfect if it weren't for the fact that it's polyester (so a little bit hot).  The Swaddle Me is pretty good although it does occasionally require me to tug the shoulders down for proper fit.  For reference, our baby is 2 months old and around 9 lbs.  Sadly, this one just didn't work out for us.

I prefer the kind of extension unit in which the plugs are more staggered in their positions. With many devices today having large "boxes" at the plug position (no idea what those are called), it's getting harder and harder to fit everything into one power strip. The Belkin power strip is a little more useful for me with electronics because it offers that staggered plug placement (so you can fit more of those "boxes" side by side). This one isn't a bad option though if you don't need that feature.

Very comfy and perfect for our out of town guests. When folded up, this takes up about the same space as an old fashioned steam radiator. Doesn't look too bad either. I particularly like that this supports a range of body sizes - many of the other folding beds here have a top weight limit around 250-300. This was also EXTREMELY simple to get set up and to fold up and down every day, particularly because the legs automatically come down when you start to unfold it. I slept on this twice myself and it is very comfortable - not bars or ridges in your back at all. Highly recommend.
Didn't cause any negative skin reactions for my sensitive Boston Terriers and costs quite a bit less than the competitors. Definitely will buy this again!
These fit our daughter much better than the huggies brand diapers, and we've never experienced a blow out with pampers. The sensitive line does seem to be gentler on her bottom than other pampers.
Super yummy sodas - love these. They don't have any overly sweet or fake taste like most diet sodas, and are really refreshing.

Another great heater/fan combo from Vornado. I know the temptation to cheap out on these personal heaters, but seriously, spend the few extra dollars and get one like this. It has a safety tip over switch, doesn't get hot to the touch, fits nicely under a desk, and looks professional and nice. Plus, it's a handy little fan for when heating is no longer needed. Definitely give this one a try.

Setup was SUPER easy and within minutes, this router was cranking out really fast interwebs through the air in my apartment. I kinda wish you could choose NOT to have three different bands (I just don't need them), but I still really appreciate the speed, quality, and easy setup of this router. It's far faster than my Apple router or the Xfinity dual band wifi router/modem combo, and has an excellent range. No more endless buffering in the back bedroom when watching Netflix - yayyy

Super cute little bath toys - love these!  They are darling and modern-looking, so I don't have to rush to hide them every time we're done using them. And the water jet they put out is entertaining to baby.
I love love love having a usb extension cord so that I can reach plugs quickly and easily. This fits the bill, is unobtrusive, and allows my devices to charge quickly. I'm very happy with it
Dog pillow is super cute and very durable. Love it!

This is very cute, but the actual pages themselves are way too focused on nursery decorating than on baby. For example, there are three pages devoted for you to paste in "nursery inspiration."  I'd rather that space be used for birth memories or other pictures and writing down things related to being pregnant. I feel like there's not a lot of pre-filled questions for the parents to fill out, which would be nice in order to kind of prompt you when filling up the book. I'd also love love love it if this book included paste on photo corners, since there are lots of spots that say, "put baby photo here."  The things I DO love are the wrap around string to keep items in the book, the great big pockets for keepsakes, the spiral lay-flat binding, and the modern design. Just improve the written items inside and this would be a five star baby book.

Works great to protect our twin bed from spills and animal fluids - this is designed to function kind of like a hospital style bed pad, so it's really easy to get on and off and very absorbent. I appreciate that it's held up well to a few washes so far. Will consider getting another one so I have one to use when this is in the wash.

Very thick, sturdy bags that don't rip or tear - I really like using Husky bags for recycling instead of extra cheap bags because husky bags won't explode into a giant mess. My recycling tends to be heavier than trash and much bulkier. These bags keep it in line and corrale all of that stuff. I like both the clear and the clear/blue bags for recycling but prefer the blue tinted ones slightly as it's easier for guests to know that can is for recycling with the blue color. Excellent product

This mat is super soft and cute. If love if it had a pocket of some kind to fold back into itself, or an integrated strap with which to fold it up and secure it. Otherwise it's lovely and soft, with lots of cute crinkly items for baby to play with and explore. The ears and "deer horns" are flexible and floppy, so baby can play with them, and the different parts of the mat crinkle nicely for tummy time. The design is also fairly cute and easy on the eyes :)  Lastly, this comes wrapped in a lovely ribbon, making it ready for gift giving at a shower.  It would be nice if this came in gray instead of pink or blue, so it could be more gender neutral (maybe it does and I just don't see that option on Amazon). Otherwise it's a great product!

Baby loves this swing and so does mom. It's so great that it's battery powered and can be taken from room to room. Our baby has reflux and I need to keep her upright after eating. This swing makes it easy to do that wherever I am in the apartment. The vibrating seat is a big hit with baby and keeps her happy. Our daughter is very small and fits perfectly in the seat. I also like that it looks so nice in our apartment (it looks like it practically matches our Halo Bassinest Harmony Circles).

Our baby was born early and was given pumped milk exclusively by bottle for the first two weeks of her life.  Because of that and her relatively underdeveloped sucking reflex, breast feeding was a bit harder to get the hang of than we expected.  For that reason, we really focused on making sure the bottles we used imitated that wide open mouth suckle that is needed for good breastfeeding latching.  Both the MAM and the Avent Natural bottles are designed to make this transition between bottle and breast easier, and both claim to help "colic," a catch-all term that here refers specifically to stomach distress on the part of the newborn.  Having used both, I am much happier with the Avent Natural for a few reasons:- Avent nipples are less likely to fold back in on themselves when the baby is suckling on them. Avent claims their "petals" imitate live nipples, so maybe this is part of it.- No difference in stomach distress between the two of them, but I'm able to get the last of the milk out of the Avent bottle more easily than the MAM without tipping the baby's head all the way back.  Since the pediatrician strongly recommended feeding her while she is a bit upright to reduce stomach gas and spit up, this is an important distinction.- Most importantly for me, the mouth of the baby when suckling on an Avent Natural nipple looks much more like the mouth that should be seen on a good breastfeeding latch - wide, with a very open bottom lip.- Just two preference things - the markings are much easier to read on the Avent bottles (both Classic and Natural), so I'm able to see more quickly how much milk the baby has consumed.  Also, I don't see the point of the separate screw-on bottom for the MAM bottles.  Seems like one more thing to lose for me, and my pediatrician stated she doesn't think those bottoms actually have any affect on stomach distress.All in all, I tried out both Avent types (classic and natural), the MAM, and Born Free.  I am sticking with the Avent Natural and bought another 6 bottles in that line because I strongly prefer their nipples and the latch they promote.

Husband says this is very easy to use and does a nice job on both body hair and beards. He found the messages of "works great in shower" and the inclusion of a shower hook a bit confusing, given the contradicting instruction that the tool works best on dry hair. Otherwise he said the groomer was extremely easy to use and worked well.

Waaay too large for me, resulting in it being unusable. For reference, I use a medala size small nipple guard and size 24 pump flanges. The case won't fit any other nipple guard beside this one (and only barely fits this one), so even that aspect of the order isn't usable for me. Too bad because medelas are expensive.

This has been a GREAT help postpartum - I set it up next to my bed and the baby's bassinet, and put a cheap placemat on top.  At first I was worried it was too big, but then I started collecting more and more baby items after she was born.  This little table holds my breast pump, my bin of breast pump supplies, my huge container of water, the baby monitor, snacks, and any other random things I need.  The lip around the sides is so useful to keep things from falling off, and the price was perfect.  Super happy with this thing, which has really been a lifesaver.  I particularly like, too, that when I want to move it to a new location, it's just a quick fold-up and it will move easily.  Definitely a good product for a new mom who needs a place to set down the few thousand extra things you need with a new baby.
This toothbrush works great, gets my mouth exceptionally clean, and really does appear to visibly whiten. It's been about 5 days of using it and my teeth look cleaner and whiter already.

Love that this quickly and easily heats a room, without obvious hot spots. Like the other vornado heater we use, you never feel a direct blast of heat from this product. Instead, it really manages to heat a large area of air quickly, making small to medium sized rooms comfortable quite quickly. We live in a fairly moderate climate, so heaters like this are great so that we can just hear small areas of our apartment. Score one for energy efficiency. In addition, the safety features here are a must - most particularly the tip-over function. I've tested it several times while standing there, and the heater absolutely will not run if tipped over in any direction. That's an essential for me. Lastly, the colors are cheery and gender neutral - perfect for baby's nursery. Definitely recommend this product.

Doggies love the taste and smell of this obviously, as they come running when I open a can. I love that it doesn't upset their sensitive stomachs, so I can use it as an occasional meal topper. I have two bostons and a can lasts about a week when used as a meal topper.

These are really lovely 0.925 silver and perfect for sensitive ears. They go well with many outfits and are so lightweight that your ears never feel too stretched after wearing them.  It's also a great design.
Beautiful 0.925 stamped silver earrings that are perfect for sensitive ears like mine - no irritation from the metal, very lightweight, and lovely with multiple outfits.

Smells wonderful and my husband loves that it doesn't dry out his skin. I love that it doesn't smell like he's washed in a bottle of cologne like when he uses Old Spice body wash. Bottle is the perfect size for the shower and fits nicely in the shower organizer.

I've always been intrigued by the promise of Bluetooth headphones, but never liked any pair enough to plunk down the big bucks.  What you get in convenience you usually lose in looks, cool factor, and sound.  However I feel like after a week of using this little set, I'm a convert to Bluetooth headphones.  It's so incredibly convenient to throw these around my neck and work all day in my open office environment with them on.  I love that I can switch between my iPhone 6 and my macbook pro quickly and efficiently, due to the dual pairing function.  I don't know of any other Bluetooth speakers I have that pair from one device to another as seamlessly as these do - other manufacturers should take note.  Other things I love:PROS- Sound is great.  Almost as good as my V-Moda over ear headphones and just as good at blocking out noise.- Size and fit.  Perfectly fits around my neck and just rests there comfortably.  It's easy to forget I have these on, actually.- Functionality.  Others have complained about the relative simplicity and lack of "clickiness" of the controls, but I actually REALLY like these two factors.  It's so simple to use all of the controls and I find myself reaching for them intuitively already, a week into using these.- Earphone covers for life.  Puts them in the realm of V-Moda for great customer support and standing behind their products (V-Moda already replaced my headphone cord twice).  I found the variety of sizes really nice, too, as I usually can't fit the bigger in-ears properly and so was pleasantly happy to find the small fit perfectly.- GREAT for phone calls.  Clients can hear me loud and clear and these look WAY less lame than those one-ear Bluetooth monstrosities from the early 00s.CONS:- Sometimes I have considerable feedback when using dual device pairing and answering a phone call.  Seems like this happens if my laptop and iPhone are right next to each other - I fixed it by turning off bluetooth on whatever one I'm not talking on at that moment.  Easy peasy.- Battery life could be a little longer (currently listed as 8 hrs, about what I get).  Sound and connection degrades quickly at the end of the battery life, and I would love to be able to listen to my headphones in bed at night to sleep without worrying about how they will charge in the morning in time for my train commute.- Indicator light is SUPER annoying when the headphones are charging if you don't turn them off ahead of time.  That's the only one that almost made me dislike these.  I figured out that you have to turn them off BEFORE you plug them in to charge, though, and then then light no longer blinks on and off all night.In all, the pros considerably outweigh the cons for me.  As with another reviewer, I don't think I would have purchased bluetooth headphones at all prior to testing these out, but now I would be quick to buy another pair if anything ever happened to these.  They are great and so portable.  Now off I go to listen to more music...

Purchased as a gift for my friend - price was great, case works splendidly, and it looks very nice too.  She loves it, particularly the "polka dots" on the case.  Definitely recommend for someone looking for a functional but not huge case

Smells wonderful but isn't perfume-y - I'd say the blood orange flavor just about gets at that "who peeled an orange" smell. I really like that if I leave the lid off of this candle in my spare room, I can smell it all the way on down the hallway. But again, it's not a fake gross smell. Candle also looks very nice sitting on my side table.
Love love love that you have the option of both the bulb and the "sucker."  This works great and is the best of both worlds. Would definitely recommend as a baby present

Scissors are always wandering off at our office, so this giant pack of them is perfect for the "kids" at work. These fit adult hands just fine and cut nicely. I keep a pair in my craft bag too. Color is nice because they are easy to spot!

This vacuum is a nice option when we don't want to get our large Dyson out (okay, "large" is a stretch, but the Dyson is kind of a bit much to pull out EVERY time the dog decides to shred something on the carpeting).  I like how lightweight and easy to use this Bissell is, while still having the economy of a cyclonic (no more bags!).  However, as others have noted, there is no rotating brush on the "head."  That kind of renders this thing weaker than it needs to be, particularly because the vacuum seems to have enough suction to be able to pick up debris when it's off carpeting.  On our relatively newish shag carpeting, though, using this is a bit like dragging a large Dirt Devil handvac over the carpet, over and over.  It takes a while to get fuzzier items off the floor.  I would definitely recommend this thing for power, weight, and ease of use if you mainly have hardwood/laminate and some rugs.  It does an awesome job on those surfaces like in our kitchen and bathrooms, and is easy peasy to use.  For that reason, I am only taking off one star - just know what you are getting and buy accordingly!

This soap leaves my skin feeling SO soft and smelling wonderful.  The scent isn't overly flowery or cloying, but is more like a unisex "clean" scent.  I love how natural it smells.  I have extremely sensitive skin, and using this soap for over 8 days didn't cause my skin to itch or feel tight even once.  The box that this comes in is so pretty too, and the bar smells lovely through the packaging.  Definitely would make a nice gift for someone you want to allow to treat themselves :)

This is really nice balm, and easy to carry around in my little purse pocket.  I like that I can use it all over my face, not just on my lips.  It has a very light smell and doesn't burn like the Burt's Bees products that have menthol in them.  My skin is so incredibly sensitive and this balm doesn't cause any reactions.  I still think my Egyptian Magic balm is a little better, but it's much less convenient to carry around.

Cute little mat that fits perfectly under our Petmate water fountain (we have the small square one, but it would fit under others). I like that it's non skid and keeps the fountain from jostling around when the dogs drink from it. It's also big enough that their drips from the water are contained nicely. And it's darn cute!

I really love the scent and feel of this lotion. It goes on smoothly and absorbs quickly. One star off because the ingredients are a bit chemically more complicated than I prefer - I like something more like alba very emollient lotion. The alba lotion can go on your skin when wet too.

I have purchased these in the past (identical part number), and they were excellent little USB 2.0 drives.  Now, they have been redesigned (and not a lower price, either), but they are like 1/6 the speed on small files (to joke levels), and the sequential writes are half.  About the only positive thing I can say now is that it looks nice, but the newest revision of this is one of the slowest drives around.  Hardly worth the slow 10 days shipping to receive such a poor product.

The reviews sounded promising and the ingredient list contains a few things I have heard of/tried before like stinging nettle root, velvet bean extract, and tongkat ali, but after taking a bottle of this at its maximum 2 capsules 3X day on workout days and 2X on non-workout days, I noticed no discernible difference during or since stopping.  I have been working out for about 5 years and workout typically 5-6 days per week, and I know my body and diet well.  I got neither leaner nor bigger.  That's not to say it won't work for you, but I would rather take herbs like stinging nettle root, maca, or tongkat ali straight.  For me, the price was not justified.

I've gone through a couple tubs of this product as well as a couple bottles of other tablets.  I cannot honestly tell any significant difference.  Everybody is different, but I will not be purchasing this again.DAA claims are based on something like one research study, and all the supplement companies jumped on the bandwagon to sell the "clinical" dosage of 3g.  If you spend any time on the pub med website, you can find research that readily shows conflicting results of about any supplement, so I take these claims with a huge grain of salt.For me, I had no dissolving or taste issues, but it just didn't do anything either.  It is a naturally-occurring, non-essential amino acid (also meaning your body can convert to/from this amino if it wants).  Just go look at your typical amino acid profile of whey, and you'll find that it contains about the same amount.
I have purchased a few of these, and they work excellent for me.  To confirm, I am using these with 4K = 3840x2160 at 60p and 4:4:4 chroma with never a problem.

The quality is generally consistent, but C&E has jacked the price up 2X to 5X from when I first purchased these in several different lengths and quantities (perhaps after some favorable reviews).  They are no longer competitive and, while most are flexible and above average, some are stiff and sub-par for sure.  Pricing is seriously hit or miss and mostly miss.

I have the "ultimate set of tools" and have been working with electronics for 45 years, so I was not afraid of the tools required.  These use a 1.5mm hex key.  Not that popular, but I have them.What is a total fail is, while the center conductor screw clamps onto the conductor, the ground/shield is a totally bass-akward design that could only possibly work for coax and only partially.  The set screw for the other conductors screws against the first wire.  This will never work with a speaker cord which is what I was using it for (longer wires for some computer speakers).  In the case of a coax conductor it will also just split the shield and cause a flaky connection and pierce the insulation into the center connection if you would go any further (as in enough to get the housing over the set screw).I short, I have no idea what they were thinking when they designed this.  It is a total fail and just needs to be withdrawn from the market.

These look stunning, and the size (going by inches) of 26-30 is accurate.  I run on the smaller side of US small, and these were not tight at all.  I take off a star since I think the quality could be better, but, given the price, I would buy them again, and the shipping speed was pretty good, too.  I just melted some of the unraveling threads with a lighter.  The wording is also a bit overdone on the front, but they are a sporty-looking swim/pool bikini if you have the body.

Dell needs another generation on this IMO.  It works fine if you are using this only at its native resolution/refresh.  I am a geek with many, many PCs, laptops, servers, you name it.  This one was to replace a 24" Dell U2410.  The primary PC would be running 4K 60Hz, but, via the wide array of inputs, it would also be used occasionally for a 2nd PC, a docked laptop, and a phone.I am not a gamer, and I have zero issues at 3840x2160 at 60Hz via DP 1.2.  No noticeable lag, and good color, especially after calibration.  Unfortunately, at any other resolutions/frequencies, it is worthless.  At 30Hz, the lag is terrible -- like 1/4 second to 1/2 second.  Note that, again, I am not a gamer, and I find 3840x2160 at 30Hz on a 4K TV to be very usable.  This is not.  It is awful.  I've never seen anything this bad.  Also, it is unusable at HD 1920x1080.  Rather than just multiplying 2x2 like you would expect (or that Windows can do if equipped with a suitable graphics card), it does some major upsampling, then downsampling again.  The result is so ugly.  10X worse than a regular HD monitor or TV.  I have not seen anything this bad since a really BAD CRT.  And, yes, I did fiddle for hours with every conceivable setting.In short, if you are using this at 3840x2160 and 60Hz via DP 1.2, you will be OK.  If you intend to use it via MHL, HDMI, or with any other PC/game console/whatever that doesn't, it's useless.  The manual is wrong, and the VESA modes that it lists are unusable. I am much happier with my Samsung 4K TV or my other Dell HD monitors.  Given I have about 7 other Dell monitors, I expected better -- at least better than a TV.

This is a fantastic drive.  I am a major hardware geek, especially when it comes to drives (desktop, mobile, SSD, whatever).  Your life and work (or school) are stored on drives, so I keep many around, usually in pairs -- one of which I keep in a fire safe at all times.I also have this drive in the larger (thicker) dual-platter size, and I don't like it nearly as much.  Although the price difference is small between the 500GB and 1TB drives, I like the 500GB better.  It is plenty big for OS and files -- about anything other than video.  The 500GB drive is just super slim and SUPER quiet.  It is about 9mm versus the 12mm listed on this page.I am burned-out on loud drives, and this sleek, thin drive is not only quiet but well-built and handsome.  I got this as part of the VINE program, but I subsequently purchased a twin silver one in 500GB.  I then purchased the 1TB (thicker), but I don't like the 1TB drive nearly as much.  It is thicker and louder.The tops of these are real metal with a nice machined logo on them.  The sides are shiny plastic which I don't like as much because it scratches easy and shows fingerprints.  The bottom is a nice, matte, textured black plastic.  The LEDs are white and in a slit which has a nice effect.  The slimmer 500GB also minimizes the black sides while emphasizing the nice top.I have not had any problems with any of these.  I was tempted to buy some of the 2TB drives, which are a fantastic price, but they are even louder, and you basically destroy the nice case if you try to extract them.  In fact, the 2TB drives are louder than my WD Green desktop drives.So, despite the price, the 500GB is really my pick of the litter.  They also make a Mac version in silver which, instead of a brushed silver finish, comes in a matte silver finish.

This review is not fair to OKGEAR, but is representative of the Amazon product listing.IF you get the real OKGEAR CG12AMF product, it is a fine cable, and it is 12" long and works as advertised.  I have purchased 3 of these from Coolerguys, and they are legit.  Those are 5-star products.However, at the time of this review, approximately 2/3 are sellers in China/Hong Kong.  I have purchased 2 of these from Wire Factory (a seller in China).  These sellers come and go, and what I received is even "reject" generic cables.  They were not made by OKGEAR.  They made no attempt to even make these look fake with a different package and part number.  The cables had sloppy molded connectors and were only about 7" long.  These were even rejects by generic Chinese standards.  The package was labeled 30cm, and the product inside was only 18cm.Be very careful about who you buy these from.  Only buy from a legitimate USA seller if you have any hope of receiving the real product.  You will pay a premium, but the fake ones aren't even worth 1 star.  I won't even attempt to use those junk cables with my expensive SSDs and other drives.

This appears to be the only "desktop" gigabit switch with more than 8 ports that route out the back.Sad, though.  It looks supremely cheap in real life, and, apparently, the quality/construction goes with it.  Mine arrived with something major like the circuit board or PSU clunking around inside.  From YouTube videos and (many thanks to) Amazon members, this is not normal and is defective/broken.  As mentioned, all the ports are just plastic as well.  I also don't like how it is slanted, so you can't stack anything on top of it, but I was willing to live with that.This is cost-cutting gone wild, but with no savings to you, the customer. Other, sturdy, metal 24-port gigabit switches are similarly priced, but the ports go out the front.

I have purchased numerous sets of these.  They are excellent quality.  I very much like that they are fully sleeved for a neat appearance as well as they have fully-enclosed receptacles.  Most "cheap" splitter cables have exposed pins.  This can have the unfortunate problem of accidentally shorting out on practically anything if they become disconnected or while you are "tuning" with different fans/speed reducers.  If this happens, you can easily fry your motherboard.  This is cheap insurance, and I am a big fan of this and other Noctua products -- best quality out there.

I have two older versions of this fanless PSU, namely the 80 plus Gold versions and quite a few fan-powered SeaSonic PSUs.  No pun intended, but I was a SeaSonic fan boi!  I would have thought the new Platinum fanless would be an improvement.  Not at all.Note that the quality of the PSU itself is excellent.  No noise, high quality -- just like the previous "older" versions.However, SeaSonic has redesigned all their power supplies compared to a couple years ago, so the modular plugs are no longer compatible.  But, the deal breaker is that the new modular cables use cheap flat ribbon cables, and, for me, they are TOO SHORT!  The older cables were vastly better.  They were fully sleeved as well as longer.  I build my PCs with large cases for big circulation and ventilation as well as large, slow fans.  These fanless PSUs are perfect for this.  However, the newer cables get all scratched and cut up by my heat sinks.  The cables are stiff and cheap and too short.  Also, for my cases (SilverStone FT02), the SATA "backplane" connectors go the wrong way, so the cable has to be further mercilessly twisted and contorted to reach.  The old cables were not directional (not 90 degree), so you could easily use them in either direction.  I had to use many extensions and Y-connectors, and it was a mess.  I finally decided to replace as many of the cables as I could.  Luckily, the older SeaSonic PSU cables for the Molex and SATA can be found on eBay.  Those are compatible.  In all, I had to spend another $20 to get just SOME of the cable back to like they were in the older version designs and to fit my cases.NOT worth the cost or the hassle.  I will look for another fanless PSU brand in the future.  I have enjoyed SeaSonic PSUs for over a decade, but no longer.  Their cheap cables are not worth spending 50% of the cost of the power supply to replace.  I will probably go with SilverStone fanless in the future.UPDATE:  I'm going to knock this down another star.  This comes with 3x PCIe sockets (technically a 4th is a shared MB CPU/PCIe modular socket), but there are NO commercially-available PCIe cables that fit this -- not even from SeaSonic.  I tried one from SilverStone which physically fits, but SeaSonic is too cheap to pin-out these 8-pin sockets.  They are only 6-pin and thus the PCIe only works with 6-pin -- NOT 8-pin.

Wow!  What a fantastic cable!  Not only is this a super-rare, left-angle power cord, but it is available in a variety of lengths (as well as right-angle).I actually needed the two prong version of this which, I believe, is a C17, however this is compatible.  C17 cables are next to impossible to find, especially in an angle plug.  This is exceptionally compact and has the added benefit of a gripper to pull the cord out.I have many C13 power cords, and most of them are stiff, cheap junk, so I was worried that this 3-wire C13 would be way too thick/stiff for my 2-wire C17 application.  To my surprise, this is much more flexible than most of my C13 cords and about as flexible as my 2-wire C13 cables.In sum, I am just completely satisfied with this on all levels.  I would highly recommend this compact plug for any 2-wire/3-wire application where you have limited space behind your equipment.  This gave me my needed clearance, and I am thankful for this product.  I rarely say thankful because often there are many products to choose from, and it is often a matter of choosing the least bad solution, but not here.  It delivers with no sacrifices.

I regret believing the positive reviews on this "enterprise" product.  For three hundred bucks, I could buy ten or more garbage consumer products which actually work better.  The web interface is crude and is a joke.  I wasted time on forums trying to figure out how to do pretty much anything more advanced than setting the SSID which, that and pretty building pictures, are about all you get through the UI.  There is no MAC filtering which is a basic feature even on junk products from ten years ago.The real killer on this joke of a product is it's range.  It falsely advertises 28dBm and 28dBm on 2.4GHz and 5GHz respectively with 3x 5dBi antennas.  Well, first, it won't let you set 28dBm.  Well, they could argue this is a country limitation.  So, I changed it in the SSH command line, but the UI will still not let you change it.  At a maximum of 22dBm on a 5dBi antenna, it consistently provides a signal 5 to 10 dBm LOWER than a garbage WiFi 20 dBm router with a 2dBi antenna.  On 5GHz, I can barely get a signal in the room directly above the AP.I thought this would solve my problems of poor reach/range and competing with neighboring WiFi signals, but this is a joke, and there is basically no feature set.  I will have to go back to having multiple APs, but I will go with the ones that cost twenty bucks.

Decent and good value, these are of the split ring construction (male end) which is the only kind I will use.  I've had various of the machined (and more expensive) brass ends, and they get jammed on the female jacks, sometimes breaking them or ripping them clean off the circuit board.  These are the safe kind, and, in fact, I would say that the male end is too loose -- not gripping enough and spinning around too freely.I would give these 3 stars for this, but they are also very inexpensive, and I needed 8 of these, so this worked out fine in a home environment.  I would be hesitant to use these in a mobile/car environment, however, because of the too-loose fit.  Overall, these work without spending 5 or ten bucks a piece on ones that can potentially damage equipment -- which is pretty much all the other available products out there.

Fantastic!  This is of the PE dielectric coaxial construction and is surprisingly flexible.  The little dongle/connector in the middle is a bit large, but it performs fine.  I noticed no pickup of hum or noise which suggests this is a quality, shielded product.Despite the other negative review and conflicting Amazon information, I took a chance on this.  Unlike the detailed description, this matches the title and picture.  It has one male RCA plug adapting to two female RCA jacks.  Each female jack gets fed the same signal from the male end.  This is useful to sending an audio path to two amps, etc.  In my case, this was to two subwoofers.Also, note that the male end is of the split ring construction.  This is the only type I will buy.  I have had many of the machined brass kind, and they are terrible, despite appearing more fancy and certainly, usually much more expensive.  The reason is this.  Male/female RCA jacks vary in tolerances all over the place.  I've had machined brass RCA male plugs go into the jacks, but like one of those Chinese finger-pull toys, they don't pull off.  I've had them jam and literally rip the jacks right off expensive amplifier circuit boards.  This is a very common construction, and I avoid them period.Anyway, these are the "ticket" and work excellent.  I highly recommend this product along with the KabelDirekt coaxial RCA cables for connecting low-level signal paths.  Finally, run away from those twisted-pair construction wires.  They are garbage, too.

I love these little subwoofers and would give them 5 stars except for their quality control problems.  I've had to return about 50% of them.They deliver a good amount of tight, controlled bass for a bedroom or office or small living room.  I actually prefer the bass quality of two of these over a larger subwoofer, including some pricey brands.  This is something I prefer in the 5.2 or 7.2 setups where two subs perform better with less standing waves and more even bass distribution, despite the sheer lack of ultra-low frequencies.  These do exceptionally well for music, but not as good as the bigger 12" and 15" units in a home theater where you just need to move a lot of volume of air for explosions, sound effects, and so on.The quality control is terrible on these with several units having crooked drivers (yes, the actual drivers) and sloppy manufacturing.  Sometimes, the manuals are all torn up, like they got dragged under a forklift or something.  Weird things like dirty, broken Styrofoam and holes punched in the boxes.  Seems to be all over the place.  Most of these cosmetic defects, however, can be cleaned up with the exception of the crooked drivers/assembly.There are also a few bugs.  The LFE (according to the manual) is supposed to bypass the active filter, but it doesn't.  Also, it is labeled such that the right channel is LFE only.  This doesn't fix it either.  In any mode (line-level or RCA), both left and right inputs are summed and go through the active filter.  With only 1 channel, you will get half the bass.  You may be able to correct this with level settings, depending on your overall setup.  This is fine with me, but not the way it is labeled/described in the manual -- just so you know.  Also, the auto standby doesn't do anything.  The power draw is the same no matter what.  This is also OK with me as a fancy-pants Velodyne would auto-cutout at low volumes despite not having an advertised auto-standby feature.  I'd rather have it not work, but it doesn't work like in the manual -- just so you know.  Finally, across different systems, these seem to work best with the phase 180 degrees.  In all, these electrical bugs are OK with me and perfectly OK compared to the problems I've encountered in other components.  Sad that in this day and age, something as simple as a subwoofer can be filled with bugs.Anyway, the electrical problems are inconsequential to me.  The quality defects may or may not be a deal breaker.  I hope they bring these back soon, as I would like to buy some more.  The price is great, and the looks are fantastic.  They do not scream audiophile dork.  Very clean and elegant-looking.  Compact and unobtrusive.  For the price, these are a winner, assuming you get a good one.

These are garbage.  I can't believe all the positive reviews here.On the plus side, they are quite flexible, and the connectors are excellent and compact.HOWEVER, these are just twisted pair wiring.  There is no shielding whatsoever.  These pick up more noise and hum than I have ever experienced.  Truly loud and obnoxious background noise.  I've never had to worry about noise/hum with even dollar drugstore RCA cables or the cheap Chinese-made cables included for free with almost any product.  These are for low-level, high-impedance signals, and they are just a big fail.  I threw them out.  Too bad I bought them somewhere else where the shipping from and back would cost me too much.Nice-looking cable, but that's about it.  Terrible performance.  If you care about sound quality, don't buy these.

I am a huge fan of Noctua, and these are no exception.  They are 50Œ©.  The reality is that every motherboard/configuration/fan is slightly different with a different load.  You can hook fans up directly to the power supply with 12V or through a motherboard header.  Since this is a 4-pin adapter, it makes no sense to use this with anything other than a 4-pin motherboard header and a PWM-controlled fan.  Different motherboard manufacturers implement different speed logic (or none at all) on their motherboards for different fan outputs.  There is also a dependency on the temperature sensor location (chassis or CPU).  The net is there is a huge range of variables.  Any claims that a fan reducer drops a fan by 300 RPM or whatever is a gross simplification and, generally, wrong IMO.What I like is that these are about the right resistance for most of my applications.  I have about 6 computers at any given moment, and most of them are overclocked monsters in huge cases.  My fans range from 60mm to 180mm -- presenting different loads, requirements, etc.  Most of the existing fan speed reducers I have are in the 100Œ© to 150Œ© range which is too high since I'm using slower, quieter fans to begin with.  I no longer use Zalman adapters with Noctua as they lead to a buzzing noise.  With these I can use 1 or stick a couple in series to get 50, 100, or 150 ohms and then pick one of my others if I do, in fact, need more, but I find 50Œ© is pretty good for a chassis fan off a PWM-controlled chassis 4-pin motherboard connector.  Again, it all depends on your particular fans and motherboard.  I generally run SSDs, and I want everything silent.  My monitors typically make more noise than my PCs.Emails with Noctua confirms these are nominal 50Œ©.  Noctua quality, sleeved, etc., but I wish the box wasn't so fancy since I just throw that away.

Love it!  I use this in a USB 3.0 desktop hub.  Most of my devices that are plugged into it are USB drives or mouse dongles, etc., but I have a few cabled devices such as a SATA dock and a wired keyboard.  Instead of having the cable angle towards me and then have to flop it back over in a mess, this just does the trick in sending the cable rearwards.  A bit expensive to be tidy, but I'm sure it'll come in handy for a long time.  Note to check your port orientation.  This is a right angle.  They also make a left angle. You can tell by which side of the port rectangle has the plastic blue tab/connection.

I bought this to re-purpose an older, socket 1156 motherboard/CPU -- last one to have a floppy port.  ;)  Embarrassed to say this cost probably more than the motherboard/CPU was worth, but my older EnzoTech HSF beast would not fit in the desktop case this was destined.To get to the point: This is well-made, but uses an incredibly complex/funky mounting system with proprietary screws/etc. so there is no chance to modify/adapt this.  The translation from Japanese was never reviewed, and the instructions are just awful.  I read through them completely 3 or 4 times.  Luckily, the pictures speak a thousand English words.Well, I can tell you that this does not fit my Gigabyte socket 1156 motherboard.  I also checked with a Gigabyte socket 1155 motherboard I had nearby.  The problem is the backing plate for CPU retention mechanism is too thick for this thing's intended design.  This is the scenario with almost every retention mechanism I can recall.  The special stepped screws are just not plain long enough to reach the heat sink arms to even get a thread or two on.  This is something where the holes were designed to line up, but there was no consideration for thickness.I have been building systems since the PC AT days, and all the recent HSFs I have used all accommodate the CPU retention mechanisms that I have encountered.  In the end, I just stayed with my EnzoTech heat sink and did not use its fan.

This is a good USB 3.0 front panel.  It is sad, however, that people who design these don't have ANY knowledge of the electrical/mechanical aspects to make a great front panel.First, electrically, it works fine with my Intel motherboard's USB ports (both internal header and external), but it won't work at USB 3.0 with my motherboard's ASMedia chip.  The devices are just not recognized AT ALL -- only USB 2.0 devices.  I have found this with other USB hubs, so I suspect it is a problem with the ASMedia chip.Anyway, this uses a USB 3.0 motherboard header.  Strangely, it uses one USB 3.0 port for the 4-port USB 3.0 hub, but then wastes the second USB 3.0 connection for a 2-port USB 2.0 hub.  I wonder why on earth they would do this since USB 3.0 ports are backwards-compatible with 2.0, so this just wastes a precious USB 3.0 motherboard port to give you a lame 2-port USB 2.0 hub.  (I also need an internal header for my case's front 2-panel USB 3.0 connection).I hooked this up to an internal header to external Type A adapter, and confirmed that I can actually just plug one "half" into a USB 2.0 port and the other into a USB 3.0 port, and everything works as you would expect.  The speeds I got tested out at around 250MB/s on a Samsung 840 Pro SSD, however, I suspect the limitation is actually my SATA-to-USB 3.0 bridge.  It is clearly working at well-above USB 2.0 speeds and plenty fast for my usage (card readers, conventional HDD, etc.).Another minor fail is the use of an antiquated 4-pin MOLEX power connector.  Almost any modern computer with USB 3.0 headers is using SATA drives and SATA power connectors, so you will have to source an adapter on your own.  They are only about $1, but will interrupt your build and you will have to pay for the shipping/inconvenience.Next, on to the mechanical.  It is made of metal which is nice!  No cheap plastic which I dislike.  However, during the machining, they didn't even bother to remove the plastic wrap on the metal, so you will have to pick that off yourself.  Since it extends under the faceplate, it's easiest to remove the 3 screws which hold it into place rather than trying to pick it out of the cracks.  While it was off, I also painted mine silver since I have a silver case.More on the mechanical:  The USB 3.0 ports are freaking tight, while the USB 2.0 are fine.  I found it best that, while you have the face plate off, take a tiny screwdriver and bend all the friction/grip tabs on the USB 3.0 ports away from the connector.  They are the problem, and when they are bent out of the way, insertion/removal is still snug, but you won't worry about breaking anything off.Meanwhile, the circuit board is held in by 2 screws.  Mine was not like in the picture with 2 screws at the rear of the board.  Mine had two screws in the middle of the board, and the circuit board flops up and down in the panel, especially when struggling with tight connectors.  In the end, I found 2 standoffs and added the rear mounts.  There were screw holes drilled, but mine had no standoffs or rear screws installed.  It does not use typical motherboard-height standoffs.  They are like 3/8" of an inch.In sum, this could be a really good panel with even the tiniest forethought and care in design/manufacturing.  But, as it stands, it is just a basic, good cheap Chines-made panel.  Nothing to brag about and could be better for the money.

This is a first-rate maca root extract.  I have been comparing different brands of maca to assist with BPH.  I have found that maca is a key component of my treatment program, but even at equivalent doses, this works better than some brands (Now, for example) which don't work at all -- or at least not that I can tell.  Although, per equivalent gram, this is more expensive than cheaper brands, it works.This is a 10:1 extract at 750mg.  I am taking two AM and two PM for an equivalent of 15gm twice a day.  Thus, it lasts less than a month for me, but it is still more economical than the prescription drugs I am on which treat the cause and not the symptom -- which I believe is the more healthy approach.  This is considerably more quantity than the typical 1-3g  or even 5g per day recommendations, but I like the higher dosage.  There does not appear to be any harm in much higher dosages.I do not notice any change in libido, but this herb works not to boost any particular hormone such as testosterone, but bring various hormones more to healthy/normal levels.  There is some research that it is as potent as finasteride for treatment of BPH, and I can definitely say that is true.

The Cuddlebed is indeed very comfy.  It is soft and fluffy for sure.  The cotton TOP is a nice, durable, high thread count fabric.  It adds comfort and breathability to foam mattresses which was my main intent.  Even the sides are a high-quality, very stretchy and durable material.  In short, I have no problems with the preceding...However, this product is SERIOUSLY FLAWED.  The bottom of this mattress cover might as well be made out of toilet paper.  It is that super cheap polyester "paper" is about the best I can describe.  In less than a year, it began to pill and just disintegrate.  Where my shoulders rest, the paper just tore and all the polyester fluff came out.  It is just a huge clean-up job at this point.  See my customer pictures.I would give this thing 5 stars if they would have thought to make the bottom out of actual cotton fabric or other more durable material.  To use such a cheap material that fell apart is just a disgrace at this premium price point.

I'm not even going to comment on size.  It's like if you buy an extra large shirt, then complain it doesn't fit right because you are a medium.  This is MY size!  Love the size!OK.  Nice watch, but it doesn't feel as quality as some other watches that may be more expensive but also more discounted.  I would give it 4 stars on the quality.  The watch band is wide, and the holes are cool.  The leather is soft, comfortable, and flexible.As far as style, it is simple and clean and stylish which I prefer or the mega-mechanical look of some watches with endless dials and numbers all over them and are just a busy mess.  Does anyone ever really use lap timers and stopwatches and so forth? I have a smart phone if I ever need that.  I just want something stylish which I can tell I've got 5 more minutes before a meeting by just tilting my wrist which is something I can't do with my smartphone.What I don't like however are a couple of things.First, the bezel is shiny chrome while the body is brushed.  This is too blingy and out-of-place compared to the rest of the watch -- much more so in real life compared to the pictures.  Some of the other colors of this watch don't have shiny bezels.Additionally, I just don't like the overall proportions.  The watch band is thin and seems to vanish away in your arm.  Meanwhile, the very large case (and thick) sticks out.  It just doesn't look overall balanced -- like you have a large protruding metal lump on your wrist rather than a watch/bracelet.  I much, much prefer the Invicta Corduba watches which are a mm or two thinner, but also don't look as thick because the thickness includes the glass (some models).  Also, the Invictas have VERY fat, thick bands which just balance the size of the metal case and look so nice on my wrist.Overall, a good watch, but I think there are some nicer/better watches, too.  I think I would like the other colors better, too, but I was looking to replace a black on brushed with black band Nixon 51-30 which is mediocre quality and too expensive to keep repairing.

I have purchased this product from Real Herbs several times and am pleased with the quality and customer service.  I am taking this in combination with other supplements for the treatment of BPH which is also being treated with prescription medication.There are various forms of Stinging Nettle including leaf and root and extracts, and even the extracts are not always standardized or standardized across brands the same.  Thus, it is very difficult to know what you are getting, and different parts of the plant can be used to treat different symptoms.  This Real Herbs product is the root and an extract, and, although it is a bit pricey, at least I trust I am getting the portions I am seeking.Regarding the results, let's be honest.  The results are all over the map with in vitro, in vivo, studies on rats, various preparations/dosages, and so forth.  Some done on humans do show improved BPH.  Stinging Nettle contains a variety of components including beta sitosterol and other plant sterols, but the beta sitosterol is comparatively weak, especially when compare to beta sitosteral supplements.  Some research shows no increases in testosterone levels in humans.  Yet, others show that the lignans do block the binding of DHT to SHBG, but this should increase circulating DHT.  Yet, others show it is a mild 5a-reductase inhibitor, maybe 1/10 that of Finasteride (lowers conversion of testosterone to DHT).  It also contains substances which are mild aromatase inhibitors (prevents conversion to estrogen).  So, what am I getting at?  It is a complex herb, and if the scientific community can't really figure out this stuff, then I doubt Amazon reviewers are much better or at all statistically significant.For me, in combination with other supplements (including beta sitosterol), I believe there is a noticeable difference with BPH, even when used with prescription Finasteride/Dutasteride.  I seem to have a slightly less receding hairline, but this could be due to the combination of other products, diet, stress, etc.  Note that these results are improved over just using the prescription products alone, so I believe there is merit in this regimen.So, I will conclude that I will continue experimenting with this product.  For now, though, I give Real Herbs good credit for providing a quality supplement as stated on the label.  There are certainly a lot of lesser, nebulous products that don't even say whether they are root or leaf.

I bought these, despite all the negative reviews, based on some recent reviews that maybe they had revised them.  Well as of 10/31/14, they have not.THESE ARE A JOKE!  Your junk will just plain not fit unless you are a woman.  I measured the fabric across the front, and it is only 2-1/2" across!  I measured a similar pair of new (and washed once) Jockey Elance bikini underwear -- comparable and just as skimpy, but they are 4-1/2" across the front.They have not revised these, and they do not fit males.

I had purchased this a long time ago, and it was, in fact, chrysin, a yellowish powder.  I made the huge mistake of purchasing 6 BOTTLES of this stuff and found that they had reformulated it to contain tribuulus, ZMA, and other ingredients which are massively cheaper.  In fact, looking at the partially-filled capsules, it just looks like over-priced trib.  I did not get the results I expected from past purchases and feel ripped-off.  Unfortunately, I did not get to opening/using the reformulated bottles until I finished my old supply, and it was too late to return.  Very disappointed to say the least.  Big black eye for Big Bulk Supplements that they would pull these kind of games, and I will not purchase from them again.

I've tried some really bad fat burners, and this is one of them.  I can handle A LOT of caffeine, so I it's one of the other ingredients.  I am only familiar with about half of them used individually.This really made me jittery for the whole day and into the late evening.  It made me EAT WAY MORE.Please note that I workout every day and am single digit bodyfat, and I am dead consistent and accurate with my calories, macros, workout routine, bodyfat %, and so on.  After 5 years of doing this, I know my body pretty well.  I could not keep my consistency on this stuff, and, in fact, had to back off on my workouts.

The biggest problem I have with this is Axe's own Cooling Face Gel http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00A0J089E/This foaming face wash comes in your basic foaming soap pump, but the wash is very mild.  It is free of ALS, ALES, SLS, and SLES detergents, so it is very mild if you have dry/sensitive skin.  If, however, you have combination skin like I do, you will be reaching for another wash like the Axe Cooling Face Wash because some parts will still be oily/dirty.The smell of this is also bordering on aweful.  It is sort of plastic meets dead skin.  Again, the Cooling Face Gel has a nice, refreshing cucumber scent.  This foaming face wash delivers a big handful of light foam which just doesn't feel rich and luxurious.  Again, the Cooling Face Gel is very thick and luxurious.  Compared to this, the gel feels like a substantial product.  Also, the gel is cheaper and the bottle lasts a lot longer.All-in-all, it is not a terrible product, and in fact, it is probably the mildest I have ever used.  But, for me, the Axe Chilled Cooling Face Wash is also mild, and is just so much better in every way.

I have used a bunch of "accessory" trimmers/shavers including the Philips Norelco BodyGroom (junk) and Multigroom Pro (awesome) and All-in-1 (good) and various Wahl's and others...I really like this little trimmer/shaver despite a few complaints.  First, it has a very fine tooth trimmer blade.  In fact, it has the same small trimmer blade and foil as the Multigroom Pro.  This fine pitch is important because some are too coarse which lead to more nicks and cuts.  Yikes!  Also, this is impossibly small compared to the other tools mentioned above which makes it very convenient and easy to maneuver.  It is listed for use on facial hair, but since it uses the same cutter and foil as the Multigroom Pro (similar but better than the Bodygroom), I found it works as well on other parts of the body as well or better because it is so compact, thin, and well balanced.  Overall, operation/function-wise, I would give it 5 stars.  It uses a single AA battery which is very powerful and seems to last plenty long for the detail work for which it is intended.The body is sleek and shiny plastic on half, but there is an orange slightly rubberized grip.  I did not find that it was too slippery to hold or grip at any time.There are a few things which I don't like about it, though.  One is that the on/off requires a twist motion.  That requires two hands and which also means if the other hand is wet or dirty with razor stubble, now both pieces are wet, dirty, etc.  Also, the on/off action is the same which opens the bottom to replace the battery and which is the same which twists off the top pieces. So, it is all to easy to accidentally turn the thing more than one stop and/or inadvertently disassemble the thing.  I would much prefer a separate on/off switch.  The beard combs are also a little tight to remove and require the same twisting action.The other thing I don't like about it is that it is vague about using it around water.  It says not for use while bathing/showering/etc. and not water-proof, but to wash it after use.  In fact, INSIDE the battery compartment is a water faucet symbol.  There is a rubber O-ring sealing the battery compartment.  I am not so interested in submersing it, but I do like to rinse things under water or with a little hand soap to clean it out, and so far, that doesn't seem to affect it.A final nit is that I didn't find a whole lot of difference in the 3 beard combs, which are listed as 4mm, 5mm, and 6mm.  I would have preferred a larger range such as 2mm, 4mm, and 8mm, or something like that.In all, my complaints are relatively minor, though.  It is a great companion to my other shavers, especially my Braun foil shaver.  Braun shavers for the last umpteen years have just the junkiest trimmers on them, and I can pull this out and do the trimming that I need.  The Philips Norelco styler is quite inexpensive and very useful.  Not perfect, but definitely recommended.

Honestly, I was actually hoping I wouldn't like this.  I already have too many Axe products -- various scents of anti-antiperspirants, shampoos, conditioner, 2-in-1 shampoo+conditioners, body washes, body scrubs, hair goos, you name it.  I am beginning to have more stuff in the bathroom than my wife ;-) I don't find the body washes and shampoos all that different, and I figured this might just be some ploy to repackage a similar formulation into a face wash.But, it's not.  Actually, I really do like it.  It is super concentrated.  A pea or bean sized amount is plenty to wash my face.  It is very gentle on my skin YET cleans it as well as the harsher body washes.  I even found it works well on "delicate" parts which can be irritated by harsher soaps.As for the packaging, I was a bit disappointed that 1/3 is filled with air.  Yes, just above the clear window of the bottle is where the contents stop.  But, no big. 5 oz is 5 oz.Regarding the scent, with a name like Chilled and menthol on the ingredients list, I was expecting a cheap overly minty/menthol smell.  Instead, it is definitely more herbal.  It contains a lot of plant extracts/botanicals.  The minty chill is barely noticeable to me.  I would almost describe it more of a salon kind of cucumber kind of smell.  It, therefore, feels and smells very luxurious.I have the dreaded "combination" skin with some oily, some dry, and some normal.  I felt this did a much better job at not making my face feel tight and dry (Winter cold air mind you) than the regular Axe body washes.So, looks like I will have another Axe product on the shelf...

I am a car and car care nut.  I have shelves of products.  No, make that a whole closet full.  The best features of this kit are the excellent packaging.  The products, themselves, are just OK.  My overall rating is 3 stars.First, I'll say something about the packaging.  That is one of the best features of Griot's products. For example, the Speed Shine comes in a nice wide-base round bottle with a quality sprayer. When you are detailing a car, I can't stand cheap bottles with junky sprayers that are thin and fall over easily. Often, you are carrying multiple things in your hands and need to rest the bottle down on something and having it fall over all the time and dribble out or pick up dirt is just irritating!  The bottle is very high quality and clear so you can see how much is left and where the end of the pickup tube is.  Similarly, the clay come in a nice, screw top jar with ample space.  Every other clay I've used comes in some cheap cellophane wrapper or some tiny box and getting it back into, well, anything to protect it is nearly impossible.  Hats off to Griot's on the packaging/containers.First up, this contains a generous lump of paint clay.  You can read about claying a car elsewhere but the basic idea is it's a very good part of the prep process for polishing/waxing a car.  The clay in this kit is of a fairly mild type.  It's kind of hard to explain, but there are aggressive clays that are for really poor condition paint that will also start to remove sealants and such, and there are mild clays which remove less contaminants but are more gentle on the paint.  And, there are some in between.  This follows the tradition of most Griot's products that I have used in that it is mild and relatively fool-proof for the beginner but better suited towards well-maintained cars.  The generous lump can be kneaded and used on many cars depending on the level of dirt/contamination.  High rating for a mild clay that can be used frequently and comes in a best-in-class jar.This kit also contains 35oz of Speed Shine which can be used as a clay lubricant.  Speed Shine is technically a quick detailer for used on a slightly dusty car with microfiber towels, but in this kit, it is used as a clay lube.  There are a lot of products that can be used as a clay lube.  In this case, this product works fine.  I also used Speed Shine as a quick detailer (its original use).  For that, I was less impressed.  It seemed to leave a lot more streaks and the lubricity was not as good as competing products that I've used.  The bottle and sprayer are excellent, though.In sum, this is a good, but not impressive kit.  I would be tempted to just buy the clay separately.  There are other better quick detailers out there (Finish Kare #425 is one of my favorites), but if you are new to detailing, this kit will serve you well, and you will appreciate the quality containers which you can reuse.

I am a car fanatic, and I have used practically every leather care product on the market as well as a host of Griot's products.  I will review each of the components individually.  Overall, my score is 4 stars.First, I'll say that one of the best features of Griot's products, in general, is the packaging.  For example, the Interior Cleaner comes in a nice wide-base round bottle with a good sprayer (more later).  When you are detailing a car, I can't stand cheap bottles with junky sprayers that are thin and fall over easily.  Often, you are carrying multiple things in your hands and need to rest the bottle down on something and having it fall over all the time and dribble out is annoying.  All the bottles are very high quality and clear so you can see how much is left and where the end of the pickup tube is.This kit contains 8oz of the Leather Care Spray and a separate pump spray nozzle. I was quite surprised by the Leather Care Spray.  It is an excellent regular-use cleaner and conditioner.  It leaves a very nice leather smell as well.  I would recommend it for leather that has been well maintained and in good condition.  What I REALLY like about this is that it does NOT leave a greasy, sticky mess behind like most other leather products.  A little goes a long way.  If your leather is in bad condition, look for something more like Leatherique.  The pump spray delivers a well-controlled fine mist, although sometimes it felt like it got stuck and I had to press extra firm.This kit contains 35oz of the Interior Cleaner and separate trigger spray nozzle.  Like the Leather Care Spray, both bottle and spray are packaged separately and sealed so that there are no leaks.  The sprayer is a very high quality and delivers a large volume per pump, but I found the spray pattern to be a bit large and often this led to overspray which I had to wipe over previous areas.  Like the Leather Care Spray, the Interior Cleaner is a mild, regular use product.  I used it on everything from leather, vinyl, to plastics, to even touch screens.  It was fairly all purpose and cleaned mild dirt well.  It did not remove heavy duty stains like some sunscreen on black leather, but that was to be expected.  This is not a miracle product, but an everyday maintenance product.  I felt this cleaner is a bit on the expensive side, but you can also buy a gallon refill bottle.  If you are really cheap, you can make your own refill and just use the excellent bottle.  It has a good amount of surfactants and did not leave streaking.Lastly, this kit contains four 16" x 16" green microfiber towels.  I would rate these towels as a "basic grade".  I have a LOT of much higher quality ones that I use for paint waxing, etc., but a good basic towel like this is better suited to the task at hand.  Can't fault them for that as it would just make the kit more expensive.  I also have much cheaper MF towels.In sum, this is a good kit for routine maintenance on well-cared-for interiors, and the bottles are nice and Griot's makes larger refills for the leather and cleaner sprays.
