It does support VGA, so an older monitor should suffice.If you desire to use the Internet-based "live viewing", keep in mind you'll also need an internet connection. I've not gotten to the point of trying to configure this yet, as we do not have a network drop in our shop. As such, I'm hopeful I can use a wireless adapter. I just need time to work through it. It's a nice feature, but is likely to require some thought and configuration before I can use it. But it would be a VERY helpful feature to me for checking on the property and horses when travelling.So all this said, there are several things you should consider regarding this system. It is NOT just "plug and play":- You will need to plan the location of your cameras to record as many areas (or zones) as possible- You will need to carefully plan the location of the base unit to ensure your cameras all reach, as they are NOT wireless- You will need to install the cameras and run the wiring to the base unit. If you have an attic (vs. open rafters) this will be more difficult- You will need to ensure there is sufficient power at the location of your base unit- You will need to acquire a display for your unit, such as a computer monitor- You should plan to use a UPS device to protect the base from power surges while also recording during power outages.- You may wish to acquire an external hard drive for saving/transferring video for backup (to keep data for a longer period)Overall, this is a very nice unit and appears to be of good quality workmanship. As noted, it has many great features which will be helpful in keeping our farm secure. It is NOT an alarm system, but would actually be more helpful in catching a criminal who has made an attempt to steal something and has gotten away (it's hard to put an alarm on a gate). Just be aware of what you are getting, what you will need to provide, and what you will need to consider to set it up and you will find this to be a nice system.

Let's face it - painting is not a simple hobby to get started with. What kind of canvas? What kind of paint? What kind of brushes? If you're not ready to take classes and don't have a mentor or teacher, where do you get started?Enter the Aquarelle "Watercolors Made Easy" painting kit. The designs are attractive, and the process is simple. Think of it as "color by numbers", but without the numbers. The design lines are clearly defined, but are essentially "invisible" once the painting is completed. No, this will not look like a gallery piece worthy of the Metropolitan, but it is a great way to learn and enjoy the process of painting. The designs also do not completely restrict your imagination -- you can still exercise some judgment in your use of color.How easy is this? My 11 year old daughter thoroughly enjoyed painting one of the canvasses without any guidance. And the "beach paradise" scenes worked perfectly as a backdrop to her hermit crab tank!Overall, I give this product 4 stars. It would be nice if there were a little more paint (some of the colors were more "full" than others), and perhaps a canvas that was slightly more "advanced" to allow you experiment and branch out a bit further. An extra brush might also be helpful. But for beginners or someone who just wants to see if they would enjoy painting, it's a great start.

I have previously review the HMDX JAM Plus speakers, and found the XT 'Extreme Wireless' speaker to be every bit the same quality. The sound that is generated by this little speaker is quite surprising, and is more than enough to fill the room. I also have a 'Bose Soundlink mini', and this speaker is nearly on-par for a fraction of the price. Although not having the same bass response, the sound is brighter and perhaps better for open areas.For me, however, the best feature of this speaker comes in the splash/drop/dirt proof rating! I board horses and spend a lot of time cleaning stalls and working outside. The fold-out carabineer Bluetooth range allows me to hang this little guy on a nail and whistle while I work, without having to worry about having my iPhone sitting out or dust and dirt getting into the speaker. This will also be a great little companion for our annual trips to the beach at Lake Michigan. The rechargeable battery should offer more than ample playback time for these occasions.Overall I highly recommend the HDMX Jam XT, or any of the HDMX line of speakers. I've tried the little pop-up speakers, and they simply can't hold a candle to the HMDX quality and sound. These are simply the best when it comes to a price-to-performance balance.

After years of having our old Liftmaster contractor-grade (chain-drive) opener rattle the house and groan like we were releasing the Kraken from the garage, I jumped at the chance to review the Chamberlain WD832KEV. Especially since our 1-year-old's bedroom is directly above our garage!This opener promises several things:*Ultra-quiet operation - I was skeptical of this, but indeed compared to our old opener, this opener is SIGNIFICANTLY quieter. In fact, the only real noise now comes from our door, itself, and NOT the opener. It no longer rattles and vibrates the whole floor, and certainly gives us more confidence in opening the door during our baby's nap and sleep hours. The 1/2 HP is more than sufficient to open our door.*Timer-to-Close feature - This is not something I use very often, as typically when I'm outside I want the door either open or closed. But it's nice to have this feature, and I found that it works well.*Light compatible with using compact fluorescents (CFLs) - This is important, as CFLs are replacing incandescent bulbs and would not work in my old opener. The motion-detection control panel is awesome and turns the lights on automatically (and off, later) when I enter the garage. That has been very helpful!*Uses less than 1 watt on standby power - Any energy-consumption is appreciated. I do not know how much 'standby power' my old opener used, but certainly this is good.*Lifetime warranty on motor and belt; 5 years for parts; 1 year for accessories - This is great, as my old opener only had a 1-year warranty!*Assembly required - This is VERY true. At first I wasn't sure everything was in the box, but it was. And the multi-piece rail had me concerned, since my old rail was one piece. I was also nervous about hanging the opener myself as I did not have help, so I paid a garage door company to hang it for me and adjust and lubricate my door. While the price they charged was a little high, it was worth it to have it done in a matter of a couple hours by trained professionals while also ensuring the door was properly adjusted. That said, I watched them and if you are handy and have help, you should be able to do this yourself.I also picked up the 'Chamberlain Universal Surge Protector' to ensure I had warranty protection and to protect the system board. I also purchased the 'Chamberlain CIGBU MYQ Internet Gateway', which perhaps is one of the best features of this door. The MyQ compatibility and Chamberlain app for my iPhone enables us to check the status of our door and open or close it from anywhere, which is fantastic (especially since my wife always thinks we left the door up). Expect to spend about $50-60 more for these features, as the opener does not include them. I found it money well-spent.The only issue I have had is with getting it to work with my Homelink buttons in our cars (2003 and 2006 models), but I've not put a lot of focus into getting that resolved. I suspect this has to do with the 'Security+ anti-burglary technology' (rolling code), so I may need to contact Homelink or obtain the special adapter. But that has only been a minor nuisance and by no means a detriment to the product, and the included openers have been fine. Since we will likely be in the market for a new car in the next year or two, I likely will not worry with it.Overall, this opener is really nice and I'm very pleased with it thus far. The Chamberlain brand has a solid reputation (unlike Genie) and this opener offers many great features at a relatively affordable price. Highly recommended!

I've used and reviewed multiple different cases for the iPhone 4 and 5, and to date this case is my absolute favorite. To be clear, I was provided this case for the purpose of this review. HOWEVER, I also own the black/slate gray version, which I purchased on my own and have been using for nearly a year. And while I have tried many new cases, as noted, I have continuously gone back to using the Speck CandyShell Grip case.In my personal opinion, this case has offered me the best mix of 'form and function'. It is very low profile, so I have not had to remove it from the case in order to use it with my dashboard mount or my arm band for running, as I have with many other cases. The raised, rubberized "bezel" around the face of the phone allows me to set the phone face down on a surface without it sliding or scratching, while the soft, rubberized interior helps protect the phone from impacts.This is not an "all elements" case for construction workers or great outdoorsmen, but it's pretty solid. It's also quite comfortable to use, with the textured rubber "grips" really allowing you to keep ahold of your phone. I've gone running several times with it in my hands and it has been comfortable to hold. I've had no issues plugging in my headphones and, although the speakers are protected by a bunch of small holes, have had no distortion with sound. The charging port opening has ample clearance and works well with the OEM lightening cable and the micro-usb adapter. I have not tried it with any docking stations or aftermarket cables, and I doubt that the 30-pin adapter would work, so please be aware of that.Initially I DID have some issues with my first Grip case, where the rubber grips strips on the back were "peeling" away from the case. Example of this can be seen in photographs from others. It happened on my first case after about 2 weeks, so I returned it and Speck replaced it (free of cost). Despite being careful, it then occurred on the second case after a month or so AND the small section above the charging port broke (a common weak spot on Speck cases). I used it like that for few months, then returned it. Speck again replaced it without question. HOWEVER, my third (black/gray) case AND the White/Black case I've received for review has NOT demonstrated this issue after several weeks to a month or more of using them. It feels to me like maybe the rubber is slightly stiffer than what I had on the previous versions.Generally speaking, I like a case that doesn't 'stand out' much. So at first I was not sure if I'd like the White/Black case. But after putting it on my black iPhone 5, it's actually kind of cool looking. I like to call it my "iStormTrooper" case, because it makes my phone look like a Storm Trooper. LOL! I've found the white case actually shows scratches less than my black case. I have had no issues using the flash with this case, either. Despite having both black and white cases, the white version has stayed on for now.There is actually ONE frustration point I have with this case: Although the covered volume buttons work great and the mute control is easy to access, the power/sleep/wake button is NOT as responsive. If I push straight done, nothing happens. I have to kind of "push pull" it toward me to get it to work. Both my black and white cases are like this, and it was NOT something I noticed with the previous two cases I had, which further leads me to believe something was altered a bit in the design. It almost feels like the button cover is out of alignment. But that has been a minor issue, and by no means reduces the appeal of this case.Overall I strongly recommend it and give it 4.5 stars, but with the reminder that it IS just a cell phone case and is not made of diamonds. It will scuff and get worn over time, as with anything you use daily and pull in and out of your pocket. In fact, I don't really recommend this case if you need to put it in your pocket a lot, because that will wear the grips faster. In that case, I'd look to a regular Speck CandyShell case. This case would also likely wear out a bit faster if you remove your phone often, so that's worth consideration as well.

I have to say, after years of helping my son try to piece together oddball creations out of random Legos, this kit was pretty refreshing! Not to say Legos aren't still a little fun, but the Erector Multimodel set is for some serious construction! The kit's 610 pieces allow us to build up to 50 different (suggested) things, and more if our imagination kicks in. And it's fun to "modify" the plans they give you, as well! Erector Sets have been around for ages, and they certainly are more 'advanced' than building blocks. So you'll need some patience and planning to build a model. But how cool is it to plug up one of the motors (6v or 3v) and watch your creation spin to life?!This kit comes in a hard shell case which is great for storing and travelling with all the pieces, and includes a small battery operated 'power tool', so nothing will disappear from my tool box. Keep in mind this is for kids at LEAST age 8 and up. Kids of a younger age will likely be frustrated by the advanced models, and the small parts should definitely be kept away from small children.As the parent of a young boy who has spend ENDLESS hours building things at his "Lego table", it's really fun to watch him dive into this set. I know he will learn a lot about how things move and take shape, which will only stimulate his mind further. Highly recommended!

Despite having a touch-screen ultra book, I'm still not a huge fan of Windows 8. I just don't feel the need to touch my screen when using the computer, and it's really not intuitive to me yet. My wife has adapted better than me, but I still prefer to keep my touch screen for my phone or tablet, and have my laptop be a laptop. Laptop touchpads have never been my thing, either, as I often hit them inadvertently, so overall I just prefer to use a mouse.As an IT worker, I've used many brands and types of mice over the years. Of those, Logitech mice have been a favorite. For many years (almost 10!) I used a corded Mx500, which I loved. Currently, I use a wireless Logitech M510 with my desktop, and a wireless M705 with my Win7 work laptop. So I was happy to try a mouse that is wireless and designed specifically to function with Windows 8.Compared to my other Logitech wireless mice, the M560 mouse felt lighter weight. That's not to say it felt cheap - it's perfect for using with the ultra book. The styling is simple and understated, with a matte black finish. Because I have large hands, the full size profile of this mouse was nice, but my wife found it comfortable to use, as well. The mouse was easy to configure -- simply plug in the USB receiver and it automatically synched with the mouse. The scroll wheel was also nice - more solid than my 510, but maybe not as solid feeling as my 705. The thumb buttons were a bit difficult to get used to at first. Experience has taught me that they are for forward and backward browsing, which is how they would function if used with Windows 7. But with Windows 8, they either minimized all applications or took you to the "Start screen" (formerly known as the "Metro" interface). Once I got used to that and using the scroll wheel for forward/backward movement, it was fine. The "Edge" shortcut button was also quite helpful for bringing up the apps switcher and "charms bar" (settings menu) on the left and right-hand sides of the screen.Overall, this M560 made using Windows 8 *significantly* easier for me to use, and would likely be a great asset for anyone who does not have a touch screen or who just prefers a mouse. The device should work fine with a laptop or desktop, as direct 'line of sight' is not required to the receiver. And if you still have Windows 7, it will function with that OS, as well. I've had no issues with using the mouse on a wide variety of surfaces, and while I can't speak to the battery life of this specific mouse, the batteries in my other Logitech mice have lasted a really long time.Overall, I highly recommend this product!

Overall, the Hape Galloping Zebra Cart is very attractive. Unlike so many of today's plastic toys, this one is made from wood that is sourced from eco-friendly sustainable growth forests. The paint is also water-based and conforms to ASTM testing, so no worries about toxic paints or chemicals. The colors are warm and fun, and the zebras are cute. It certainly takes you back to a time when toys were a bit more "simple" in function and devoid of all the flashing lights and bleeping noises.Overall, the cart was easy to assemble. The box came with the required Allen wrenches and I had it together in a matter of maybe 10 minutes (you only have to assemble the handle, fortunately). My 11-month-old daughter was immediately attracted to it, and wanted to put her things in it. That is where this cart has a bit of a drawback, as there's only one small area for this on the back. Otherwise, things get in the way of the zebras, which can then prevent it from rolling properly. I also felt the cart was a little on the light side, so it's not really something that counters a child's weight so she can use to pull herself up with. I also felt it was difficult for her to turn on the wooden floor, since the rubberized wheels do have a bit of a "grip" factor.One concern is that buyers should take note of the age recommendation. My daughter fell face forward toward this cart and got her face caught between the zebras! We actually had to "extract" her from the cart, which was a scary moment. Fortunately she was not seriously hurt and did not suffer any cuts - only a couple of small bruises. But it scared her away from the cart for a few days. And while she can stand, she has not yet mastered the idea of walking behind the cart, so she has a tendency to fall forward. As such, I'd definitely recommend the cart more for a 'toddler' who has taken her first real steps and just needs the cart for added stability.Overall, I give the cart a "B+", or 4 stars. I love the simplicity and colors, but do wish it were easier to turn and that it had a bit more 'heft' to it.

The Pampers 'Natural Clean' wipes are soft and lightly moist - a great wipe that isn't heavily scented or dripping wet. They are thick and sturdy enough for use, but not overly thick like some wipes. Just as the name says, the wipes have a 'fresh/natural' clean scent that is understated and not overpowering. They will not make your hands smell like baby's behind after using them.Perhaps it was just a coincidence, or perhaps the result of using these wipes, but within two days of using these wipes the mild rash (bumps) that had been on my daughter's bottom for about a week completely cleared up. We believe it was due to the fact that these wipes are perhaps more gentle than what we were previously using.The travel-size packaging is attractive and 'gender neutral', though it varied a bit from the product picture. The package size is perfect for your diaper bag, as well.Overall, highly recommended!

We actually DID visit Disney World in Orlando in late-June of 2012. AND, we visited it with our kids, ages 8 and 9. My wife, who has been to Disney World numerous times and who actually worked there several years ago, still spent a lot of pre-trip time studying up and planning things out. But I can attest that this book was an invaluable resource for our family. There were LOTS of great tips relative to when to visit the parks, where to eat, how to save money, what attractions we should hit and what we could likely skip. This book saved us a lot of time and money, and was instrumental in the fact that in 7 days we were able to cover all four parks (Magic Kingdom x2, Animal Kingdom, EPCOT, and Hollywood Studios), AND spend a day at the resort and Disney's Marketplace. If you are planning a family trip to Disney World, this book is well worth the price. Especially if you are visiting for your first time, or are visiting the parks with young children. If you're reading this, I hope you enjoy your trip, and I highly recommend you check out this book.

It's difficult to wax poetic about a pen, so the best thing I can say about the Pilot "Dr. Grip" pen is that it's sure to be swiped. Most likely by my wife, or perhaps a co-worker. Cruddy pens do NOT go missing, but GOOD pens... they're like a bowl of M&Ms. One moment they're there, the next they are gone.I found the "Dr. Grip" pen to be very comfortable to hold and use. I'm a dude with big hands, so small pens sometimes hurt to use. No so with this one! The cushioned grip fits comfortably in my hand, and it flows smoothly across the paper. And even better, the ink does NOT smear! For as smoothly as this pen writes, I was surprised to find that I could immediately run my hand across the paper and the ink did not smudge.So why only 4 stars? Constuction-wise, the pen just feels a bit cheap to me. It's primarily all plastic, with a metal clip and "accents". While it IS well-balanced, I would have preferred it to be slightly heavier and have a more solid feel, especially at this price-point.That said, if you do a lot of writing, you can't go wrong with Dr. Grip!

Let's face it... no-one wants to admit their house smells. Well, mine doesn't either. But it HAS smells... like the smell of the bacon I fry in the mornings, the smell of our cat (which I could do without), my gym cloths accumulating in the closet, the smell of my son's football clothes laying around his room. Not exactly a bouquet of roses!Generally speaking, it's hard to quantify the performance of an air filter without some serious testing. But with the summer temperatures in my neck of the woods hovering in the upper 90s to low 100s, it's safe to say the AC has been running NON-stop for the past few months. And I can say that, after having installed this filter, it DOES seem to run less than before.So the A/C is perhaps running better... let's get back to the smells. Does this filter cut back on them? I'd say yes... especially with regard to the cat and bacon, which have a way of permeating the house.I would recommend this filter, especially to folks who may feel their home has a smell resulting from pets, meals, or stale air. It has worked well in the month that it has been employed in our home.* One note (or bit of confusion): I only received ONE filter from Amazon for testing, so I can't really swear on the long term use of these. The product says it is a 4-Pack, so I'm not certain what happened there.

Here's the deal... I don't profess to be a TV expert. I can't really wax poetic about image processing, backlight scanning, speaker output, etc. But what I can tell you is that the 47" Panasonic VIERA TC-L47WT50 is one AWESOME TV! Here are a few of my key observations:PROS:- LED HD Picture: It's simply astounding! SUPER clear. Black levels (I do know what those are!) are very solid.- Viewing angle: I know I can watch it from the side, and the picture is still great.- "Smart" functions: Built-in Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, YouTube, Skype, Twitter, Facebook, Web Browser, AccuWeather, and more... just... WOW!!- Built-in Wi-Fi: I'm able to connect to my home network without running cables, and maintain a solid connection. Nice touch!- Multi-task function: You can really do multiple things at once!- Size: This thing is amazingly thin, has a very small bevel, and a nice light at the bottom.- Remote: The primary remote is back-lit with red light (light button glows!) and very intuitive. I had no issues figuring it out.CONS:- I feel the TV could use a few more inputs, primarily for component video. As it stands, I can not hook up both my (original) XBox and Wii without HDMI converters.- I wish the TV had a simple audio-out so I could output the audio to my home stereo. As it stands, it comes out hollow and echo-y when I tried this configuration using the component audio-out.- Motion smoothing: Perhaps I've just not figured out how to tweak this yet, but sometimes the picture and things look "fake". Kind of an odd panning motion. It's just so clear, it looks odd. It's not bad, it just catches my eye sometimes.- It would be nice if the TV came with at least one pair of basic 3D glasses (not the active shutter, but just the basic glasses).Worth noting:- Sound: The "3D Real Sound" isn't bad. It's clear, I just wish it were a bit louder and had more bass. But it is not distorted by any means, which is good.- Viera link: I don't have a Viera-compatible home theater system, but I sure wish I did! This looks like one sweet feature.- VIERA Touch Pad Controller: I haven't needed to use this much, but believe it would be more handy if I had a Viera-compatible system.- Smartphone Remote Function: This is a very nice extra feature, as well.- 3D functionality: I do realize that this is a 3D TV, and certainly wish I could attest to those features. Unfortunately, I can't spring for 3D glasses right now, and I do not have a Blu-Ray player capable of playing 3D. If I get a chance to test these features, I will update this review. However, this TV is NOT "just" a 3D TV. It's a great TV even without consideration of that capability.The set-up of this TV was SUPER easy. It literally took me about an hour or less from unboxing to turning it on. I didn't have to jump through any extra hoops to set up the picture -- it was perfect out of box! I set it up the day of the Indy 500, and was blown away. Watching racing, the NBA Finals, etc. have been so awesome, I can't wait for football season! The movies we have watched have all been great quality (1080p DVD), so no qualms there. And I'm sure with BlueRay this TV would really shine! I had no problem updating the firmware on the TV, or figuring out all the extra functions. They just worked. All of this is more than I can say about another name-brand TV I own, which was a real nightmare to set up.Overall, if you are looking for a TV in this segment, you can't go wrong with the Panasonic VIERA WT50. It really is cutting edge, and is sure to enhance your home entertainment experience.One final note: This is not product-related, and is not the fault of Amazon or Panasonic. But my TV arrived in a damaged box, with one corner crushed and punctured, and the foam inside broken. It was also left standing on end agaist the wall of my front porch, which seems like a silly place to leave an expensive TV. I'm very disappointed in FedEx for how they treated this delivery.

After completing the loading phase and taking the second phase for several weeks, I can definitely tell that I was getting a bit of extra help from the creatine in my lifting routines and metabolic exercises. I was able to power through some extra sets that previously might have derailed me. So from that aspect, it worked. I have some skepticism on whether the loading phase is really necessary, but from what I can tell it simply helps the body ramp up the creatine levels faster.The BIO-SYNERGY Creatine Plus consists of two phases: Phase one consists of 800mg Creatine Monohydrate per capsule. Phase Two consists of 650mg Creatine Monohydrate and 150mg of Chitosan per capsule. The recommended intake is as follows:Phase One - LoadingTake 5 capsules, 5 times a day for the first 5 days, thereafter take a maintenance dose.Phase Two - MaintenanceAfter the loading phase, take 4 capsules per day, if a training day 2 (1 hour before training) and 2 (immediately afterwards) with a glass of water or carbohydrage (sugary) drink. If a non-training day take 2 capsules before lunch and 2 before dinner.Overall, I believe this was effective in some areas, and not so much in others. Without a doubt, my muscles appeared more full and I was able to get in some extra reps. HOWEVER, I also felt VERY bloated and gassy on the BIO-SYNERGY Creatine Plus, which I understand is a sometimes common effect of creatine monohydrate. I also gained a VERY fast 5-6lbs within the loading phase, going from around 208 to about 212. That is mostly water weight, which explains the bloated/puffy feeling. But it did help me add muscle (by virtune of aiding with extra reps), so it was beneficial from that aspect. But I did not lose significant body fat, so I don't know that the Chitosan as a "fat eliminator" really did much for me in that department. I read up on how it is supposed to act in that manner, but it seems the claims have not really been thorougly proven out. I do believe it can aid with kidney function, though.For those doing "first time" shopping for a creatine supplement, one thing I have learned is that Creapure (German manufactured creatine monohydrate) micronized creatine is considered more "pure" and often associated with less bloating and gas due to the purity. This product does not appear to use Creapure. Also, something that is not stated in the BIO-SYNERGY packaging, is that while taking creatine it helps to drink a LOT of water (perhaps more than usual).As with any supplement, do your homework BEFORE you start taking it. Know what it does, how, and why you are taking it. I was fortunate and willing enough to give this a try, but I would likely consider all options before purchasing it. I did find the pill form to be more convenient for me than a powder mix, so that was helpful.****************************************************************************************************Note: after submitting my review, I decided to read through some of the others. I particularly agree with reviewer "E. Brown" relative to the loading phase and BIO-SYNERGY's recommendation to take the creatine post-workout. If anything, the best time to take it is in the morning (upon waking, when your body more easily absorbs), and pre-workout. Also be sure to cycle on and off of creatine. No long-term studies of creatine's effects have been completed, so one should use with caution.

When perusing the cereal aisle, there are a LOT of choices these days. Some are clearly NOT good for you, some are, and some are just OK. You aren't going to be on a 3-hour sugar buzz, but neither are you really doing yourself that huge of a favor. Perhaps you are one of those who thought Raisin Bran was good for you... until you found out it has more sugar than Fruit Loops!Enter Quaker Oatmeal Squares, in this case infused with "a hint" of cinnamon. My first two thoughts are 1) must be good for you if it's from Quaker Oats! and 2) mmm... cinnamon!Bottom line: IF you sweeten it a bit, this cereal is good and crunchy at first. It does NOT have an overwhelming cinnamon flavor, and in some ways is a bit bland. But the flavor is acceptable. The crunch will wear off quickly, though, if you let it soak for more than a couple of minutes.The pitch is that "each square has cinnamon baked into it". Well, honestly, does it matter if it's baked in or sprinkled on? I think it could use a bit more flavor, but that's mostly just my opinion. Others may find it just right. The cereal consists of 46 grams of whole grains per serving, so that part is good. If you are going to consume cereal, you should consume those made with whole grains. It also packs a decent amount of soluble fiber (5g) and protein (6g - high for a dry cereal). There are 210 calories in a 1 cup serving of Quaker Oatmeal Squares Cereal (Cinnamon). The caloric breakdown is: 10% fat, 79% carbs, 11% protein. The cereal has 9g of sugar per serving.So if you're a cereal eater and looking for something healthier than Cap'n Crunch, this is probably a "better" selection. That said, I caution anyone against starting their day with a ton of carbohydrates, especially those derived from sugary sources. And as with anything, be aware of what a "serving" is and practice moderation. If not measured out, many folks would potentially consume 2-3 servings (in this case cups) in a single bowl, which would equate to a quick 400-600 calories just for breakfast!

Prior to receiving these straps, I had two sets I was using... one is a set of 2" Goodyear Racing branded straps, which are GREAT (tough as heck!), but are also very long and have long leads on the handle end. That makes them sometimes impractical for use in my truck bed. My other set were some basic 1" straps, which were a real pain to use and not sewn very well.Enter these Macro Force "Sure Grip" ratcheting straps. The name includes 'PowerSports', and they are perfect for that purpose. I have used them to tie down my ATV and they work great. The 2,500lb break strength gives me confidence they will secure my ATV or my son's go-cart without issue (though I have to definitely use two on the ATV). The ratcheting handles are comfortable, and the release mechanism works smoothly (unlike my old ones, which were always jamming up). The stitching on the ends is also solid, with several cross pattern stitches that don't look like they'll be pulling loose any time soon. The nickel-chromium plated mechanics should also prevent them from rusting over time, since those alloys have excellent oxidation resistance, wear resistance and high temperature properties. One other thing I like is the rubber coated hooks. There's nothing worse than having a metal hook bang against the side of your truck!These straps also come with storage bags which, though not of super high quality, are a nice additional touch and helpful to have. I typically store all my 'truck stuff' (straps, gloves, cables, etc) in a bag under my rear seat, and the straps and hooks usually get all wrapped up in each other. This should prevent that from happening. I do wish the two bags weren't connected in the middle, though. Also note that some folks might find the 8' length of the straps to be a bit short, so definitely keep that in mind. However, they are perfect for me as my F150 has a 5' bed, so I often find some straps to be too long. These are actually the perfect length!I've seen more cheaply-made straps at places like HF and TSC that sell for more than the current list on these. If you're looking for good tie-downs in this size range, you can't go wrong!

I could easily write a review that repeats all of the aspects of this printer. And I could have easily written my review before I unboxed it, or after only a week of using it. But I have now been using this printer for approximately a year, so I feel like I have a good foundation of experience with it. So aside from all the marketing stuff, here is what I have found:- The printer itself seems OK. Perhaps a bit flimsy in some areas, but fine for the most part (it's not like I haul it around).- The printer size/footprint is normal for a printer with these features.- Setup was fairly simple. I was able to connect it to my wireless network and use it from two different computers.- Installation of the drivers was simple and easy. Both my XP system and my Win7/x64 system installed the drivers without issue.- Unlike with my old HP printer, I do NOT constantly experience driver issues or software crashes.- I only installed the software for scanning. I do not need more photo-organizing software.- The printer came with full ink cartriges, and they have lasted me nearly a year now. It seems to use less ink than my HP that had all-in-one cartriges.- The 'sample pack' of paper it came with was pretty much a joke. It was like 3 sheets.- Print speed IS pretty fast, and it is capable of edge-to-edge printing, which is nice.- The 'quick print' function (to save ink) is kind of frustratingly buried in the menus.- The auto document feeder is nice, and has not jammed or produced off-kilter images.- The ability to fax directly from the printer or my computer has been handy and has worked well. Speed has been normal.- I have never had the need to use the front USB port or memory card ports on printers. Ever. That's why I have a computer.- Printed pages and photos do seem to dry fast, though photo brightness depends on the paper.- I have not really had any issues with paper jams like my in-laws have had with their Canon Pixma, but the Canon is quieter and has a better interface.- Printing envelopes with this printer is a pain in the rear, and the address is often crooked. An envelope guide (to keep them straight) would have been nice.Thus far, I do feel this printer is worth the cost. It has a lot of features and has performed well. When I received this printer, I actually had my eye on the Canon printer. This one has performed better than I expected and restores a little shine to Epson's name. I don't "love it" to the point that I wouldn't shop around if I had to replace it tomorrow, but I DO like it and would recommend it as a solid home printer.Please note, Epson also now has the 645 model, which they did not have when I received this printer for review. The 645 also supports Apple AirPrint (app-free printing) and auto-duplexing, which are both great features. This printer is currently selling at the same or similar pricepoint, so be sure to do your research!

Let's keep this simple, shall we?What this IS:A great little low-end first aid kit for mom or dad to carry in the car, so they can address the typical minor cuts and scrapes that occur on the playground, etc. It might also be handy to 'stow away' with camping gear, in horse trailers, in the farm truck, etc. It is mostly bandages, and the majority of the time that is all a person will need. The container is a soft bag, however, so care should be taken not to crush the contents. The case is sufficiently large enough that you can add a few of your own items if so-desired.What this is NOT:This is not an all-inclusive kit to take on a hiking trip, ATV or canoe trips, office supply kit, etc. It's simply missing too many critical items, and there are many other things you should have for such trips. Please review the contents, and research what kind of contents you should have in a kit if you are participating in more extensive and physically demanding activities.In short, temper your expectations. Please do not order this expecting a fancy kit that will be suitable for all purposes. However, if you are looking for a handy little kit to stuff in the glove box for those inevitable cuts and scrapes that life deals us, you will likely find this handy.Please note: this review is for the 95 Piece kit. I cannot attest to the value or usefulness of the other larger kits produced by this same company.

I had a couple of Adobe products that were working fine, so I held off initialy on installing the Photoshop and Premiere Elements 9. But as an experienced user of Photoshop, I was disappointed in the product. This is primarily my fault, as it is not bad if all you want to do is tweak photos. But if you desire to create your own graphics, you will need to stay with the full Photoshop program. Honestly, I think Adobe does a disservice to the Photoshop name by using it with this program, because they are not the same. But ironically, this product IS probably more of a 'photo shop' than the full-blown version, which has historically been a great graphics-editing application. This product WILL help you organize your photos and videos, if you want it to. But if you don't, it can be a bit frustrating to deal with. I had issues when resizing windows or trying to open photos side-by-side to compare them, and the software locked up and crashed more than once (on a loaded Dell 9300 running Win7/x64!). This software is very resource-intensive, so do not try to run it on an older computer! That said, installation was simple enough, and Adobe provided some decent tutorials.As another reviewer has noted, PSE9 is "web connected" software. You will have to create an online account with Adobe to effectively launch and use the applications, and the software does exchange information with Adobe about your installation and perhaps even how you are using the software. I personally find this a bit invasive, as I want to use my software anonymously and have it fully functional in a disconnected state without other 'requirements' such as this. I also do not like software to report on my system or usage history.Honestly, this software is NOT easy to learn. Yes, you can do a lot with it, but definitely expect a learning curve. Also, as of the time of this review, Photoshop and Premiere Elements 10 have now been released. As such, this review should not be considered reflective of this newer version, which may have worked out some of the kinks and/or changed some requirements. But for those who are considering this 'old' version, I encourage you to consider some of these factors as you make your purchasing decision.

I ordered the 15 piece Nail Art Painting Pen Brush Set from Crazy Cart for my granddaughter for Christmas. It is a very nice and complete set. It has quite a selection of different sizes of brushes, I'm sure she will really enjoy using them. These brushes are to be used with NON-acetone polish remover. This is a VERY inexpensive nail brush set, so that being said, I am very happy with it. At this price I expected a lot lower quality, and am happily surprised at how nice it is. This product was estimated to arrive on December 11, yet I received it over a week ago and it is only November 21st.

Cute doesn't begin to cover how adorable these Soft and Cuddly Animal Slipper Socks With Grips are! I purchased the bumble bee socks and they have googly eyes and antennas.  I got them for my granddaughter, now I think I'll have to buy some more. We all want a pair of our own, now we just have to decide which animal. The other choices from Riverstone Goods include Ladybugs and Frogs. The socks are pretty thick, super soft, and fuzzy, and cute...really cute. They are easy to put on, stay up well and have grippers on the bottom. I received a discounted price on this product in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

This Ultra Thin Professional Digital Touch Kitchen Food Measuring Scale is a pretty handy little gadget. I wanted it mostly to weigh items that I have to mail, but it also works great to weigh other things (such as food like intended). I have been wanting something that could easily weigh thick envelopes and small packages before going to the post office, then I can have the cost figured out ahead of time. I have had nothing but a positive experience using this scale. I have tested it using various things that had their weight printed on them, so far so good as far as accuracy goes. I like the bright red color, it is easy to keep up with, and quite modern looking. The timer that was included as a free gift is also nice. I received a deeply discounted price on this product in exchange for an unbiased and honest review.

I bought the RiverStone Goods Ear Warmers because winter is here and these looked like they would keep my grandson's ears warm. He doesn't wear a hood so these really do come in handy. They fit on your neck, not on top of your head. They are made with a soft fleece material and are very comfortable to wear. The wires inside that hold the earmuffs on grip well but do not feel overly tight. I like that the ear muff parts are large enough that they cover the entire ear, it helps to cut down on the effect of the cold wind, and also makes them fit people with varying sized heads. They do not fold up but still fit into a pocket of a jacket with no problem. I received a discount on this product in exchange for an honest review.

This product, the Skinomi¬Æ TechSkin - Amazon Fire Screen Protector 7" does just what it says it will do. It protects the screen from scratches and  is virtually invisible. I am not very experienced at applying these types of screen covers but after watching the suggested video online, it was a lot easier to do. The printed instructions are good, but actually seeing it can make a big difference, at least to me it does. I intend to shop for Skinomi screen protectors for my other devices soon, I am happy with the quality and ease of use. I received this product free in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I ordered the Comfort Fit Cervical Neck Traction Device by Comfort Fit because my neck problems cause me to have horrible headaches a lot. I spend several hours a day at my desk, and sometimes it feels like my head is just too heavy for my neck to hold. This Inflatable Neck Pillow / Cervical Traction Pillow is a little scary looking when you first take it out of the package, at least it was for me.  It has tubes and a pump up bulb like the ones on blood pressure cuffs. The outer material is a very soft velveteen, in a deep royal blue color. Now, for the actual usage of the product. First, read the instructions. It is very important to be seated comfortably and go slow. After turning the knob to close, slowly pump it up until it alleviates the strain on your neck. Adjust it until you get it to where it is comfortable for you. My daughter and I both used it, and agree it can, and does, really help.I received this product at a deeply discounted price in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. All opinions stated are my own.

As with all Majestic Pure products I have previously purchased, this Majestic Pure Therapeutic Grade Peppermint Essential Oil is of very high quality. The fragrance is pure, yet strong. I started with just a few drops in my diffuser and that filled the room with the smell of peppermint. I also mixed a little with some almond oil and applied it to my arms that had dry skin. It really smells and feels good used in this way too. Peppermint essential oil is used in our home to keep spiders out and it also helps to unclog stuffy noses as well. This is a large 4 ounce bottle so it will last me awhile. It comes in a dark bottle to keep the oil fresher, out of the light and included is a handy glass dropper. This is one of my favorite essential oils, it is so versatile. I received this product at a deeply discounted price in exchange for an honest review. All opinions stated are my own based on my actual usage of this product.

I am very happy with the quality and materials used in the PopUp Windshield Sunshade Ultimate Auto Protector by briteNway. It is very small and compact for storage, so easy to keep in a side door pocket or back of a seat pocket. The size when unfolded and ready for use is standard size, fits most vehicles. It is held in place by lowering the sun visors on the driver and passenger side. Truthfully it is not quite as easy to get it back in the little pouch as the diagram shows but with practice it can be done. It will be more than worth it not to have the steering wheel be so hot that it burns my fingers. This sun shade will also protect the dash and upholstery, and just make driving in the summer a lot more comfortable. I received this product free in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

These Moon Solar String Lights by Rextin are gorgeous! The lights are a deep, beautiful blue color and are very bright. Each moon, I think they are made of acrylic or hard plastic, has a face like the "man in the moon". They're pretty good sized moons and light up brilliantly with the blue LED lights. There are 30 lights on a this string. I was happy to find that I could charge them by setting the solar panel in my front window, and they stay charged for a long time. It has a convenient on/off switch on the back too that also lets you choose between a steady on or flashing mode. I truly love these lights and think they would be great for many different decorating needs. This seller, Rextin, really backs their products with excellent service. I agreed to give them an honest review on this product, and in return received it basically free.

I bought the 100 Skeins of 8M Multi-color Soft Cotton Cross Stitch, Embroidery Threads Floss for my daughter. She does a lot of sewing and craft projects including embroidery. This item will be a Christmas gift so it has not been "used" yet but I did open the package and inspect the product carefully so that I could give my honest opinion of the quality. This is a very nice set in an amazing array of color choices. The skeins are all uniform in size and banded to keep them untangled. The six strands of each skein appear to be just as easy to separate as higher priced brands. The colors vary greatly but all threads look shiny and of good quality. I'm sure my daughter will be very happy with this set, almost endless possibilities in embroidery projects with so many colors to choose from. If for any reason she finds fault with them I will update my review. I received a discounted price on this product in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I am very happy with and quite frankly surprised by, the high quality material and workmanship of this Heavy Duty, Oven Safe, Commercial Quality Cooling Rack by DuraCasa.com. It is so awesome, very small grid pattern and can be used in so many ways. It is made from 100% premium-grade stainless steel without any dangerous additives, coatings, or treatments and can hold a lot of weight without sagging in the middle. I am spoiled now and do not want to use any other type of cooling rack, the foods cool so quickly and evenly on this rack and do not fall through. It is exactly what I was looking for, the 12" X 17" fits with my largest baking sheet and can cool a lot of cookies at one time. As with all my reviews, all opinions stated are based on the usage of the product by my family members or by me. This is my first DuraCasa product, but it will not be my last, lifelong customer now.  I received a discounted price on this product in exchange for an honest review.

I was very impressed when I first opened the box to the Tonor¬Æ Professional 3.5 mm Stereo Plug Studio Condenser Recording Desktop Microphone. It is very handsomely packaged. Next, the little tripod is perfect for use on a desk or table to put the microphone near whatever you are using it for. I bought this one for my grandson to use to record his guitar playing as well as his other instruments. The old style look and feel of this microphone is a big plus, I like it and so will he. I am giving it to him for Christmas but tried it out using my computer and it seemed to be pretty true sound wise. It sounds pretty good for a microphone that costs less than $100.00. I did not expect it to put out as pure of sound as if I'd spent several hundred dollars so I was in no way disappointed.  I truly think it is a quality microphone and will be great for what I bought it for. I received a discount on this item in exchange for an unbiased, honest, review.

Keeping in mind that this BESTEK¬Æ Mini Ozone Anion Air Purifier is made to control odors in one very small area at a time, I think it does a great job. Using a USB cord that I have for other things I charged it up and then put in the car for awhile. I thought that it definitely made a difference in the air quality, seemed to clean it up and do away with odor. I then recharged it and tried it in a small room in the basement that has a lot of old books in it. It really helped in there too. Biotin is a vitamin that is found in small amounts in numerous foods. It's used for preventing and treating biotin deficiency associated with pregnancy, long-term tube feeding, malnutrition, and rapid weight loss. It is also used orally for hair loss, brittle nails, and a multitude of other uses. I've used it for a couple of years now to strengthen my nails and improve the health of my hair (thinning hair with age).The way it works-  Biotin is an important component of enzymes in the body that break down certain substances like fats, carbohydrates. The B complex vitamins are important in metabolism, helping your body to process energy and transporting carbon dioxide from your body's cells. It contains water-soluble form of vitamin B group which actually helps to transform proteins, fats and carbohydrates into energy, which is so necessary for normal functioning of a human body.My hair slowly started growing in fuller, my nails are stronger than ever. My hairdresser even commented on my hair. She asked why all of a sudden all the fly-a-ways..I told her THAT'S NEW HAIR GROWING IN :)I will continue to take Biotin and long as I see positive results!Product received in exchange for my honest review.

This lightning to usb cable is one of the best cables I have used so far. My husband and I are very hard on our charging cables and they don't tend to last very long around our house. The main factor in any iPhone/iPod/iPad charging cables is the MFI (Made For iProducts) rating. If the cable is not MFI then it is most likely going to be useless. I have had non MFI rated cables and they won't sync or charge your device the way their suppose to, usually giving the error message on your device that the cable is unable to charge or sync. This cable is durable, I have found that the nylon braided cables seem to be the toughest cables that you can get. The cable does not kink at the charger connectors like most cables do, The braid keeps the cable from pinching and keeping a crease on the wires which ultimately lead to the failure of a cable. I have ordered several of these cables because they are incomparable to other cables.This cable is worth every star and even though I did receive this cable for my unbiased review, when I do need more, I will be ordering the JOTO Lightening Charging Cable.

Finally, the dream of lying flat on your back, watching TV at your feet, can be realized, they allow apathetic TV addicts and lethargic book worms to kick back and watch their favorite shows lying flat on your back.If you have any type of pain in your back or neck, you will greatly benefit from these lazy glasses. They work a little like a periscope, using mirrors to bounce light from one place to another to allow a wearer to effectively see in an unnatural direction. Lie on your back with your head upon the pillow as normal, and you'll be able to read a book or watch TV while the prism turns your angle of view 90 degrees. I use them just about every day now. Eliminate the hassle from stubborn wine bottle foil with the Zerlite Wine Foil Remover foil cutter. Just place the cutter on the bottle, and the foil is neatly cut with a few quick turns.
