However, I found that it was great for getting glasses and cans off the high shelves in our kitchen and GREAT for picking up all the random stuff our 19 month old likes to drop behind the couch that gets stuck between the couch and the wall. No more climbing on chairs to get things off the shelves. No more having to move the couch on a near daily basis. We've only had it for 2 weeks so I'm sure we'll find even more uses. Very handy gadget to have!The quality is great. Very sturdy and well made. The suction cups do a great job of holding onto items so they don't drop. The handle is easy enough to use that even our 6 year old has no trouble.

We have been using coconut oil for a while now for so many different things. I'm always careful to make sure it's organic and the price of this oil was the best I found recently that is certified organic so I decided to give it a try. I separated about half out into a different container so I could take it as a supplement and use it for cooking. It tastes great, melts easily in the microwave so I can add it to my smoothies, and works perfectly as a butter replacement for cooking. My 6 year old won't usually eat coconut oil right off the spoon, but she had no issue with this one. The other half of the oil I used instead of diaper rash cream for my 19 month old. It's so much safer and works just as good if not better! I've been using this brand for about 2 weeks and we haven't had even the tiniest amount of rash. Usually I use coconut oil for 4 days or so and then have to do a day of Desitin. We have been able to use just this! I will be ordering more containers so we have one going at all times for diaper rashes, 1 for daily supplementation, 1 for cooking, and 1 in the bathroom for skin and hair conditioning. Coconut oil in general is pretty much a miracle product with so many uses and the All Natural Wonder oil is easily the best we've used.

This is the 3rd (and final!!!) back seat mirror I have purchased. The others just weren't worth the money or hassle. What I like most about the Cozy Greens mirror is that the reflection is so clear! The curve really gives you a full view, it's a great size, very reflective, attaches easily, doesn't move around, and I can actually see my daughter. She is 19 months now, but we are an extended rear facing family so she'll likely be rear facing until after her 4th birthday. I need to be able to see her! Thankfully I finally found a mirror that will work. I think this will be my "go to" baby shower gift from now on. My husband wanted me to add that he really liked how witty and funny the box was. He got a real kick out of it. :-) Also, my 6 year old is planning to make something out of the box as suggested. I love that the company really is "green" and makes the recommendation to reuse the box rather than throwing it out. Great product and great company.

I feel like anything you write for a product like this will be TMI, but then again if people are looking for this product they probably need to know it works and are anticipating reading about sex. Anyway... I am currently breastfeeding and one side effects of that is low estrogen which leads to major vaginal dryness. My husband and I have been having trouble in the bedroom because of it. The dryness makes it uncomfortable and sometimes painful for both of us. We found we were having sex less often because it wasn't as enjoyable. NOT OKAY!!! I wanted to try something natural rather than picking up the usual "junk" at the store. Isabel Fay did not disappoint! It is very silky, really helped with the dryness while feeling natural, didn't get sticky, lasted as long as we needed it, prevented any pain, and was very easy to clean up. I also don't have to use much so the bottle will last a decent amount of time. Most importantly it doesn't have parabens or hormones. Neither of which would I want to introduce into my system. We will be sticking with this lubricant for as long as it is needed.

Seriously having so much fun with these! I used some to label jars in the kitchen, storage bins in the playroom, storage totes in the attic, folders for homeschool materials, and birthday party favors for kids. I still have some left over! Such a great price for so many labels. They are great quality, stick and unstick easily, and are a perfect size for so many different things. Various color chalkboard markers work very well on the labels and show up nicely. I messed up writing a few of my labels and found that they really do wipe off very easily so I could redo them. I love that they are reusable!!!

I have been using this for a few weeks now. I have noticed a definite improvement with my digestion. I often experience gas/bloating after most meals. Those issues have dramatically decreased since using these probiotics. Each pill offers over 5 billion organism count which is great. I never feel like I need to take more then 1 to get the results I'm looking for so 1 bottle will last 2 months! The pills are easy to swallow with no aftertaste. I have experienced no side effects and that means a lot considering the trouble I often have with supplements. I never take supplements that aren't made in a GMP facility because the standards associated are very important. I have also noticed a slight increase in energy and with 2 kids I definitely need that!

I always used to take probiotics and when I ran out I thought there was no real reason to get more. After a few months I realized I was wrong. I decided to give the Earth Pearls probiotics a try. I'm glad I did. It's only been a few weeks and I've noticed a difference.I usually take them every afternoon with my lunch (salad) and I have less digestive issues than I used to. My stomach doesn't make weird "I'm trying to digest all these vegetables" noises and I'm experiencing much less gas. Not sure if it's related or not, but I just had a cold that I got over quicker than normal and I'm thinking it may have something to do with the immune help from the probiotics. I haven't done anything else different.The pearls are very easy to swallow and have no taste. I'm thrilled that these are made in the USA with no GMO. I will definitely be continuing and likely getting them for my husband and daughter, too.

I'm very picky about fish oil because I hate the inevitable "fish burp." I can't believe I finally found a fish oil that doesn't cause that problem for me! I have been taking this daily for 2 weeks. Not once have I noticed any kind of fishy taste. I usually take it with my lunch, but if I forget I'll take it hours later... even on an empty stomach... and still no fish taste!I also love the high concentration per capsule. Getting 1300mg of fish oil in just one capsule is hard to find. The suggested dose is 2/day, but I've been taking just one. I feel like I'm still getting a great intake of fish oil and Omega 3 and the bottle will last twice as long. Either way the price is great and very much worth it.I used to sell supplements and I know how important it is for fish oil to be pharmaceutical grade. It's pretty much the only way you can know it's not full of mercury etc. The safety and purity of this fish oil is an important aspect for me wanting to continue taking it. I love the extra effort they have gone through to make sure it is a pure, safe product.

I have been using this for about 2 weeks. I apply it every night before bed after washing my face. It's very silky and rubs into my skin nicely. Not at all greasy. I can't even tell it's there. I've noticed a reduction in wrinkles on my forehead and around my eyes already. I have sensitive skin and haven't had any trouble with this (no irritation, acne, drying, etc). I usually pump the serum on to the back of my hand so as not to waste it moisturizing my palms. I find that I don't need to use very much to get full coverage on my face, therefore I expect the bottle will last quite a while. It's already a great price and the fact that it won't run out quickly is great!

To be honest this thing kind of freaked me out! As soon as I took it out of the package I turned all my lights off and started looking around. I keep my house pretty clean, but you never know what's lurking about. I could clearly see "invisible" stains on my cabinets and too many to count on my carpet. It was 9:00pm and I made my husband get our carpet cleaner out! We bought it a month ago and hadn't used it yet so the carpet hadn't been cleaned - besides vacuuming - in about a year. I'm pretty sure it was mostly milk stains from our 18 month old, but I just had to clean the carpets right away. Haha! I feel like if I brought this to a hotel I would have a heart attack and have to immediately check out. It works great and really does show you what you can't see on your own. It's a good size and the range is pretty decent. I'm sure I will keep finding more uses (and more stains) with this nifty gadget!

I got these for my 56 year old mother. She has really bad arthritis and joint pain. She had never taken anything besides prescriptions before and they weren't really helping. She needed to be careful about what she took with her medications. He doctor gave her the go-ahead to try these since they are all natural. It hasn't been long (about 2 weeks) and she's already noticing a difference. She said her knees and wrists both feel so much better and she can definitely tell the inflammation has reduced and the pain is about half what it used to be. She said she's also sleeping better. She hasn't experienced any side effects and is extremely happy.

Jeffrey Osborne's "A Time For Love" is the great but underrated balladeer's tribute to classic standards. The late George Duke was probably the producer who brought out the best in Osborne on albums like 1982's "Jeffrey Osborne" and 1983's "Stay With Me Tonight" and the magical chemistry between them is still there. Considering the state of the music industry today, "A Time For Love" is a beautiful  CD that can be viewed as an oasis in the middle of a scorchingly hot and relentlessly dry desert (so to speak!). If you like smooth, heartfelt, romantic and passionate music then you really should waste no time in getting this CD. Enjoy!

This former member of The Temptations should have become a bonafide solo superstar and this CD deserved to have gone Gold or Platinum. As a singer, Louis Price is just as powerful and soulful as Teddy Pendergrass, Marvin Gaye and Otis Redding and the material he was given on this CD is (mostly) very strong. Unfortunately, poor promotion and/or Urban Contemporary radio's unwillingness to give it airplay prevented it from becoming a major hit album. Enjoy!

Released in 1989, "Heaven" was one of the most commercially successful inspirational music CDs ever made. Granted, this is NOT Gospel music in the traditional sense but songs like "Heaven", "Lost Without You", "Hold Up The Light" and "Don't Cry" can literally get you "up" even on "down" days because of their sheer beauty and uplifting messages. This is a timeless album that truly deserved every bit of its success. Enjoy!

This is a beautiful compilation of classic Philadelphia Soul ballads from the 1970s and 1980s. What makes this compilation unique is that most of the tunes included here were NOT released as singles and remain slept-on but nonetheless BEAUTIFUL and heart-rending gems. Lou Rawls, Billy Paul, Jean Carne, The Jones Girls, Instant Funk, MFSB and the late Phyllis Hyman (among others) are featured and this is one of those CDs which (thankfully) contain no filler tracks whatsoever. Enjoy!

This compilation includes classic ballads by The O'Jays ("Sunshine"), Teddy Pendergrass ("Turn Off The Lights"), Jean Carne ("Don't Let It Go To Your Head"), The Intruders ("I Wanna Know Your Name" ) and several others. These gorgeous ballads are truly timeless and this budget-priced CD is sure to please all fans of romantic Soul ballads.

This 1984 release was the follow-up to the first "Noche Caliente" volume from the previous year and its big hit was the Ray De La Paz-sung cover version of Emmanuel's "Todo Se Derrumbo Dentro De Mi". The late Louie Ramirez was truly at his best and at his creative zenith when he produced these albums.

In 1983, the late, great and much-missed Louie Ramirez accepted a rather strange assignment from the K-TEL Records label (which was then primarily known for its countless Rock, R&B and Disco compilations). The assignment in question was to produce a Salsa "covers" album in which Latin Pop ballad hits were given a Salsa "makeover". This album was the first of three "Noche Caliente"  albums and the two primary lead singers featured were Ray De La Paz and Menique. Its big hits were cover versions of Raphael's "Estar Enamorado", Jose Luis Rodriguez's "Dueno De Nada" and Jose Jose's "Preso". In a certain way, this hugely successful album can be viewed as the first Salsa Romantica album ever made but it is by no means a sappy , cheesy or insipid one.

In 1988, Norman Connors signed with Capitol Records and recorded this very fine but underrated album for the legendary label. The two vocalists featured here are the late Spencer Harrison and Gabrielle Goodman. Goodman's sensuous, lilting and classy remake of Minnie Riperton's "Loving You" should have been a big hit while Harrison's stunning vocals grace "You Are My Melody". Enjoy!

Released in 1977, this obscure album is a rare gem that unfortunately fell through the cracks and came and went virtually unnoticed. Vitamin E was a Soul harmony vocal group with a strong Gospel influence and the title track deserved to have been a much bigger hit than it was. Produced by the great Norman Connors this album (like most R&B albums from the late 1970s)  features uptempo Disco numbers, sultry and soulful ballads and a mid-tempo number or two as well. The 2008-issued BMG Japan CD reissue of this obscure but very nice album features excellent sound quality and is well worth getting if you are into high-quality R&B/Soul music. Enjoy!

This album was Ismael Rivera's second album as a solo artist for Tico Records and was produced by the legendary Tito Puente. It includes three absolute classics in "Tambores Africanos", "Compay Guito" and the ageless "Lo Que Dijo La Gitana". Granted, this album is not as well-remembered today as other Ismael Rivera albums like 1974's "Traigo De Todo" or 1975's "Soy Feliz"  but it more than proves why Ismael Rivera is universally revered as one of the greatest Salsa singers of all time. Enjoy!

This compilation was originally released in 1979 and features tunes by the Fania All Stars ("Juan Pachanga"), Ray Barretto ("Canto Abacua"), Louie Ramirez ("Paula C", "Sin Tu Carino") and Willie Colon ("La Mora", "Pablo Pueblo" and "Me Recordaras")  on which a pre-superstar Ruben Blades was the lead singer. By this time, it was obvious that Ruben was going to enjoy a truly successful solo career and this compilation was issued to cash in on this. The 2006-issued Emusica Records remastered version of this CD features very good sound quality and informative liner notes and, as such, is worth getting. This compilation offers a decent overview of Ruben Blades' career as a Fania recording artist before becoming a Salsa superstar. Enjoy!

"El Que Mas Goza", "Ya No Regreso" and the stunning "Guaguanco Africano" are the standouts on this 1982 release which was produced by the legendary Johnny Pacheco. Orquesta Inmensidad was one of those Salsa bands that enjoyed a certain degree of consistent success but that never truly became as big or as popular as it could have been. While it is true that the early 1980s are regarded by many Salsa purists as one of the worst eras for the Salsa genre it is also true that Orquesta Inmensidad was one of the best new Salsa bands of the 1980s.

"Lagrimas", "En Cada Cosa", "Renacer", "Lo Siento Mi Amor" and "Se√±ora" are your reasons for getting this CD. Orquesta Inmensidad was a truly unique Salsa band that recorded several albums for the Fania label during the 1980s and which featured Roberto Blades (Ruben's brother) as its lead singer. This fine but under appreciated album got plenty of radio and club play and was a noteworthy success for the band but Orquesta Inmendsidad was never able to duplicate its success. Unfortunately, the sound quality of this (now out-of-print) CD reissue leaves much to be desired. If you can find it at a budget price I would recommend getting this CD but don't expect too much as far as sound quality is concerned.

This compilation focuses on MFSB's uptempo Disco dance tracks from their 1972-1976 albums for Philadelphia International Records. While the perennially-popular "Love Is The Message" became a world-famous hit and a true Disco anthem most of the other tunes on this CD are not well-known but will definitely get you to groove on the dance floor. While MFSB's record sales and chart success may never have equalled those of their much-better-known label mates The O'Jays, Teddy Pendergrass, Lou Rawls, Billy Paul or Jerry Butler (to name but a few!) there simply would have been no "Philly Sound" if there had been no MFSB...and this compilation proves just why this was so. Enjoy!

Jose Maria Napoleon is undoubtedly one of Mexico's best--but in many ways underrated and underexposed--singers/songwriters. While this 1991-issued compilation can not exactly be considered definitive it does contain 15 of his biggest hits including the ageless "Cancion Del Molino Rojo". His music is very romantic, very emotive and truly heartfelt. If you are looking for a compilation which features most of his big hits at a budget price with relatively decent sound quality then this CD would definitely be a good purchase for you. Enjoy!

During the 1960s, the late, truly great and much-missed Lou Rawls was signed to Capitol Records where he was originally marketed and promoted as a Blues and Jazz singer with varying degrees of commercial success during his tenure with the legendary label. These two albums were among his most successful for Capitol and both prove that he was a singer who could convincingly sing different musical genres even when the material given him was not always great. If you are either a fan of or are only familiar with Lou Rawls' Philadelphia International recordings of the 1970s and '80s then this CD will probably be an acquired taste and one you will probably listen to attentively before you really like it as its material is certainly different from Lou's subsequent albums. Enjoy!

This 3-CD box set can, in many ways, be viewed as the truly definitive and most comprehensive Al Green compilation issued to date. Al Green was truly one of the 1970s biggest R&B stars and a true icon of R&B/Soul music and this collection is definitely a fitting tribute to one of the genre's most important male vocalists. The songs are included (with one or two rare exceptions) in chronological order  and both the big hits and other tunes that are not so well-known are included as well in order to (presumably) give this box set balance and perspective. If you have all (or most) of Al Green's classic albums from the 1970s (all of which have been reissued by different labels in both non-remastered and remastered editions) then this box set is not for you but if you (on the other hand) are looking for the hits and have no intention of getting the original albums then this box set is definitely for you. As with all reissues on the Demon-Edsel label, this box set has excellent sound quality and it is obvious that all tracks were transferred directly from the original master tapes. Enjoy!

Released in 1981, "And Once Again" was Isaac Hayes' penultimate album for Polydor Records and is now thankfully available on CD thanks to BBR Records. While this album was not one of Isaac's biggest sellers it does contain some truly gorgeous gems such as "It's All In The Game", "This Time I'll Be Sweeter" and "Love Has Been Good To Us" and this CD reissue from BBR Records has truly excellent sound quality. Now that this very fine but underrated album is available on CD it will hopefully be rediscovered and (as such)  get the recognition it failed to get when originally released on vinyl. Enjoy!

I love Jose Jose and truly believe that he is one of the greatest Latin pop balladeers of all time but I would recommend staying away from this compilation because of its shamefully poor sound quality. Although this CD contains 20 of Jose Jose's biggest hits (including such timeless gems as "Volcan", "Amar Y Querer","Almohada", "Insaciable Amante", "Si Me Dejas Ahora", "Gavilan O Paloma" and others) the sound quality is just appalling. I can not believe (not even for a quick second) that the original master tapes were used here as it sounds like all 20 tracks were transferred onto CD from poor-quality duplicate copies of the masters. There are quite a few other Jose Jose compilations available with better sound quality than this one.

The recordings contained on this 2-CD set were made at some point in the mid-1980s at a Miami nightclub and the original TH-Rodven label apparently chose not to release them. If it was because of the terrible sound quality then I can't blame the label's executives for this decision as (even for a live recording at a crowded nightclub) the sound quality is simply horrific. Tommy Olivencia's orchestra (as usual) brings us some truly hot and searing Salsa while Frankie Ruiz, Hector Tricoche and Paquito Acosta stand out as world-class Salsa singers BUT... there is NO excuse whatsoever for the ridiculously poor sound quality.
I am unfortunately unable to afford $5 an episode so I'm wondering if they will ever be available in years to come.

I like this sheet very much.  I think it's nice for the price.  I also bought the fitted sheet, which is esp nice because of the very deep pockets.  It doesn't slide off the corners.  I think, being 100% cotton that they will wear well.
Does not work. Ever.

I read a review on WM of this product and they said they were using it for an eye wash and it was fine.  I don't wear contact lens but I do use an eye wash every night.  So, I ordered this and I must say it was very refreshing but after  less than a week I realized my vision was developing a cloud over it, esp noticeable when I was watching TV.  So, I discontinued it and withing two days my regular vision was back.  Maybe a younger person wouldn't notice it but my vision is already somewhat impaired so it's a fine line between acceptable and not very good for me, so I am sensitive to changes in my vision.  I didn't know how to rate it since I used for a purpose it wasn't intended for.

I know this isn't fair, but I saw the actor that plays the love interest in another film that was one of the most disgusting and perverted films I have ever seen and now I remember that whenever I see him.  Plus they didn't seem to have much chemistry.  I like the original film much better.
I love Sweet Baby Ray's BBQ sauce and that's whey I ordered the jerky.  but it was all small pieces and mealy.  I didn't like it at all.

Works perfectly and I love it by my bed do I don't have to get up to answer the phone when a phone scammer calls me at 7am.  I can't block them all because my blocker only holds 30 numbers but if I don't recognize the number I don't pick up.

I have this app on my Kindle.  And I have showtime on my Directv subscription.  I decided to watch The Affair on my desktop and went to showtime online.  That is absolutely the most confusing trial I have gone through.  They need a separate site for people they want to subscribe and another one for those who are already subscribers.  It's all mixed together.  In any case it kept telling me over and over that javascript was not enabled.  So, clicking on the instructions on how to enable, it tells me that it's already enabled; which I though it was as I had just check it through about:  Basically the site is telling me it's not enabled and it is enabled.  So, nothing I can do.  This sucks.
Makes my mouth taste like a sewer.
Perfect. I heat a lot of stuff up in the microwave so these bowls are great for me.
Great for cooking in my electric fry pan, which I sit on the counter.
I love couscous and eat it with everything, like beans, and chicken and hominy.  This larger box seems to be the best price so far.

I have a small countertop dishwasher.  I wash the dishes and silverware separately.  I actually have two baskets and alternate them so I can just keep one basket on the counter to store clean silverware and the other in the sink to hold dirty silverware.  Only one of me so I don't wash that often.

Like another reviewer said, it's thin, but I needed a lighter weight coverlet to put over my electric blanket in the winter.  Mostly I find when it's really cold, like below zero, that if I use a quilt I end up at first okay and then sweating before the night is over.  I'm hoping this solves that.

So far I love this little skillet.  I don't have a stove so I use this for things I can't put in the microwave.  I had a larger one but I needed one that fit on the counter with other things and this works great.Update.  I used my larger one for years and I never had a problem inserting the electrical plug.  After only three uses the prongs are bent and I have to look inside every time I insert the electrical connection.  There are no guides, just a hole and if it isn't exactly placed to line up with the prongs, you can bend them.  Which I did.  I had to bend them back so I hope it keeps working.The temperature guide is just very, very basic, no high, med, low.

I've tried a good deal of their products but they are too processed tasting for me.  And they are kind of expensive.  So mostly I go to Netgrocer.  There I get processed food as well but it's stuff I've bought before mostly so I know if I like it.  They do also have some fresh stuff if you are in their "zone" for mailing.
I don't just have leaks so these don't work for me.  They are for minor leaks, like when you sneeze.  When you put it in a expands into a small cup that catches any small amounts of urine.
This is the world's best apple juice.  Very appley.  I've been drinking it for years.
I eat these with everything.  When they were out I got the sweet and sour but I didn't like them at all.  The cabbage is also excellent.
I loved this series, but I had to pay for the last season.  Well, it was worth it.  The chemistry between Boyd and Eva was palpable and irresistible.

These diced tomatoes are truly delicious and taste fresh.  They claim they use a hot water process to remove the skin so apparently that makes a difference in taste from other brands.  I use these with just dried onions and peppers to make an easy salsa to eat with crackers.  I also mix them with beans and couscous and sometimes diced chicken for an easy dinner.  I don't heat them.

I bought these a while back because they looked like some other ones I had a few years back that held heavier bags and lasted a long time.  Unfortunately the springs on these have been popping off until I only have 2 left, so I won't be buying these again.  It is so hard to find quality products anymore.

My son started having symptoms of interstitial cystitis a few months ago.  He found Prelief online and has been taking it, but not every day.  Can anyone tell about their experience in either taking it regularly or just when they have symptoms?  Which is best?  I also have urinary incontinence and am wondering if it would help me.  I can't take pumpkin or drugs because of the side effects.  For the men, if you are worried about having to urinate while you are out, they have absorbent underwear you can wear under your clothes and there is no smell.  I know younger men don't want to try this because it reminds them of old men, but it really could make your life better.  I would say cut back on the liquids a few hours before you go out though.
I live the cucumber dill flavor, but I didn't really like this one.  Too sweet.
I have eaten this pizza before and I actually like it a lot.  But there is no way I'm paying 22.20 for each shipment when I can buy it in the store for 2.50 each on sale.

I make a salad with pasta, black beans, garbanzos, dried onion, Hunts diced tomatoes and corn.  I order most of my food online and can't find small cans of corn so I usually end up throwing out half a can of corn.  I don't like to eat leftovers.  I was reordering the dried onion, which is fastastic by the way, and thought why not use the freeze dried corn since all the reviews were so great.Later: Well, the bean salad didn't work out because the corn is too sweet; very, very sweet.  I don't know what else to use it in.  Any ideas?

Today I took one pint of real vanilla ice cream, a half cup of walnuts, and about a fourth of a cup of this maple sirup.  I can only say it was delicious, better than a bottled ice cream topping.  The flavor is light and just right.

I got this particular rack because it was long, but if you put anything on it except something very lightweight, it sags.  You'll notice the picture shows cups on the top, but on the end.  If you put them in the middle it would sag.  They could have added a metal rod the length of the top for more support.
My favorite feta stuffed olives but they are too expensive so I had to switch to another brand.  Darn.
Something I eat frequently as a snack.  Quick and I love the beans and pasta together.
These are my favorite version of Triscuits.  Thin and crispy and fewer calories as well.
The only thing better than one of these pies would be a homemade chocolate pie.  They are delish!
But..they raised the price 2.00 since a couple of days ago.  Already too expensive.

I have had a chronic diarrhea problem, for years, off and on.  the other day (don't read further if you get upset by poop) I left a trail on  my back porch to the bathroom.  I use a walker and that was the LAST thing I wanted to deal with.  I have tried mainly eating food with fiber and taking fiber.  Didn't work.  I was so fed up I determined to find a solution because enough is enough.  I also have to deal with incontinence.  I ordered these pills and it was instant relief.  Now I don't have to get up and wheel myself to the toilet as fast as I can at the slightest inkling I have to go  in order to actually get there.  What a relief.  they worked right away.NOTE:  Okay, I've been taking them for a month.  If any sign of the diarrhea I take two, but no more than four a day.  Otherwise I've been taking one twice a day.  Unfortunately there have been side-effects.  I know they are not meant for long-term use so keep that in mind.  I have headaches in the morning; I have a very foul taste in my mouth; I have mild nausea; I have a stomach ache while I'm eating; and I have this low-key anxiety type feeling which is very uncomfortable.  I don't feel myself.  I am loathe to give these up as they work so well.  For me to have solid BM's every day is a miracle.  I'm wondering if anyone out there uses something else that works.
I use a million of these.  They are stuck all round my computer edges and if I need a note to myself when I go downstairs I use them and stick them to my shirt.
Got this for my elderly mother who shakes so she can't fasten one with a fastener; and part of a easy reader group from Timex, so she can read it better.
Was very yuck.
I eat these all the time, 3-4 times a week.  Very tasty and just enough.

I put this in ground turkey patties and it was so good!  Highly recommend them.  Also have put them in tuna salad sandwiches.  And yesterday I added them to Hunt's petite chopped tomatoes with one chopped avocado and it was so good with crackers just as a meal.  I ordered some lime juice so I'm going to add that next time.  I don't reconstitute them because I like that little crunch.

since I am using incontinence patches and one side-effect is bladder infections, which has come to pass, I've started drinking cranberry juice to keep them away.  Working so far.  I don't like the light variety, so I have to accommodate for the extra calories, but it's a must after the infection went up to my kidney and I was in bed for two days 24/7 with much pain and cipro and penicillin.

For what they are, a boxed meal, I think they are great.  I eat them about two times a week.  I'm old, don't go out that much anymore, and don't cook except with the slow cooker and once in a while the toaster oven.  It's best not to compare fresh and prepared meals or you will probably always find them lacking.  Just take it for what it is: tasty and convenient.  I just dump the noodles, and the two packets into the box with one cup of water and it comes out fine. I would say if they aren't cooking thoroughly you might have a microwave with low wattage.  Need about 1100-1200.  Most directions are made for that number.  You can compensate for that by cooking longer.

I've used Command adhesives before, like to hold coats and my bag.  They are strong.  So I knew this holder should work fine and it has.  I have a narrow edge on my PC but it is just enough for the holder to adhere well.  My old holder finally broke and I was hoping I could find another one that did as well and held up as long.  This one has so far been great.
My son recommended this from when he was visiting a friend and he had one.  I LOVE them.  Such a simple idea and yet saves so much mess in my microwave.  I was using paper towels.
these beat out Hostess by a mile.  Great to have with  my tootsie roll cocoa at the end of the day.  They take a while to get here so hang in there.

I really like this tootsie roll flavor.  It's not too sweet but just right for me to sit and relax watching tv and enjoy!  Despite all the fancy flavors of the K-cup coffees, I can barely tell the difference between them so I decided to try the cocoa.  For 70 calories it's really good.

I use meds for incontinence and one side-effect is dry mouth.  this really isn't a spray, it's a stream and it has a strong flavor.  I prefer the gel, which lasts longer.  I use it at least twice during the night.  Don't need it during the day.
This was a fun, typical comedy for the 60's.  It was interesting to be reminded how talented a comedian Jerry Lewis was when he was young.

Okay, you would have to be completely stupid to not realize that there are a few ringer reviews posted here.  This can opener is just a 5.98 can opener with a large handle.  I like the larger handle because it's easier to turn.  But there is no miracle here.  It operates just like a regular can opener and is vastly overpriced.  If this is what you need all you have to do is decide if you are willing to be ripped off on the price.  I might have give it more stars if it lasts a couple of years, like can openers used to.  I just threw away one that I bought on Amazon that laster less than a year.

I have a Brother laser printer and tried to use this to replace my Brother toner cartridge, but it didn't fit right and the printer would make a grinding noise when I tried to print and it kept flashing error from the beginning.  When I put my old cartridge back in it didn't work.  So, I ended up ordering a new printer.  I'm not sure what happened.  I had the Brother for almost three years and it was great, very reliable when I used the Brother cartridge.  Of course I would rather use a cheaper toner cartridge and was disappointed it didn't work.
Not really a spray, but a stream.  It's not awful but kind of strong, but it works okay for a few hours.  I put in the gel when I go to sleep and use this if I wake up during the night.

I would wake often during the night with a mouth so dry I couldn't swallow, a combination of dry air during the winter and using an incontinence patch (side effect).  I put this in and usually wake up only once.  It not as dry as before.  I bought a spray so I put that by the bed and squirt it in and go back to sleep.  It's not really a spray, just a stream of mint fluid but works well enough for the rest of the night.
I had hip replacements and can't bend over to tie my tennis shoes so I put these in and can slip my foot in without having to do anything.
This is a very cheap product and won't even stand up by itself easily.  I threw it awat and kept my old one.

I was developing some kind of nerve or tendon problem in my hands from holding my kindle when reading lying down in bed at night so this has solved that problem.  I can use it with my hand facing me or away and rotate the Kindle, so it's perfect.  the pain in my right hand is gradually going away.
This stuff is so delicious I bought my first jar and just ate it out of the jar with a spoon.  So, I have to be careful!  Yes, very yummy.

I have always listened to the BBC on my radio using my computer and an FM transmitter, so this is much better.  However, I have not discovered the secret to turning the app off once I'm through listening to the radio.  It continues on even if I bring up, say a netflix movie.  I have to power down my Kindle completely.
I don't want to judge the taste because I have never eaten Devon Rice pudding before but for me, it is really bland and watery.
Terrible taste.  I threw them out.

I bought this to give me some help with my balance but it didn't work that well.  My son bought me a simple walker and it's perfect.  I can walk fine but I get off balance so the walker is more secure.  This cane is heavy and kind of cumbersome and you have to learn how to walk with it.  It's more for short distances and just moving from place to place, not really walking in a normal gait.
I use these for everything and they have never split.  When my son was helping me clean out my house I threw away a lot of old books and no problem.

I'm a bit torn on these wheels. I bought these to replace a set of MT Sidebiter wheels. I wasn't very happy with those either and its a very long story of why I went with another set of MT Sidebiters. The old set were made in Taiwan where these are made in China. The last set were difficult to balance because the center holes were not perfectly centered. Add to the fact that the design made mounting the tires a chore and I wasn't really that happy with them.These new Sidebiter II's are a better design for mounting the tires. They also have a bit more back spacing. I actually like the satin finish better than the old gloss finish of the Sidebiters.So, why only 3 stars? Actually I'm being a bit generous here. Two of the 4 wheel I bought ran pretty true and were easy to balance when the tires were mounted. One wasn't great but not terrible either. One of them was way out though. The center hole was way out of center.it took about 16 Oz to balance on the inside! I really should have sent it back but there is no guarantee thinned one would have been any better and I realty just didn't have the time. I needed the wheels for an upcoming trip.The biggest issue I have with these wheels is something I found when I went to mount the tires. There is a warning on the wheels not to mount a tire larger than 31" in diameter on them! What? I mounted my 35x12.5's on them and ignored the warning. Heck, I think stock Ford F150 tires were larger than this. In my application I have 5 on 5.5" which is stock F150 bolt pattern so the 31" limit is really impractical.Between the poor quality control and 31" tire diameter limit, these were disappointing.
This item worked well to replace some plastic rivets on the fender liner of my 2008 Dodge Carver Daytona that had failed. The tool itself is particularly well made.

I'm a bit torn on what rating to give these sliders. On one had they fit my AXO Aragon boots perfectly. They are the exact same sliders that came with the boots. They also include the slider base (the sliders are two pieces) and screws which are not shown in the picture.On the other hand they wear quickly if you drag a toe out on the track. They wear no quicker than any other plastic sliders but they are also your only choice. There are no titanium, ceramic, or any other types available.So for fit I give them 5 stars, for wear I give them 3. I'll settle at 4 total then.

This is the second time I have ordered these socks. At first I wasn't too sure about the calf of these as they are not as elastic as many other socks I have owned. After having my last set for about a year I am hooked on them. I don't like any other socks now and I don't like the way other socks feel on my feet any longer. Other socks make my feet feel very sweaty where these do not.After a bit of an adjustment period I just won't wear any other socks.The great thing is these socks are made in the USA!

Seeing as I just bought this a week or so ago as of this writing, I cannot really comment on the reliability of this monitor. I can say that it is sleek, relatively light weight, and has a nice picture. I don't use it for gaming or anything very demanding. As time goes on if I run in to any trouble I will update this review.

I like this keyboard so much that it is the second one I have bought. Not because the first one failed, but because I had another computer that needed a keyboard. Having a wireless keyboard that never needs batteries or any other attention other than cleaning is very convenient. Even though it is a very thin sleek design the keys feel great when typing. I've had my original keyboard for over a year and it works like the day I bought it.

By far the most important aspect of safety gear is that it protects you when you need it. Looks and design take a back seat to its most important aspect, protecting you. I had a pretty significant crash at Road America in turn 5 a bit back. I hit the pavement hard and slid for quite a while. These boots have some significant black scuffs from sliding on the asphalt. The plastic "armor" held up very well and the boots overall came out of it with just scuffs. From a safety perspective I give these 5 stars.From a functional aspect I have a few issues. First, the Boa system works fine. The problem I have is that to get them really cinched down you really need to crank on the rotator. The rotator is grippy but it is just a smallish round disc. Maybe a folding flat tab that would give you some more leverage?Another issue I have is spare parts. Unlike some of the more established brands it seems that spare parts are a bit harder to find and some of the parts that should be replaceable are either permanently attached or not available. Boots from companies like Sidi have many more replaceable sliders and armor that would allow you to replace parts as needed to keep your boots looking and performing like new for a very long time.The last issue I have with them are the toe sliders. I often drag a toe and being plastic these wear out quickly. Replacements are available but you only have a choice of the exact same plastic slider. Again, Sidi makes the standard plastic, metal, and a slider with ceramic inserts.Overall these boots offer great protection, great fit, and easy on and off. Everything you need for a great boot out on the track.

I bought these to replace the standard incandescent lights on a horse trailer for my daughter. The standard incandescent lights suffer from both burned out bulbs and poor connections between the bulb and socket. These should solve both problems as the LED's should last a very long time, and they are permanently mounted to a board and completely sealed in some sort of epoxy.I have two minor items I would change if I were designing these. First I would make them a one wire connection and rely on the mounting screws for the ground. I quite simply pulled the white with into the housing and grounded it with the mounting screw anyway. This isn't a huge issue but I think in most applications a hard wire connection to ground really isn't needed. The other thing I would change is to have a void behind the base of the fixture. The way it is made the wire has to go directly into a hole to keep from being squished by the housing when mounted. If the hole is off from where the wire exits the fixture then there is no space for it.Other than that these should last a very long time and be very reliable.

The standard incandescent lights suffer from both burned out bulbs and poor connections between the bulb and socket. These should solve both problems as the LED's should last a very long time, and they are permanently mounted to a board and completely sealed in some sort of epoxy.I have two minor items I would change if I were designing these. I installed two of these on a horse trailer for my daughter. They replaced the old fashioned incandescent lights that were problematic. The old incandescent tail lights not only had issues with burned out bulbs but also the contacts inside of the lights would get corroded and need attention. These fit right in place of the old lights and she shouldn't have to worry about burned out bulbs or bad contacts any more. If for some reason these fail I will update this review. As a side note these are nice and bright too.

These are just rivets and nothing too exciting. With the rivet being stainless as well as the anvil (or whatever they call the pin) these are very difficult to snap with a standard rivet gun. I was able to do it with my standard Craftsman gun but it sure wasn't easy. That is no fault of the rivet just part of the fact that it is all SS construction. If you need a fully SS rivet these are a good buy.
This belt fit my '04 XC90 T6 without any issues. Time will tell how long it will last but it appears to be well made.If it fails prematurely I will update this review.

I was getting a check engine light on my '04 XC90 that indicated the engine was taking too long to get to operating temperature. I suspect the problem was with the thermostat but wanted to change this while I was replacing the thermostat just in case.I'm glad I did as I had everything out and apart making installing this a breeze.Everything fit perfectly and the sensor seems to be working as it should.

My 2004 XC90 was getting a check engine light and indicating that the engine was taking too long to come up to temperature. Upon removing the old unit I found that the small button on the blocking disc was missing. I'm not certain that was causing the issue but I guess that part is there for a reason. It will remain to be seen if this will eliminate my error message.

Like all OEM inks these work perfectly. Also like all OEM inks these are priced higher than they should be. Aftermarket inks are usually a crap shoot on whether they will work so as to make them not much of a bargain either.So, even though they are a bit expensive, you know they will be compatible.

Like almost all OEM cartridges these work perfectly as should be expected. The only issue I have with these, which is of course the same with all OEM ink, is the price. I don't think Cannon is as bad as some brands but ink is always the OEM's profit maker.As I said though, other than being a bit pricey, the cartridge works perfectly.

I've only installed one of these so far. It went in with no issues and the printer recognized it. The printer is working just fine with it.On the past I've tried generic and refurbished cartridges in my Lexmark printer and couldn't get them to work. These newer printers use RFID chips embedded in the cartridge to make sure they are compatible and keep track of their ink level. Unfortunately the cartridges I've tried in the past, again with the Lexmark, couldn't get past this RFID programming. These, at least the first one, do not have this problem.If for some reason the next cartridge I install doesn't work I will update this post. Also, with the price and the fact they seem to work, I will likely be buying more in the future. If I run into problems with them I will be sure to say so.
These are inexpensive crimp-on connectors yet work pretty well. They are not as well made as some of the other ones I have used. They do seem to work just fine though.
These are inexpensive crimp-on connectors yet work pretty well. They are not as well made as some of the other ones I have used. They do seem to work just fine though.

This unit is very nice for wiring up your trailer. Not only is the plug and cable very high quality, but it gives you a great place to connect the trailer wiring. Using this gets rid of crimp-on splices which fail over time. It also makes trouble shooting your setup a breeze.The cable is not super long so the box will need to be located near the tung. I believe there are versions of these with longer cables if you need them.

These are working perfectly for me. I have used several on my motorcycle and have recorded many 175mph race track sessions. In addition I've had a crash or two and have yet to have one come off. The mounts fit into them very well yet cost much less than the OEM GoPro mounts.

My Neato hit the battery warranty mark and the original battery was exhausted. I bought this replacement battery and it appears to be the exact battery as the original. My Neato is once again going about its business of sucking up dirt and animal hair in my house.I am giving it 4 stars instead of 5 mainly because the original only outlasted the warranty by a couple of weeks. Having said that maybe this one will last longer. Also, our Neato run every single day and vacuums about 1600 sq ft total. So it gets a lot a charging cycles in the just over 6 months it lasted.

i can't say enough about these clamps. They work well and look great. They also never need to be re tightened.There are a few drawbacks and limitations though.First and most important is you must be able to get at the clamp with a heat gun. That access must be all of the way around or mostly so.The other issue is that they must be destroyed to remove them. These are a bit pricey (one drawback) and if you frequently need to remove that hose this is clamping it would get expensive to keep changing them.Still though I use these anywhere I can and anywhere they make sense.

The shield on my Bell Star helmet got broken and it broke one of the hinges with it. As the rest of the helmet was perfect it wouldn't have made sense to scrap the helmet over a part that cost a few bucks. I bought these and being original parts they replaced my broken ones perfectly. Now my helmet is as good as new again.

Fit perfectly and works perfectly. It is nothing glamorous but my old one quit and this one fit right and and is working fine. It is a brand new unit and not a rebuilt though I personally feel there is nothing at all wrong with a good rebuilt starter.One thing a bit misleading about the photo is that this starter is not painted, it has a goldish coating. I would actually have preferred it be painted for cosmetic reasons but it has no effect on performance so I'm not going to take a star away.Lastly, I think it has been mentioned before but I'll repeat it, this part is made in Tiawan. I would have much preferred it be made in the U.S.A. but I knew before I ordered it where it was made. Being made in Tiawan may not be bad or good but I think people should at least know and so they can make informed decisions.

I absolutely love these hose clamps. They hold tight and create a leak free seal. Unlike worm drive clamps they never need to be re-tensioned. As an added bonus they have a very tidy appearance when installed.

Thia tool is a great tool to use for no mess brake bleeding. It is plenty large to bleed each corner of a car without having to stop and empty the container before finishing that corner. The magnet is very handy allowing the bottle to be attached to the rotor.

I put this battery in my CBR1000RR track bike and so far it is working perfectly. I've had zero starting issues with it. Not only is it much lighter than a lead battery but it is much smaller. That makes fitting into most bikes a breeze.I also have a Lithium Iron battery of a different brand in my Buell 1125R street bike. The experience I've had with these batteries has helped my understand that these batteries may not be for everyone.First and foremost is how these batteries work in the cold. When it gets cold the bike may at first turn over very slowly and not start. This is actually normal. Depending on how cold it is and how hard your motor is to crank you will need to get current flowing in the battery to warm it internally. They recommend you turn on the headlights for a period of time. Trying to start the bike, letting it sit a bit, then trying it again until it starts has worked for me. The problem is it is a bit counter intuitive. You feel as though if the battery is too weak to start the bike running down further will just make things worse. The fact is it is different technology than the old lead batteries and therefore it works differently. It takes a bit of getting used to.The next thing is that draining them to nothing is a sure way to kill them. I accidentally drain my Buell battery and I got very lucky that it took a charge and still works. A friend of mine with a track bike has yet another battery brand that uses the same technology. At the end of a track day he forgot to turn his bike off. The next morning the battery was dead and unfortunately junk. These batteries do not like to be run down to nothing. In most cases its not an issue but if you leave the key on or otherwise run it down to zero you can plan on needing a new one.On that same issue, if you live where there is a riding season and an extended non riding season you will have to take precautions. Any computer controlled bike will draw a small amount of current even when the key is off. This small current draw will drain any battery down with time. If left sitting long enough the battery will be drained completely and once again with the Lithium Iron battery you'll likely be replacing it. The instructions say that if you leave it in the bike and it is not ridden then you should charge it once a month. That is very similar to a lead battery. Where these differ though is that there is nearly no internal discharging. A lead battery must be periodically charged even if they have no external current draw. These batteries do not self discharge. Because of this the best way to store them for the winter is to pull them from the bike and store them inside the house. If you do that they need no attention over the winter. I did try this with my Buell Battery the first off season and the bike fired right up in spring when I put the battery back in.If your willing to live with their limitations they are great small and light alternatives to lead batteries. This battery in particular is also nice because it has the positive and negative terminals on both sides which makes installation more flexible. It also was priced lower than any of the other brands so I thought I'd give it give it a shot. So far I have no regrets.

This oil is more than likely just fine for most motorcycles. For my use though, in a CBR1000RR track bike, I found the bike shifting differntly than when I ran Amsoil. I could not find Amsoil when I needed it so I decided to give the Castrol a shot. After one track day weekend I decided to switch back to Amsoil. As I said though in most cases I'm sure this oil will work perfectly fine.
I installed this in my Surface Pro 3 and so far it is working perfectly. It was a great way to double my storage space.

So far so good. I bought this to wear under my one piece leather motorcycle suit. In the past I was using Under Armour which worked just fine. Coovy is a much lower priced alternative and I would be hard pressed to be able to tell any difference at all when I'm wearing it.I don't know where the Under Armor is made but Coovy is made in Korea. It may not matter much to most but I think it is important for people to at least know.

This boot does a good job not only protecting my pressure gauge but also making the gauge easier to grip. If you have a Accu-guage that didn't come with one of these on it I highly recommend getting one.
This filter fit perfectly into my 2006 XC90. Mann has a reputation for making good filters and I see nothing about this filter to dispute that reputation.

I bought this for my CBR1000 track bike. So far I have had no issues with it but I didn't really have any issues in the past either. I didn't use this to solve a problem I was having, I used it to avoid any potential problems. I had been using Motul with no issues. I like the fact that Torque publishes their test data on their web site. I also like the fact that it compares well, and in most cases better, to Castrol SRF yet is almost half the price. It seems expensive until you compare it to the Castrol.

These worked perfectly to replace the broken ones on my 1998 Cherokee. I had to replace the cowl on my Jeep after doing some off roading. When I went to remove these clips from my cowl 3 of 4 broke immediately. They were very brittle. I went to the local parts store figuring they would have them but no dice. I ordered them from Amazon and I had them in a couple days as usual. They snapped right in to a factory cowl and I was good to go.

So far these have worked out great. I had a set just like them (unsure of the brand) that I bought out of a discount bin at a hardware store years ago. That set held up great for years. Unfortunately I broke one after really abusing it one day and was short one out of the set. I did a search here on Amazon and found these and they appear to be nearly identical to my old set but with better chrome. I've used them a few times now and they seem to be as well made as my originals.One thing to keep in mind is that the ball style hex drives are not as strong as the non-ball style. This is true even with high end brands such as Snap On. If you need to really torque a screw on or off and don't need a ball style you are better off using straight hex style sockets.As a side note these tools are imported as you may have guessed. In most cases I try my best to buy domestic but for the money and the way my old set held up they are worth the money.

These nuts look great and are much lighter than the OEM steel nuts. Each one has an steel threaded insert (like a heli coil) so they are strong enough to do the job. They do have a torque spec specific to the nut and I recommend it be followed.I ran these on the sprocket of my CBR1000RR for two full track days at Road America with speeds over 170mph and they held up with no issues at all.In the instructions they recommend that you wrap the nuts with Teflon tape to keep them from getting marked up when tightening. I did this and it worked perfectly. If you don't have any Teflon tape laying around order a roll of that too.

If you have RE joints do yourself a favor and get one of these sooner than later. I've been running RE joints for years and struggled to tighten the joints with every method I could think of, other than just buying the tool. Now that I have the tool I can see how foolish trying to make something work really was. With this tool making periodic adjustments is simple and effective. The only issue is that you still have to gain access to the joint to tighten it. It is part of the design of the joint though and not really the tool

This is a great filter and a great alternative to both paper disposable filters and oiled cotton gauze filters. Being a dry filter it never needs oiling yet can be cleaned and reused likely indefinitely.The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars opposed to 5 is because of fit in my application (2008 Charger Daytona.) On the Daytona, and likely all R/T's, one corner of the filter housing it too shallow to accommodate the same thickness as the rest of the housing. With a paper filter it is a non issue as the filter media compresses easily enough to accommodate the lack of depth. This filter is much stiffer, especially at the edges, and makes getting it into the housing very difficult.

I bought this mostly for the thumbscrews wrench. It was only a little more money to buy the wrench in a kit than buying the wrench separately. The wrench itself works perfectly. Not only can you easily tighten the thumbscrews sufficiently to keep the camera from moving in the mounts but it makes loosening very tight thumb screws a breeze. The wrench works with standard GoPro style thumbscrews as well as the more round style thumbscrews included in the kit. The thumb screws themselves look very nice and being made of aluminum should hold up very well with time.
I bought this for my daughter who rides and shows her horse. She absolutely loves it. It looks very realistic and is made very nicely. I recommend it for any horse lover in your life.

Just your basic every day tail light bulb used on many late model vehicles. Its nice to have spares around when you need them and buying a pack like this is more economical than buying blister packs at the parts store.

These not only make short work of removing you drum heads, it is also really nice looking. For something as simple as this DW seems to have done a great job with the chrome. Having two is nice because if their anything like a regular drum key one will always turn up missing!
About all I can say about these heads is they are the standard by which others are measured. They are made in the USA and are pretty much the standard for snares all over the world!

In the past I have used Bloxide. The price and availability of Bloxide lead me to look for an alternative.When welding two pieces of sheet steel together I don't like the idea of having raw steel against raw steel. To me you're just looking for a place for rot and rust to start. Regular paint doesn't work because it contaminates the weld. Also, any area subjected to heat will burn off and you will end up with unprotected areas near the welds but between the steel. That's where weld through primer comes in. You can coat the bare steel and then any area where the steel touches will be protected.Bloxide has always worked well for me but as I said it seems to be pretty expensive and hard to find. This product seemed to work just as well, at least at the weld. Only time will tell if it protects the two sandwiched pieces of steel I welded together. I think for certain it will be better that if it was bare steel to bare steel.After spraying this on and then welding I can say that the welds went on contaminant free, unlike regular paint. As I was welding I didn't notice any of the primer burning off like paint normally does.

This is a nice enough cap and rotor set for what it is, a stock replacement cap an rotor. The cap terminals are of course aluminum which aren't as good as brass, but of course it isn't priced like brass. The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is because the metal pieces of the rotor are a little thinner than I would have liked to have seen. It works well enough, at least in my stock application, that it may make no difference.I will say it is getting harder and harder to find a cap and rotor set with the older rotor style. All of the brass terminal sets I cold find included a new TFI style rotor.

I absolutely love these hose clamps. They have constant tension for the entire circumference of the hose and never need to be retightened. The first time I used these I was very worried about leaks and if the hose would be tight enough. My fear was un founded as the hose seems to be as tight as they ever were with regular hose clamps. Also, you never have to worry about over tightening a clamp. The only other clamp I feel even compares to these are the OEM constant tension clamps. As any one who ever had to remove one of those knows though removal and installation can be a pain to say the least.The only issue you will ever have with these, provided they are properly installed, is they are a one time use item of course. To remove the hose it will have to be destroyed and a new one installed. They are not super expensive but if you have a hose you remove every so often it could get a little pricey.One other thing I like about these. They have a very "clean" look when installed. Many of the SS worm drive clamps look a little cheesy to me depending on the application. On a show car a improperly sized worm drive clamp can look down right terrible. These have a super clean look when installed.

These plugs are very nice and the price is right. I'm not sure that they are any better than any other quality double platinum plug, but they for sure are a very well made plug. I've never experienced any failures with Autolite plugs, platinum or otherwise. I have experienced plug failures with other well known and reputable brands but not Autolite. This is the primary reason I stick with Autolite.

These hoses work great for times when there is no molded hose made to fit your application. I am using this one for a lower hose in a Jeep Cherokee with a 5.2L Magnum engine swapped in. It flexed to fit right in and should last a very long time.What I has on there before this was one of the stainless steel corrugated flexible hose kits. It is similar to this hose but it is made of stainless which I thought would be a good thing. Unfortunately you still need rubber connectors at both ends of that stainless hose. Now you have four clamps to leak. Also, the rubber those couplers were made out of were horrible. They started cracking after about 12 months. These flex hoses have none of those issues and actually look better too.

I absolutely love the functionality of these butt plates. They are a little bulky compared to a plain old but plate. Considering how well it works at allowing you to make 3 incremental adjustments to your snare wires at the flick of a lever it is well worth the extra bulk. Not only that but these are very well made and have a feel and heft of a quality piece.If you need a butt plate for your snare, look no further!

About the Book:One night four lives entered the world by the hands of an Amish midwife, just outside North Star, Pennsylvania.Rebekah‚Äôs babies, as they are called, are now grown adults and in four heartwarming novellas each young person experiences a journey of discovery, love, and the wonder of Christmas.Guiding Star by Katie GanshertCuriosity gets the best of Englisher Chase Wellington when he investigates the twenty-five-year-old disappearance of an Amish baby. When he finds adventurous Elle McAllister in Iowa will his discoveries upend her world?Mourning Star by Amanda FlowerEden Hochstetler slips from her parents‚Äô fudge shop to investigate the death of her friend Isaac Yoder.  Who is guilty? Isaac‚Äôs handsome great nephew Jacob, an angry Englisher, or someone else?In the Stars by Cindy WoodsmallKore Detweiler has nursed his broken heart, avoiding North Star after Savilla Beiler suddenly rejected his love.  But when he is called to return home, he and Savilla must join forces to keep a family together.Star of Grace by Mindy Starns Clark and Emily ClarkAndy Danner left North Star to work in construction in a new Amish settlement in Louisiana. His little brother devises a scheme to bring Andy home for Christmas, and unwittingly unleashes the power of forgiveness in an old widower‚Äôs life.My Review: It's good to read a novella because you get a chance to sample several different authors and find a favorite or two. I love Christmas fiction, it really gets you into the holiday spirit and Amish Christmas at North Star is no different. Each of the four authors collaborated on this and it all centers around one person with which all the main characters have a connection. Rebekah has been a midwife for over twenty years so she has a wealth of experience as we will soon see.Guiding Star by Katie GanshertWhile going there for a totally different reason Elle finds love in the most unexpected place.Mourning Star by Amanda FlowerEden is devastated when she learns of her friends death. she has to get down to the bottom of it and fast.In the Stars by Cindy WoodsmallIt is all about business and they must set aside their differences in this beautiful love and lost romance.Star of Grace by Mindy Starns Clark and Emily ClarkSomebody is up to something especially when it comes to Andy's little brother. He sees someone in need and believes his big brother is the answer. A good mix of love, lost love, mystery, and intrigue! Each character and their story line will leave you reeling. Perfect book to get cozy by the fire on a blustery fall day. Loved each and every story. This book is definitely a keeper!**Disclosure** This book was sent to me free of charge for my honest review through Blogging for Books.

About the Book:After cheating death, Veronica Welling is determined to savor every moment in her idyllic kingdom with both her true love and best friend by her side at last. At the same time, Mackenna Reid is enthusiastically building her new life and a theater with her prince. But just as their dreams of happiness are within reach, the world Vee and Kenna have chosen is ripped away, leaving them to face their most horrific challenge yet‚Äîtheir old lives.Thrust out of Doon, the best friends are confronted with tormentors from their past and no way to return to their adopted land. When the MacCrae brothers rush to their rescue, the girls' situation turns from nightmare to modern-day fairy tale. But their happiness could be short lived: unbeknownst to them, someone in their closest circle is aiding the witch of Doon in her bid to destroy the kingdom once and for all.My Review:Veronica Welling is the queen of Doon, and she has a lot of weight on her shoulders. She must keep everyone happy and safe. And that was her mind-set until the day she almost died, now she wants nothing more than to have fun while she can with the love of her life and her best friend. All seems to be going well, that is until she and her bestie begin seeing weird things. Brushing the odd visions aside, she believed it to be nothing but waking up back in the modern world, she knows something is amiss.Mackenna Reid could believe her eyes when they arrived back in the modern day Scotland. But after battling to get back and fast, she was distraught when they arrived back at their homes in America. Poorer than poor in America, Mackenna and Veronica don‚Äôt believe they will ever get back to Doon and their handsome hunks. But when the MacCrae brothers arrive to take them home, it seems all is well.Back in Doon, evil is at work. The evil witch that wants nothing more than to harm them is hiding among the people and no one but Mackenna, Veronica, and the MacCrae boys can stop her.Shades of Doon is book three in the Doon series. This book was a wonderful addition to the series. I love how the authors write in such a way you feel like you are right there with them. I hate to see this series end but at the same time I am excitedly awaiting the fourth and final book that will arrive fall of 2016.**Disclosure** This book was sent to me free of charge for my honest review from the author.

About the Book:My Give Thanks Bible brings beloved Bible stories such as Noah‚Äôs Ark, David and Goliath, and the birth of Jesus to life for beginning readers. The stories chosen for this padded cover board book show children how people in the Bible were thankful for God‚Äôs great blessings and remind us that we should be thankful for the blessings in our lives too.My Review: Just in time for Turkey day comes a board book from Zonderkidz to help us keep our kids focused in the right direction. A small Bible packed with a punch that will surely deliver the message in the appropriate way. Our children will learn who created this magnificent world around them. Beginning with Genesis 1 and ending with Jesus going to heaven, this small board book Bible is geared toward ages 4-8 years old. Younger children can be read to while it is simple enough for the older age group. after each small 2-3 sentence lesson based on scripture and illustrated is a simple prayer for each child to pray. This sweet book is a great gift and with thick board like pages is great for those sweet, precious hands of a child!**Disclosure** This book was sent to me free of charge for my honest review from the author.

About the Book:Love surrounds you, beauty, too.Notice how God blesses you!Clap your hands, shout and sing:Thank you, Lord, for everything.A comfortable and relaxing rhyme tells the story of God‚Äôs great blessings in this padded cover board book. P.J. Lyons‚Äô engaging text and Tim Warnes‚Äô playful illustrations remind readers how much they have to be thankful for.My Review: Packed into this little, tiny board book perfect for small hands is a HUGE message we need to teach our children. How to thank the Lord for everything. This tiny leading character with no name takes you through a day in the life of him and shows you how he thanks God for everything throughout the day. Not only his creation but for his family, food, and friends. A happy book that teaches our children who to thank for the world around them. A perfect gift for children right before the holidays. Geared towards children in the age range of 4-8 years old. Can be read by an adult to very young children and the perfect six=ze for young hands. A precious book about thankfulness!**Disclosure** This book was sent to me free of charge for my honest review from the author.

About the Book:Six-year-old Gretl Schmidt is on a train bound for Auschwitz. Jak√≥b Kowalski is planting a bomb on the tracks.As World War II draws to a close, Jak√≥b fights with the Polish resistance against the crushing forces of Germany and Russia. They mean to destroy a German troop transport, but Gretl‚Äôs unscheduled train reaches the bomb first.Gretl is the only survivor. Though spared from the concentration camp, the orphaned German Jew finds herself lost in a country hostile to her people. When Jak√≥b discovers her, guilt and fatherly compassion prompt him to take her home. For three years, the young man and little girl form a bond over the secrets they must hide from his Catholic family.But she can‚Äôt stay with him forever. Jak√≥b sends Gretl to South Africa, where German war orphans are promised bright futures with adoptive Protestant families‚Äîso long as Gretl‚Äôs Jewish roots, Catholic education, and connections to communist Poland are never discovered.Separated by continents, politics, religion, language, and years, Jak√≥b and Gretl will likely never see each other again. But the events they have both survived and their belief that the human spirit can triumph over the ravages of war have formed a bond of love that no circumstances can overcome.My Review: Gretl Schmidt is six years old and is on the run from the Gespo. Being a German Jew she doesn‚Äôt really have any allies. The Polish despise Germans and the Germans despise Jews. So with her family having no where to turn to, do the fact they are on a train to Auschwitz, they decide to sneak Gretl and her sister Elza off.Jak√≤b Kowalski fights along with other Polish men to rid the Germans from their country. Planting a bomb on the train tracks for a coming German Troop transport seemed like a reasonable idea. That is until he takes little Gretl in. With her mom and grandmother killed on the train he helped destroy and her sister dying from a fever, she is all alone with no one wanting to take in neither a German nor Jew. So Jak√≤b decides to keep the little girl by his side.Three years later, Gretl looks more and more like a German everyday and Jak√≤b is worried for her safety. With no where else to turn, Jak√≤b must send dear little Gretl to an orphanage in South Africa. Where maybe just maybe a nice Protestant family will wish to adopt her.The Girl From The Train is a wonderful book about love and endurance. I enjoyed how this book was full adventure and kept you sucked in. This author has become one of my favorites and I‚Äôll be sure to keep my eyes out for more of her books.**Disclosure** This book was sent to me free of charge for my honest review from Book Look.

About the Book;Andi Boggs and her best friend Colin Carter are at it again ‚Ä¶ in this third book of the Andi Boggs series, Andi Unstoppable, school has begun for the two Killdeer middle schoolers and the science teacher has a great idea! He is an expert birder and wants his class to share in the fun. In a birding group with Colin and her biggest school rival, Ava, Andi sets out to be the first student in class to spot the elusive Kirtland's warbler but ends up spotting the town‚Äôs resident ghost instead!Together with her friends, Andi takes on another small town mystery‚Äîis the legend of the ghost of Dominika Shalley more than just a story? And does her sudden appearance have anything to do with the holes the friends find in the Shalley graveyard as they look for the rare bird?My Review: Andi and Colin are at it again! This was a very good mystery book for young children between the ages of 8-12. Andi, Colin, and Ava are all put in the same project group together. Their Science teacher gives them all an assignment that is sure to get them more interested in birds and hopefully they will each become more knowledgeable about one in particular---Kirtland's warbler. Soon the kiddos are off on a camping excursion with Colin's great aunt that just happens to know a thing or two about birds. Well it's not long before the camping trip turns into a mystery needing to be solved. Especially when these two are around, Andi and Colin anything can happen!**Disclosure** This book was sent to me free of charge for my honest review through my participation on the Z Blog Squad.

About the Book:No one needs to push Nikki Boyd to excel on the Tennessee Missing Persons Task Force. The case of her own missing sister, still unsolved after ten years, is the driving force in her work. When a Polaroid photo of a missing girl shows up at a crime scene, Nikki quickly recognizes similarities to the past. The closer she gets to the abductor, the more she feels this case has become personal, and she is not the hunter . . . but the hunted.With this explosive first book in The Nikki Boyd Files, award-winning author Lisa Harris takes you on a fast-paced pursuit of justice that will have you holding your breath until the heart-stopping finish.My Review:Nikki Boyd lost her sister  when she was younger. No one ever found out her whereabouts and even recovered her body. Now many years later Nikki excels to do what‚Äôs right when someone is missing, after all its is her job. Being on the Missing Persons Task Force, she has seen many people go missing and most of the time she is able to help the families find their missing person. But one day when she is out climbing a mountain side, Nikki is called with and unusual case.The missing person is a teenage girl who went out to see the sunrise and never came back. But as the story unfolds, Nikki discovers they have an abduction on their hands. With everyone out scouting the area, she is unsure if they will ever find the girl. But as she gets closer and closer to the identity of the abductor, she discovers she may very well be next.Vendetta is book one in the Nikki Boyd Files. This book was an epic read all the way to the end. I can say I am excitedly awaiting the next book in this series. I really enjoyed this book and anyone who loves a good mystery will love this one for sure.**Disclosure** This book was sent to me free of charge for my honest review from Revell.

About the Book:Welcome to Monsterland ‚Äì the scariest place on Earth. All guests can interact with real vampires in Vampire Village, be chased by an actual werewolf on the River Run, and walk among the dead in Zombieville.Wyatt Baldwin, a high school student and life-long movie buff is staring bleakly at a future of flipping burgers.
