The Mask is extremely fast-paced, filled with multidimensional, complex characters, action packed, atmospheric, and the intertwining plot lines are written with an expert hand.  Stevens is indeed a master storyteller and for those who enjoy suspense thrillers, The Mask by Taylor Stevens is not to be missed.

In a Dark, Dark Wood by Ruth Ware is a book I was expecting to devour in one sitting and rather found myself not enjoying the book, however it helped passed the time.  Ware is a lovely writer and her story sounded as though it had such potential for a suspenseful psychological thriller and yet I just did not feel that as I read the story.  On the upside it is a rather fast read, if one accepts the odd choices at face value and slogs on.  Leonora a.k.a. Lee a.k.a. Nora, depending on whom is speaking to her is a recluse and a crime writer.  Leonora prefers to not leave her home unless absolutely necessary, and yet decides to accept an invite from a friend she has not spoken to for over a decade to spend the weekend with Clare in a rather secluded house with along with Flo, Nora, Nina, and Tom.  Even when Leonora makes her way to glass house in the woods she wonders why she accepted the Hen party invite, especially considering she was not invited to the actual wedding, and yet she goes.  After much chatting or complaining, this is open to interpretation, I found the whole group rather annoying, forty-eight hour pass and Lenore (Lee? Nora?) wakes in a hospital bed only knowing that she is alive and someone is dead and she must tease out the answer.  In my opinion In a Dark, Dark, Wood held the promise of a superb psychological thriller, however I never found the story line plausible, by the end of the book I think many fans of suspense thrillers will neither be surprised by the ending nor pleased by the ending.  In a Dark, Dark Wood holds a lot of promise and simply because I did not get out of it what I had hoped does not mean others will not enjoy this book immensely, my best advise is to ignore the book synopsis and read other reviews before deciding if this is the book for you.

Being of Czech decent, I was thrilled to be able to read Innocence; or Murder on Steep Street by Heda Margolius Kov√°ly a powerfully written novel, which nearly did not exist due to censorship.  Kov√°ly introduces the reader to the early days of Communist Czechoslovakia via life in Prague during the 1950s, a city filled with loyalist Party members, corruption, tyranny, and constant surveillance, for one could never know if a family member or a neighbor will turn them in, these are considered ‚Äúsmall terrors‚Äù.  Kov√°ly adds in a ‚Äúbig terror‚Äù with the case of a young boy murdered in a cinema and as the investigation unfolds, the lives of the female ushers come under intense scrutiny, each of whom harbors a secret of her own.  What one must remember throughout this fantastic book is that Kov√°ly is portraying history, life under a Communist regime, one must remember this is during the Cold War and written shortly after the 1948 Czechoslovak coup d'√©tat, which put the communists (KSƒå) into complete power.  If one goes into this book expecting a simple murder mystery, one will most likely be disappointed, as Kov√°ly is providing the reader insight into what it was like for average citizens during this very oppressive time in history.  Communism happens to be my area of expertise and Kov√°ly does not disappoint, rather she managed to craft together an exceptional atmospheric work of historical fiction and I am very grateful the censors did not destroy this historical literary masterpiece.  I would recommend Innocence; or Murder on Steep Street to readers who enjoy historical fiction.

Villa America by Liza Klaussmann is based on the actual home on the French Riviera used by Sara and Gerald Murphy as a refuge in the 1920s, the Murphy‚Äôs also happen to be the inspiration for Fitzgerald‚Äôs, Tender Is The Night, which is why I chose to read this book to begin with, I am quite a fan of Fitzgerald‚Äôs literary works.  Klaussmann has created a beautifully atmospheric novel set in the 1920s with a rather eclectic group of expats who appear to be carefree with their numerous parties and at least on the surface, their utterly carefree lifestyles.  However, underneath the opulence and apparent lack of concerns lies a group rife with secrets and flaws.  Villa America is a detailed exploration into the ‚Äúlost generation‚Äù and of the golden age of the 20s that was unable to last forever. Fortunately for the reader Klaussmann deftly portrays the lives of some very famous people, and for this reader, some of my favorite authors of the time period.  For readers not overly interested in the authors of this time period, this book may come off as more historical and slower paced.  I for one would have liked to have learned even more and felt the pacing of the story was quite masterfully done and well researched.  I would recommend Villa American to those who enjoy reading about ‚Äúthe lost generation‚Äù and the power couple who inspired authors and helped make the French Riviera the place for the rich and famous.

This may be the best book I have read thus far in 2015, and I have read some rather wonderful works of literature.  I Saw A Man by Owen Sheers is an expertly written work of literary fiction, and if that is not enough, Sheers expertly weaves together the stories and histories of two separate protagonists and the events, which bring them together in this absolutely brilliant book.  I happen to enjoy non-linear stories, for some it is a deal breaker, fair warning, Sheers‚Äô writing unfolds through going back and forth from one central tragic moment to slowly and deftly allowing the book unfold.  In I Saw A Man the readers meet Michael Turner who has recently relocated to London after the death of his wife Caroline, Michael soon becomes friendly with his neighbors Josh and Samantha Nelson and their two little girls, a family which on the surface reminds Michael of all he shall never have.  As Michael attempts to make sense of his wife‚Äôs death and put his life back together tragedy strikes, no spoilers here, which changes the lives of the central characters forever.  In one expertly crafted story, Sheers manages to reach down and tug the heartstrings of the reader drawing the reader deeper and deeper into the emotions of the story, many of which are rather unpleasant emotions, and yet so well written in such a beautiful prose, one cannot help but want to know what will happen next.  Personally I was unable to set this book down and I cannot imagine not recommending it to everyone.

Typically I would not choose to read a coming of age story, however there are usually some exceptions to my genre preferences and Sara Noviƒá‚Äòs Girl at War is the exception.  Due to be released 12 May 2015, I highly recommend this book be added to readers‚Äô lists. Noviƒá‚Äôs writing is richly detailed, atmospheric, intense, and exceptionally beautiful, especially considering some of the subject matter.  The reader is taken to Zagreb in the summer of 1991 and in introduced to 10-year-old Ana Juric, her family, and her best friend Luka.  Soon civil war breaks out across Yugoslavia and Ana is not spared from bearing witness to unspeakable horrors and tragedies, finding the strength to do what it takes to survive and find her way to New York where she must try to adapt from a child who has witnessed far more that what most people could imagine to being a ‚Äútypical‚Äù American student.  Ana‚Äôs past is constantly with her, this is most evident when she speaks to her American friends, for whom she alters what she says about her childhood and her home.  Finally Ana makes the decision to return to Croatia to encounter her past in order for her to be able to move forward.  Girl At War is a book that is not to be missed; Noviƒá has captured the essence of a girl who came of age in the midst of a civil war, who survived, but at what cost to herself.  Highly charged and atmospheric, Noviƒá‚Äòs gentle yet beautiful prose captures the reader from the very beginning and does not let go.  I cannot praise this book highly enough and recommend it to all readers.

The Rose Hotel: A Memoir of Secrets, Loss, and Love From Iran to America by Rahimeh Andalibian is an exceptionally beautiful memoir and which captures all of the minute details of life alongside the overpowering events and shows how family is shaped, the bonds forged out of pain, grief, struggles, and well as immense love and forgiveness.  In Andalibian‚Äôs memoir she tries to make sense of her father avenging a rape as well as dealing with her brother being accused of murder, and in her journey to make sense of these two brutal acts, Andalibian takes the reader back through her life which began in Mashhad, Iran, as she and her brothers spend their youth living in the Rose Hotel, then the revolution in 1979 which eventually forces the family to relocate to one-room flat in London, and eventually to California, where the family quickly learns one cannot out run one‚Äôs troubles.  The Rose Hotel is deeply atmospheric and the reader is transported into the life of this family and it is quite easy to become lost in Andalibian‚Äôs life and struggles.  I read the book in one siting and find myself now still reflecting on what I have read.  I would not hesitate to recommend The Rose Hotel to al readers who enjoy memoirs, literary fiction, and especially to book discussion groups.

I‚Äôd Walk With My Friends If I Could Find Them by Jesse Goolsby is literary work of astonishing depth and beauty, and yet one that is deeply heart-wrenchingly sad and at the same time hopeful.  The story surrounds the lives of three American soldiers, Wintric, Dax, and Torres, each of whom struggles in their own ways, and while each man‚Äôs story is told, the book focuses most on the struggles that occur after the men‚Äôs deployments in Afghanistan.  What I really enjoyed and some readers may not enjoy as much as I, is how Goolsby tells the three men‚Äôs stories in a non linear manner, I felt this brought the story to life and made the characters all the more realistic.  I‚Äôd Walk With My Friends If I Could Find Them reads a lot like a memoir and yet it is a work of gut-wrenching literary fiction.  Goolsby‚Äôs has crafted a beautifully written and eloquent debut and one I would recommend to those who enjoy well-written fiction as well as those who are in book discussion groups.

Ghost Fleet by P.W. Singer and August Cole is a detailed techno-thriller about an imaginary, yet plausible look into what a near future war would be from several perspectives, each which aid in not only developing a suspense filled plot, but also in enabling the reader insight into those involved or affected by such a global war.  In Ghost Fleet a new form of the cold war starts up but this time outer space and cyber space are also included alongside the more traditional land, sea, and air forms of fighting used in previous wars.  From advanced drone strikes, cyber-warfare, teenaged hackers, and the old naval warships named the ‚Äúghost fleet‚Äù, tensions run high as the United States is attacked by China, leaving the US to struggle to combine  ‚Äúlow tech‚Äù veteran insurgents with modern day and futuristic technologies on both sides of the war.  While I am not typically a fan of sci-fi novels, Ghost Fleet shows just how plausible and not too far off this sort of fighting could indeed be, which made this book more of an action packed thriller for me than a sci-fi thriller.  I personally look forward to reading more works by authors P.W. Singer and August Cole, both of whom are leading experts on cutting edge national security, a topic I do enjoy reading and as an added bonus their combined expertise makes Ghost Fleet read as though this scenario is far closer than one may imagine.

Not set to be release until 15 September 2015, Did you Ever Have A Family by Bill Clegg is definitely a book to add to any reading list.  Did You Ever Have A Family is a story about family, those we are born into and those we create, and the celebration of life and family while beginning with a tragedy.  Clegg‚Äôs fictional debut is expertly written, filled with depth of characters, deep and expansive emotions, and is told from various viewpoints which adds to the beautiful structure and depth of this book.  The night before June Reid‚Äôs daughter is to be married a horrific tragedy unfolds taking the lives of everyone in June‚Äôs family, except June.  While June‚Äôs small community in Connecticut attempts to come to terms with the devastating loss to their community, June begins her journey alone and directionless driving heartbroken across the country until she settles in at motel on the Pacific Ocean, where June falls into a state of mere existence, and yet the after affects of so many dead in such a horrific manner causes ripple effects which lead to secrets becoming unburied, truths being discovered, and slowly life returns as a wonderful and eclectic cast of characters find solace.  Did You Ever Have A Family is a beautiful story of family, love, hope, and a view of humanity at its finest.  I highly recommend Did You Ever Have A Family to anyone who enjoys well-written works of fiction and anyone in a book discussion group.

Revenge of the Kremlin by G√©rard de Villiers is a tightly woven story of suspense and espionage surrounding the suspicious death of exiled oligarch Boris Berezovsky.  MI-5 opens the case after it is believed Berezovsky‚Äôs death was not a suicide, however no sooner does MI-5 begin poking around when PM Cameron shuts down the official investigation, an act which alarms the CIA, as the fear of old KGB tactics and the new and closer ties between Britain and Russia are formed.  The CIA sends Malko Linge to investigate not only Berezovsky‚Äôs death but also the alleged cover-up to his death and to search for any involvement the Kremlin may have had in the entire affair.  G√©rard de Villiers has crafted a taught and action packed book filled with espionage, distrust, assassins, government official and agencies including; Putin, PM Cameron, Mossad, the CIA, MI-5, and the American government, no one is free from scrutiny.  Revenge of the Kremlin immediately draws the reader into the ever evolving and twisting plot of murder, mystery, intrigue, agencies distrusting other agencies, countries distrusting each other, and loyalties being tested.  I thoroughly enjoyed reading this book and admit I literally read it from cover to cover.  I highly recommend G√©rard de Villiers‚Äô Revenge of the Kremlin to all who enjoy books about espionage and suspense and look forward to reading more translated works by this masterful French author.

Due to be released on 26 May, 2015, Secrets of the State by Matthew Palmer is an intense suspense thriller that will take the reader on a taut journey to the brink of war between India and Pakistan, this is a must read for all who enjoy suspense thrillers.  Sam Trainor was the top South Asia expert in the State Department‚Äôs Bureau of Intelligence & Research, but has decided to work outside the government for a Beltway Bandit consulting firm, twice the pay for the same work, at Argus Systems, which will allow him more freedom and he will still be proving key intel to the federal government.  It does not take Sam long to discover the vast differences in motivations between the public and private sector, and while trying to adjust he stumbles across intel that could not possibly be true, but could be catastrophic to the delicate balance between India and Pakistan.  The more Sam digs into the phony intel the more dangerous the situation becomes.  Palmer is quite gifted at crafting political suspense thrillers and Secrets of the State just well may be my favorite to date.  Secrets of the State is superbly written, the plot lines are well constructed and intertwine in unexpected ways, which keeps the reader eagerly turning the pages, his characters are well defined and the story is atmospheric enough for the reader to feel as though they are there with Sam.  Palmer‚Äôs knowledge of international relations and politics creates for a wonderful and realistic story as well as a taut suspenseful thriller and one I highly recommend to readers who enjoy this genre.

Migratory Animals is a beautiful and profound debut by Mary Helen Specht whose own life may or may not be mirrored in the main character Flannery.  Flannery has been studying in Nigeria when she finds out her sister Molly has been diagnosed with Huntington's Disease, the same disease that killed their mother, and so she makes the difficult decision to leave the research she loves and her fianc√© and return to Austin, Texas, to help Molly.  Through beautiful prose Specht brings the readers into the lives of Flan and Molly and their close knit group of friends and the struggles and rather serious life changing decisions that must be made by these 30-something women.  While older than the women depicted in this group, I did not have difficulty identifying with each of them or their various problems, each trying to find their own footing in the world.  Migratory Animals is brilliantly told through shifting viewpoints allowing the reader to become fully immersed in the characters lives, so much so that when the book ended I still wanted to know more.  Migratory Animals is an exceptional debut about what one owes to not only oneself, but also one's family, of finding out where one belongs, were one calls home.  Migratory Animals would be an excellent book discussion group choice.

When the Doves Disappeared is an exceptional work of literary and historical fiction by Finnish-Estonian author Sofi Oksanen.  While the book covers topics of tragedy, treachery, occupation, and resistance, it also offers up hope, love, and honor, all of which is covered in Oksanen‚Äôs beautiful prose.  On a personal level, I enjoyed this book not only for the well-crafted storylines, but also because Soviet foreign policy is my area of expertise.  The book takes place in communist controlled Estonia in 1941 and 1963.  In 1941 we meet Roland and Edgar, both fleeing the Red Army, and Roland goes into hiding while his cousin Edgar abandons his wife Juudit and becomes a loyal supporter of the Nazi regime.  Moving forward to 1963, Estonia is firmly under Soviet control and Edgar has shifted alliance to become a Soviet apparatchik, however will his secrets stay safe as long as Roland and Juudit do not uncover the truth?  While this may sound confusing, or at least crammed with information, it is best not to give to much away, I prefer books to unfold as the author intended and When the Doves Disappeared is definitely one where a little information is all that is needed.  Oksanen is a masterful storyteller and her deft writing and detailed historical accounts make this an excellent work of deception and heroism in the worst of circumstances.  The three main characters tie the storylines together and bring these crucial moments in Estonian history to light, through three completely different viewpoints, which intertwine deftly to show the humanistic viewpoints of the collaboration in Eastern Europe.  I would recommend When the Doves Disappeared to those who enjoy historical fiction and beautiful works of literature.

Due to be released 14 April 2015, Where They Found Her by Kimberly McCreight is a book to be added to the lists of readers who enjoy taught psychological suspense.  The story takes place in Ridgedale, New Jersey, where at the end of a long winter the body of an infant is discovered in the woods near the town‚Äôs prestigious college, and while the identity of the baby is unknown, there are a lot of opinions flying around.  McCreight tells her story through the eyes of freelance journalist Molly Anderson, who recently lost her own baby and is struggling with depression, Sandy who dropped out of high school and is searching for her missing mother, and Barbara the PTA president whose son is suddenly having difficulties, in addition we also have the psychiatric notes and a diary for additional information.  Molly unearths some of the town‚Äôs deepest and darkest secrets, some dating back two decades, and as Molly, Barbara, and Sandy continue to tell their stories the more the three lives become intertwined in this wonderfully executed tense psychological suspense novel.  Where They Found Her is well planned out, the storylines are probable and the numerous characters tend to hit all the major emotions for the reader from compassion to utter disdain and they mystery surrounding the infant is quite intriguing.  I truly enjoyed the book and think others who enjoy psychological thrillers and buried secrets come to light will enjoy Where They Found Her.

A Dangerous Place by Jacqueline Winspear is the eleventh book in her Maisie Dobbs series, and also, in my opinion, the most different from the others.  Yes there is a mystery and plenty of historical fiction, however the reader learns more about Maisie and the inner turmoil she is going through in this book.  It has been four years since Maisie has left England and she longs to head back to India for solitude and healing peace when she is summoned back to England by her stepmother.  While Maisie is on a ship headed back to England and her aging father, she realizes she is not at all ready to return and ignoring all warnings disembarks early in Gibraltar.  Gibraltar in 1937 is filled with refugees escaping the Spanish Civil War and things are not just dangerous in Spain, as Maisie quickly discovers as she becomes apart of a murder investigation of Sebastian Babayoff, an investigation that catches the eye of the British Secret Service, all the while Maisie herself, much like Gibraltar, is at a dangerous crossroads.  Having enjoyed previous Maisie Dobbs books, I must say this one is my favorite.  I liked the deep political and historical details, the new characters, and the very serious decisions that weigh heavily on Maisie.  Winspear, in my opinion, has outdone herself with providing historical and political background, as well as creating an intense atmosphere, adding fabulous supporting cast members and reminding the readers just how far Maisie has come and what is has cost her to do so.  For those new to the series or long time fans, I highly recommend A Dangerous Place.

The Omron's Alvita Ultimate Pedometer (HJ-325), is small, lightweight, and fits into a protective holder to clip on, can be used with the optional strap, or can be slipped into a pocket or bag.  I have used Omron‚Äôs products in the past and the quality is what I expect from Omron.  Right out of the package it is extremely easy to set up, and then all that is left is to track one‚Äôs movements.  The Omron Alvita Ultimate Pedometer keeps track of steps every 12 hours and differentiates between walking steps and aerobic steps, a function I truly appreciate.  The device allows the user to press one button to display steps, aerobic steps, distance walked and calories burned.  As an added bonus this pedometer stores a week‚Äôs worth of data for a quick look to see how one progressed over the week.  The display monitor is quite easy to read, the instruction manual is short and to the point, and within 5 minutes of opening the box I was set.  I would highly recommend the Omron HJ325 Alvita Ultimate Pedometer for those who like to add cardio in during their day and also want to count their walking, as it truly does an excellent job at determining which is which.  I have used the pedometer for a week straight and it has been spot on for my distance.  All in all I am quite happy with this product.

Happiness for Beginners by Katherine Center is a deeply engaging, atmospheric, and character driven book centered around thirty-two year old divorcee Helen Carpenter who has been talked into signing up for a wilderness survival course in Wyoming, by her younger brother, in what is supposed to be an outside the box chance to pull her life back together.  However, Helen is faced with more than she originally bargains for, the first of which is her brother‚Äôs roommate, Jake, has also signed up for the survival course and begs a ride to Wyoming with Helen.  Center does a superb job and writing each of her characters, they are well thought out and quite easy to relate to.  In addition, having personally lived in Wyoming, I loved the descriptions and found them to be rather accurate and had little difficulty imaging the remote wilderness of the mountain range, and felt quite nostalgic; the mountains in Wyoming are indeed beautiful.  Center‚Äôs main plot for finding happiness again is a unique one and it works beautifully with the other characters in this well crafted story.  Happiness for beginners teaches some valuable lessons about happiness and just how happiness can be obtained, yet not in a self-help sort of manner, but rather through well developed characters and plot lines.  I would not hesitate to recommend Happiness for Beginners to anyone who enjoys well-written works of literary fiction and to book discussion groups.

Before I Go by Colleen Oakley is a deeply poignant debut which reminds readers that life is not only short, but precious, and we should let those around us know just how much they mean to us before it is too late.  Daisy is twenty-seven years old and approaching her three-year ‚ÄúCancerversary‚Äù when she is dealt with a devastating blow, her cancer has returned and has spread; she has approximately six months to live.  Whilst it is difficult to know what one would do if one was given a death sentence, I am not certain Daisy‚Äôs choice would be mine, then again, thankfully I am not in Daisy‚Äôs position.  Daisy has decided her husband cannot care for himself properly and she makes it her mission to find a suitable wife for Jack after she is gone.  Oakley has taken a very depressing topic and created an interesting, and yes, melancholy debut novel that easily kept this reader‚Äôs attention.  I found Daisy‚Äôs obsession with finding her husband a new wife deeply depressing, and while the book synopsis, in my opinion, gives way too much of the story away, I shall not.  Needless to say, things do not go as Jake or Daisy plan and Oakley deftly weaves together a beautiful, at times heart-wrenching tale of a family trying to come to terms with a terminal diagnosis.  Before I Go is a beautiful story and a perfect choice for book discussion groups as there is a wealth of information to be discussed and debated.  I highly recommend Before I Go to book discussion groups and those who enjoy works of literary fiction.

Signature Kill by David Levien in the fourth in his Frank Behr series and the first I have read, but it will not be my last, as I plan start the series from the beginning, nothing is better than discovering a new masterful suspense/thriller author.  Frank Behr is down on his luck and close to broke, and is working a no-win missing persons case when a young women is discovered murdered and hideously arranged on a side street in Indianapolis.  Behr believes the two cases may be connected, however he has almost no friends left on the police force he was once apart of.  As the body count increases, it is clear there is a serial killer on the loose and Behr relentlessly pursues the cases, but this time his greatest strength could prove devastating.  Levien has crafted a powerful suspense thriller with a strong plot and unexpected twists and turns.  His main character is well drawn out and while I could not put the book down, I kept wishing I had read the previous books; I personally wanted more insight into Behr‚Äôs life.  Signature Kill definitely can be read as a standalone, I think the reader would benefit even more from reading the previous books, however Levien‚Äôs writing style and deeply suspenseful atmosphere with unexpected twists will keep readers new to his works riveted to the story.  I highly recommend Signature Kill to readers who enjoy exceptional suspense thrillers.

Compulsion by Allison Brennan is the second book in her Max Revere series and in my opinion even better than the first book, Notorious, which I enjoyed.  I typically shy away from romantic suspense novels as many tend to lean more toward the romance side, a genre I personally do not care for, however, I have not found this a problem in the Max Revere series, Brennan has a wonderful balance and creates an atmosphere of suspense that kept me fully engaged throughout the book.  Compulsion is centered on a missing persons case Max has been investigating which leads her to, Adam Bachman a psychopath who is on trial for five New York City Murders, however Max is convinced, there are more victims still unaccounted for.  Max is allowed a pre-trial interview with Bachman, which only makes her even more certain that Bachman, is responsible for a missing retired couple and he is not working alone.  Unfortunately, Max does not have any real evidence and the Distract Attorney wants nothing to do with Max‚Äôs theory, so in true Max form she intends to dissect Bachman‚Äôs past to find the truth, a path, which is far deadlier than Max can fathom, and one that could very well lead her straight to a meticulous sociopath.  Compulsion is a fast paced suspense thriller that will keep the reader guessing and turning the pages long into the night.  The characters are fairly well developed and hopefully will keep developing as the series progresses, and while Max rubbed me the wrong way in the first book, Notorious, I have come to appreciate this no nonsense lady in a way I did not think I would.  The plot lines twist and turn and intersect in delightfully unexpected ways, which helps to keep the suspense ratcheted up.  I will definitely be waiting for more books by Allison Brennan.  I would recommend Compulsion to anyone who enjoys romantic suspense and suspense novels.

This is a fun holiday *Santa* *Saint Nicholas*  book written at a grade school level.The reindeer are hungry. The sled is super full. The night is incredibly foggy. Will the presents get delivered on time?***This early reader is suitable to be read to/with younger/less advanced readers or aloud to a group for extra special holiday fun :) *recipe included*

This series must be read in order. The first book is Runes. This is the second book. I can't wait to read the next book and find out what happens next!Raine has gotten her father back and Torin. Only there seems to be something off with her father... Something he is hiding from her and not her mother. Something off. Torin brought her father back to her which had to be the best gift ever... Too bad Torin doesn't remember her, them or anything at all else related to their time together. How will she get him to remember her? Is it even possible? Or will she spend her whole Immortal life pining after her true love while he thinks she is some kind of crazy stalker pathetic Mortal? Will anything in her life go right ever? Will she be able to keep the people she loves safe? Or should she just give up, accept defeat and become a Norn? How will she ever make the right decisions without all the facts?Torin is lost. He feels like many things are familiar and yet he has no clue as to why. He feels both drawn to and repulsed by Lorraine Cooper and her odd antics. Why is she under his skin? How can one Mortal girl have such an effect on him? Why is everyone around him handling him with kid gloves? What does everyone else know that he doesn't? Will he ever figure out what he is missing? Or who he can trust?*** This series is suitable for mature young adult through adult readers who enjoy a little romance in their paranormal fantasy coming of age action adventure mysteries with starring roles by the Old Gods and a whimsical take on their mythos :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book. I can't wait to find out what is next for Raine in Immortals!Raine misses her father. He has been missing for months. She is starting to lose hope he will ever come home. Her mother swears he is alive. How can she be so certain? Who is the mysterious new neighbor Torin and what does he want with her? Why does she feel like she is being watched? Why is she seeing things noone else does?Torin is drawn to Raine in an undeniable and inexplicable manner that baffles him as much as it consumes his every waking moment. Why is she different than any other girl he has ever met? Why can't he just ignore her like all the others?***This series is suitable for mature young adult through adult readers who enjoy a little romance in their paranormal fantasy coming of age action adventure mysteries with starring roles by the Old Gods and a whimsical take on their mythos :)

Ardent (The ArcKnight Chronicles #1)Fated To BeThis series must be read in order. This is the first book. I can't wait to read the next book MarkTier!Lily has trusted the wrong person her whole life. Elise stole her Ardent Talisman which led to her banishment from the ArcKnight pack. Alone and desperate after barely escaping something nefarious by some skeevy guy she is almost eager to accept help from a MarkTier soldier. Can she really trust him? Why would he help her?Ephram is the second Prince of the MarkTier pack and has been looking for Lily since they were betrothed as children. In his mind at least he has vowed she is the only one for him. He will do anything to help her no matter the cost. Will they find the woman who betrayed her? Will they get her Talisman back? Will she ever feel for him the way he feels for her?MarkTier (The ArcKnight Chronicles #2)Cursed BloodlineThis series must be read in order. The first book is Ardent. This is the second book. I can't wait to read Enmity to discover the next new twist in this amazing series!Exiled for LIFE... How do you even begin to deal with that? Forbidden to marry... And finally in love. Lilliana used to be a pampered but ignored second Princess but all that changed the minute she was betrayed by her closest friend. Now she is banished to Temple and working as a waitress. Will she ever find her place in the world? Will she and Ephrem find a way to mate in defiance of their packs? Or will they be engaged forever and in Limbo?Raphaela is unhappy. She is Queen but she has lost her sister. Her King Gil is cruel and petulant leaving all the real work of governing to her and Alec. What kind of Alpha does nothing for the good of the Pack? How could he  take her so for granted? Why can't he be like Alec? How will she survive without an ounce of love?***This series is suitable for adult readers who like a little twisted prophecy in their modern paranormal fantasy with a dash of romance and loads of intrigue, suspense &mysteries around every corner :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book. I can't wait to read more!Allie is a practical girl. She works hard and tries to make her Mama proud. Receiving a letter about a mysterious inheritance has her on a plane and on her way to find out the truth. Why did Ava leave her anything when she is a total stranger? Why is she having strange dream where she seems to be someone else? Someone she has never seen before? Is this some elaborate hoax? Why is she drawn to the gardener of all people? Is the house truly haunted by a malevolent spirit?This story has all the classic hallmarks of a Gothic romance only completely modernized! Vengeful Spirits, curses spanning the ages and star crossed lovers destined to die and do it all over again... What more could you ask for? Modern Gothic is hopefully here to stay!***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little horror in their Gothic paranormal romances with plenty of mysteries, ghosts, intrigue, action, adventure and snarktastic humor :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Lana Elkins is THE Cyber Security Expert. She can stop just about any threat. When the whole US power grid is taken out she is scrambling to get to the bottom of the attack. Where did it come from? Who is behind it? Will they be able to stop further attacks? Is America doomed?***This series is suitable for mature young adult through adult readers who enjoy Cyber thrillers and horrific worst case scenarios in their modern warfare race against the clock to avert an all out apocalypse :)

This book is the first in a series I fervently hope! I can't imagine leaving this world or the characters anytime soon... I will definitely read any fiction this author writes :)Moira is a very gifted empath... Just not in the traditional ways. She hides most of her gifts for her own protection. Too bad her gifts did not save her from her master's abuse. Awaiting execution for murdering him has weakened her to the point she would almost welcome death. Luckily the Elite have a problem they think she will be helpful in clearing up. The Pheonix has been persuading people to kill themselves or others. An empath serial killer cannot be allowed to decimate the Elite. Will Moira find the Pheonix? Or will she take an opportunity to run again? Why does Detective Keenan Edwards get under her skin so easily? Will they solve the case or kill each other?***This book is suitable for adult readers who enjoy historical paranormal romance in dystopian societies filled with intrigue, horror, mysteries, and sarcastic humor amid all the action,suspense, thrills and skullduggery :)

This series must be read in order. The first book is Blood And Bone. The second book is Sin And Swoon. This is the third and final book. I can't wait to read whatever she writes next!Jane is on the mindrun from hell. Forced to look inside her traitorous partner's twisted brain for the true breadth of his treason and treachery. The lines blur and everything mixes into an unrecognisable mess impossible to sort fact from fiction. Bound by her code of honor and thirst for revenge she must sort fact from fiction and reality from fantasy to find not only the truth but the lies. Will she succeed at wrapping this all up neatly? Or will she lose herself for good? Will Rory destroy her sense of self  and blow up what is meant to be her happy ending? Can she even be a real girl? Or will she always be the monster she keeps hidden inside?This was totally the biggest mindfrak of a book(and series) I have ever read! I LOVED it from beginning to end :) Personally I believe Tara Brown to be the Queen Of Mindfrak and I adore being her willing victim! As long as she is writing I will be reading... hehe.***This series is suitable for adult readers of the nonsqueemish variety who enjoy a good dollop of graphic horror in their sci-fi thriller suspense mystery action adventures with ruthless special soldiers and a dash or two of unconventional and obsessive romance :)

This series must must be read in order!!! I cannot stress that enough! The first book is Blood And Bone. This is the second book.Jane is a mindrunner. She finds the secrets you want to hide... Or are to broken to tell. Either way, once within your mind, none of your secrets are safe from her. No one has ever run more people than she has. No one has ever even tried. But she is engaged now and he put in for a transfer to a nice "safe" profiling job with the UN... Is she doing the right thing? It is not possible for her to continue within her job without going insane... right? Is she even sane now?Filled with even more plot twists than the first this book keeps you on the edge of your seat guessing and breathless! Never have I ever found a reading experience like this and I will probably cry when it is over! I want the next book like yesterday and am sure this series will be one that I read over and over hehe :)***This series is suitable for adult scifi romance lovers who don't mind horror and thriller suspense being the real heart of the book:)

This is a stand alone novel. I can't wait to read more amazing romantic comedies by this talented author!Melanie is the perfect daughter. She has been taking care of her sister and father ever since her mother ran off 20 years ago. She does it partly because they are family, partly because she wants to and because she never saw any other way. Someone had to do it and it fell to her. She goes to church and helps the community and fosters abused and abandoned dogs until they can be adopted. She has a full life... Mostly. She even writes to a convicted murderer just to improve his life and give him hope... After all there is always hope. Afraid of being hurt she never much had time for romance. The closest thing she has to a beau is a widower with an amazing daughter she befriended. At least he's safe... He NEEDS her! Too bad she is having so much trouble finding a carpenter to hire for the renovations of her father's grocery store. Will she ever let anyone in? Can she ever trust enough to love someone?Kane was freed after serving almost 3 years for a crime he didn't commit. He only got through everything because of Melanie's letters. At a loss for what to do with himself and wanting a fresh start he decided to go thank her for all she did for him. He also hoped she would help him get that fresh start in the town she made seem so ideal. Will he ever come to terms with his true feelings for her? Will he be able to accept he is worthy and give love a chance? Will they learn to let go of the past and heal enough to love truly and find happiness?***This book is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a bit of mistaken identity in their contemporary romantic comedies with chic lit leanings full of forgiveness, hope and HEA :)

This is a stand alone novel.Malachi is a wolverine shifter who was raised by a human man. He had to fend for himself alot (especially as his father got drunk and accidentally killed himself giving rise to rumors of patricide) and left town a pariah. Now he is about to leave town again (for real this time) when he sees a flurry of feathers that turns into a beautiful (naked) blond woman. He can't help himself. He feels the need to help her. Will she be okay? Will he ever figure out what happened to her? Is she reason enough to stay for good?***This book is suitable for adult readers who enjoy ancient myths come to life in their modern fantasy paranormal romance with tons of mystery and thrilling adventures :)

This series must be read in order. The first book is Ardent. This is the second book. I can't wait to read Enmity to discover the next new twist in this amazing series!Exiled for LIFE... How do you even begin to deal with that? Forbidden to marry... And finally in love. Lilliana used to be a pampered but ignored second Princess but all that changed the minute she was betrayed by her closest friend. Now she is banished to Temple and working as a waitress. Will she ever find her place in the world? Will she and Ephrem find a way to mate in defiance of their packs? Or will they be engaged forever and in Limbo?Raphaela is unhappy. She is Queen but she has lost her sister. Her King Gil is cruel and petulant leaving all the real work of governing to her and Alec. What kind of Alpha does nothing for the good of the Pack? How could he  take her so for granted? Why can't he be like Alec? How will she survive without an ounce of love?***This series is suitable for adult readers who like a little twisted prophecy in their modern paranormal fantasy with a dash of romance and loads of intrigue, suspense &mysteries around every corner :)

Ardent (The ArcKnight Chronicles #1)Fated To BeThis series must be read in order. This is the first book. I can't wait to read the next book MarkTier!Lily has trusted the wrong person her whole life. Elise stole her Ardent Talisman which led to her banishment from the ArcKnight pack. Alone and desperate after barely escaping something nefarious by some skeevy guy she is almost eager to accept help from a MarkTier soldier. Can she really trust him? Why would he help her?Ephram is the second Prince of the MarkTier pack and has been looking for Lily since they were betrothed as children. In his mind at least he has vowed she is the only one for him. He will do anything to help her no matter the cost. Will they find the woman who betrayed her? Will they get her Talisman back? Will she ever feel for him the way he feels for her?MarkTier (The ArcKnight Chronicles #2)Cursed BloodlineThis series must be read in order. The first book is Ardent. This is the second book. I can't wait to read Enmity to discover the next new twist in this amazing series!Exiled for LIFE... How do you even begin to deal with that? Forbidden to marry... And finally in love. Lilliana used to be a pampered but ignored second Princess but all that changed the minute she was betrayed by her closest friend. Now she is banished to Temple and working as a waitress. Will she ever find her place in the world? Will she and Ephrem find a way to mate in defiance of their packs? Or will they be engaged forever and in Limbo?Raphaela is unhappy. She is Queen but she has lost her sister. Her King Gil is cruel and petulant leaving all the real work of governing to her and Alec. What kind of Alpha does nothing for the good of the Pack? How could he  take her so for granted? Why can't he be like Alec? How will she survive without an ounce of love?***This series is suitable for adult readers who like a little twisted prophecy in their modern paranormal fantasy with a dash of romance and loads of intrigue, suspense &mysteries around every corner :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book. I can't wait to read the next book MarkTier!Lily has trusted the wrong person her whole life. Elise stole her Ardent Talisman which led to her banishment from the ArcKnight pack. Alone and desperate after barely escaping something nefarious by some skeevy guy she is almost eager to accept help from a MarkTier soldier. Can she really trust him? Why would he help her?Ephram is the second Prince of the MarkTier pack and has been looking for Lily since they were betrothed as children. In his mind at least he has vowed she is the only one for him. He will do anything to help her no matter the cost. Will they find the woman who betrayed her? Will they get her Talisman back? Will she ever feel for him the way he feels for her?***This series is suitable for adult readers who like a little twisted prophecy in their modern paranormal fantasy with a dash or romance and loads of intrigue, suspense &mysteries around every corner :)

This series must be read in order. The first book is Stormrise. The second book is Stormrage. The third book is Stormwind. The fourth book is Shadowstorm. This is the fifth book. I can't wait for Storm to come out so I can find out what happens next!Becoming a Federal Agent is a learning experience for Raven. She is not quite ready to deal with it but what other choice is there? She misses home. She misses Levac. At least she has Aspen. King is always evading her questions but at least he pretty much lets her do what she wants. Except he has assigned her a new partner... A new Lycan named Kole. How will she deal with babysitting a werewolf who is so new to the supernatural world? It will be worse than when Levac was just starting to see what he shouldn't! Will they figure out what is going on early enough for her to meet Aspen in Chicago for Halloween? Or will her green new partner get them both killed trying to follow human rules and human laws? Why does it seem like they are trapped in a cheesy horror movie come to life?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little romance in their urban paranormal action adventure crime mystery fantasies  with lots of thrills and a dash or two of horror :)‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ NOT for the closed minded or homophobic!!! ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢

This item did not work. I noticed no beneficial effects at all. I have used many different brands of valerian and had carrying degrees of effectiveness. This brand had no effect whatsoever. Buy another brand. Do not waste your money!

This seems to be a stand alone novel. I look forward to reading more books by this author.The narration was skillfully done and highly amusing! I really enjoyed it :) I am sure that a lot of my enjoyment of this book was due to the narrator's portrayal of the individual characters and situations. I would definitely be interested in more Audible Editions featuring this talented narrator!Tammy is a Tyree. That means no one thinks much of her. Her family's reputation is enough to keep her down for the most part. Between taking care of her Autistic brother and dealing with all of her Uncle E's crazy schemes it is a wonder she has time to hold a job ... Much less a couple.  Working at Two Spoons gives her access to email. Learning of an inheritance through her email both excites her and causes her trepidation. How will she come up with $500 for the fees? Will she be found worthy by Dr. Barinas? Or will she lose her inheritance to some less worthy relative?***This book is a cozy and suitable for young adult through adult readers who enjoy a little travesty in their cozy mysteries with a dash of romance and a bit of injustice :) I HIGHLY recommend the Audible Edition as it is an engaging and unique way to enjoy this particular novel!

This series must be read in order. The first book is Under Different Stars. This is the second book. I can't wait to find out what happens in the third and final book Darken The Stars!Kricket, Trey and her other Cavars have barely escaped the last crisis with their lives. A floating military fortess should be the safest place on Ethar... But treachery has no boundaries. Either worshiped, coveted or reviled everyone seems to have an opinion about Kricket and an idea on how to use her. Will she ever be free to live her life as she wishes? Or will she always be a piece in a game she has no desire to play? Can she prevent the disasters of the future? Or is she destined to always be Fate's Fool constantly trying to do damage control?***This series is suitable for mature young adult through adult readers who enjoy a little Destiny and horror in their apocalyptic alien sci-fi new adult paranormal dark fantasy action adventure romances with loads of intrigue and a heroine who will not give up no matter what :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book. I can't wait to read Born Of Treasure to find out what happens next!Clark is a Treasure. His mother is a Tarnished Silver. These two things should not be. The Treasures are the most well known and well loved and wealthiest of families. Even a bastard Treasure should be safe from everyone and everything. Will the true Treasures accept Clark? Or will they cast him aside? Can they keep him safe from the military that killed his mother?  Will his powers be his downfall?***This series is suitable for mature young adult through adult readers who enjoy a little sci-fi in their paranormal western steampunk fantasy action adventure suspense thrillers with a dash of romance and a smidge or two of horror :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book. I can't wait to find out what is next for Noa&James in the next book!!!Noa came home to visit her baby brother Kenji... Unfortunately she ended up in a concentration/forced work camp instead of spending quality time with her favorite sibling. She thought life was at its all time low when her husband was murdered. Too bad she was wrong. Knowing she must escape and rescue her brother is the only thing that keeps her going. Why has her homework devolved into Nazi like persecution and insane antitechnology religious zealotry? Why are they railing about heretics and demons as well as aliens? What caused this horrific mix of violence and genocide?James woke on the planet with no clear idea of how he got there or what transpired before that. All he knows is he has a driving urge to find Noa and save her from those who would harm her. His past is fuzzy and unreal. Why does he feel an overwhelming desire to gain her trust? Why is he always seeing black whenever it seems like something will end her? Will they escape with their lives and sanity intact? Will they be able to find a way off planet to expose the atrocities of the camps?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little first contact in their futuristic dystopian sci-fi fantasy action adventures with a dash of romance and a heavy serving of horror :)***I received an ARC in exchange for an honest review***

–∞∞ As I read more stories I will update this review ¬∞¬∞¬∞In Too Deep (Others of Edenton Book 1)Running Into DestinyThis series must be read in order. The first book is New Beginnings. This is the second book. I can't wait to read the next one!Fallon is done with men. She is going to drive until she can't drive anymore an then sort out what she is going to do once she has had some sleep. Or at least that WAS the plan until a gorgeous werewolf plowed straight into her on her bike. What is he running from. Is he going to be okay? Will her bike?Brody has been in mourning for his dead wife Sarah for over four yers. No matter how many women chase him. He just isn't  ready to move on. Running from two vampires causes him to crash into a bike. Why is he so drawn to the redhead whose bike he totalled? How is she okay after the accident?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little horror in their paranormal modern fantsy romances with plenty of action, thrills and suspense :)Ardent (The ArcKnight Chronicles #1)Fated To BeThis series must be read in order. This is the first book. I can't wait to read the next book MarkTier!Lily has trusted the wrong person her whole life. Elise stole her Ardent Talisman which led to her banishment from the ArcKnight pack. Alone and desperate after barely escaping something nefarious by some skeevy guy she is almost eager to accept help from a MarkTier soldier. Can she really trust him? Why would he help her?Ephram is the second Prince of the MarkTier pack and has been looking for Lily since they were betrothed as children. In his mind at least he has vowed she is the only one for him. He will do anything to help her no matter the cost. Will they find the woman who betrayed her? Will they get her Talisman back? Will she ever feel for him the way he feels for her?***This series is suitable for adult readers who like a little twisted prophecy in their modern paranormal fantasy with a dash or romance and loads of intrigue, suspense &mysteries around every corner :)

This series must be read  in order. The first book is Cinderella Had It Easy. This is the second book.Tess has always been interested in world renowned photogrpher Parker but she does not have the confidence to speak to him.  After all why would he give a Plain Jane like her a second glance after all th gorgeous models she sends his way? There is no way she can compete! At Girl's Night she and her three best friends make a wish on a magical locket for the confidence they need and the looks thy wish they had... Cinderella bodies for them all from Midnight to Midnight because they deserve it! Will the magic work for them? Will her Prince Charming finally notice her?*** This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy  little magic in their beach read length chic lit romances :)

***I recieved a free copy in exchange for an HONEST review******This anthology is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little mayhem and humor in their modern fantasy¬ß¬ß¬ß I will add to this review as I read more books ¬ß¬ß¬ßAtomic by: C. Gockel (A Loki Novella)Sigyn does not understand her exhusband Loki. He drinks too much and refuses to stand up for himself to Odin. Instead he plays the drunken Fool of a Court Jester. She senses he has more magic than Odin but yet he does anything and everything that tyrant says. That is what drove them apart. Will Loki ever change? Or is he truly the selfish and inconsiderate alcohol soaked Fool? Is there nothing he loves more than his vapid fun?

This series must be read in order. The first book is Investigating the Hottie. The second book is Undercover with the Hottie (Investigating the Hottie Book 2). This is the third book. I can't wait to see what happens next!Amanda and Will are on their way to Sydney,Australia  to thwart a terrorist attack for GASI. Their supervising agents are Amanda's Aunt Christine and her partner Nic. Weirdly enough Christine and Nic are playing a married couple AGAIN... What's up with that?! Does GASI know something they don't? At least Amanda & Will don't have to pretend to be related again! Going as a real couple relieves A LOT of pressure on their cover story and will help them blend in to the Go Big Tour Group and excuse any suspicion about why they keep disappearing. Will they be able to find the terroists' targets in time? Will the attack be prevented? Or will they fail and have to deal with the aftermath? Will they be able to have any fun?***This series is suitable for young adult through adult readers who enjoy a little romance in their scifi action adventure spy thrillers with plenty of humor and loads of intrigue :)

This series must be read in order. The first book is The Fairyland Murders. This is the second book. I can't wait to read  the next book!Blue comes home to find his intern James dead in his apartment. Needless to say, SOMEONE is trying to kill him AGAIN . Too bad the list of people who would like to see him dead it probably longer than even he knows!  What did he do this time? How will he find out who is trying to kill him now? Is this because of his mysterious unknown past? One of his old cases? The missing fairies?Izzy has her secrets. She has feelings for Blue but she refuses to admit them (especially not to him)... She has turned their business into a quickly expanding success. Too bad Blue is still hiding things from her. Will their partnership remain intact? Or will the secrets and lies rip them apart? Or cause their deaths?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little irreverence in their urban fantasy thriller suspense mysteries with a dash of romance and a lot of humor :)

This series must be read in order. The first book is New Beginnings. This is the second book. I can't wait to read the next one!Fallon is done with men. She is going to drive until she can't drive anymore an then sort out what she is going to do once she has had some sleep. Or at least that WAS the plan until a gorgeous werewolf plowed straight into her on her bike. What is he running from. Is he going to be okay? Will her bike?Brody has been in mourning for his dead wife Sarah for over four yers. No matter how many women chase him. He just isn't  ready to move on. Running from two vampires cuses him to crash into a bike. Why is he so drawn to the redhead whose bike he totalled? How is she okay after the accident?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little horror in their paranormal modern fantsy romances with plenty of action, thrills and suspense :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Allay used to be a human girl until the fateful night that she intervened when she saw a man attacking a girl. Unfortunately for her they were demons and she accidentally absorbed one of them. Now she feeds off of emotions and must consume another demon's core every 200 years to survive. That time is almost up. What should she do? Does she have the right to kill another being in order to keep on living? Should she just let herself die?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little horror in their urban fantasies with a dash of romance and loads of suspenseful thrills :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Prudence(Pru) Potts is still learning to deal with the loss of her police detective father at the hands of a criminal. This turn of events has led her to question everything and believe nothing. Turns out that is the best way to approach life... If you want to encounter magic! Who sent the mysterious postcard? What exactly is "The Unbelievable FIB"? Will she find the answers to any or all of her questions? Is there anyone she can trust?This amazing middle grade reader is perfect for any fan of mythology as well as an awesome resource for children dealing with grief caused by the loss of a parent or someone close. Fast paced and full of action and adventure I was sad when this installment came to a close. I can't wait for the next one!***This series while written at a middle grade reading level is suitable for reading to/with younger or less advanced readers who enjoy fairytale and fantasy adventures with a dash mystery and lot excitement :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Lucas Soul is an aberration... Or at least that is what he has been told by both immortal races he was born from. He is a halfbreed. The matter of his(or any halfbreed's) birth has been a sore subject with immortals since the known beginning of both races. Noone know how the war between the two immortal species started or why... Just that the mingling of the specieses is forbidden and punished by death for all parties especially the offspring. Why is Lucas all of a sudden back on a hit list after all these years? What is going on behind the scenes of the immortal world? Is another immortal war about to start?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little scifi in their globetrotting urban supernatural fantasy mystery action adventures with a dash of romance and loads of intrigues :)

This series is written by different authors but would probably be best red in order. This  is the first book.Cami's grandmother gave her a magic locket that grants the user 24hrs of the beauty(and the confidence that goes along with it) they envision for themselves from midnight to midnight after the power is invoked. On a lark at their girls' night they all sit in  a circle and wish on the locket... Will they get the bodies of their dreams? Will Cami find her Prince Charming? Or is the locket just a fake?This was a fun and easy read perfect for beach reading. Or curling up with in your favorite reading nook :) I would definitely read more by this author and I can't wait to read the next book Spellbound Cinderella (The Cinderella Body Club Book 2)!***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy quick reads with humorous heroines and a touch of magic :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Courtney is finally in college and getting ready for life on her own. Her overprotective mother is planning to move to Colorado for a better job.  Everything is looking up... especially her new romance with Dylan. What could possibly go wrong? Then one night at work she witnesses horrible murder in the alley. Worse yet Dylan is the murderer! He warns her to keep quiet. Wht is she going to do? How can she lie to the cops ?! How can she tell the truth? Will she survive being a witness?***This series is suitable for mature young adult to adult readers who enjoy a little romance in their ~clean~ new adult suspense action thrillers with a dash of gang violence :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Fleeing from her obsessive Alpha Gregory(her drunken mistake of a one night stand) has made Jess even more prickly than she would usually be. Her undeniable(and unwanted) attraction to her new Alpha Slater causes all sorts of complications. It doesn't help that almost every vision she has about him is them having really hot sex. Can she resist her new Alpha? Does she want to? Is he her Mate?Slater does not do relationships... Not since his wife committed suicide by bear at least. He has a sex only relationship with his best friend Victoria(a vampire) because neither of them want the real thing. Why is he so obsessed with his new wolf Jess? Why is he so crazy jealous and protective?***This series is suitable for adult readers who like a psychotic villain mucking about in their paranormal romantic suspense thrillers with an amazing happily ever after :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Eyelet is always waiting for the other shoe to drop. With her seizures she could be caught and named Mad thus ending her life in an Asylum or worse. The Illuminator was supposed to fix her so she is alway searching for it. Why did her father abandon her? Where is his greatest invention? Will it finally cure her?***This series is suitable for mature young adult through adult readers who like their steampunk dystopian worlds full of mad scientists and scifi action adventure mysteries with a dash of romance and a smidge of gothic noir horror :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Richard has grown up in Westland without any exposure to  any magic (that he is aware of)... But that is about to change. Tracking down the strange plant he found in his father's message jar(after his father was found brutally murdered) has caused no end of hardship and strangeness. He feels an undeniable need to seek the truth behind his father's murder no matter the consequences. He finds the strange plant near the Boundary (and it bites him leaving behind a thorn that seems to still be alive)... He knows something is incredibly wrong.  Will he find out who killed his father and why? How is magic getting across the Boundary?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little romance in their dark high fantasy action adventures with a dash of the impossible and loads of horror :)

This series must be read in order. The first book is EL-204. This is the second and final book.Jason and Heaven survived the nuclear bomb and so did everyone and everything else that was treated with EL-204 and STR. They seem to be immortal but Heaven notices changes. What have they become? How will they get out of the facility before the air runs out? Do any of them even deserve to live? Can anyone stop them?The new President has a plan for EL-204. He wants to stay young forever... But he also wants an undefeatable army. Picking up Jason's experiments in secret he is determined to achieve both goals. Can he perfect both serums and find a way to live forever? Did anyone or anything survive from Jason's experiments? Will he be able to create an immortal army without being caught? Or will he destroy the world and all life?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little twisted psychotic love in their futuristic scifi horror action adventure with loads of mad science and tons of gore :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Summer is devastated by the dissolution of her parents' marriage. After graduating from college with honors she throws away her whole life plan (including her almost fiance) and moves back home to Heritage Plantation to help her father. No more big city job or boys or just about anything else. After meeting the new hand Ford she tries desperately to ignore her attraction to him. Will she succeed in keeping away from him? Does she truly want to? How does he make her feel this way?Ford is only at Heritage Plantation for a work study assignment. He is the rolling stone that gathers no moss. Raised by hippie parents to be a free spirit and revere the earth and growing things means they fully support his dreams. He will not be tied down and forced to sacrifice as his father had to. He is bent on just enjoying life andtraveling and learning. Why is he so drawn to Summer? Why is she so different from anyone he has ever known?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little drama in their new adult southern romances with a dash of down home farm life :)

This series must be read in order. The first book is Southern Spirits (Southern Ghost Hunter Mysteries Book 1). The second book is A Ghostly Gift (Southern Ghost Hunter Mysteries). This is the third book.Verity is still reeling from learning that she can see and interact with ghosts. Ellis(her kinda boyfriend) and her little sister Melody are pretty much the only live people who really know about her "gift". It's not like she'd advertise... Enough people think she's crazy because of what went down with Beau(sleezy cheater) and her failed wedding. Now there is a History Channel crew running around town filming a documentary about The Battle Of Sugarland and making the town even more crazy than usual.How will she survive Beau chasing after her again? Will she ever be able to free Frankie from her property? Does she really even want to?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a liile snark and sass in their southern gothic supernatural amature sleuthing mysteries with a dash of romance and loads of comedic mayhem :)

This is a stand alone novel.Tessa is a journalist on a mission. Her mother had a heart attack shortly after starting a new cancer drug Zaplex. After another woman (a gatecrasher at her mother's funeral) claims her mother died the same way, along with many others, Tessa decides to take a job with Helix and investigate. Will she find the answers she is looking for? Is Helix corrupt? Will she be found out?Jim hates the way Helix was run under his predecessor. Now that he is President of R&D things are going to change! He is going to make the department more effective an clean up the company's image at the same time. Why is he so drawn to the exreporter Head of Communications? How could a reporter ever do this job?***This book is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little romantic comedy in their chic lit with a happily ever after :)

This series must be read in order. This is the eighth book. It may be the final book.Canada still does not know who the biological father of her baby is. Evil Jake who created the whole zombie epidemic or her darling husband Will. Either way Will is going to be the kid's dad no matter what! Is Will ever going to forgive her for what happened with Jake? Will they be able to find and rescue the rest of their people?***This series is suitable for adult readers who like their super heroes snarky and their apocalypses zombified with a dash of romance and loads of horror :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Graham gave up vet school to take care of his little sister and help with the family business when their dad got sick. Now that the business and his 17 year old sister are all his due to his father's passing he is over worked and over wrought. His dreams are on hold indefinitely and there is no break in the near future. Townsey wants to help her brother so she comes up with an ingenious idea to hire herself (under a fake name OF COURSE) as an independent contractor. Will she be able to pull it off? Or will she get caught?I love the chemistry between all the characters! They all fit well together and make the story engrossing and believable. The public service announcements nature of the subject matter was organic and realistic. If I had not seen all the links I might not have realized the author meant it as a book to give strength and nurture people trapped in these very real and devastating predicaments :) It truly felt like just a pleasure read which is pure awesomeness! I can't wait to read the next book! (And anything else the author puts out ... Hehe)***This series is suitable for young adult through adult readers who like their heroes avant garde and their adventures realistic and their problems horrifyingly tinged with reality all with a dash of unexpected romance :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Grieving the loss of his mother to breast cancer and guilty over not sharing her diagnosis with his brothers as she asked him not to has caused Lane to feel worthless. Hiding his mother's illness from his brothers for so long felt like a betryal of the worst sorg. He feels, for his landlord Gretchen, things he has never felt before. How will he deal with his guilt? Can he stay away from Gretchen as he should?Gretchen is a widow. She runs the trailerpark the Iversons are staying in. She has not felt drawn to a man since her husband's tragic death. She can't get Lane out of her head. Should she take a chance on him?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy small twon contemporary romances :)

Though advertised as Stand Alones I would read this series in order to avoid spoilers :) This is the first book.This is a story about damage. That we cause each other. That comes from growing up rough. That we imagine through stereotypes. It is also a story of redemption and healing. Touching and poignant from beginning to end, I was entralled by this unconventional love story! I have never read anything like it and I can't wait to start ReDesigned :)***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy drama&uncerainty in their new adult contemporary romances with a HEA :)

This series must be read in order.Hailey LOVES being Mayor of Sapphire Falls and her ADHD makes that a very difficult job. It only gets worse when Ty is around. He is the biggest and worst distraction of all. She love him but cannot function as Mayor with him around even though they have been dating (in Denver) for over 3&1/2 years. Add to that a mysterious and loud early rising new next door neighbor and she is quickly losing both her grip on her temper and her sanity! Why is Ty coming home so often lately? Who is her new annoying neighbor? Why doesn't he want anyone to know his identity?Ty bought the house next to Hailey's and moved back home to Sapphire Falls because he wants to make Hailey his life now that there is no chance he will win a gold medal. He wants a fulltime relationship instead of a smattering of weekends every year. Will Hailey break her rules and allow them to be together at home? How will she react to him bein home for good? To being his literal neighbor?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little adversity in their fun and flirty small town contemporary romances with a lot of humor and plotcentric steamy sex scenes :)

This series should be read in order. This is the first book.Myra and her Kingfisher Diver find a bright yellow motorcycle in the shed one day after school. It is magic and will change their lives forever!***This series is written at an advanced reader gradeschool level but is suitable to be read to/with younger children and less advanced readers who enjoy super heroes and fantasy :)

This seems to be a stand alone novel.This is a memoiresque coming of age story set in the 1970s-80s punk scene of Hamilton, Ontario and beyond. It is gripping and raw as it vividly details growing up rough on the streets in the music scene and drug culture. Tragic and compelling, it is almot impossible to stop before the end because you just HAVE  to know what becomes of these characters.***This book is suitable for adult readers who like a little anarchy and mayhem in their historical fiction memoiresque coming of age epics with a dash or two of tragic love :)

This series must be read in order. The first book is The Substitute. This is the second book.Blair has only ever loved one man and she didn't even really know it until they were broken up. Now she is making the safe choice by marrying Neil... Or is she? Lately she has been thinking about Garrett alot. Is she making a mistake by not marrying for love? Will marrying Neil bring her happinesso? Or just help her advance  her career ?Garrett has been kicking himself ever since he broke up Blair 5 years ago. She is the only woman he has ever(or will ever) loved. He has never had the courage to reconnect with her until he sees her across a bar in Pheonix. Can he convince her to give him another chance? Will they even like each other after all this time?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little mystery in their romantic comedies :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Megan dumped her fiance Jay 6 weeks ago when she caught him screwing his secretary on his desk. Now she is beyond desperate because she is supposed to be getting married in a couple of days and she has NO GROOM! Her mother terrifies her... What is she going to do!? Worried about airsickness she pops a couple Dramamine and boards the plane determined to enjoy the first class amenities. After a couple of mimosas she finds herself confiding in her gorgeous seat mate the whole sordid quandry... What is wrong with her?Josh is on a last ditch mission to save his company. At a convention Noah(his brother) met a girl...The next morning (after the slept together) she had scampered off with the plans for a part they were patenting. Now with the patent denied his only recourse it to try and get proof the other company stole it. How will he get access to the other company to find proof? Will he really pull it off by crashing the guy's daughter's wedding? Why can't he ignore the gorgeous woman sitting next to him on the flight?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little comedy in their contemporary romances with a dash of Fate :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Carrie is stuck. She is unsure about everything in her life. Does her husband love her for her? Or only a th mother of his kids? Will he love her when she admit she is sick of trying and failing?Ian has alway been head over heels for his wife. He doesn't know how to make her happy and is afraid of losing her. Will he figure out a way to erase the distance between them before it is too late?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little drama in their small town romances :)

This series must be read in order. The first book is Stormrise (The Storm Chronicles Book 1). The second book is Stormrage (The Storm Chronicles Book 2).  The third book is Stormwind (The Storm Chronicles Book 3). This is the fourth book.The serial killer that stole so much of her (dead) father's time from Raven is back. Now she has to stop the killing before she becomes a victim herself.... Or worse. Can she solve the case that stumped her father and Frost (for her whole entire life) before it is too late? Or will the case that was Mason's obsession be the end of her and all she loves?Written from both Mason's and Raven's point of view this book encompasses both the past and present killing sprees creating a unique reding experience. Almost all the unanswered(truly maddening) questions lingering from the prior books are answered even as new conundrums arise :) I was incredibly happy with this book, and can't wait to read Raven next!!!Ã¨¨ NOT for the homophobic or closed minded!!!***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy snarky goodness in their urban paranormal crime solving suspense thriller action adventures with a dash or two of romance and a healthy serving of horror :)

Thi series must be read in order. The first book is Jilted In January. The second book is Fixed Up In February. The third book is Mixed Up In March. This is the fourth book.Evie is sick to death of being the Lifestyles reporter for her small town paper. Chad the "Golden Boy" always gets the real news stories. Noone can ever show up before him... Almost lik he is psychic. Will she ever get a real news story to create her big break? What is with this gorgeous self defense teacher anyways? Is he actually hitting on her? Or does he flirt shamelessly with all the girls?Tanner is an EMT who also teaches self defense classes to senior citizens at the rec center. He never expected to meet the woman of his dreams teaching THAT class! Does he have a chance with her?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy small town contemporary romances with comedic aspects  :)
