This series must be read in order. The first book is Divergent. The second book is Insurgent. This is the third and final book.The Factionless have taken over and Evelyn is ruling with an iron fist. Factions will be no more. Ex Faction members will learn and do the jobs traditional to the Factionless. Noone will leave the city EVER. Tris needs to find a way out... To find the truth. Will they find their way out of the city? Or will they die in the process? What is waiting for them in the outside world? Is the world ever what it seems?***This series is suitable for mature young adult through adult readers who enjoy a little tragic romance in their futuristic dystopian post post apocalyptic mystery action adventure scifi thrillers :)

This series must be read in order. The first book is Jilted in January. The second book is Fixed Up In February. This is the  third book.Emerson is annoyed that she had to travel all the way to New York City to receive pitches from ad agencies that are much closer to her company than the city. She hates traveling because her name always leads people to think she is a man and when they discover she is a woman no one is ever happy about it. It is a hassle of unimaginable proportions. Once she gets over the shock of a naked man in her room she is not even all that surprised they mistook her last name for a similar sounding one. She is, however, livid that they gave away her room! Where is she going to stay? How is she going to make it back to the Convention for her meetings? Who is Jared Barton and why does he have to be drop dead gorgeous ?Jared is quick on his feet... But a gorgeous screaming woman throwing bubblebath at him while naked in his OWN hotel room is a bit much. Who is she? How did she get in his room? More importantly .... How can he keep her?***This series is suitable for adult readers who like a little comedy in their contemporary romances with a dash of mistaken identities :)

This series must be read in order . The first book is Jilted In January. This is the second book.Audrey has a horror story for every date she has had last year and this. She is so desperate to go our with a guy who is not a freak or  creep that she enlists Cassandra's help. Cassandra is rumore to be an incredibly talented matchmaker. Will going to Cassadra change Audrey's luck? Will she finally have a  "good" date?Max does not really want to do his cousin Cassandra a favor. He does not want to go on a date with a stranger especially as a second choice to bail his cousin out (he does NOT believe the matchmaker hype). Eventually he agrees to the date ... Will he actuallt like her? Will this be fun, amusing, or just sad?***This series is suitable for adult readers who like a little snarky comedy in their small town contemporary romances with adash of wrong place right time :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Being a jilted bride is something Harper never saw coming... Until Brad called her at their rehearsal dinner from the airport saying he was leaving on their honeymoon by himself because he was having a nervous brekdown. Now she is trying to move on by clearing up all the wedding minutiae like picking up the centerpieces an favors from the hall where she was supposed to get married. Meeting the gorgeous new manager of the venue makes her want to move on in a different way! Is she ready to date again? What will everyone think? Is he even interested in her?Grant is desperate to turn the business at Taverna Fiora around. The last manager has run it almost completely into the ground with her soft ways and sympathetic practices. He dreads interacting with Harper the jilted bride until he sets eyes on her. Instantly smitten he comes up with a plan to hire her to do decorations and favors as a service to future TV clients. He even pays her half her deposit fot the centerpieces from her failed wedding to use for the Firefighter event that night. Did he just have a brilliant idea? Or is he going soft because he can't stand the idea of making her cry? Will he ever be able to catch her eye?***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little humor in their small town contemporary romance with an underlying comedy of errors theme :)

Not sure but I think this is a stand alone novella.This was a fun and fun to read love story about opponents finally recognizing their match in the opposition. It was also about healing and doing the right thing. I would definitely read more by this author !***This book is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little  tragedy in their not so opposites attract contemporary romances :)

This is a Kindle Worlds novella. As such it is a stand alone in an established world unless this author writes a connecting story :)Abby has misgivings about her engagement... She only wants to get married once EVER! Derrick seems to be in a  bit of a mad rush to get it done and fast. And now she has lost her engagement  ring! Why is she not bothered more by its loss? Should she call off the engagement or just stall?This was a fun madcap romantic comedy of errors with Shakespearian undertones :) It was an incredibly fun and funny read that left me wanting more! I can't wait to read more by this author!*** This "sweet" romantic comedy is suitable for young adult through adult readers who enjoy a little just deserts in their contemporary romance :)

This seems to be a stand alone novel but I hope the author turns it into a series :)Darius is not like other kids. He is a Vampire in waiting. The American government subjugates all young Vampire Americans by forcing them to take the Red which keeps them from transforming... The Government also bribes their parents into submission by paying $12,000 as long as an underage kid is on the Red. If you do decide to transform then all your teachers at school must be informed and the payments stop. As if high school wasn't bad enough?!***This book is suitable for mature young adult through adult readers who enjoy their coming of age stories dark and snarky as well as poignant and supernatural with a lot of dystopia and  dash or two of romance :)

This is (so far) a stand alone novella.Ebrus is run by the State with an iron fist and no leeway. Everyone of age under 55 works 6 days a week and is only allowed 3 sick days a year. Zlotta is looking forward to being promoted to Accounting when she turns 21. She believe the State rhetoric unquestionably until she hears an odd yet beautiful noise coming from an alleyway. What is the noise? Why does is invade her mind and make her feel funny?This short novella illustrated a stark Dystopian world where independent thought and personal expression were not allowed. I hope the author chooses to revisit this world again as I found this story entrancing and would like to learn more of this vivid postapocalyptal world!***This book is suitable for young adult through adult readers who enjoy a little rebellious hope in their totalitarian post apocalyptic dystopian new adult coming of age mysteries :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.I can't wait to read the second book The Lady In Pink (Deadly Ever After Book 2)!Blue is cursed. He was abandoned not long after his birth. He has no idea who (or what) his parents were or how he got cursed. But cursed he is. If someone (anyone) touches his skin they get electrocuted. If he touches a surface (unless completely flame retardant) with his bare skin he sets it on fire. How he manages to survive another day is a mystery. Now his landlord fairies want him to find the Tooth Fairy To Be, their niece Isabella, and keep her safe. Before Jack The Tooth Ripper finds and kills her... What could possibly go wrong? Will he find her in time? Will he catch the serial killer?***This series is suitable for adult readers who like a little irreverence in their comedic mixed up fairytale mystery suspense thrillers with a dash of romance :)

This series must be read in order. The first book is Divergent. This is the second book.In the aftermath of the Erudite Simulation that massacred more than half of Abnegation everything is chaos. Tris is in shock both from killing Will and realizing there may have been another way. Disarming Will could have saved both her life and his ...If only she had been capable at the time of rational thought she mightn't have murdered one of her best friends. On top of that how will he deal with both her parents sacrificing their own lives to protect hers? So much guilt overides logical thought. Should she tell Tobias that she killed Will? How can she help him deal with his evil father Marcus? Will the Dauntless ever recover from being used as minless zombie weapons?***This series is suitable for mature young adult through adult readers who enjoy a little scifi in their dystopian  new adult action thriller suspenceful mystery adventures with a dash of romance and alot of intrigue :)

This series must be read in order. The first book is Getting Out Of Hand. The second book is Getting Worked Up. The third book is Getting Dirty. The fourth book is Getting In The Spirit. The fifth book is Getting In The Mood. The sixth book is Getting It All. The seventh book is Getting Lucky. This is the eighth book.Hailey should have never given Tyler Bennett the time of day. After all he is two years younger than her. He did not do group sports and she was the Queen of the school. This is the sweet and sexy start of their epic romance.This was  an awesome read perfect for any Sapphire Falls fan! I always wondered what started everything with Ty and Hailey  because it seemed so incongruous to me... Now that I know it finally makes PERFECT sense! I can't wait to read Getting Over It to get the rest of the story!!!***This series is suitable for adult readers who like a few real world obstacles in their small town contemporary romances with plot centric sex scenes and a dash of happily ever after :)

This seems to be a stand alone novel though I hope it turns into a series :)Josiah is a hitman who used to freelance for every government agency known to man (and a few that aren't known) ‚Ä¶ Now he is retired. He has been retired for about three years. Ever since Anna found out what he was and left him. He lost it... Bigtime. Now he waits for the phone to ring and Anna to come back. When the phone rings he is in shock. Anna needs his help... He might be able to win her back. What has her brother gotten her into? Will he be able to keep her safe? Will she ever forgive him?***This book is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little supernatural elements in their hitman with a heart of gold action thriller mysteries with a dash of romance

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Beatrice is not cut out for life in the Faction she was born into. She does not really believe in sacrifice of self. Her brother Caleb, on the other hand, is practically perfect in every way. How will she survive the aptitude test? Will she rate another Faction? Can she handle losing her family ?***This series is suitable for mature young adult through adult readers who like a little romance in their post post apocalyptic scifi new adult action packed coming of age adventures :)

This seems to be a stand alone novel.Julia has always been in love with Michael. So when he casts her aside after thier night of passion Julia is beyond devastated. When she finds him practically dead in the woods time seem to stop. Why does he call her name when he finally regins comes to? What does the way he looks at her mean? How can he remember her if he has total amnesia? Why can't she just forget him and move on?I LOVED this book and totally wish it was a series! I can, however, totally understand how and why it ended where and as it did :) It is nice to read a different genre from the Queen Of Dystopian as it shows her true versatility as a writer! I cant wait to read whatever she writes next!!!*** This book is suitable for mature young adult through adult readers who enjoy a little realistic horror in their paranormal suspense new adult coming of age love stories :)

This series must be read in order. The first book is The Hunger Games. The second book is Catching Fire. This is the third an final book.Peeta is captured. District 12 is gone. Almost everyone is dead. And District 13 wants Katniss to be the Mockingjay. The face of the Rebellion. Katniss wants Peeta back. Instead she is not all here. Grievous injuries sustained in the Quarter Quell Hunget Games keep her in a constant state of shock and illness. Nothing seems real. The only thing for certain is she must get Peeta and the other Victors back. And kill Snow. Too bad she has no idea who to trust or how to accomplish her goals.The only certainty she has is they are still keeping things from her. Will she be able to save the others? Will the rebels win against the Capitol? Or will they all die trying?***This series is suitable for young adult through adult readers who like plot twists and inrigues in their apocalypal post post apocalyptal futuristic scifi dystopian survival adventure with a dash of romance  :)

*** I will add to and edit this review as I finish more books :) ***Paxton Private Investigations (Paxton Private Investigations, #1) by Juli AlexanderVeronica Mars Would Be ProudThis series must be read in order. This is the first book.Graham gave up vet school to take care of his little sister and help with the family business when their dad got sick. Now that the business and his 17 year old sister are all his due to his father's passing he is over worked and over wrought. His dreams are on hold indefinitely and there is no break in the near future. Townsey wants to help her brother so she comes up with an ingenious idea to hire herself (under a fake name OF COURSE) as an independent contractor. Will she be able to pull it off? Or will she get caught?I love the chemistry between all the characters! They all fit well together and make the story engrossing and believable. The public service announcements nature of the subject matter was organic and realistic. If I had not seen all the links I might not have realized the author meant it as a book to give strength and nurture people trapped in these very real and devastating predicaments :) It truly felt like just a pleasure read which is pure awesomeness! I can't wait to read the next book! (And anything else the author puts out ... Hehe)***This series is suitable for young adult through adult readers who like their heroes avant garde and their adventures realistic and their problems horrifyingly tinged with reality all with a dash of unexpected romance :)

This series must be read in order. The first book is The Hunger Games. This is the second book.Katniss is becoming accustomed  to the life of a Victor ... sort of. She has moved her family to Victor Villiage and even has resumed her hunting trips. She misses Peeta and Gale. Nothing will ever be the same. She has too much time on her hands. And noone really to spend it with. How will she adjust to this sedentary life? Will she be forced to play out a farce of a life with Peeta as he grows to hate her more and more each day? Will Gale ever adjust to being her "cousin"? Or will they all die a little more each day? Have they escaped the ire of the Capitol or is Snow just biding his time for the perfect moment to strike?***This serie is suitabl for mature young adult through adult readers who enjoy a little chaos and mayhem in their scifi dystopian action survival adventures with a conflicted heroine and a few dashes of romance :)

This series must be read in order. The first book is Jenny Undead. This is the second book.Jenny can't live without Declan. Jenny Alive Again or Jenny Undead. To be honest even Jenny Alive could never live without him. Too bad that he came back wrong when she tried to save him by making him eat parts of her flesh. It should have worked! Now Jenny's mission is to find her mom and force her to fix Declan... And maybe eat her later. Revenge is a dish best served alive and screaming after all! Can they find her mother ? Will Anna be able to fix Declan? Who is Farron and what is his damage?I LOVED this book an can't wait for th next! Jenny is the end all be all zombie girl hero and I am always in awe of her indomitable spirit and refusal to give in. It may take her a bit to figure out the right path but once she does... Watch OUT! Before this series I never considered a zombie for a heroine but now I am totally addicted!!!***This series is suitable for adult readers who enjoy a little scifi in their Apocalyptic Zombie Horror Action Adventure mysteries with a romance chaser :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first bookApril is a survivor. First she survived her father's death. Then she survived her mom starting up with Randy. She even survived Randy trying to replace her dead father... So far. This virus, on the other hand, seems like  difficult thing to survive. If the virus gets you it turns you into a feral vampire like creature with no thought other than to feed on anyone near you not also a feral. If it doesn't get you... The ferals will unless you kill them first. How will they survive? Will she be able to keep her baby brother Jeremy and her mother safe as well? How do you hide from a disease and those inflicted? Will life ever be normal again?*** This series is suitable for mature young adult through adult readers who like their new adult apocalyptic stories with a strong heroine and loads of monster killing fun :)

This series must be read in order. This is the first book.Katniss is a rebel at heart but she just does not realize it. She sees her rule breaking just as a means to an end... Survival. Hunting is just what she does to keep her family fed not as an act of defiance. With an indomitable will and an unbreakable spirit she she shocks the world with her volunteering to take her younger sister's place as Tribute. Noone from a regular district has voluntarily gone as a Tribute to the Hunget Games in her life as far as she knows... That is far too altruistic. Will she survive long? How will she live with herself if she does win?***This series is suitable for mature young adult through adult readers who like a little horror and brutality in their scifi post post apocalyptic survival action adventure coming of age stories with alot of anarchy and a dash of romance :)
Love it and the poses are challenging, but can be modified easily. The meditation part at the end is my favorite‚Ä¶zzzzzzzz.The 35 min. seems to just fly by.

This is an amazing product -very easy to use and once on, doesn't require a set time. I have a black leather Brookstone backpack that had a wear hole in the back and also part of the synthetic piping had worn through and the plastic was starting to stick out of the corner. I was able to take this circular patch, cut it to size (cuts easily), and use it to repair two areas.  I was a little skeptical that the corner repair would be next to impossible, but the adhesive is really strong, the patch is thin enough and matches the sheen on the leather so it's not as noticeable as I thought it might be, with the exception of the embossed pattern of course.  It does seem a little expensive, but it's really quite effective, and it's an instant fix, so is a good deal in the long run. If the company that makes these could make little dots or things for smaller holes, it would be nice to have more options, but I found a way around it, so no big deal.If it proves otherwise, I'll update.Am ordering the pirate patch, that one will be used just for decorating the same bag.

I'm really quite appalled by the sexual content of this book. I enjoy a little spice in my novels, but had a really hard time with the inclusion of the obvious sex (not hinted at, it's all out there) between the two main characters, who are both girls at the beginning. I was expecting "Summer Sisters", not "Scissor Sisters"!!!Really not my cup of tea. Made me feel yucky reading it.

I have a couple of pieces of costume jewelry, obviously "silver tone", or plated with some sort of silver coating.One of my rings was seriously worn through and the copper was showing. I don't wear this ring a lot, but it's showy, as you'll be able to see from the photos. It is a fun piece and cost me very little, but I do like it, and will wear it on occasion when I feel like tossing in a bit of bling to my ensemble.In any case, I bought this with some expectation of it not working out. I was really surprised to see that it DOES work. It's obviously a very thin coating, and the dullness of the restored plating doesn't match the shinier plating, but it's on an area that can't exactly be seen, so I really don't care. I'm just thrilled that it looks like a nice silver piece of jewelry, and that the copper doesn't show through.I also have a pair of "silver tone" earrings that have white and black stones that I enjoy wearing. Once again, the copper was exposed and they were turning green. I also treated them with the plating, and I can't see any copper in there at all, which is really amazing.Cheap fix and so easy to do! I'm a fan!

My 9 year old daughter is taking swim lessons this summer, and has had problems with water getting stuck in her ear for the first time. She was pretty freaked out (and in turn, so was I), so we tried silicone ear plugs, which were uncomfortable and she kept fidgeting with them. I bought these drops and they're working great so far.I had tried just plain alcohol, and vinegar is out of the question because she hates the smell of vinegar -the alcohol worked, but made her gag. These are the right combo for her, and they help the water naturally drain out of the ear canal. Very happy with this inexpensive and effective fix!
I love this cute little guy. Going on our minivan.

My 9 year old daughter loves to swim and takes swimming lessons too. She's just started to have the unenviable problem of swimmer's ear -hasn't gotten the actual infection, but water gets trapped in her ear canal and she can't seem to figure out how to get it out herself, no matter how many times she tries to shake her head to get the water out.I used ear drops, but it made her gag and really upset her to feel the drops going into her ear. This was the last resort. I bought these so she wouldn't have bright orange plugs in her ear and separated one plug in half for two milky white youth-sized plugs. Getting them on her ear wasn't so hard. I just took each half and balled it up a little bit, then I gently pushed it into a disc shape into her ear. Getting used to them took a minute, but after a swim lesson, she realized they're well worth it. I was getting a little nervous there for a minute, because I had just signed her up for a month's worth of summer swim lessons!!!Thanks to Mack's, she (and I) won't have to worry about the issue of swimmer's ear!!! Great product, and inexpensive, too.

I entered a Clo voice contest for Stornetta Farms. Didn't win the grand prize, but received this awesome book, a nice thanks from the company and some coupons for their delicious products!!! This book is REALLY cute, I love the punny jokes that they put in their ads too. Kudos to this California-based company for sticking to their ideals and for thanking their fans!!!

These are a good price here. I bought these for $55 elsewhere and they're definitely worth that, but to find them cheaper is always nice.In any case, VERY happy with these KEEN replacements. I say that because the KEEN sandals are a beast to get on when feet are wet, hot and sweaty. These have three different points to open them from so are super-easy to get feet into.I love the bumper toe‚Ä¶very pleased with these cool-looking KEEN alternatives!!!

Love this case, hesitated a little at first because I wasn't sure about the fit. Some of the earlier reviews stated that the fit was off, but it appears that Otterbox has worked out that problem because this fits perfectly.After buying a cheaper case for my older phone and having the screen shatter when I dropped it, I decided to go back to Otterbox.I bought the Moroccan color. It's really lovely and the pattern is interesting. It does appear to be a decal but I'm hoping that it is as durable and will remain on the case as time goes by.The built-in screen protector is fine -my daughter noticed the sensitivity is reduced, but I don't mind it. There has to be some sort of trade-off.

Bought these at a Hallmark/gift store near our house.LOVED them, but then the insoles started slipping around and bunching up where my arch was, which was really quite painful!!!That happened only after a few wearings. It's like the movement and the heat of my feet loosened the glue and they just weren't the same.I wore them one more time when I went on an RV trip by the river and threw them out. Disappointment.Oh, and if you drop something heavy on your foot, forget it‚Ä¶no protection, substantial but thin material. The sole is OK, but it's really thin as well. Good tread.

This remains one of the best paranormal dramas to date.Excellent story and acting. Very atmospheric and multilayered. Bruce Willis is fantastic.It's difficult to go into the story without giving anything away, so you'll just have to see it for yourself.

This is a good drain opener. That said, it shouldn't cost the $115 + shipping as shown at time of review. This stuff costs about $12 or so in the hardware stores, so don't pay much more than that.I had the unfortunate experience of dealing with a clogged drain -the water wasn't backing up -yet- but I could smell the unmistakeable scent of dank water and knew one was gonna cause the washer pipe to overflow all over the garage. So I poured the recommended amount into the drain after removing the hose and waited 15 minutes. I also cleaned out the kitchen sink drain as well, since it's the same pipe system.First off, this stuff is thick and black and it stinks like you wouldn't believe, straight from the bottle. That's due to what it is- acid‚Ä¶when it comes in contact with bio-waste, the smell is even worse so I really recommend opening up every window in the house, or putting a box fan into the window blowing out and another window open to vent out the room/house. The garage wasn't so hard, but the kitchen‚Ä¶phew! Stinky-stinky!  It does say to make sure there's water in the pipes, but how besides running some water in there, I don't know so can't comment more on that. I used an old paint bucket on top of the kitchen drain and a take-out plastic cup on top of the washer drain to keep the fumes in -it won't help much, but it's recommended.As I was flushing out the drain in the garage, I started to feel a bit like I was gonna pass out, so I stopped for a minute and then came back. I ran a rinse cycle w/cold water just to flush it out more and it seems great now.Again, I'd recommend this, but be warned‚Ä¶Pee-YEW!!!!

Great, bought it to replace a picture light bulb.  The other one I had was an incandescent and it seemed to get way too hot, so I thought this would be a good alternative. I'm really glad I bought it. First off, it's really bright, but it's a warm light, not the hard cold light that I associate with the office. It's cool, temperature-wise, which is also better, since the light is made of metal, and is attached to the frame.I'd definitely buy this again.

Love using this for Ugg and Bearpaw boots.My advice: don't hold the can too close. A couple of light passes should do it. And try to get the entire boot because it will darken suede/sheepskin a bit.One can can do quite a few pairs of shoes.

I used this on a pair of UGG Bailey bow boots that had salt damage on them. Some of the salt damaged areas were stiff and discolored. I used a toothbrush to gently scrub at them while flexing the wet suede in a cold bath of this wash for a few minutes, rinsed them, changed the water (I was using a 5 gallon bucket), and gave them another go, in case there was still salt in the water. Being that they are blue, some of the dye came off in the water.  That wasn't surprising to me, and it wasn't too bad. But they did come out nicely‚Ä¶they look (and smell) a lot better, too. I actually submerged the boots completely into the solution -some websites advise against doing that, but I did anyway, since the shearling needed refreshing too.  Remember to use an old piece of towel or washcloths in the toe of the boots when you're drying. It helps to retain the shape of the boots. I have a drying rack that allowed me to turn them upside down and let the water drip out of the boots. I dried them in the garage so the water could drip off of them and kept them out of the heat and sun, which won't be good for them. Take the toweling out of the boot toe after about a day and let that part air dry.My photos are before and after washing (if they're not on here, I'll post them soon).I also used this on a pair of Coach signature laceless sneakers. It worked on those as well. Again, I completely submerged them. I don't have photos for them, but the water was DIRTY after giving them a good dip, and they really cleaned up.It does say that "rinsing is optional" on the bottle. However, I partly rinsed the Ugg boots out so that there wasn't a lot of soap residue on the inside of the boots, since my daughter wears them barefoot. I like the lanolin smell of this stuff and it seems to condition the leather, so will definitely use it (and highly recommend it) for Ugg boot/shoe care.

Nice-looking earrings, not too large, nor too small. They seem smaller than 1 carat each, but that's OK‚Ä¶for the price I paid I'm not going to complain.These are a bright, clear green.Understated but bright enough to be noticed.I'm giving these as a gift to a special friend.Come in a silver cardboard box on a slightly padded backing‚Ä¶the label was long and stuck on really well (wouldn't come off w/o label residue). I bought an extra presentation box and will use that instead, so no big deal‚Ä¶actually, just giving them to someone on a card would be OK too.
Would buy again, a nice plush jewelry box. Makes any jewelry look more posh when gift giving.Using for studs, drop earrings and a necklace.

Use it every day and I feel good about not using aluminum-based products on my skin.It doesn't stop me from perspiring, but that's OK. I figure if my pits need to sweat, then there must be a reason.At least my shirts don't stink anymore‚Ä¶that was always a problem.
Works for what it was meant for.I put a small keychain on it so I don't lose it, because it's teeny tiny.
I keep this in my wallet, just in case.Haven't had to use it, but it's there. Price is right and it's very discreet.

Love this basket. Had a wicker basket that used to slip and point downwards, was flimsy and didn't last very long. Glad I found this replacement‚Ä¶it's cool-looking, sturdy and the hardware anchors it so it doesn't fall forward. I don't put anything heavy in there -I hang my garage door opener on it when I'm headed home from work and also put my iPhone, a sweater and keys in there. It looks great on my beach cruiser and I'd definitely recommend it to others for sure.Only caveat: I didn't get any kind of mounting clips for the basket so the strap could be put on it, but I did buy some round aluminum carabiners on a very popular auction site and they fit perfectly. I didn't like the included strap either (I don't like gold hardware, just one of those things w/me), so I used an extra black nylon camera strap and it looks (and works) great.

My honest opinion: Was on the fence about returning these.First off, the pair I received is a watery Swiss blue. They're pretty in their own right, but they're NOT a medium blue by a long shot. Had they been the stormy London Blue, I would have been a lot more pleased with their appearance, because that's what's shown in the photo.Secondly, the box is OK, but the earrings are in plastic bags (one has "Made in Thailand" printed on it) in a blue satin bag and I honestly wasn't quite sure how to present them, as the box's interior doesn't have post holes and they'd just be rolling around in there. Others may not have an issue with it, but I found it fairly tacky, presentation-wise.I ended up using a completely new and generic jewelry gift box of my own and pairing these with a sterling necklace, and they looked great in it. I threw out the original box and kept the pouch to store a stray ring that I had.I was on the fence for a day or so as to whether I wanted to gift these. If the box and presentation were better, like the photos in one of the early reviews, I would have kept them without the extra hassle of finding another gift box and working to arrange them in it.

This used to be my go-to hair color, but in the last 2 or 3 uses, it's faded to a weird orange color. I'm not sure if it's because of the product changing or possibly because my body's chemistry has changed, but it's not a good look.It looks great from the day of coloring, which is a plus and doesn't stain the skin.We're talking less than 2 weeks after coloring, so have to change my hair color.

I love the looks of this helmet and it's really well made.It looks cool, not like the "racer" helmets that I really don't like to wear.I love the sassy bow print on the side.Just so you know, it sits pretty high on the head so you might not like that look. But I do!My daughter says I kind of look like I'm in the military‚Ä¶yeah, the fashion police, I say!!!

Adorable, for sure.Yes, there's a lot of assembling. Tiny boxes, little stickers, organizing.But when it's done, it's so darned cute.I fully expect to step on these little pieces often. However, since my daughter is growing up I know that pretend play days are numbered so it's totally worth it.This might be one of those "keeper" toys that I hang on to when she outgrows it. It really is that nice.
A really good-sized set (Kohl's exclusive).If your kid is into MLP she or he will absolutely love this set.Quick shipping, and my daughter is really happy so five stars.
Daughter loved it and I got teary-eyed during parts of it. The girl who plays Annie is adorable. Wish I had ignored the negative reviews and had seen it in theaters.

Wow this stuff is magic!I've used a lot of leather cleaner and lotion on my bags and this is probably one of the best I've tried.Used this on three purses and a pair of boots.The boots had spots on them and were dull and faded. The straight cleaner seemed to fade the stains to nearly gone and the moisturizer blended them in and added a lustrous glow.  After I buffed the leather, they had a nice, mellow shine.One purse had major body/hand oils on the handle, which turns out is not a good thing for leather. Using the straight cleaner lightened it up a shade and lightened some of the stains on the body of the purse a bit. The other purses weren't in bad shape, so I didn't use the cleaner on them, only the moisturizing lotion. They did benefit greatly from the lotion, and again, it gave them a nice, mellow sheen.Comes with an applicator pad (fabric and foam, like a car wax pad, but nicer).It's a good idea not to use too much of the conditioner‚Ä¶just as much as you need and then maybe 2-3 times a year, or as needed.The odor of the lotion is wonderful. It smells like almond milk and is really quite mild on the hands too.I highly recommend this product for all leather. It's wonderful and really does work!!!

The biscotti is a gorgeous oatmeal/eggshell color that goes with a purse that I have (and even if I don't carry the purse, the shoes still look fabulous and sort of Miami Vice). I want to wear these with light pants and boyfriend jeans. Very preppy and rich looking. Not only that, but they were PERFECT FIT right out of the box. LOVE these and want to get another pair in pink!!!

Best value and quality for the price.Bought these for our daughter, who outgrew her old ones. The old ones still had some miles in them‚Ä¶too bad they don't fit!I'd recommend tall socks with these‚Ä¶otherwise they get STINKY.Not really for hot days or for a place where there's miles of walking, like Disneyland. They're fine for school, though.
Best deal I could find, especially for The Sound of Music. Completed my R&H musical collection with these.

These are wonderful for shoes that are just a touch too large. I use them on heels and on loafers and they work great.It's really important that a shoe horn is used every time the shoes are put on, so the adhesive doesn't peel off. It's a very strong adhesive, but it will eventually start to roll down if a shoe horn isn't used.Nice quality suede leather product.

...the heading (and quote from the movie) says it all.Bad acting.Unintentionally funny.Has a slight homosexual vibe to it that I wasn't banking on (not that there's anything wrong with that), due to the bizarre attention from Daniel-San's (many) male antagonists, who seem to have nothing else to do but completely fixate on him.  It's evil that's nearly orgasmic to the villains and cartoonish in its depiction, which makes this movie somewhat squirm-worthy to watch.The Karate Kid is easily pushing 30 and has gained a noticeable amount of weight since the first movies.  He pleads, whines, runs around in a tizzy, blows his top, apologizes frantically, or seems to be always in an otherwise loud and overacted state of heightened anxiety for much of the movie. I saw somewhere that Ralph Macchio didn't want any romantic scenes with his "girlfriend" so his wife didn't get jealous...maybe the tension caused him to nearly explode from the stress?Mr. Miyagi is the rock of the film, but is sort of a strange presence, glancing in a concerned way at Daniel and is antics, etc. In contrast to Daniel, he's Mr. Cool.Terry Silver, the ascot-wearing Steven Seagal ripoff, and billionaire predator, hisses with laughter and casts many an evil glance as his clever, diabolical scheme unfolds!The karate moves are geriatric in motion, scripted and stiff.A sad ending to the Karate Kid franchise, which seemed to get it right with the first two flicks. But still, sorta fun to watch for a few laughs when catching a re-run. Three stars.

These are great. I hate the glare of the lightbulbs from our kitchen ceiling fan light, which I can see in the front room. This totally alleviates that problem. They look cool, too.Wish they made these in LEDs, because I don't know how long they'll last and they're pricey.For anyone who might have been wondering (I posted a question, which was unanswered and took a chance on ordering), these are 40W -the title and the description have different wattages.

Lovely setting, lovely ladies.They're very toned and the moves are seductive and good for the gals. I love the hip and lower leg movement, because it seems like women should use their hips like this more...it's really feminine, natural and alluring.The moves are slow and low, and it might take a few tries to get the steps and the rhythm down. If not done right, it can hurt (squats and the like). I actually thought the cool down at the end was pretty intense the first few times I did it.Anyhow, a good switch-up from other DVDs that I use.

Yummy. I like these!!! My daughter and her friends do too. It is sugar, but I don't feel as guilty as I do if I buy the kids drugstore candy.So far, I like all of the flavors except for mango. I usually don't like watermelon-flavored candy, but it tastes good and fresh and don't mind it at all.
Yummmm, these are so good. I don't typically like sugary sweets but these are really tasty. They don't look as good as color jelly beans (they have a whitish coating to them), but they taste great.
Nice purple color to these ties, I love them. Bought them to jazz up some cellophane bags that will hold party favors. Purple is a great "unisex" color for kids' parties.

These are so darned cute. I love the color. I'm putting brick candies into them to give to my daughters' classmates on her birthday. Tiny, but nice looking and easy to embellish!I could see a bride using these for table favors too.
Great movies, great price. Bought these as a gift for my husband.

Wow, this is an awesome camera case. It's just what I was hoping I'd find and I did, with the help of a Canon message board.I have a Canon Powershot 16 and was looking for a case that would be low-profile, easy access and would safely house my camera. I searched online and at camera supply stores.The case has more than enough room for my camera, and the sides open to reveal pockets that are large enough for a small wallet, memory cards, and the battery charger that came with my camera.I love the opening to retrieve the camera. It's dual zippers, one on each side, and a quick tug on the nylon strap opens both sides at the same time for easy and quick access. Perfect for someone like me who wants to get that quick shot without a lot of fussing or pockets. I can whip out my camera in an instant if I need to.The tether strap (note that there's also a wrist strap too). I'm not too keen on it, because it screws in where the tripod mount is a weak point in the design -since the camera will get used and twisted/turned around a lot, it's more likely to unscrew itself.I bought the BlackRapid RPB-1BB Snapr 20 (Black) kit (overpriced for what it is, but necessary), but found that it didn't work with the G16 because my camera has a recessed strap attachment and had to return it.I decided to work the smallest of the strap attachments around the recessed strap hardware on my camera and it's now tethered to it securely.The tether is really short. It requires some pulling of the strap in order to get the camera towards your face, as shown in the picture. It takes some getting used to, but I would definitely recommend giving this a try. It doesn't even bother me any more after months of use.One other thing -I actually had my camera in this and my daughter got sick and barfed on me (yes, kids do that). It was all over the case and I was wondering if it was salvageable. I ran it through a front-loading washer twice and air dried it. Can't even tell/smell that anything happened. I'm a fan!
Ya gotta do this at least one time...it's hilarious to see the recipients reaction!!!They look like real product boxes!

I pranked my husband big time with this box.He was totally convinced it was real.He looked at it and said, "Oh. Wow!" (totally forced smile that was so transparent it wasn't even worth the effort IMO. Then he opened it (at my urging) and that was the best part!These things are genius...so realistic!!! And so funny too. They remind me of those airline catalog spoof books.So -basically, most people that receive these will look at it, try to figure out what to say/do, and then put the box down. You CAN'T let them move on to the next gift/subject. So my advice is to say something like, "It's amazing that they fit all of that in the box! Open it up and see for yourself!" That's the FUN part -when they realize it's a joke. Then they giggle, a mixture of embarrassment and relief. I won't call them naive, because there's so many REAL As Seen on TV-type gifts that are the same, and the packaging is so darned convincing that nearly ANYONE will fall for it. hell, I'd fall for it if I had no idea what it was, but I'd also open the box to see the coolness for myself, because that's normally what I'd do.Speaking of, when the person opens the box, they might see a two side flaps, one says "PRANK YOU" and the other "You've been pranked". But having given three of these out, NO ONE except my husband saw THE HUGE BLACK ON YELLOW LETTERS upon opening it. I contribute that to the shock thing.I've heard that these are at Walmart for less, so I'm gonna have to check that out. I think this would be a FANTASTIC part of a white elephant gift, or a birthday, or anywhere there's a crowd, seriously. It's that good.It's hilarious. But once you prank someone, the jig is up.The box is good enough it can be reused a few times or kept for display. I encouraged my recipients to prank someone else so the fun could continue on...it's kind of like a prank it forward of sorts!Oh, and this is made in the USA. So I have NO PROBLEM paying for these.And regarding the cost, don't sweat it. A greeting card can set you back as much. And the graphics are so awesome and well done, it's more than worth it for the chaos that ensues.

Got this for a friend that I've known for a while (almost 40 years).I'm not a prank person. But this was too good to pass up.She opened the wrapping, and slowly turned the box over and over. I could tell she was struggling to be polite. It was hilarious and I had a hard time trying not to smile.Then she said, "Wow! Can't wait to try this out!"Of course, there's no way you can fit a coffee maker and a shower head in a box this size, but no one seems to realize that after the initial shock.So most people that receive these will look at it, try to figure out what to say/do, and then put the box down. You CAN'T let them move on to the next gift/subject. So my advice is to say something like, "It's amazing that they fit all of that in the box! Open it up and see for yourself!" That's the FUN part -when they realize it's a joke. Then they giggle, a mixture of embarrassment and relief. I won't call them naive, because there's so many REAL As Seen on TV-type gifts that are the same, and the packaging is so darned convincing that nearly ANYONE will fall for it. hell, I'd fall for it if I had no idea what it was, but I'd also open the box to see the coolness for myself, because that's normally what I'd do.Speaking of, when the person opens the box, they might see a two side flaps, one says "PRANK YOU" and the other "You've been pranked". But having given three of these out, NO ONE except my husband saw THE HUGE BLACK ON YELLOW LETTERS upon opening it. I contribute that to the shock thing.I've heard that these are at Walmart for less, so I'm gonna have to check that out. I think this would be a FANTASTIC part of a white elephant gift, or a birthday, or anywhere there's a crowd, seriously. It's that good.It's hilarious. But once you prank someone, the jig is up.The box is good enough it can be reused a few times or kept for display. I encouraged my recipients to prank someone else so the fun could continue on...it's kind of like a prank it forward of sorts!Oh, and this is made in the USA. So I have NO PROBLEM paying for these.And the cost...psssht. Big deal if it's over $5. You're paying for the artwork and the entertainment factor. Don't get all wound up over it. A greeting card can be nearly as much cashola.

Great for treating insect bites.My daughter doesn't like the way that the water looks (it looks like light chocolate milk), but she loves the way it makes her feel if she has bug bites.15-20 minutes seems to do the trick with a little bit of epsom salt tossed in too.

Bought an assortment (cow, chicken, pig, duck and penguin) for coworkers in my unit.They're small, but they're big enough to get a fist around. When squeezed, their eyes bug out to comic effect and they're really funny and cute at the same time (and just gross enough to make them different from any other stress ball out there).  That they're named "Poppin Peepers" is also hilarious in itself!Since I have 8 coworkers, this will be a good gift, but won't break the bank!!!

Love this goofy hat. It's kind of cool though. My husband has a big noggin and has a hard time fitting caps, but this fit him. He doesn't seem that excited about it. I don't care, because I keep putting it on and wearing it.The ear flaps tuck under if you don't want them out.Only part I don't like is the back. There's a big gap where the fit band adjusts. But for the price, who cares.I'll add a photo.

Like some others, I bought these for a salt lamp that I have.The bulb that came with it was damaged and I was glad to find these on Amazon.They're definitely 15 watts, as the salt lamp gets warm and glows brightly.Will keep buying these as long as they're available.

Love these. Bought them to replace a lighter weight chess set that had lost a couple of pieces. The pieces fit perfectly on my 12" x 12" chess board and are really well made. The bases are heavier as expected, wider and they're carved and finished more carefully than the pieces that originally came with the set. The finish on the two is different enough that it's easy to tell the two sides apart.I'm really glad that I treated myself when I purchased this set!Will post pics of the difference between the two if it's possible for me to add photos to this review.

I like Leonard Maltin, and obviously he's been doing this for a long time. But the ratings that he gives for movies is sort of harsh and I found myself a little disappointed that some of my favorite movies weren't rated higher.Not that this isn't a thorough guide and a great resource, it's just that I disagree with many of the ratings that are in here.Will post some examples later.

My advice: don't bother. I put this in and it doesn't do anything for algae. Over four days, one is supposed to put 1/4 of the additive in during the first four days, and the filter is only good for seven -basically after seven days this is supposed to be tossed out.  The additive didn't do anything, nor did the filter for the algae in my Biorb.I think that it's better off to spend your money on a regular filter. I was pretty upset that this didn't work so I put some activated carbon inside of the filter (after leaving it in for a week) and re-used it to get my money's worth out of it.Doesn't do any more than a good cleaning with a white nylon pad and some elbow grease. Won't buy this again!!!
Buy elsewhere‚Ä¶the price is high. Should get twice as much for your money if you shop around.
Great novelty and retro item. Bought these for my daughter's Halloween favors at school.

Not wrapped individually as I had hoped. I had read another review and thought that they were each wrapped, but they arrive loose in a box and have strings with them.I'm sure nearly every kid knows how to activate these, so will count on that when I give them to my daughter's 3rd grade class.

These are so cool. I ordered an entire box for my daughter's third grade class and handouts at work for Halloween. I like that they're made in the USA and the colors are beautiful. They're unusual and I'm sure the kids will love them.Fast shipping, one of the best prices I found, too.Four of the pops had broken sticks (broken in half) from something heavy being placed on top, but the rest were fine.P.S. My daughter is a sugar junkie, and while she thought they were beautiful, she didn't like the banana-ishy flavor of these. They do have a different taste and texture from traditional hard candy sugar pops.

Wow, this thing really works for headache pain. For me, anyway! I suffer from migraines and cluster headaches and I found this to be relaxing and it helps to ease the tension in my head and neck.It's easy to use, and I can use it on myself and feel the tension melt away.I have the copper model and it's wonderful!!!1.  Bend the wires into a gentle curve that fits your head. It will look like a pumpkin in a sense.2.  Lower it on the head...it feels like someone is using long nails. Twist, turn, raise and lower slowly -- I find the neck and the scalp are the best.3.  Adjust the wires any way that feels best: tight, or loose.LOVE it!!!

OK, let me say first off just how bummed out I am that these didn't fit. I have a green/black leopard print dress and a green/black witch hat with feathers that I was SO LOOKING FORWARD to pairing these shoes with.I received them today and took them out of the box. The jet black patent is shiny and looks to be much better quality than the price reflects. The style is AWESOME. Very cartoony, vampy and has sass with the shiny, evil sort of pointy toe, exaggerated heel and brass-tone web-patterned buckle. There's enough grip on the bottom of the sole that these wouldn't slip. I also like the heel because it's sturdy and allows for some stability instead of a pointy, thin heel.Anyhow, completely fine out of the box. Stunning and perfect.Alas -then I put my foot in (with a clean, thin footie sock or "ped") and my foot didn't fit!!! I wear a 10-10.5 (some shoes require an 11) and I had ordered a 12, figuring how small could it be. I'd say that the shoe that I received (and I did check to make sure that it was marked 12 and it was) was sized more like an 8 or even close to a 9!!! Just putting the shoe on to see if it fit made my two little toes practically scream with pain! They hurt a good 10 minutes after.The problem is the pointed toe. The point of the toe isn't designed past the point of the foot, like it should be so the sizing is from the very pointed tip to the heel and the whole balance of fit is off because of it.I've never had to buy a 12 and that size is usually a good 1" larger than my foot!!!So I'm boxing up these awesome shoes and sending them back for inappropriate sizing. I'll have to find another option for my Halloween costume. Too bad!!! If these didn't run so darned small, I would have kept them for sure!!!
My daughter loves this and it keeps her ice water cold for a long time. So worth it.

There's no doubt about it. Michael Jackson was one of the greatest (and most controversial) showmen on Earth.There WERE other videos that could have been on here, such as "Leave Me Alone" and "Scream" -two videos that I always found visually arresting (the songs weren't up to par with his other hits, but his music was hardly ever horrible).I won't list the songs, because you can see for yourself on the description what they are and it's redundant to do so.Of course, since most of these are back in the 70s/80s, MJ can be seen as "altered" slightly and then towards the end he's pretty much a unisex Peter Pan with a black fro-let. I admit that I had some difficulty staggering through my explanation of that to my 8 year old daughter, who likes Michael Jackson but doesn't understand why he "changed" so much.A few notables:"Thriller". Back when this first came out, I was in Jr. High school and MTV was IT...of course, I had to get the DVD just to see Thriller on TV, even though I could watch it on YouTube on TV. It's better on DVD in my opinion. It's just an astonishing 13 minute mini-movie. I still can't believe the genius of it, even to this day."Billie Jean" -brilliant. Somewhat elegant in it's simplicity as a video."Beat It" -great song, dance moves and a great message.I love "Black or White" but the beginning of the video is just weird with Macaulay Culkin and his "parents". Seeing the neighborhood kids on a stoop with MJ wasn't exactly comfortable for me but I try to watch it without thinking of what MJ was accused of and what we all know from his trials. The rest of the video, especially with the morphing of the faces from one ethnicity/sex to the other is always visually arresting though and was flawlessly done.This is a good video investment and a nice selection for the cost.

My daughter loved this comforter! It was soft, and the twin fit my daughter's twin bed perfectly. However, in the picture, it shows 2 sham pillows, there was only one sham pillow cover. But the decorative pillow was very cute. I recommend it!

Bigger than I thought. The size is buried in the product details and the photos don't show much with anything to put it's size in perspective. I was surprised how big it was, and it's a decent size. It is also a substantial weight and well designed. I guess I was thinking it was just going to be a novelty burlap bag that looked cool with the graphics, but it's a lot more. It's a serious storage product. The burlap weight is heavy duty. The inside liner is thick and can be removed for washing, which is a good thing sometimes, like when you leave vegetables untouched too long and they go rotten. The cinch string closes securely. I'm hanging it off a hook instead of laying it on the floor of our pantry. I'm guessing a dozen or so onions would fit nicely. I believe it's actually worth the price since it looks like it will last a long time and part of the money goes to Education without Borders.

All the look, feel and performance of a precision designed, high quality product. It's hard to imagine any of these 3 tools could be made any better. The scissors close easy and smooth yet you can feel the blades just touching all the way up and down the length of the blades, making a nice, clean cut. The slightly curved scissor tips allow you to get into tight spots cut what you target. The nail file has a stiff blade with evenly dispersed metal "sand" with the perfect density of coarseness. Doesn't look like it will ever wear down. The tweezers are that rare find that seem to be able to grab even the smallest nub of hair and be able to firmly grip it as you pull it out. I don't know why it's included in what appears to be a nail grooming kit, but it's the one thing I needed most.The black case is thick enough to last forever and has a nice, smooth black low cut felt lining. The black crystal badge is nothing special, but if it's a gift, I guess adds to the effect. Is it worth the cost? Well, they definitely are the best tools you can find, and if there's someone on your list that already has everything, and you can afford it, it might be a nice addition to their collection. I would say it's good as a travel kit, but I'm afraid some vigilant airport security guard might consider the tools a risk.

One of the key issues we've had with Lighting cables is the lack of protection where the wire meets the phone connector. Perhaps by Apple requirements, it seem like all Lighting cables have insufficient reinforcements at the point that takes all the moving force and, over time, the plastic sheathing wears through and exposes the metal wire. While these AmazonBasics still have less reinforcement that most non-Apple cables, it is still better than most. It looks to me like these wires will last longer than some others.The wire flexibility and length is good for our needs. My wife is the only one with an iPhone in our house. We have 3 Android phones that use regular USB cables. What she likes about the AmazonBasics cable is that it has their logo on the phone end, so she knows if she sees a white cable with the logo on it, among the several other non-Apple white USB cables bunched near the charging station, she knows it's hers.So far, so good. I will update if any problems develop.

Charges reliably. I like the (on-at-night, lower brightness) nightlight feature. Full brightness casts a usable light on a wide area. Definitely a good product to place over areas you wish lit up at night when you came that way. Good bang for the buck. The only thing I give it a knock for is the sensitivity range of the motion detector. I wish it picked up motion sooner so it could light up the area sooner as you approach. Otherwise, I believe this is as good a product as exists for it's intended use.

Professional weight, materials and construction. Built to last. Looks like something you'd find in a medical office. Super heavy base plate. Large area glass and excellent magnification strength. Even lighting with a nice range of brightness levels that make it useful as a desk lamp. Looks like B+D just puts their name on this product, but I can see why they'd want it in their line up for DIY repairers. The main issues dropping it to 4 stars have to do with range of motion. It does not swing towards and away from you (horizontal motion), and the vertical arc it travels from the base is limited. I wish it had more flexibility. In addition, while you will get used to using the on/off and light level mechanism, it's placement is easy to accidentally hit when you go to move the magnifier end.Overall, a solidly built light that could use a few more design improvements to make it a near perfect lighted magnifier.

Really soft, meaning the sides and back are not rigid, but that's ok with me. Makes them very comfortable. They are just a tiny bit larger than expected but that's ok for this time of year, meaning as fall approaches I will begin wearing socks, so the tiny bit of extra size will accommodate my socks better. If it's summer and/or you plan not to wear them with socks, it would be a very close call. Without socks they are a bit loose but they stay on my feet with no problem. I probably would not risk going a size smaller, but if you prefer them feeling more secure on your foot, you may go a half size smaller. Really close call.I owned a Fryre brand driving shoe before this and the construction held up well. These appear to have the same quality of construction, so I hope they hold up, as well. The design is a classic loafer/boat shoe. I could probably do without the specks in the rubber sole, but I guess they needed to make it look different somehow. So far I really like them.

The main thing I noticed is how light the razor is. I haven't owned one in a while but I recall them being heavier. Battery technology must have come a long way. The other thing I like is the design. Seems to be perfectly proportioned, balanced and curved. Blade strength and vibration is fast and strong. Seems solidly built. Battery lasts a long time. The trimmer is great for a lot of things.Electric shavers are best used everyday; they can't mow down a growth of several days very well. The closeness and smoothness of this razor is as good as any I have used in the past. I don't know if much more can be done with electric razor technology to make them any closer or smoother. So, if electrics are your thing, this one is a well designed and engineered example of current electric razor technology.

Simple and effective. While it does seem somewhat "cheap" (lightweight plastic), it none the less performs as advertised. I like the uniform water coverage. The regular spray works fine for me, but the more intense mode is not as strong as some "massager" modes found on other shower heads. I assume it has something to do with lower water usage. I say assume because I found no print materials in the box I received, which isn't unusual for Vine (free to review) products. The Amazon product page title says it is water saving, but that's it (the seller should clarify the water usage specs on this product). Still, I'm satisfied. One option to direct more water on you is to turn the head 90 degrees so the water comes out more vertically over you. How it holds up remains to be seen, but, so far, so good.

The main difference in this product versus before is the attachment clip. Otherwise, the fabric and quality of the elastic band itself is the same high quality product we are used to. The clip replaces the metal, sharp pointed clips known by generations of Ace bandage users. An advantage is there is only one clip. A disadvantage is there is only one clip, meaning if you lose it, you have nothing to hold the bandage together with, unlike the 2 metal clips, where if you lose one (and who hasn't?) you still have one to secure the bandage.The "Ace Clip" uses 1/3 of the width of this 4" bandage. It seems disproportionately large and doesn't curve with the bandage, awkwardly sticking out a bit, possibly getting snagged on something. You sandwich the end piece of the bandage fabric between the clip "tongue" and the clip frame. Since the clip tongue is just a tad longer than the clip frame, it requires force to power the tongue (and fabric) past the frame and get "stuck" on the other side. It does hold securely, but it is really hard to hold the clip and get the leverage you need to perform this procedure, especially with one hand. So, if you are applying the bandage yourself, you're going to end trying to get the thing fastened using 2 hands, and end up wishing you had some easy to use, old fashioned metal clips.The other end of the Ace Clip, the end that gets stretched and placed in a position on top of the bandage fabric to hold the bandage tight, is made of a strip of velcro-style gripping material, and holds onto the fabric just fine. Now, I'm no engineer, but it seems to me a more user friendly, and just as workable, solution would have been to make both ends out of the familiar, easy to use velcro-style gripping material. The Ace Clip is not intuitive to understand, bulky, awkward, hard to apply with one hand (and not much easier with 2) and requires more force than some people are going to like. Seems like an over engineered solution, but if this is what they are going to make us use, I guess in a couple of generations we'll get used to it (or find a supplier of metal clips).

I'm impressed! I actually have a newly planted lawn growing (from seed) and there are weeds growing among the grass. I had tried selectively dabbing weed killer on them, but that takes forever and you can also kill surrounding grass. I tried this product on the weeds one day, and they next day you could clearly see the weeds wilting. The next day they were turning brown, and the surrounding grass is fine. This is especially good since the grass is still young and some "grass friendly" weed killers say not to apply to new grass.One ding I will give the product is its package. I have used other Ortho products with the same spray nozzle and it always leaks all over your hand. I wish they'd come up with a better one.So, it works fast and effectively and does not kill the grass, as advertised, but the nozzle stinks.

This is my first experience with home cinema and I'm glad I did it. I almost didn't go for this. I tried to cancel my request for this product, but they sent it anyway. Now, the reason I tried to cancel it is because, not having a home cinema before, or knowing anyone who did, after I clicked to order it, I started to realize I would need a bunch of other products to go with it in order for it work. I also wasn't sure how it connected to my AV system. After I got delivery of it, I then went and spent a couple of hundred dollars for a QualGear QG-PM-002-BLK Universal Projector Ceiling Mount, 50 foot KabelDirekt (40 feet) HDMI Cable and a VonHaus 100" 16:9 Widescreen Manual Projection Screen.Setting it all up was time consuming but did not require any special skills. Hanging the manual pull down screen (I now wish I bought a motorized one) from my ceiling with hooks was easier for me because I have a wood ceiling. The ceiling mount wasn't too bad once you know which parts you need, and running the HDMI cable wasn't too hard either, especially using Command Round Cord Clips.Once I figured out how to set my AV receiver so that it used the Epson, and I figured out how to rotate the picture orientation on the Epson (because the unit hangs from the ceiling upside down), it worked pretty much right out of the box. I just had to make a few adjustments to center the picture, and there it was! I was thinking there would be no way a projected image was going to look better than on my plasma tv big screen, but I was really shocked to see just how good the screen projected image was. The screen area is probably 2.5 times bigger than my 50" tv screen, and the level of detail, sharpness, and color accuracy is amazing. It is nearly as good as my plasma, but you'd have to consciously look for the difference (like looking at a pure white image section, you could make out some screen material graininess and wrinkles). I am really blown away by the image quality!The machine itself is pretty simple to use. There are not a lot of top level settings to go through, but you can dig deeper and find a lot of detailed settings if you really know your stuff. I found the remote to be pretty intuitive to use. The machine does have a fan, but it is fairly soft and easily overtaken by the sound system. It does take a few minutes to warm up. One thing I was concerned about but then pleasantly surprised by was that it uses 350 watts; my plasma tv uses 690! It also does not display the screen text from my AV receiver, so I cannot see things like sound volume level or effect settings (I'm not sure, but that may be a characteristic of my AV receiver). However, what I did was set my AV receiver to send the signal to both the plasma and Epson so I can turn on the plasma if I want to see the AV receiver settings. I also need to keep the plasma tv available for daytime viewing because the Epson is terrible in daylight. I also don't always want to watch such a huge image. I have this in my living room, viewing from about 12 to 14 feet, and it sometimes seems like I'm sitting in the front row at the movie theater. Still, for big budget action movies, connected to my 7.1 AV system, the experience is awesome! My only wish is that the machine casing was black, not white. It's too visible hanging from my ceiling.Again, I have never owned a home theater protection system before or have much to compare it to. Maybe other, lower priced projectors would have had the effect on me. All I know is the the specs on this machine seem to be way up there, and even though the price tag seems big, if you compare it to a high end TV, it's reasonable (but you'll still need the TV for daytime). My final conclusion is I am glad I took the plunge and got this thing. It's a whole new viewing and entertainment experience now in my home. I'm also looking forward to outdoor movie night come summer.

My uses are mostly indoor and as a means to get better sound into my camcorder and movies on my DSLR camera. It provides a much better sound quality in my camcorder by replacing the camcorder's mic with my own setup. I can see this is built to be used on the move, as the only power is from the batteries. In my home use of it, I have not had any battery issues. I am using Amazon Basics 2000mAh rechargeables and they have lasted me quite well. Mounting the unit for use under a camera worked fine for me. I have used all the inputs and outputs a different times. It took me a little reading to figure out the various stereo/mono record modes, but once understood I know what to do. The mixer only has left/right and balance, no reverb. Having the preamp built in saves me from having to use the one I have and I absolutely love the fact it asks me first if I want to turn on the phantom power (I sometimes use a ribbon mic and it just scares me the possibility I forget or someone else turns it on). The Quick button makes access to often used features (gain, EQ, et al). The sound quality is great and I have not had any issues with unwanted outside noises creeping in. Kind of weird to see Tascam still uses the old USB connector size and not the near ubiquitous micro size. As a mobile unit, I can see where it might be worth the price. However, I also own a Tascam DP-008EX, which costs less and can also serve my purposes. But, it doesn't have a pre amp, it's a more complicated to figure out (it has more features and capabilities), and the way the DR-60DmkII mounts on a tripod is very convenient. The DR-60mkII is a simpler device. It's extra cost, I assume, is because of its mounting feature and a feature set dedicated to video camera work.

If you were going to drop almost $1,000 on a vacuum, this would be a pretty good choice. The German design and manufacture (yes, it's made in Germany) is top notch. Solid materials, heavy duty construction, built to last, for sure. Thought through pretty well.Pros:1) Really good materials. The metal tube is thick and heavy, but no so much it's hard to move around. Plastic parts are thick and substantial. You can tell it's going to last a few lifetimes2) Good sized buttons, knobs and grips. No skimping on the things you use all the time3) Very strong suction. You can feel it sucking down deep into the carpet. It has electronic buttons for multiple suction strength settings (which, to be honest, could be just as easily achieved manually. I owned an old Electrolux that had a sliding plastic ring on the suction tube that could let air in a varying number of holes to weaken the suction, but for this price point, Miele's going to turn that ability into a electronically controlled one, I guess). When set to high, it noticeably sucks up all fur stuck on a low pile rug. On the lowest setting, I can clean crumbs off a table cloth easily4) Nice attachment selection. There are 3 on board smaller attachments for crevice, dusting and hard surfaces. The Parquet Twister attachment sounds like just a fancy marketing term for a hard floor head attachment, but it does slide really smoothly, twists and turns nicely, and picks up a lot of fur in the brushes. It fits nicely under furniture, too. Well thought through. The only thing included that lives up to the "Cat and Dog" labeling (and this appears to be the only feature they, themselves, highlight as it having any special abilities to clean up after your dog and cat) is the Mini Turbo Brush attachment. I love these things for cleaning fur off of upholstery. I previously wrote about the usefulness of these types of tools (it's not unique to Miele) when I reviewed the $140 BISSELL CleanView Complete Pet Rewind. Of course, the $950 Miele version is far superior5) The main spinning brush head is big and effective. It has 1 foot operated up and down adjustments (keep pushing and the height level cycles through each position, up and down, endlessly) and 1 foot operated pedal the unlock the handle from standing up (and it stays upright pretty stable when you park it). One feature I discovered, that I have never seen before, is the brush automatically stops spinning if you accidentally suck up something that jams it (anyone remember belt driven models that would start to smoke?)6) Rolls over different floor levels easily7) Very quiet. The motor unit is nearly silent. Most of the noise comes from the suction heads8) Uses bags. One characteristic with bagless vacuums is they are VERY messy to clean and hard keep clean. They also spread dust back into the air when you empty them. Bags are way cleaner and easier to useCons:1) Price. I will say this, however: with Miele, what you are paying for is more the product quality and performance than a trendy name, like Dyson products, which are made in Asia. You can be assured that a German made product is made to last. In fact, their sales points say they are made to last 20 years (though, for some reason, the warranty only runs 1 year overall, and 7 and 10 years for certain parts)2) Some people say the flexible tubing is too short. I'm ok with it, but I can see how some might think so3) Uses bags. One thing I quickly noticed with a bagless vacuum (with a see-through canister) is just how quickly pet fur accumulates. Because of this, you can imagine you'll go through bags quicker. I am still on my first one, but I can see it is filling up quickly. I already bought Miele replacement bags, which (brace yourself) run almost $5 a piece! To be fair, these are really high quality bags, with extra filtration features, and you get 2 other filters used by the machine along with the bags. I bought the Miele brand first, but I have a feeling I'm going to switch to the much cheaper 3M Filtrete version, which don't have all the features of the Miele, but will do the trick.I did not touch on all the various filtration features this machine (and bag) has, which I'm sure works well, because that is not a major concern with our household. I'm sure other reviewers can provide insights.Overall, I am very pleased with the quality and performance of this product. I did, however, get it for free to review. You will have to consider if the price is worth it, but I can assure you that the quality and performance of this product will not disappoint.

From what I was able to hear, they sounded fine, but they did not connect to the device I bought them for. Connected to my Samsung S3 phone and my Dell computer (after several tries), but would not connect to my Onkyo TR NX636 after at least 10 attempts. Followed all instructions. Sent e-mail to Ausdom support (they have no telephone number). The site said they respond within 48 hours; it's been 8 days and I haven't heard from them. Sent them back for refund.The headphones are very light and feel cheap and don't cut out outside noise well. But, I really only wanted them to be able to listen to my TV without disturbing anyone else, and for that they fit the bill. Customer support, however, leaves much to be desired.

This is my first screen, so I can't compare it to anything else. Heavy, solid, appears well made, extremely well packaged. Screen hangs nicely, though it has a few waves in the middle that are hard to detect when in use. As far as the quality of the picture, to me it looks great, but, again, I have nothing to compare it to.The main complaints are going to be the smell, which takes a few days left open to get rid of, and the difficulty getting it to roll back up. The secret to getting it to roll is you have to lift up on it as it rebounds, so that there is no weight at all pulling down on the screen. You have to, in effect, "push" it back in. Of course, if it's hanging from the ceiling, like mine, the best way to do it is to get a chair or stool and as it starts to roll up, keep "ahead" of it by lifting it faster than it is rolling back in. With a little practice, it's not so bad. But, I think I'll invest in an electric one next.Good for the price.

Any time you can get a range extender with a pass though outlet, it's good, but this has a couple of caveats. One, it's a 3 pronged plug. You could use an adapter on your 2 prong outlet, but since this thing is 2" from wall by itself, so you may end up sticking way out there.  Second, if you plug it in the bottom outlet the top of this thing doesn't cover any part of the top outlet, but it does encroach right up to it, so a big plug on the top outlet will probably get blocked out.I set it up as described, linking it directly to my main router. The WPS matching worked fine and the signal worked nicely. When you match up to your router, the wireless connection you see when you scan is the same name as the router. What I ended up do was placing it further away in my house, where the signal to my router was weak. The extender could connect to it, but it was still a weak signal. So, what I did was match the extender up with a repeater I use in the middle of the house. The repeater does a good job, but the signal where I placed this extender wasn't full strength. When I matched up the extender to the repeater, I got a very strong signal and now I can enjoy faster speeds through it.This extender also has a port for an ethernet connection, which also works fine. But, what I discovered was, this extender is not a powerline adapter. I happen to have my home connected using all TPLink brand powerline adapters, as well, and when I tried matching this extender up to the powerline adapter network, it wasn't possible. So if that is something you thought this could do, it can't.So, what this is is a pretty good wireless extender with the convenience of a pass through power outlet, but it is not powerline capable. I have tried many brands of wireless and powerline products and TPLink is the brand I have consolidated around. So, I am expecting good things from it.

I guess you need direct current to get the ability to smoothly ramp up and down between low and high speeds, and be able to select any speed you want in between. It's a really neat ability and bound to be a welcome feature for those who like their fan speed "just right." In terms quietness, it's probably as quiet as a 7" fan can get. I don't think it's possible to be really quiet with such small blades, but I don't think you can say this is a loud fan. it's probably about what you would expect.
