Plus, the set is put together by people with developmental issues, and that means a lot to me...my daughter is on the autistic spectrum. This clay set is helping us heal and made May's death easier to deal with. Four paws up.

I need caffeine like no tomorrow. Just like someone else stated, these actually have green coffee bean extract to give you that kick. At first I was not thrilled with the flavor, but it grew on me. I taste primarily the stevia, ginger, and, of course, the hibiscus. You just add one powder tube to sixteen ounces of water, add ice, and you are off. They are a bit pricey, even at discount stores. Do not share!

Frankly, this is the one we purchase because it is so readily seen in discount stores (i.e.Walmart and Target). As soon as July hits, these bottles are everywhere for the taking for teachers and germaphobics alike. It does smell mostly of alcohol, but I am not trying to impress anyone. It evaporates quickly, but if your hand is already even slightly damp during application, it can get tacky. Price is excellent at the above mentioned stores.General info:-Do not use on babies.-Can hurt wood and some fabrics.-We had ours for a year and a half before it expired.-When ours expired, there was only half an inch left in our 30 fluid oz. bottle after heavy use.The main reason I am reviewing this stuff is because I owe it a lot. I have fed stray cats for years, and this stuff has protected me so far from picking up any strange maladies from them. More importantly, my daughter's kidneys failed last spring. She did get three more illnesses quickly after that - two general kid viruses from schoolmates, and C. diff. This sanitizer prevented us from passing anything else to her. After all that, all I can say is that I love it and support it.

I have been on the hunt for several years now for comfy, affordable, strong socks. Pathetic, but that's life. We used to be "Hanes" devotees, but they decreased the cotton in their socks, thus rendering them less powerful, sweaty, uncomfy, etc. I then used "Target/Circo" socks, which are great for my older kid, but my younger kid is very picky. She complains about the inner seam in Circo socks where possibly the toe is sewed up with the upper portion. Picky, but helping her is helping me not obtaining another sock before the school bus arrives. So, I decided to go with these, and the picky kid is happy. She says their comfy, and they have less or no thread clumps on the inside toe. Just wanted to let people know this in case their kid is...picky.

I am always using the word "shocked" in reviews. I have to use it once more. I am shocked that these little suckers weren't good! I was so excited when I discovered that my husband had not ingested the whole bag in one evening; I was ready for sweet nirvana. What I got was a mid-placed tier in hell. Since they are so small, all you taste is the Dove. When you do get a hint of berry, it tastes of something sweet with a touch of decomposition. Ditto for the cranberry ones, too.For scientific purposes, I experimented while writing this review:1. Even choosing a larger berry on purpose did not increase the pleasure- nuthin' goin' on but chocolate.2. Closing my eyes while chewing did not work, either.3.Neither did washing my mouth out just in case past coffee was somehow screwin' up the taste buds.Stats: Choco is dark, bag is small (2.38 oz), 190 calories and 9 grams of fat per serving (2), sugar and salt is involved. Milk and soy are hanging out, possibly with all peanuts, nuts, and wheat.Don't get me wrong, the choco is great, but we paid for the starring berries, too, so I want action. See me in my upcoming role in which I throw this candy of a cliff in "Review Hard, Part Three", coming to a screen near you.

Same for me- totally wow! I do not like cherries at all, not even as a "Kool Aid" flavor. However, these are great, even for a non-cherry devotee. The chocolate is not too milky, you can taste the real cherries, and they are not too chewy at all. They are expensive, as someone else stated. We get ours at Target. Target has a great selection of upper crust chocolates, and we do treat ourselves about twice a month. Treat yourself, too!

Shockingly good. I am not a fan of chocolate covered nuts, but I decided to try one, and fell in love. My husband ate the whole bag way too quickly. I got like five. You can taste the sea salt, too. And the milk chocolate is a perfect compliment. May contain peanuts and other tree nuts. Eleven pieces are 220 calories. Get only for yourself and do not share.

Yeah, they got "snap", but who the heck can detect molasses with all that ginger going on? Oddly enough, even with all that ginger going on, they have a strange metallic under-note...something that you cannot put your finger on, unless it is the iron in the molasses or it is "second" molasses. Even more oddly, these cookies have more molasses in 'em than ginger! They are so hard that I wished for Neandertal teeth. I know that traditionally ginger snaps are hard, but these are so hard that the military can use them as dangerous projectiles. I have also noticed that within supermarkets that Nabisco prices have gotten ridiculously high, so keep that in mind when purchasing that brand. Contain wheat and soy. Watch "Ginger Snaps", the werewolf movie, in order to fulfill your craving.

My seven-year-old daughter requested these vitamins, and my husband shocked me by buying them. I figured I would go with the flow, and just let her keep them this once. To my surprise, she detested these vitamins. I tried one to see what the problem was, and I was even more surprised when I first discovered that they are not bad at all. Kids today are not in the know about that hard strawberry candy with the strawberry wrapper and the strawberry filling. Yes- if you did not get that- the strawberry candy. The ones that senior citizens hand out on Halloween, and that kids toss from their candy pile in full mistrust. So, me being forty-one- I can tell you...that is what these vitamins taste like. There is a bitter aftertaste, which no one would enjoy. They are expensive, and on top of that you have to take two daily. Plus, they seem easy to possibly choke on. They are hard, rounded like an egg, and smooth. Not for kids under five, and the colors and flavors are natural. They do belong in the stone age.

I bought this candle because it was on sale in the YC store in our local mall. I am terrible at explaining scents- I like it a lot, and while I am sure glass found on the beach is unscented, I do smell a tropical fruit combined with lily-of-the-valley. It smells great in the jar, is not overwhelming, but, oddly enough, when burnt it is not strong enough to conquer questionable air. Standard YCs usually do a good job at scenting rooms. This candle burns pretty quick. What concerns me the most is that burning- the wide, wooden wick crackled a lot at first, then dwindled its noise factor after more use, then transformed into a torch. Meaning- it burns really hard, and you have to babysit this candle. I have even cut the wick, and to no avail. I love warm light, but not danger. Go with the standard YC jars.
Only three stars due to strong scent. Still "works" great. You just have to definitely be a shea butter fan to fall in love with it. Go with the body wash for a more subtle scent.

Such a cute idea...you get a couple smaller-than-usual Swedish fish, plus their "eggs"- small, gumdrop-like pieces that come in lemon, orange, blue raspberry, and lime. I would buy these suckers all year! Fat free, and made in Canada. The caviar of the candy world.

So cute. Adults love, and kids do, too. Does smell like candy apple. Use will not turn your mitts into crusty, ol' bear paws. I love winter imagery on products and using said products past winter to prolong the beauty of it. O.K., O.K., so what if it was on sale? I do love winter, I tell you, even though I have to police heaters and cringe every time someone coughs in public. Speaking of which, just use this soap when you get home from shopping, and you will be pacified, while at the same time committing germicide. Thanks, BaBW, for balancing my life.

I am usually not a fan of dessert scents, but this one was on sale, and I threw caution to the wind. It smells exactly as it looks, with orange notes to boot. Your mouth will even water due to the powdered sugar that you can smell. Pretty bottle. Hands did not dry out, as they do with other soaps. We all deserve sweet hands, so go for it.

Fell in love with this scent in-store. Later, I thought I coined the word "manitizer" before anyone else, but a men's toiletries company beat me to the punch. Anyway, I did purchase this scent eventually, and I now regret it. It smells of men's cologne, circa 1988. Very strong. Very wrong.

Finally, a past affordable "Jackson"- you had to be in a certain store at the right time to find him...before Xmas of 2014; ___mart. Shoes stay on, but come off with ease. Same for outfit. Has two cuffs- one will stay on as long as the hand does, the other can fall off easily. Do not remove clear band that keeps cuffs on, in that case. Has permanent eyebrow ring. Glasses are sturdy enough for older gals, but not for fourish ones. Yellow streak in hair; coifed very nicely. Bends at knee and elbow. Love the fact that he has never been to Malibu. Included matching bracelet for kid is a sweet touch. The included flyer with Frankie's (Frankenstein gal that he has a crush on) pic is very small and not durable at all- it is glossy paper. Same for sign- cheaply executed. Some people like minute details and I provide them. Comes with stand, too. If emo was a doll, this would be it (at least from the neck up).

We take care of two stray cats and their cronies, so I depend on bleach to disinfect anything that comes in possible contact with said cats. The other day, a towel that my dog lays on got mixed in somehow with people towels, and this dog towel touched my face when I smelled it trying to figure out the problem (i.e.why a certain towel that seemed to smell funny was with other towels).  At that moment, with dog tush on my pores, I was glad bleach was on hand. Not to mention the human towels that have embraced certain tight spots on us humans. And, last but not least, we once had c. diff hangin' around, and bleach knocks it dead. So, I depend on it for other things as well. Spashless bleach sounds great, because if you are a doof like me, it is not flying around the laundry room bleaching your favorite shirt that is air-drying. However, splashless bleach is not dependable. Today, after I washed shoes that had been affected by dog poop, I finally decided to look at the label to read the directions. I saw in very, very, very, small writing: "Does not sanitize or disinfect". Imagine that horror. Imagine me horrifically imagining writing this review. Read this pre-, present, and post imagined review and live the horror.Update on 11/11/15: Added one star for makin' stuff smell good; see comments.

Sometimes you can taste the mint, sometimes you can't. That's the only way I can explain it. Plus, they are very hard. You cannot just bite into one during a cookie fit. If you did, you might chip a tooth. Find an alternative.

This thing works great. While I am still getting over the demise of "Plug-Ins", I know that I have to move on. This was on sale, so we went for it. It is very easy to get the fragrance refill in. There are three settings for you to choose from, and even the lowest setting does a great job of giving off scent in any size room. Don't ask- for some reason, it does great no matter what the square footage is. So well that I have to unplug it sometimes so I do not get a headache. And that's on the lowest setting. Just getting that out there for sensitive people. Can even fit sideways electrical sockets with just a twist. I chose the "Beach Walk" scent with my set (in a mall), and I discovered that I am not crazy about that scent. It smelled better in the store, and I cannot pick up notes of beachiness at all...it just smells like a general, perfumed scent. Not horrific, just not my style. This bird scent-plug also comes in yellow. Very cute and, uh, smelly.

I got a set of this stuff for my older daughter years ago, and she never wanted to use it. So, I saved it for my younger daughter, who is newly seven. Well, the older kid freaked and would not let us use it; insisting that she would use it. Mind you, it sat in a closet for a few years. So, I went ahead and got this set. A bit pricey for what you get and for the time it takes to make these creations, but I wanted my younger daughter to be happy. Once you engage the use of the "Whipple", you have to use it right away, so the fun lasts for about half an hour. Basically, you are piping false frosting. Instructions are included on how to make different "shapes", but I just let my kid have fun. I do wish it came with a bit more bling, but you do get the cool leaf and cherry beads. I would have also loved to see at least two smaller bags of different colored frosting for variety. You can also add your own beads and bling, as we did. Do not get wet. Comes with three chains to make keychains. Depending on how you make them, some will be more delicate. Donuts are soft plastic. Biggest one is two inches across. Set includes: the chains, three donuts, three cookies, pink frosting, thirteen rhinestones, twelve beads, four pearls, and instructions. Hope this comes back in another incarnation somehow.

At first, I was going to go with a much more expensive set, until I saw that this product was sporting the official "Shrinky Dinks" logo. As soon as I saw that, I was in. Price is very affordable. No cutting, just coloring. No rules about using only the included pencils, but I have not experimented with our own as of yet. You get a good amount of everything to make stuff- beads, barrettes, hoops, adhesive dots, elastic string which I think we had trouble tying, and eight pencils in bright colors. Instructions are included, and there are even video ones if you need 'em. Just be patient when baking- as soon as they lie completely flat, they are done. I bake ours on a piece of foil on the cookie sheet, then save the sheet for next time. Everything can fit in a sandwich Baggie. Timeless fun.

Overpriced for what you get. Have to place included stickers into makeup cases yourself. Top of bigger case fell off immediately and cannot be placed back on. Cute, but poor quality. My daughters have the "Dairy Queen" sets and an "OPI" set; those sets are just fine (they paid). Pass.

So my eleven-year-old wanted the "Bedhead" brand of wavers. Problem is, the price for that one is high and my kid is young with small hands. Heck, my hands are small. I knew I would be the one doing the grunt work anyway, so I decided to get this Conair mini waver. So glad I did! The price is right, and it is the perfect size for hobbits. I read the reviews on this critter a few times before purchase, and decided that people will never agree on waving vs. crimping. Crimping is very tight and geometrical- check out the pic at "Wikipedia"- while waves are loose and curl-like. Like, well, waves. The tools are entirely different as well- a crimper has triangular plates, while a waver has curved plates. Whether or not you want to say if certain waves are beachy or not is up to you...I think it depends on the humidity and a person's hair. I have had minor waves and major waves after beach trips of about the same length, so it can definitely vary. I did my younger daughter's fine hair, and my own tougher hair, and ended up with the same results. Waves do not depend on a time factor- less or more heat time gives the same results as well. For some reason, my waves were gone in the morning, while my kid's were still present. Waves even lasted a week on my older daughter's locks. Anyway, anyone younger than thirteen will probably get burnt using this waver. Gets hot quick and stays hot. Does not turn off by itself. Has cord and on/off switch. If pics do not help, let me know. Can redo. What you see is what you get. Go get pretty.

Promises the "shatter" look, but did not deliver. Like a previous reviewer stated, polish starts to come off after several hours. Dries fast, but in order to get the above mentioned look, you have to polish your nail with a light color first, then put this polish over it, then you get to be disappointed. Did not work well. Polish does not have an expiration date. Too good to be true. If you must, you can pick this polish up at "Big Lots".

Would avoid. Wings are not sturdy. Bigger than standard "Littlest Pet Shops". Takes two button batteries. For adult collectors- small kids will demolish it in two minutes flat. How I pine for the second gen of "LPS".

My daughter acquired c. diff last spring of 2014, and our doc told us to get probiotics. The brand she suggested was not at "Whole Foods"; this brand was suggested by an employee. Fantastic. Knocked c. diff out within one month. Once a day, I open the capsule and dump it in a beverage. I have added it to milk, juice, and root beer. I investigated if carbonation affects the probiotic; we also got a brand recently that stated on the label not to add (the) probiotic to acidic stuff, but I have added it to both types of these bevs, and like I said- the c. diff is gone (still not sure about the carbonation thing; we had to get a different brand due to unavailability of above probiotic once). Has to be kept cold. Can travel for six hours in cool car on ice until you get to fridge, but that's it. Can be frozen. Still taking it for general health support. This stuff changed our life. Get it.Extra stuff:-Take after a meal.-Do not take two different probiotics at the same time.-If you miss a few days, it is O.K.-If you have to switch over to a different probiotic, that is O.K. to do.Update on 8/28/15: Hi! I contacted Udo's and asked them two things:1."Can you take a probiotic every other day?"2."Do acidic and carbonated beverages affect the probiotic's potency when the probiotic is added to these beverages?".The answers:1. According to Udo's, no. They suggest you to take it even three times a day! There was a lot of talk about probiotics in general that I did not understand. I am going to ask my pediatrician so I can try to save money. If you want more details, just ask me.2. No. Feel free to add the probiotic to these drinks.Updated Answer to Question 1: Yes. On October 12, 2015, a nurse at our pediatrician's office said it is fine to take a probiotic every other day. You will have plenty of it in your gut to do its job. No worries!

Yo, at first I figured that there was no point even reviewing these cookies, as there are many reviews, but what the heck...I love to express. These cookies are so dry that you can use them as an aid in constructing walls. I started choking on a single crumb, which I now know is possible. When I told my husband how bad these were, he did not like that. He had just polished off a bag. I started to bring the bag over to the 'puter as a visual reminder to review, and he stated not to- that the crumbs could fall out and get everywhere. The crumbs and broken bits at the bottom of said bag could be reconstituted into at least eight cookies. I told him that was my proof of how dry they are. I will say that I do not think that they are rock-hard like other reviewers. I will also say that these cookies were bought right off a shelf, not through Amazon. If you want someone to expire soon, give them one of these cookies.

I always craved these as a kid because my mom was not a "Nilla" devotee. They are in fact simply delicious- not too sugary, not too vanilla-y: they are perfect. Great as a snack for tikes; will not send them climbing the walls. The only reason I removed one star is because the bag they come in rips way too easily. This happens every time I purchase them, and if you do not notice, they will go stale. If you do notice, then you have to schlep out a container to keep them in. Nabisco: change the bag and I will change the stars.

Just got these last night from a store similar to Marshall's for six bucks. Not even worth that. They fall right out of your ear, even with your correct earbud rubber casing size. Bud cords designed for mic use (one side is shorter), but that is no biggie unless you are really picky. Do not purchase.

Did jack for me. I believe that it actually sets stains even more somehow. I am sticking to my homemade version. I used that on pizza after the Shout did not totally remove the stains, and it worked great, as usual. Just tried on chocolate ice cream, and it only lightened the stain- did not remove it. Glad it was gifted upon me and I did not waste my money.Update: Hey, unhelpful voters, see my review on "Fab" for my "Great Stain Remover Experiment of 2015". If that doesn't help, I don't know what will.

As usual, Playmobil is at the top of the heap. Case is very sturdy, closes easily, and snugly. Good for travel. You can actually dress the gals and even put stuff in the display case. Price is the same at "Toys R Us".  Great value for what you get in this set. You get everything that you see in the above pic. Nice details at a nice price.

Gorgeous, huh? This is the one that my daughter craved, so we fulfilled her wishes, not ours. I not only write reviews, I read 'em. I told my kid that this bag is beautiful, but not durable. Several college gals stated this in reviews, and when you investigate used ones, they are always worn in some, same way (bottom wear, stains, jacked handle) which makes purchasing a generally used one undesirable. Ones barely used but in excellent condition are priced far too high by greedy sellers. Onwards- lo and behold my daughter had to bring home a huge book- two pounds, 2" thick, 8.25" wide, and 10.25" in length. Could she carry it in this bag? No. Did I assess the situation in order to see if said book could go into bag and decide that it could? No. No kidding- I was scared to put this book into the bag. I felt that the book would weaken the bag and hasten its throes. I am even afraid to put it on the floor, so it has its own chair. My kid carries very light stuff in this bag right now, but I will update this review if that ever changes...if her teachers hand out hardbound text books suddenly. I will say that it has a lot of mostly great pockets and comfy straps. I also want to say that I will get a used but hopefully intact and non-pricey one for myself because I cannot find an adult packpack that does not scream "sporty" or "juvenile". I just cannot scream, "Wow!".Pros:-Easy on the eyes.-Prints appeal to adults.-Tough, smooth-moving zippers.-Comfy, adjustable straps.-Back padded laptop pocket with special protection pad held in place with Velcro, general middle pocket, small front pocket with storage compartments (zip pocket, 2 ID/card pockets, 4 pencil pockets, non-zip pocket).-Washable.Cons:-External, side waterbottle pockets are too narrow (standard bottles cannot fit).-Not rain proof. (Does have an inner liner, but not sure if it is functional. It is very light. Will update this review if it performs wonderfully.)-Not stain proof.-Cannot hold heavy stuff.-Not durable.(i.e.All above cons equal one unrealistic, unusuable bag for everyday use.)Update on 8/27/15: My daughter's backpack is lookin' great. However, she has even more to carry this year. Getting it all to school was a hassle, as getting even one three-ring binder (not sure if it was 1" or 1.5"; it was borrowed) was tough. There was only new folders, a few standard spirals, a pencil case/bag, and a softbound, thick book alraedy in her bag when I had to place the binder in. Other binders she had to carry by hand one day, with her pencil bag to boot. Definitely not roomy.

I have been eatin' these babies since I was a tot, so that makes it thirty-six years. No, wait, minus five vegan years. Anyway, if they have ever changed the recipe, I never noticed. Even just one hits the spot, but if you feel like going crazy, you will not feel guilty if you eat more. Gluten and peanut free, facility does not engage with eggs, gluten, peanuts, tree nuts. This is the size we always purchase, but I have just discovered that I passed on my passion for this chocolate to my older daughter, so kids today like 'em, too! So minty fresh, you can use them as mouthwash. Yum x 100.

I despise cherry anything. I believe that Andes could get away with making sardine chocolate, that's how good they are at making chocolate stuff. These things are delicious! The real cherry flavor is paired with chocolate (of course), and it has a very, very, very slight crunch from magic cherry dust. Glad I decided to try, because I did start to walk away. Peanut free and gluten free; the whole factory is peanut, any nut, egg, and gluten free. Can get at Target. Cherry good!

My mom was having a lot of trouble with ringing in her ears. It was always hard to talk to her when this happened  because the constant noise stressed her out.  My brother decided we needed to try a few different products to help her out and this one has worked the best. She told us the ringing stopped within a few days.

My wife and I have used several gels, but none really got her going any more than the last ones. Got this to try and didn't tell her I was using something new - could definitely see the difference.  Will be buying more in the future since she loved it.

With so many different products out there, its hard to tell which one will actually work. Tried a few others, but none of them did much until I came across this.  I was about to give it up since I had been taking it for three weeks, but then a surprise visit from an old friend really showed me that no, this was working fine.  Researched a bit after and found out that it was helping increase energy everywhere - I thought it was my diet, but I guess the two of them together made it happen.  I'll be sticking to this one.

These earmuffs are perfect for running in the cold. They fit nicely over my headphones and don't hurt my ears at all. Also, if my ears get too hot I can take them off and they wrap around my arm so I don't have to carry them the rest of the run.

Really good substitute for coffee if you are planning to stay awake all night. Strangely, enough does not contain caffeine which is a plus for me. Does not make me dizzy just allows to stay alert for at least four hours after taking it.

Had to give it the full trial period, but I did feel different by the end of it. I had more stamina both in and out of the bedroom.  Worked great for me and my girlfriend really enjoys the extra time we now spend in our bed.  This product is great - I recommend using it if you're having trouble with stamina.

I've been lifting for years, but due to my frame (long, small frame upper body & long, medium frame lower) I've never been able to do one bodyweight pull-up or chin-up. I've done countless lat pulldowns, and used a stool to perform modified pull-ups and chin-ups, as well as the assisted chin-up machine at the gym. I recently discovered many women were using the bands to help them build up strength more rapidly. I can already tell that this should help me work up to bodyweight pull-ups because even with the band, they're very challenging compared to the machine at the gym and modification with a stool/chair. Looking forward to building some muscle on my upper body. I bought the green band since it had the widest range. Once I get my reps up to 15-20, I plan to attempt a bodyweight pull-up. If I can't achieve that at that point, I will order a band with a lower range to further help me toward my goal. Excited!

I have hard wood floors so standard yoga mats don't really do it for me. With this one I have enough ccushion to do my exercise comfortably. Has really good traction too. My mom loved it so much that she had me order one for my sister and the length is great for her and she's six feet tall

Recently I got fed up with the feeling that I constantly needed to use chapstick. In the wintertime I keep one in every jacket I might wear, as well as at my desk at work and by my bedside. Then I read an article which explained how some ingredients in various lip moisturizer products might feel good temporarily, but are actually making it so you need *more* of the product as time passes. So I looked over the various ones I had from names like Chapstick, Blistex, and Lip Medex -- and threw away most of them.It took some digging to find options like this Neutrogena one that have all the "good" ingredients (natural oils, sunscreen) and none of the "bad" (camphor, phenol, menthol, salicylic acid). It only took a few days for my lips to get over their addiction to the bad products and get used to the better ones. Now, instead of feeling like I need to apply lip moisturizer many times a day, I only need to every few days or so -- and we're still in cold, windy winter weather here.Burt's Bees lip moisturizers are also a good alternative, but I settled on this one because it does not have any fancy "flavors" or smells -- it is just a simple "clean" smell that is hardly noticeable. So far the Neutrogena ones have weathered well in my coat pockets, and continue to apply smoothly. (Some competitors' products have partly "melted", which can be messy.)

This really helps my lose weight that I always wanted to! This is the only fat burner I have ever tried .Greatest weight loss supplement ever. I've lost at least five pounds in less than two weeks. .Awesome result in very shot time.

MiiWire's 6 foot long tangle-free wire you can charge my smartphone from anywhere i like. An I don't have to worry about wires getting in the way, MiiWire's cord is flat specially designed to Avoid entanglement giving me comfort and convenience.

I have taken many "so called" diet pills in my life and many of them don't do what they say they do. This one, on the other hand, is one that actually lives up to what it says. I would highly recommend these if you're looking to lose a couple pounds!
These head phones are the best there is. The sound is fantastic good bass and can hear stuff u couldn't hear on other head phones.

It was a bit tricky to figure out the buttons, but once I did, I love it! The sound is clear and amazingly great at loud volumes. I could use this little speaker for a party if I wanted to. It's also great at my desk for streaming the music from my iPhone.
Amazing sound. Extra awesome durability. Ready to go almost as soon as you take it out of the box. Simple connection procedure. Loud clear sound and long Battery life both on standby and in use.‚Ä®
Nice slick design, holds its battery pretty well, charges my phone quicker than plug in the wall chargers, great for traveling.

The MiiKey MiiPower2 is the answer when traveling and need that additional power to recharge your phone and iPad. I have a note2 and iPad that I use heavily when traveling domestically and internationally. The Miipower2 fits in my Swiss Gear Travel Gear Scan Smart Backpack 1900 where the iPhone pouch is on the inside top part of the bag. Instead of using it for the iPhone/headset I have the MiiKey MiiPower2 and my usb cable threaded through the top of bag. Now when I am on the plan I can either use the USB cable from under the airplane seat or plug in to charge my phone or iPhone. I can also just put my phone in the side pouch and plug in for some juice. This has been a life saver for me and I'm not running around the airport trying to find a place to plug in my phone or iPad any more.
I can get two charges for my phone out of this. It's saved me on more than one occasion when I've been trapped in conference rooms and exhibit halls. I highly recommend.
I received these MiiKey as a present and to be hones they are the best! The color is as seen on the picture, and when I have them on it just blocks out the world. I absolutely love them!
Best book of all the guides here. Straight forward to the point and the entire book is engaging.
Trying to not take prescrbtion medication...was very pleasantly surprised how much this helps with my anxiety. Highly recommend this product.

Who didn't go through the Disney phase? Every girl who loves Mickey and Minnie Mouse will have the time of their life if they receive this gift... Because my sister sure did. Everything included in the basket is very useful and of course, the body wash were among the favorite. It's definitely something to share and enjoy with other people.
I have been taking these pills for 2 weeks now and I am starting to see some changes. The weight loss may not be extreme but what is clear is that my appetite has been managed which is a great start.

My cortisol levels have decreased (saliva test), I am less stressed and I am losing weight and it‚Äôs all down to taking Phen PM. My diet has changed and has changed for the better so with this, yes they do work.

Purchased this product because I read some good reviews on it. It worked really well at suppressing my appetite. I had not lost much fat but a little bit did fall off in the 30 days I used it. However, I did feel a huge boost in energy and overall well being which I attribute to the detox.

I bought this about 2 weeks ago and I really love em.  I have NEVER in my life taken an appetite suppresant that works like this one. I love to eat but now I always feel full!  I had to actually remind myself to eat. I would go all day just to realize I did not eat!  I was afraid to take because I have had very bad experiences with caffeine but this did not cause any jitters whatsoever! I have lost 5 lbs in 2 weeks by taking it as directed.  I do work out when I can(treadmill, thigh machine...) Hopefully the weight lost will continue. I need to lose about 45 more pounds! I rarely give reviews, but it helped me so... I hope this works for you!

I love them sooooo much. I charged it as soon as I got them. I charged it for about 40 minutes because I couldn't wait. They lasted for over an hour. They would of lasted long but I put it back on the charger. They sound pretty good. I got them in Red :)

My son has suffered with an ADD disorder for many years, we tried lots of methods and had limited success with them all. We purchased these 4 weeks ago and are now starting to see the effects, his ADD seems to be getting better, fingers crossed this continues.

My friend recommended to try these pills. I worried at first because I didn‚Äôt consult the doctor. And still I tried. And I think this was the best decision of my life. I guess it depends on the body but with mine it works very quickly and I lost about 15 lbs in one month!

Do your research as this contains caffeine which some people should not take, in saying this it has worked a charm for me and helped me with my ADHD. As I said do your research but this is a good product and does what it says.
Boy do I owe a lot to this tablet, it has changed my relationship with my family completely. I have gone from having uncontrollable mood swings to being incredibly relaxed thanks to this stuff

Five stars for sure! These l have made me a different person, I was tired due to the lack of sleep I was getting and I was overweight because of the lack of sleep, now I am sleeping and losing weight thanks to these pills!
My perfect pill, this has helped so much with my diet and appetite you wouldn‚Äôt believe. I would like to recommend this for sure.

After the second week, I had lost 4 pounds, and after the third, I lost another 4. It just takes a bit to start working. I think a lot of these other people with their bad reviews did not give it time or follow the instructions.
I am very satisfied with the product. Great sound, great quality. I can only recommend buying it if you want a good product.
I had this on my phone and all I do is to prank my friends. Such a clever idea and unless your friends know this little secret, they will be pulling their heads out!

The best product where you can charge both of your mobiles or any electronic devices. I see that my battery is getting charged super quick and no more hassle of remembering to which slot the battery is connected. The best thing is that it is available in different colors too. A definite 5 stars! :)

I have been looking for an appetite suppressant that actually works for a couple years now. I am definitely eating way less. When I pair the use of these pills with regular exercise, I see fast results in my weight loss.

My body fat actually decreased after taking these pills. This item works greatly and really light. This is our second purchase (my husband has one as well and loves it). I like that it is actually saving the USB port from over-use. He frequently has to get up from his desk for different reasons and no longer has to plug and unplug.I highly recommend this item to anyone who has a phone capable of wireless charging.

I really have lost all of my salty food cravings. After taking Garcinia and working out 3 times a week I'm losing around 3 lbs. a week. The best thing that I have noticed is that I have gained lean muscle mass and I can fit back in clothes that have been hidden in the closet for years. Love this stuff!!
Does the job and keeps the beer cold.  I would love it in pink but function before fashion.  Rhinestones would be a nice addition.

Not impressed with this manicure set. I bought it as a gift and at the same time I bought a Seki manicure kit for about 30% more. The difference is night and day. The Three Swords tools look just like the cheap stuff you can buy anywhere. On top of that the straps holding some of them in place were damaged. I'm pretty sure I got a new set and it appears the manufacturer is also the seller on Amazon so no, it wasn't counterfeit.

I had pretty high expectations of the MeccaNoid G15 KS and they were only partly met. It can be a lot of fun to build and play with, but the novelty wears off pretty quickly because there are a limited number of things that the G15 KS can do. Before I jump into a list of pros and cons I wanted to mention that building the G15 KS is quite a bit of work and prospective buyers should enjoy assembling and building things since I found that to be half of the fun. If you don't like assembling furniture, Meccano, Lego, etc then don't even consider the MeccaNoid G15 KS.Pros+ Straightforward build: relatively clear directions, limited variety of fasteners makes it easy to figure out which screw and nuts to use, tools are included. Overall one of the best build experiences ever for something of this complexity.+ Voice recognition for commands is pretty cool and it works most of the time. Some novel commands like "Walk with me" will absolutely thrill the younger kids.+ Rechargeable battery included which sure beats having to bring your own batteries (like in the G15 - the smaller MeccaNoid).+ Impressive height!Cons- Some of the diagrams don't make it clear enough which parts to use and how to orient them. In some cases, the 3-D parts are not drawn well enough to show orientation.- Although you're supposed to be able to reassemble it into other robot forms I can't imagine where to start without directions- iOS app is primitive and directions on how to use it are limited. Plus you need an older phone without the case or it won't fit into the holder- Build is too tedious for younger kids (less than 10) and requires quite a bit of dexterity since the screws and nuts are quite small- You can record and playback actions but only for the arms- Fingers cannot grab or hold anything so the bottom line is that it can move it's armed and move and talk. That's about it.
Works extremely well as a conditioner and the fragrance is just fantastic. I think it's perfectly fine for regular hair and that's how we've been using it.

I have mixed feelings about the MIXIT Belkin Dock. It's attractive and affordable and fits a variety of iOS devices that use the lightning connector: anything from an iPhone 5 to an iPad ! So lot's of flexibility with the side-to-side width of a device or front-to-back thickness. Unfortunately it won't fit any of my devices with cases because the connector needs a large opening at the bottom to accommodate it and the base of the connector. It seems that many have modified their cases to make them work but I am not willing to do that nor do I think it should be necessary. My other complaint has to do with the weight of the dock. It's pretty lightweight so it's not really practical to use with heavier devices or when you want something to stay put.

I've been through a half-dozen beard trimmers over the last decade or so. They've all felt pretty cheap and I had no expectations of them lasting very long. One of them even had a laser guide for making sure your sideburns are straight! I really like the Panasonic ER-GB60. It's relatively quiet and works wet or dry and is very easy to clean (just put it under some running water!) There's a large range of trim settings (1-20mm) although you need to switch trimming attachments to get access to the whole range. It's sharp and works with one pass. It comes with a case, charging cable, a little bottle of oil for the blades, and a brush as well as the two attachments. This is not a gadget but a utilitarian beard trimmer that is easy to clean and works very well. I think the price is fair.

As a long-time user of both UPSs and portable batteries I was intrigued by the APC BGE50ML Back-UPS Connect and welcomed the opportunity  to try it out and write a review. As with most APC products that I've tried, it's well-built and pretty straightforward. With the battery connected you get a light-weight UPS with a couple of rotating receptacles and three USB charge ports (one is high power). With the battery removed you get a pretty basic surge arrester and a portable battery that can be used to recharge your devices on the go. The battery is 11,400 mAh so it's on the higher end as far as portable batteries go. The high power USB charge port is also located on the battery.The reason I'm not rating it higher is that for the price you can get a regular UPS + portable battery (11,000 mAh and up) so I don't really see the value or purpose of a product like this. A regular UPS will always give you battery backup - not just when the battery is connected.

The Contigo Autospout Gizmo Flip is a decent kids water bottle with some nice little features. I think the Sapphire design is attractive: bright and fun for kids but not garish or too boyish/girlish. Unlike other bottles, the straw is tethered which is a nice touch but on occasion I've found it hard to seat and it's come loose causing leaks. Other reviewers have mentioned that the mouth spout is not removable and, therefore,‚Äã a bit harder to clean so I'll share my cleaning secret for these bottles: I just use denture cleaner. I believe that it's the same stuff that's used to clean hydration packs and it works well.Efferdent Anti-Bacterial Denture Cleanser-120 Count

This is another okay case for the iPhone 6 and 6s. It's a basic plastic shell that's not too grippy or slippery and provides pretty good coverage and well-placed cutouts. If you like the graphics and you're looking for a basic case then this should do fine. If you're looking for serious drop protection then look to other, better-built cases that offer more shock absorption.

This is a great child's version of a balance chair. Assembly was very simple and it only took a few minutes to pump the ball up to the right size. You can vary the amount of air in the ball to raise and lower the seat and some of the wheels have locks on them for smaller kids to use. It is a bit low so it's not very useful as a chair for regular table but kids have short legs anyway so a that's a limitation of it being a children's product. I had no problems at all with the size of the ball. If you find the ball to be sized to small then I would suggest inflating it a bit more.

I have mixed feelings about this case so here are my pros and cons:Pros+ Lightweight+ Cutouts are generously sized and perfectly positioned+ Extra lip protects screen when lying face down on a surface+ Perfect fit for iPhone 6Cons- Looks and feels cheap- Only comes with one graphic insert (the one shown)- Back graphic doesn't look like part of the case. Back of the case is clear plastic and the graphic sheet goes behind it.- Expensive for what you get

I thought that cross-cut meant that the shredder would cut into small rectangles. I get large strips out of the Swingline ProStyle+ so that's disappointing since my other cross-cut shredders from Fellowes produce much smaller pieces. If I had the patience I could probably reconstruct the original documents shredded by the ProStyle+. On the other hand, capacity is great and it can handle credit cards and CDs/DVDs which is truly awesome.

The JBL Voyager Portable Bluetooth speaker looks stunning in white and is a refreshing change from many of its boxy competitors. The subwoofer itself needs to be plugged in but the speaker can run off the built-in battery. So you get two speakers in one: a small portable unit that sounds pretty good and an awesome sounding speaker+subwoofer when you have access to AC power.The speaker unit nestles neatly in the subwoofer and is held in place by magnets. I got 3-4 hours of battery life from the speaker itself. The speaker does not need to be docked with the subwoofer to charge it and I think that's great because it caneasily replace the portable speaker I take with me on vacations.

I own the JAM as well as the JAM 96K which I am currently reviewing. I'm an amateur guitarist and I've used the JAM with a variety of guitars and ukuleles and it's a pleasure to use. It's instantly recognized on my Mac (Garage Band) and my iOS devices (I like BIAS and JamUp Pro XT) and sounds great. The JAM 96K feels like it's better built and has some more heft to it but to be honest I can't tell the difference between the two so unless you have specific recording needs no need to spend another $30 or so.

May 25, 2015 Update-----------------------------After almost a year with this little battery pack I feel the need to update my review. I've tried at least a dozen different portable battery packs over the years and I've settled on this one as a clear favorite. It's got the capacity to charge my iPhone 6 at least twice from almost no charge and it's still going strong after a year of constant use. Other models I've tried have lost their capacity over time. I originally complained about the short cables but after continuous use it's really not a problem and I've become accustomed to it.Original Review---------------------This is a very handy charger because it includes the two cables that many folks will need: a lightning cable and a micro USB cable. They're permanently connected to the unit and hide away when not in use. Capacity is great - I can charge my iPhone 5s 2-3 times. A couple of minor complaints: the cords are short so it's tough to use the device while charging and there's no way to add another cord in case you want say a 30-pin Apple connector. The ends on the connectors are also fairly large and may not fit if you use a case. For example the Apple 5s case needs to be removed since the connector won't fit through the case.Overall a good effort but short of being perfect.

The Play-Doh Sweet Shoppe Cake Mountain Playset looks like it's going to be a lot of fun. It's big and impressive. But unfortunately it doesn't quite deliver. There's a limited number of things to do and the molds and extruders are a little too complicated for little handles. It was way too much of a challenge for a 3-year old but the 7-year old sibling had a blast. After an hour or two of fun it was completely forgotten.

These sweet and hot jalapenos are absolutely delicious. Not sure where the 'Krisp' in the name comes from because these are by no means krisp or hard and that doesn't make them any less delicious. The first flavor that hits you is the sweetness and then it's followed by fire. They are by no means for the faint or delicate of palate. Once the heat subsides what's left is a balanced and pleasant mix of sweetness and fire that makes me want to reach for more!
The price is right.It offers high speed charging and since the cable is coiled it's compact when needed yet can be extended at the right time. No complaints here.

This is my second Bosch drill and my first Bosch Hammer Drill. I've been using it on a couple of small projects around the house and here are some of my impressions... I was going to write a list of pros and cons but for the life of me I have nothing at all to complain about:+ Batteries charge very quickly+ Comes with two batteries+ Relatively lightweight and compact+ Built-in light+ A pleasure to use and hold. Well balanced+ Nice little features like a belt loop, bit holder, and nice case+ Hammer function can be turned on/off which makes it a great drill for general use

As you would expect, the 'Pencil by FiftyThree' is a great looking stylus. It's comfortable and just feels right while gliding smoothly over my iPad's surface. When combined with Paper by FiftyThree it really shines by adding two new features: automatic palm rejection (since it 'knows' that the surface of the pen is in contact or no) and the built-in eraser.It's a bit gimmicky and in my opinion unnecessarily complicated. While palm rejection and erasing are nice I haven't really felt the need for them. I'm also not an exclusive Paper user so the extra cost of this stylus isn't that easy to justify.It is nice that the extra tools in Paper are unlocked and free when using Pencil but I think it would have been more reasonable to just unlock them for free when users purchased Pencil.

This is a great basic cookware set. Looks good but the pieces doesn't have as much heft to them as I would have liked. They feel a bit cheap and although they conduct heat very, very well (more on that later) not sure how well they retain heat or how even the heat distribution is. Usually a heavier pan is better at heat retention and evenness.The non-stick coating works very well and seems to be reasonably durable. The pans aren't dish washer safe but it's not something I expect from non-stick cookware. The handles can get very hot. Especially the short handles on the stockpots.

For starters this came packaged in saran wrap, in bubble wrap, inside a cardboard box, that was than placed in an amazon box. Needless to say my shadows arrived intact, and in pristine condition. As for the shadows themselves, there are many neutral colors, some darker tones, jewel tones, and mattes. None with glitter in them. There is two blues in this palette, the lighter of the two didn't show up very well, I used some mac fix plus to help and it worked, but its just so light that its difficult. Most of the shadows are buttery soft, and not chalky, with very little fall out, or clumps. The lighter shadows need some fix plus to help with pigmentation, other than that, most shadows applied very well with great pigmentation without any help. All swatches shown are just with a finger, nothing added and no primer. I do suggest a primer when wearing these shadows, they blend pretty well. Overall I am quite impressed with this palette and it's quality, it's not the greatest, but it is far from the worst. I would repurchase. sample,provided for review.

I don't really have social anxiety, but I don't make friends to easily. This book has helped me become more confident in who I am, as well as being that confident around others. I really do like this compact telescope. It is a tad on the heavier side, so its not something I want to carry around and look through. I do like putting it on a tripod. I find that much easier. It comes with lens covers, a hand strap and mine even came with the tripod. As well as a convenient carrying case. It works great at night too, with crisp clear viewing.  I did test this in the rain, and the lenses stayed fog free, and it is waterproof as noted in their description.Sample provided

This is very breathable, the only issue I had were the many hooks. This watch is easily adjustable by a professional jeweler and inexpensive to do so-- only $7 to size it down. The clasp has good function and is easy to fasten and remove without the watch falling off. It has a nice face size-- one that I can see without my reading glasses. YMMV on that one. It has a nice stop stop watch function. I really don't have anything negative to say about it. This is a nice looking watch that does it job, is durable, but inexpensive enough that if someone smacks it with a sledge hammer you won't cry over it (unless you were wearing it when the sledgehammer hit).

This is a good, solid case, and a good, mid-grade tower. It has a clear side panel so you can see all your components. It has a nice accessibility port where you can plug in various media cards. It does have filtration units for all the.air intakes. One drawback is that it really should come with a power unit. This will be upgradable for the forseeable future, so you will get plenty of use out of it.

We have a few Dell systems running Windows 8 and over in our small business office, so there was no problem with compatibility with this keyboard and mouse set. It's pretty much plug and play-- no messy apps to install, no confusing passwords to remember. I like to keep a couple of extra sets like this on hand for adding a new system, or for those inevitable spills (usually the spills are from me). This is convenient to store until needed or to take out of the box and use immediately. It works just as well with non Dell systems as well. If it's not Dell, or running Windows 7 or lower, there's a thing included that you have to plug into a USB port. It's not explained very well and I know I'm not doing a good job here. Once you get it set up, it works well. The mouse is nothing special and could have used a scroller. Overall, a four star set.

My husband already uses Axe Shampoo + Conditioner, so he was pleased that there was a new scent to try. The scent is described as fruity and masculine, but I find it overpowering as someone who has a nose like a bloodhound. It doesn't smell like fruit at all, but fortunately it fades after a few hours. It does the same cleaning and conditioning job as Axe's other shampoo/conditioner. I think this one is strictly a matter of whether you like the scent.

We worked with this for several days following all instructions and.... we got nothing. The lights were on but the signal wasn't in there. We worked with it without following instructions and got nothing. We live in a house built in pre-hysterical times before Al Gore invented the internet by having a hamster running on an exercise wheel attached to a pile of scotch tape and wires in his basement. We may need to do something to our wiring to make it work. The problem is that by the time we are able to do this, my time for the review may have run out, or we maybe under attack from giant spiders. I'm going to rate this a 3. It's kind of impossible to screw it up and in my opinion if it's plug and play, it should be plug and play. There also seem to be a lot of mixed reviews on this product. Considering the number of reviews that say it never worked, or only worked for a short time, I don't think I would buy additional units.

The song is abut Red Solo Cups, not Hefty cups, so you'll want to make sure the bag says Hefty on it. They do seem to be sturdier than the average Solo or store brand disposable party cup. We got the smaller size 9 ounce cups, what most people would call "kid" size or "fun" size, definitely not party size. These are good for kids' beverages at casual birthday parties. With the textured sizes I think they really are easier to grip. I have to wonder if a full 16 ounce cup would still be easier to grip after a few beers. Only one way to find out... Red Hefty Cup, let's have a party!

I decided to try this shower gel because my husband love most everything Axe. It does the job lathering up, washing, and rinsing away, but the entire house smells like this shower gel when he's done showering. Most men's products are strongly scented, and this on is no different. I just don't understand why. I would rather have a product that cleans and deodorizes rather than something that just tries to cover up the smell with more smell. I tried to use it myself and I can't use it without opening a door or window. If you want something with a strong scent, this is it, but if you want something subtle, keep looking. Four stars because it seems to please its target customer in this household. :-)

This movie was just awful. I don‚Äôt understand all the four and five star ratings for it, unless those  reviews are from people who enjoy watching animal cruelty and suffering, plus watching little kids get upset because the movie makes it look like the neverbeast dies at the end.The neverbeast is basically like a big cat and is put through one physically hurtful thing after another. The movie becomes a masochism tango as the fairies join in by drugging him, chasing him down with weapons and restraining him. Along the way viewers are made to think fairies are dead as the neverbeast is shown in agony as lightning strikes him and he grows horns and wings. At the end he goes to sleep for a thousand years and there is a funeral procession.This is too much for little kids.The Tinkerbell movies used to be good. They were never intense, they taught good values and you knew a kid could watch it. This was a big fat piece of crap and the older kids knew it. The younger ones cried and told me they never wanted to see it again. I can‚Äôt say as how I blame them. I‚Äôm never going to trust Disney again, and I‚Äôm going to pre-screen their junk just like I do everything else.I‚Äôm 44 years old. People my age have a tendency to drop dead for no apparent reason. I don‚Äôt have time or money to waste on scary movies for my nieces and nephews that will scare them and make them cry. There is maybe 5 minutes of Tinkerbell in it, only one male character and we never get to see how the Pixie Hollow Defense Force works. Add to that the animal cruelty and making the kids cry, and it‚Äôs hard to understand how anyone could like this movie.People who say this movie is good HAVE to be lying‚Äîthere‚Äôs no other explanation. Supposedly this is the last Tinkerbell movie. If they ever do another one, they had better stay away from the heavy hitting subject matter. I‚Äôm not buying their crap anymore.

This Monster High circus playset comes with "gargoyle" doll Rochelle and some interesting play items. There's a funhouse mirror, a tightrope, a swing and a photo cutout. It comes with standard monster High branded accessories as well as little things specifically for a circus.Rochelle herself wears a clown-inspired dress without any horrid over the top clown makeup. If you haven't seen any of the MH gargoyle dolls yet, just be aware that their skin looks and feels rough. They are inspired by real-life statues of gargoyles on older buildings, and their skin is supposed to resemble that concrete and stone.This set could have been improved by including a cardboard backdrop, more photo cutouts, and other paintings for the picture frame on the "iron" gate. Of course, it would be fun to make your own pieces, too. Four stars for a cute doll and a mostly fun playset.

Space: You're going to need more of it when you get this out of the box and put it together. This playset is 4 feet tall at the clock tower and 5 feet wide at the base, but you don't really have an appreciation for that until you've got this thing out and assembled. The good news is that it folds up for storage. The height stays the same, but you can save on the floor space in the closet or wherever you plan on keeping it.At this price point, the plastic could have been more durable and the backgrounds could have been better than just thin printed pieces. It's tempting to scan the printed stuff and print it on more durable paper or to laminate it. You may want to reinforce some of the connecting parts with model glue or tape. This is more of a backdrop or diorama than a playhouse. I think both kids and collectors will need a couple of extra sets of furniture to be able to get gull enjoyment out of it.The most terrifying part of this is putting it together. the pieces are badly packed and the instructions aren't very clear. My husband is an architect and I'm lucky that he has a kind of gut instinct about little projects like this. Some of you may need to enlist the Army Corps of Engineers for help, or possibly bribe an older sibling. Don't leave it to the little kids; they will not be able to do it.On the up side, with all the doll clips and built-in clips, you can display up to 25 dolls on it. If you add in dolls on stands in front of it, you can display quite a bit of your de-boxed collection with this playset. Of course, you'll have to dust it.This playset could have been better without affecting the cost. More durable plastic would have gone a long way toward quality and stability of the structure. I'm not sure why they dedicated a space to a radio station without including a cheap mini-speaker to plug into an iPod or phone for music. I would have made that something different altogether. The clock tower only serves to make the structure obnoxiously tall, and ought to be detachable for storage.4 stars because this will display a lot of dolls for me and any kid who gets one will love it. Minus one because it could have been better.

After years of being Coke-free, I tried this. It's passable, but it's just passable. It doesn't taste like original Coke. It's not satisfying in the least and it has nothing to do with "life." It should be called Coca Cola D, for Disingenuous, or for a D grade that's not a fail. This isn't worth cheating on my keto diet, rotting my teeth and it sure doesn't trigger any nostalgia. In fact, all it does is make me wish I were anywhere but here.I don't know why Coke keeps trying to re-invent the wheel instead of giving me what I want. I want Coke with 100% real cane sugar in it, available 100% of the time. I don't want corn syrup, I don't want half and half products, and I don't want stuff like aspartame triggering my migraine headaches. Make the real thing or go sell your imitation somewhere else.

I was bullied heinously in a small town public school for 10 years, right up to the day I graduated, and they even managed to get in a final slap in the face in the yearbooks the following fall. I watched this on another service, and I couldn't believe how bad it was. I don't think anyone who worked on this movie knew anything about bullying in general, let alone cyberbullying, and it just turned out to be dumb.Bullies don't have good intentions. Most of the time, they don't even have any intentions. They're bored, they're in the moment, and they see you as their entertainment to pass the time until an adult comes along who can make them stop. There is no logical or rational explanation for their behavior. Whoever added the logical explanation for the bully's behavior was trying to engage the part of the adult audience that always howls that "THERE MUST BE SOME REASON FOR THIS!" A kid will tell you it's because their parents are divorcing or because of this or that, because that's what you want to hear, that there was a REASON, but the fact is that they do it for kicks.The bullying itself was very tame stuff, and it didn't reflect real-life harshness and intensity at all. Bullying is a blood sport and it is absolutely brutal. It doesn't stop with name calling and spreading rumors about STDs. They spit on you, shove you into lockers and walls, and won't let you have a seat at lunch or on the bus. You can be the ball in locker foosball if you show up at the wrong time-- that's where they line up in between lockers and shove you from one side into the other until they run out of time. And they don't just restrict harassment for one class or the bathroom. They do it to you everywhere. There's no peace for you on a bike ride or at the local shops. If you're an acceptable target, no one will ever intervene for you.~SPOILERS~ (If that's even possible with such a badly written script)The characters are incredibly naive and stupid. The mother allowed her to have unfettered access to the internet, not really understanding how any of it works. She kept telling the daughter to delete the social media page but never followed up. She got upset that her daughter called someone a b****, but she seemed just fine with everyone ganging up on her daughter until after the suicide attempt. Then after one run-in with a parent who was a bully lawyer, she didn't confront any of the other people who had done it. People are shocked, SHOCKED I SAY, that someone was catfishing using a made-up identity. Nobody knew about IP addresses or how to look one up. They only found out who did it because she confessed to it. The daughter had to go to therapy, because SHE was the one with a problem now, not the bullying jerks. Everybody in that group had the IQ of a sheet of bubblewrap and it focused on how victims need to adjust their behavior to avoid bullying, not on defending yourself. And of course, it had to end with everyone forgiving each other, and passing a law that most likely is unconstitutional, but everyone will support because it's "for the CHILDREN!"Not to mention this girl never would have been targeted in the first place. She was pretty, blonde, and had a circle of friends. Bullies pick on people who don't have friends and have trouble socializing. They'll focus on any visible physical flaw, but they prefer the loners. Loners don't have anyone to defend them. Even a loner's parent tells them it's their fault because they don't have any friends.The casting was good, but the diversity was awful--- it always is in these kinds of productions. The one black friend splits at the first sign of trouble and is clearly there so that they will have someone black in the movie-- same with the principal. It seems that dark skinned black girls and Hispanic kids are only good for being tertiary characters and redshirts.You can watch it if you want to see how bad it is, how not to write a movie, or play a drinking game every time a character does something dumb. That's really all this movie is good for. If you want to stop bullying, you need to raise your kids right. You have to talk to them and teach them right from wrong. When your kid says someone is hurting them, listen to them. It's nothing like this movie, and it's not going to end the way the movie did, either.

This is a dainty necklace, and I do mean dainty. The main pendant is half the size of a dime with none of the thickness, and you can't see the hearts or the engraved "taken" without a magnifying glass. The chain is thin and delicate, and I would venture to guess quite breakable. It is, however, a very nice necklace considering the size and price. If you're looking for something small for a girlfriend you haven't known long, for the petite woman in your life, or just a little gift for the wife to show her you appreciate the little things she does, this necklace makes a great gift.

The copy I got was an advance copy that did not include artwork. I didn't enjoy it as much as I could have otherwise, so I am trying to compensate for that in my rating of the book. There are ginormous plot holes, lack of common sense. characters who are too dumb to live, and logic? What logic? The mystery should have been more interesting, or the resolution of the plot. Still, I would not mind reading more of this as a series, with more care placed into the issues I listed above. I would also like to see other books like it.

This is an enormous bag of Hershey's Kisses, suitable for office candy dishes, wedding favors, and candidates prepping for their audition for "My 600lb Life." You may think you can eat the whole bag in one sitting, but even the most dedicated lady of generous girth suffering from PMS will have a hard time even getting through 1/4 of the bag. It's THAT big. That said, this is the same Hershey's chocolate that Americans love. Use this swag bag of chocolate to make friends, sweeten business deals or just to keep your shugahs up until lunch. With a bag this size, there's no reason to be stingy with your chocolate.

As a starter system this is OK. We like the dual mount option for top and rear mount. The system is straightforward and easy to install. It is easily expandable and you can add a variety of elements to it, making it a nice weekend project to the DIY person.One con is it does require direct power to both cameras rather than battery packs to both units.Installing the app on our phones is easy and it's great to be able to see what's going on at the house no matter where I am. I've used Panasonic brand electronics since I was a kid and it's great to see that they're still making great quality products.We plan on purchasing more cameras for this system as the budget allows. Burglars broke into our house a couple of years ago and we were lucky to get most of our stuff back with minimal damage to our home. Don't wait until it happens to you. Be proactive and make sure anyone who breaks into your home gets caught.

It says it's waterproof, but I'm not going to soak it in the bathtub to find out. This memory stick has plenty of space and transfers data at a reasonable speed-- I don't have to wait all day to transfer a movie or other large files on it. My only gripe is the loose cap. It's going to get lost, because loose caps always do. Otherwise a great memory stick at a great price.

It took a while to install this-- 30+ minutes with 2 DVDs. I can't award this 5 stars to an "ultimate" product that charges you extra for bu-ray authoring. This should have been included with the product, especially at the price point. Still, this product is a great value, especially if you're not a professional and need a lot of pre-made things for your projects. If you want to get professional, everything is there to do it. (Except blu-ray authoring.) You can have a lot of fun with this or make it serious business. If you've had Corel products before, you won't have problems getting started. If you're a newcomer, definitely do the tutorials to get familiar with it. There is enough here that I would upgrade from previous versions and choose this over the regular version without the extras.

Love or hate Martha Stewart, her craft product line is is top notch stuff. I buy it whenever my budget allows. (I'm currently hoarding 3 boxes of MS glitter and I don't even know why.) That's why I was so disappointed to open this fringe cutter and find that it doesn't cut tissue paper as advertised. Thicker paper might work, but my tissue paper is a torn up mess, and I'm not going to try other kinds of paper in it until I've got some I don't care about. I hate to leave this a one star review, but it just does not do what it is supposed to do.

I love the sensitivity gel-- it really works. This regular toothbrush does not clean like an electric toothbrush and I don't like using it if I'm not traveling. I wish they sold the gel pens separately. I will probably buy this but I'm going to have a lot of unused toothbrushes lying around.

I wanted a facial cleanser that doesn't foam. I'm not sure why. So when I had the opportunity to try this, I decided to take the leap. I have used regular cold cream before, and I think this cleanser is much better. I don't feel greasy 20 minutes after I wash my face, or in the morning. My skin just feels clean and comfortable. There is no irritating scent. It does have a smell to it, but it's kind of like crayons or something. I know you might not believe this review, because I'm telling you everything they say about every cleanser in commercials. Rinses clean, no residue, doesn't dry your skin, leaves you clean and comfortable, not greasy. I'm telling you, it's all true. It was my destiny to try this cleanser. It is your destiny to buy it.

I don't like to switch deodorants, but I've been curious about these clinical strength deodorants for a while now. I'm "clinically curious," I guess. Also, I switched to Degree once and had some kind of awful skin reaction, so I've used Secret for years. Dove claims to be a skin care company and says this will give me clear skin under my arms. I can't say I've used it long enough to notice whether the appearance of my arm pits has changed, but at least I'm not allergic to it. Just judging it as an antiperspirant/deodorant, however, this is the best. It really gives much better protection against sweat and odor, and yes, you can skip a day. I tried it. You have to put it on at night, so if you like to shower in the morning, this is going to present something of a problem. I'm not sprouting pit hair like Chewbacca or anything, but I like to do my shaving in the morning. I don't know if it works the same way if you wash twice and re-apply it. If they could combine this with a hair growth inhibitor so that you don't have to worry about morning stubble, it would be a five star product.

I've used these Duck rolls of adhesive laminate for years on crafts and as shelf liner. It's easy to cut with a straight edge and an Xacto knife. It does take some time to get the backing to peel off, but other than that I prefer it over contact paper since it's thinner and doesn't add as much bulk. It's probably less durable, but it meets my needs fine. It would be better if the backing came off more easily, and if they printed the back with a graph rather than just inch marks along the edge.

Words cannot express what a waste of money this package is. The spatula, replacement blades and the scoring tool shown in the case are the only useful things in this package. I think that my problem with this kit is that it's marketed as "Cricut Essentials Kit for Cricut Cutting Machines," but that's not true. The mats are useless because you can't use them with the Cricut Expression or the Expression 2, which are the newer machines that everyone is buying. The ruler is too small to be useful. I don't know what those hooks and things are-- possibly dental instruments gone wrong, but I have done lots of cutting on my Expression and I have never had a use for them. The blades on the scissors and on the paper trimmer work fine through about 10 sheets of paper, then they start to get dull, and catch and rip your projects. The paper that comes with it is ugly and not in any color that I would ever use in a project. If I hadn't used a sheet to do practice cuts I would send this item back to Amazon. Do NOT buy this kit. Get a Fiskars trimmer and scissors, and buy the spatula, blades and scoring tool separately. You will have a lot more money in your pocket and you will be happier.

This tool is for punching a pattern of small holes in craft paper so that you can sew in thread to decorate cards and other projects. It does exactly what it says it will do. You need to use the pad that comes with it underneath the paper, otherwise the rolling heads will wear out fast, and your results won't be as good. The heads are plastic that will last a long time as long as you use the pad. I use this to accent scrapbook pages, cards and in other paper crafting projects. Practice on scrap paper first so you'll get an idea of how to keep a straight line, or get a curvy one if that's your thing. There are other heads available for the tool, including rolling stamp heads. This is NOT for fabric-- only for paper. Stock up on embroidery floss, because this tool is so easy and fun to use that you'll be using it for all your paper crafting projects.

Toilet paper-- unless you have a bidet everywhere you go when you need to go, you'll have to use it sooner or later. We go through our share here at home, and it's something you can always use, so I gave these rolls a try. You can feel the thickness when you take paper off of these rolls, so you don't use as much. They stand up to just about any mess. As a nice side benefit, I think that the durability also keeps it from leaving lint behind. My husband is always the first to complain about low quality toilet paper, but he's been quiet since we got these-- apparently it's doing the job! I am surprised at how long these rolls lasted at this house, and how strong it is without being rough on skin. The packaging seems thinner and it's kind of plain, but don't let that stop you from trying it. It's also nice to be able to shop for it less often. We used to stick with Angel Soft, but I'm switching brands when this pack runs out. Squeeze this Charmin-- you'll be glad you did.

I collect dolls, particularly Barbie, and I have a few Monster High dolls in my collection as well. I was thrilled to have the opportunity to try out the latest Clawdeen doll. Clawdeen is part of a series of 3 Monster High dolls called It's Alive which light up and make sounds. Frankie Stein and Spectra Vondergeist are heavy on the lights, but I really think Clawdeen steals the show. Flip her switch, and she HOWLS at the moon as she lifts her head and hands upward! Everyone laughs until their sides hurt when I show them this doll. But the hilarious thing is that my dog howls right along with her! When the two of them howl together, there's no stopping them! This doll is great fun for collectors and kids alike. Clawdeen wants me to send an AROO to all the werewolves out there, and to collectors and kids, AROO to you too!

I already have a Venus razor, and I was really exited to try this scented variety. The problem is that the scent isn't strong enough, and the lubricating strips kind of just dissolve and fall off. It still shaves really well, but if you depend on those strips for skin protection you're out of luck. I'm going to use the handle with my regular Venus cartridges. It was a nice idea as a novelty, but with the strips disintegrating and virtually none of the promised scent, I don't think this product is worth it.

These vertical file folders seem like a fantastic idea-- until you realize they're not going to work in a standard file cabinet, or with hanging file folders. The protruding top tab makes that hard to do. I also have problems with paper covering the side tabs so that any labels are covered. I didn't test the water resistance, but they do feel like they would survive a coffee spill. I like the green and brown colors-- they're folder colors I don't see every day in the office supply stores. These folders would be much better if they did something about the tab situation and if they could fit the office furniture I already have.

I don't really scrapbook. I might start after this, but making artsy layouts of personal photos (half of which were taken against my will) is just not how I would like to spend my time. I collect dolls, mostly Barbie, and I like to make little dioramas and backgrounds for them with various props and scrapbooking elements. (Yes, I'm one of *those* people.) I mostly wanted this for the Disney classics images and decided to get this to see if I liked it before I jumped into a Silhouette Cameo Starter Kit Bundle Cutter. Unless you are dead set on using specific licensed images, many of which are only available on the secondary market at inflated prices, you may just want to go straight to the Cameo instead.Whoever tagged this as a throwback to printers and tech in the 1980s was spot on. The display and the cartridges make this thing look like some kind of dot matrix printer/Atari hybrid.
