Saucony tanks/singlets are extremely well made and hold up to mega washings over the years and still look good. The passion purple color is true to what I saw on my monitor. Awesome top!

Saucony's singlets are my all time favorite workout tops. I bought all 3 colors. They are true to size. I am a size 8/10 and bought a large, I could have gone with a medium but I like to have them flowy for more air circulation. These tops are super lightweight and extremely moisture wicking. I like the racer back for more freedom of movement. The Saucony singlets are extremely well made and hold up to mega washings over the years and still look good. The colors are true to what I saw on my monitor. Awesome tops!

I love the asymmetrical brim on this trilby hat, it makes it sassy. The combination of red and black are striking and will accent a lot of my clothes. I am thrilled about having this hat. It is well made and classy.

I ordered the International model of the Samsung S6 from Surge Telecom.  It took a while to arrive.  The box states the phone is an international model, but there is a sticker attached that says it only accepts American SIMS.You have to peel off the sticker to read"American SIM Card Only:  This product is only compatible with SIM-card issued from a mobile operator within the Americas (The North, South and Central Americas and the Caribbean)."  There is a warning about the phone not working if an attempt is made to activate with a SIM card from another region - it will have to be reset by Samsung.I needed a true international telephone for use in Europe, Africa, and the Middle East.  This phone will not work for me.  I am sending it back.
Love this case.  It is used to store a LaCie Porsche mobile drive.
This charger works as advertised.
I purchased this one for a student in Ethiopia.  Put in a local SIM card and this tablet was running like a greyhound at the track.
If you can put a key on keyring, you can install these zipper pulls.  Much cheaper then having the zipper pulls replaced at the local luggage shop.
I paid a little more, but this burner looks good on the table.  Easy to operate.
Just the right size for turning a lot of small items in the skillet.  The handles are very comfy.
This one is hard to beat for a $50 phone in 2015.  Very fast and more phone then I hoped for in this price range.  Storage is limited, but a great international phone for vacations out of country.

I really wanted to love this phone, but it is too big - think super sized phablet.  I highly recommend handling one before ordering online.  This phone is very large and very wide.  I am six foot tall with big hands and find it difficult to pickup the phone with one hand due to the width of the device and the slippery metal surface.  If you can get passed the size and weight, it performs very well - fast and smooth.
Yes, I am a fan.
It is carefree product that works extremely well with Mac computers.  Why would a Mac owner purchase anything but a LaCie mobile drive?

Correction:The case looks nice and works well to protect the screen from scratches.  It will not protect your iPad during a fall.  My iPad Air 2 took a spill while sitting on my lap and landed on the edge of the closed case and breaking the on/off switch.  The case offered no protection from the fall.  Fortunately, I purchased the Apple Care  replacement warranty.The iPad fits nicely in the case.  Warning the case is fairly heavy.

I purchased the Mobee Technology Magic Charger online at the Apple store for my new Magic Mouse.  The mouse works perfectly with normal AA batteries, but when using the Magic Charger the Bluetooth disconnects from the mouse frequently.  I own two of the magic mice - one still has the first set of AA batteries installed while the other has the Magic Charger which failed this week and no longer charges.The Magic Charger is still covered under the one year warranty.  I have submitted a request for a replacement.  I will report the response of the manufacturer.  I am regretting the purchase, because the regular AA batteries last for a long time with normal use.UPDATED 08/12/2015:I received a prompt response from Mobee Tech and a new battery was shipped to me in a few days.  The one year warranty will expire on October 20, 2015.  Hopefully this one will last longer.

Purchased this course several years ago - that money would have been better spent on studio equipment.  Musicians are better off practicing intervals and singing along with their own instrument.  Perhaps a singer without access to an instrument may possibly find the course of some use.  A singer could purchase a cheap keyboard for less money.  The CD's are basically this guy playing intervals and chords and singing along.  You can do it yourself.

Where I live socks are consider formal wear.  These shoes fit well in my life style.  Speaking of fit - I normally wear a size 13 wide shoe.  The Chiba's run a tad small so a size 14 (without socks) is good fit for me.  I wish Sanuk produced their other styles in larger sizes.  The Chiba is about the only Sanuk that will fit me.

You are buying a piece of history.  As of 2014, this game is twelve years old and beginning to show a little age.  The graphics by today's standards are a little rough (approx. 600x400 resolution).  For those not familiar with the GTA series, it is all about thugs, violence, and sex - not a good choice for the kiddies.

It does the job, but I wish there was a way to disable the automatic shutoff after running for two weeks (clean filter warning).  It is pain when it happens and you are out of town.  The humidifier must be reset and restarted.
I have had a few air mattresses, but this one is very easy to inflate and more importantly deflate.
Very interesting read.  Not at all what I expected.  An inspiration and learning experience.  Truly a worthwhile read for all.

Ravelli APGL4 Tripod and Pistol Grip Head  Tall and stable tripod will handle DSLR with heavier lenses.What initially brought me to this tripod is the maximum height of 70 inches.  I am 6 feet tall and hate assuming a stooped posture for extended periods.  I own a few light weight travel tripods.  I needed a heavier tripod for those shots that require heavier camera lenses.  I immediately took the Ravelli tripod out for a spin mounted to a heavy lens and camera while enduring costal breezes for a good field test.  As expected, this medium weight tripod kept everything from moving for shake free images.The current Ravelli APGL4 tripod bundle includes:  tripod, pistol grip head, carry bag, allen wrenches, and wiping clothes.  The price dropped significantly to sixty dollars - cheaper is better!PROS:- The pistol grip head is very stable in all positions even with a long lens mounted.  It is very easy to adjust.- The tripod is very very stable.- Large rubber feet.- The ability to mount a camera under the center column for super low shots.- Built to last.- The Ravelli provides a 10 year warranty on their products.Copied from website support page:  "Your Ravelli purchase includes a 10 year warranty for manufacturer defects when purchased new from an authorized retailer. We stand behind our products and will gladly help resolve any issue that may arise with your purchase."CONS:- It can be a little difficult to make fine height adjustments with the center column when heavy photo equipment is mounted.  A geared center column with crank would be a nice touch.P.S.The package was shipped directly from Amazon and arrived in the form of a very large crushed open box.  There was no padding, no bubble wrap, nothing.  There were a couple of other smaller items in the same shipping box which could have easily fell out of the open box.  This was not one of Amazon's better attempts at packaging.

Purchased this ring as a coupling between a Celestron Ultima 80 spotting scope and a Canon 7d.  The T-Ring seems to be well made, but it arrived with an oily substance on the threads that found its way to the optic.  The images taken are much worse then what is seen with  the naked eye - very fuzzy.  I am disappointed.  This combination may work for fuzzy moon shots, but that is about it.  Very disappointed.  The optic has no storage case - shipped in plastic bag.  Even the cheapest lens filter is shipped with a plastic storage case.

Products:Celestron 52250 Ultima 80mm Spotting Scope andCelestron 93419 T-Ring for Canon EOS cameraReview of Scope:I purchased the Celestron Ultima 80mm Spotting Scope to use as my first terrestrial telescope.  I live near the ocean and wanted an inexpensive telescope to monitor passing cruise ships and see what is happening on the other end of the island.  Initially, I was a little surprised at the size and weight of the Celestron Ultima.  Feeling the heft of a nearly four pound 18 inch telescope with a 80mm objective lens is a little different then reading the specifications.  Fortunately, this scope will stay indoors mounted to a tripod and used occasionally when the mood strikes.The visual range of a 20x-60x zoom lens on a scope can be very impressive to a first time user.  The scope is simple to operate.  It has a single focusing knob which needs a finer adjustment setting.  The finder sight tube will get you in the ballpark of your target, but that is about it.  Using the scope, you will see a narrow visible ring around the inner perimeter of the lens.  Depending on the lighting conditions, that perimeter ring color will vary in color from clear to a blue-violet in brighter light. When you are dealing with zoom optics there is always a quality compromise - especially on the lower price models.  I am not surprised by the color ring on this bargain priced scope.  The ring of color will bother some more than others.  The focus ring and the zoom eyepiece turn smoothly when changing settings.  The heavy nylon case is well made, but not padded.  The scope build quality is heavy duty - it should take a few knocks.  I purchased the scope from Amazon for approximately one hundred sixty dollars.  The price includes the basic scope, zoom 20x-60x angled eyepiece, and cases for both pieces.  The rubber cup that mounts on the eyepiece needs to fit a lot snugger.Review of T-Ring Adapter:I ordered the Celestron T-Ring adapter to mount my Canon EOS 7d.  This scope is not a good choice for those wishing to capture quality photos with camera.  The images with naked eye are acceptable, but coupling the Celestron T-ring adapter and a Canon 7d produces a very grainy image.  If you need a scope to capture clear photos, this is not the one.  The image through the scope's lenses is not grainy using the naked eye.  If all you want to shoot are pictures of the moon it should be fine, but bird photographers will be a little more critical of this scope and T-ring combination.  The best images will occur using the smallest setting 20x.  You will get much better pictures using the camera lenses you already own on your DSLR and enhancing the size of the image.  There are good examples of the scope's photographic abilities on YouTube - judge for yourself.Summary:The Celestron Ultima 80 lens has some aberrations and some color issues around the ring, but that is to be expected with any zoom lens near this low price range.  Forget about taking clear photos with this scope.Side Note:If you wear glasses there may be additional challenges.  I can see clearer images through the scope when wearing my computer glasses vs my regular glasses.  Being physically closer to the eyepiece does not necessarily give a sharper view.Every scope you see on the internet is rated very highly.  Most people are amazed to see something that is miles away for the first time.  Weight your needs for quality carefully and do not over spend.  Everyone does not need $3k scope.
Dr. Dunn presented a side of South Florida's history that was new to me.  The video documentary was so interesting, I will order his book.

This movie will appeal to certain demographics - maybe 45 and older.  Amazon needs to change the rating system for movies to just a star system.  I am only interested in movies that appeal to me.  The current system does not take that into consideration.

I am little disappointed in the sound quality.  I have experienced better sound quality from computer speakers with a sub-woofer.  It attempts to imitate the acoustics of a movie theatre - echoes and all.  If that is what you like, it maybe for you.  It is poor choice for listening to music.  On the positive side it is one main piece, with remote, bluetooth enabled sub-woofer, and easy to setup.  On the negative side it can block your remote's transmission to the TV and as mentioned earlier the sound could be better.  This product may be better than many other sound bars, but that is not saying much for sound bars in general.

I have been a devoted user of the Waterpik systems for years.  Normally, I get several years use out of the Classic model.  I needed one for the vacation home and purchased this model WP-100 at a local drugstore.  It performed reasonably well until it refused to pump water.  One year of service is not a good deal at these prices.  Now, I am looking to purchase another Classic model Waterpik.  Hopefully it will last several years.

Some will say I do not have the right to post a review for this movie.  After 1.5 minutes I wanted to kill it.  I forced myself to watch all of 11.5 minutes - It was all I could stand.  It could possibly be used for human torture.  Forcing someone to watch this garbage may be considered criminal.

I purchased this product the Magnesium Fire Starter and the Light My Fire Swedish Fire Steel 2.0 Army.  I will give you my experience testing both products.Magnesium Fire Starter:I had problems with this product initially, because there is a very thick protective coating covering the flint rod.  It took a little effort to scrape off the coating.  You will not get any sparks until this coating is completely removed.  Using the included striker/saw, I was able to produce a reasonable amount of sparks.  Surprisingly, I was able to generate a greater volume of sparks using the striker included with the Light My Fire Swedish Fire Steel 2.0.  The Magnesium Fire Starter requires a little preparation and practice to be reliable.Light My Fire Swedish Fire Steel 2.0 Army:The Swedish Fire Steel is ready to go right out of the package.  It generates a shower of hot potent sparks with little effort.  If you need to get a fire started in a hurry this is the better choice when good tender is available.  It cost a little more, but it creates a much hotter shower of sparks and makes quick work of starting a fire.Test Conditions:My test consisted of starting a fire from material available on a beach in Florida.  I gathered relatively dry tender that had fallen from palm trees.  The tender was a little thicker then I would prefer, but that is what was available at the time.  I tried both products and neither would create a fire from the thick tender with sparks alone.  Then I created a few magnesium shavings on the palm tender with the Magnesium Fire Starter.  The spark from the Magnesium Fire Starter was hot enough to ignite the magnesium shavings, but did not ignite the palm tender.  The hotter spark from the Light My Fire Swedish Fire Steel ignited the magnesium shavings and ignited the palm tender resulting in combustion very quickly.Conclusion:I prefer the Light My Fire Swedish Fire Steel 2.0 Army for most applications - 99% of the time.  If you need to start a fire with damp tender, the Magnesium Fire Starter will be a handy addition to the party.  Being able to create magnesium shavings with the saw is a handy feature in extreme situations.  Others have stated, ideally you will want both products in a survival situation. Even with the magnesium shavings the hotter spark from the Light My Fire Swedish Fire Steel will get the fire going a lot quicker.P.S.The flint can be shaved and works even better, but that is the source of your spark with the Magnesium Fire Starter - when it is all gone - no more sparks.http://www.amazon.com/Light-Fire-Swedish-FireSteel-Emergency/dp/B004412IHE/ref=pd_sim_sg_7?ie=UTF8&refRID=1E4WWD7SEVMP9EEV3MTA

This little rascal works very well. Be careful it produces a shower of very hot sparks with little effort. One of the Amazon reviewers suggested using dryer lint to start a fire. I decided to test this product by putting a ball of dryer lint in the kitchen sink to see whether the sparks could be coaxed into at least starting the lint to smolder. On the first strike a shower of hot sparks were produced and the ball of lint immediately burst into flames. Fortunately it was in the sink. I quickly turned on the water to extinguish the fire. It totally caught me off guard. I had no idea a fire could be produced so quickly. It does not take much lint to start a fire. All I can say is WOW!

I purchased a couple of these pads at a clearance sale.  These silicon pads provide a much better grip then cloth pads.  It gives the cook more confidence when moving hot pans.  Oh yea, you can set hot pans on them too.I use one underneath my very loud blender when making smoothies.  The soft silicon absorbs the loud vibration of my blender on the kitchen counter.  It makes for much quieter mornings.

I originally planned to write a review about durability of the LaCie SSD.  It was purchased to store my photos while on safari in Africa.  The safari is on hold.  But, fresh disasters popped up to create a situation justifying this review.The installed SSD on my Apple Macbook Air failed fortunately it is under warranty, but it would be over a week to get a replacement.  I could not imagine functioning in this society for a week with out internet access.  The solution was to operate my Macbook off the external LaCie SSD.  In a very short time, I had the operating system up and running on the LaCie.  The LaCie Porsche is one very fast drive.  I have no question about durability since it is encased in aluminum.  It is actually faster than the replacement SSD that Apple installed in my 2012 Macbook Air.  I would happily purchase this product again.The perfect case for the LaCie SSD and cable (sold at Amazon):  Case Logic PHDC-1 Compact Portable Hard Drive Case (Black)

I normally shave my face and head daily using the Gillette Fusion (5 blade) system with the lather supplied by a mixture of shaving cream and shaving soap whipped to a thick lather with a badger brush.  The Dorco Pace 6 (6 blade) system seemed to be a possible cheaper alternative to the Gillette Fusion system.  I purchased the Dorco system directly from the Dorco website which had the best discounted prices for their products.  The following is my experience with the product which looks very manly and has good heft.Day One:  I was very excited to try my new Dorco Pace 6 razor system.  I created a good hot shaving lather and commenced to shave my face.  I immediately noticed the strip of rubber at the bottom of the Dorco cartridge was creating excess drag.  After several passes with the new blade there was still a lot of stubble on my face.  The Gillette Fusion removes all hair in the first pass.  I moved on to my head, but the rubber that is supposed to make the hairs stand up was creating an extreme amount of drag on the top of my head.  The razor was actually bouncing across my head.  Again short jagged stubble was left on my head.  I used a 3 week old Gillette Fusion cartridge to clean up the sharp stubble left behind by the new Dorco razor.Day Two:  I installed a fresh Dorco cartridge hoping the first experience was a fluke caused by a bad cartridge.  The shaving experience was the same as day one.  I had to clean up the stubble with my 3 week old Gillette Fusion cartridge.  Needless to say, I was disappointed.I am back to using my Gillette Fusion system.  I have no use for a shaving system that creates sharp stubble.  I am better off not shaving then using the Dorco Pace 6 system.

I was looking for a cheap monopod to shoot a carnival and parade.  While looking at my monopod options, I realized a monopod head would be a necessity.  I am shaking my head while calculating the total cost.  I saw this light weight beauty and wondered if it could be used as a monopod.  I drop one leg and started shooting.  I carried this ultra light tripod by it's handle which is very comfortable.  The tripod is light enough to leave attached to my Canon 7d while slinging the camera strap over my shoulder.  I have 3 other tripods and a monopod at another site, but this is a true ultralight.  It is the only tripod I do not mind carrying all day.  Changing and locking the camera into various positions is very fast with this tripod - due to the innovative design of the head and handle.End of Day:I wore through one of the foot pads on the first day exposing the metal.  The design of the handle and head are a good idea, but the foot pads wear out very quickly.  The head, handle, and leg supports are made of plastic and may not last.I returned the product for a refund.  The foot pads are made of inferior rubber.  If the manufacturer can fix the pad issue the tripod could be useful.

I consider the Etymotic Research HF5 earphones a very good value for the price on Amazon.  What makes or breaks the audio quality of any earphone is the fit of the earplugs.  The most frequent complaints are:  not enough volume and not enough bass.  The reason for those complaints?  Most ear plugs do not provide a good seal against the out side noise.  The same is true of these earphones until you get a good fitting ear plug, the thumping bass and high volume will be slightly out of reach.  It is extremely hard to generalize about the fit of earplugs.  Everyone's ear canals are a different shape.None of the earplugs included with the HF5 earphones were a good tight fit for me.  I purchased a pair of Etymotic ER-6's many years ago and the earplugs were a very good fit for me.  Etymotic Research no longer makes those earplugs, but I found some earplugs that are identical to them on AMAZON (B007X8LGV4 at a very low price.  So, I was happy until going to the gym and working out next to a couple of heavy people running on treadmills.  The earplug seal was not tight enough to block their noise, even at the highest volume.  Unfortunately, this is a common problem at the gym.Fortunately, Etymotic Research will make custom earplugs from ear casts made by your Audiologist.  I spend a lot of time at the gym so it was a no brainer for me.  I got the custom earplugs.  My ear canals are fairly typical, the audiologist told me.  The difference in the volume and bass is difficult to describe.  Before the custom earplugs, I would turn the volume up to the highest level.  Using the custom earplugs, anything above 70% of volume on my tablet is very uncomfortable.  The bass is truly thumping with the help of an equalizer app/ bass booster.  Now, I hear nothing, but music at the gym.  It is all about getting a good seal and the best seal is with the Etymotic Research custom earplugs which will require a trip to your local Audiologist.  If the price of the custom earplugs is uncomfortable, I highly suggest the cheaper earplugs mentioned earlier in the review.P.S.Those of you that own the custom ER Musicians Earplugs (audio attenuators)  and want to know whether the  HF5's are compatible.  The answer is NO.  Sorry, you will have to get special earplugs for the HF5's which fit the ER-4's too.  If you have a very recent ear casting, just send it to ER and save yourself the cost of the Audiologist.

Fed-Ex just dropped it at my door a matter of minutes ago.  Thought I would give it quick test on the kitchen floor.  WOW!  Floor clean in seconds.  Before I realized it, the entire 2 bedroom apartment was clean in a couple of minutes.  It whizzed across the ceramic tile floors and short nap throw rugs.  Who knew this kind of power could be had for 65 dollars?  Excellent value.  How can such a light weight vacuum have so much power?  It took me longer to write this review then vacuum the entire apartment.  I love it.

Just what I wanted.  These are very similar to the ear cushions that came with the old Etymotic ER-6 earphones.  I was not happy with any of the cushions that came with my new Etymotic HF5 earphones.  These cushions are comfy and provide a good seal once you get them positioned properly.  They are an excellent value compared to many of the other cushions on the market.

Going into this purchase, I suspected the weakest link would be the FM transmission between the Roadster 2 and my car's stereo system.  Since Motorola pioneered radio and two-way communication, my hopes were very high.  I only invested a day determining the usability of the Roadster 2.On the plus side, pairing two android devices to the Roadster 2 was very easy.  The speaker on the Roadster 2 is very good considering the small size.  The Roadster 2 recognizes the names of the contacts then calls the correct phone number when selecting address entries by voice command.  The buttons are large and easily identified - consider it user friendly.  The best way to use this product is with the built in speaker.  It functions very better on it's own.On the negative side, FM transmission to the car's radio fluctuates, it is sometimes very good and other times very bad.  An FM channel that is clear initially may have static a few blocks down the road as you approach a stronger competing FM radio signal.  When streaming music to the FM radio the audio quality will not approach that of a factory installed integrated hands-free system.  The only flaw in this product is the use of the FM frequency for transmitting to the car stereo.  The Roadster 2 scans for strongest available channels which is exactly what it should not do - duh.  It should look for unused channels!  The best way to use this product is with the built in speaker which is clearer.Heck, I can get better sound quality by connecting the phone via standard audio cable which by the way works great for speaking on the phone too.  But, taking the audio cable approach, I still have to fumble with the cellphone buttons and that is dangerous while driving.If you do a lot of talking while driving, the Roadster 2 is safer than using the cellphone alone.  The Roadster 2's built in speaker is very clear and the buttons are easy to find.  The Roadster 2 provides easy to access buttons and vocal commands.  It is a useable product when not going through the FM car radio.  This product can not be compared to the integrated hands-free bluetooth radio systems that come installed on vehicles, today.  But, for the price it is as good or better than other FM frequency products.  I have paid a lot more for Bluetooth earpieces that do not have anywhere near functionality of this speakerphone.Bottom line:  If you are looking for a dedicated car speakerphone that supports voice commands, has a user friendly interface, and you are not concerned about a high quality stereo connection the Roadster 2 is a good choice.  I have come to the conclusion the FM frequency is always the weakest link.  The commercial FM radio broad cast signals are too strong.  The Roadster 2 seems to look for the channels used by the commercial stations.  Yea, I returned it.

This is a well made bag that is a true value purchase.  I can not complain, when compared to other bags costing twice as much.  It will fit most SLR cameras with a standard zoom lens attached.  Some of the Telephoto lens maybe bit much for this bag - I am talking to you Canon owners.  Measure your equipment carefully before ordering.  The bag is an excellent bargain.  The only thing about this bag is being satisfied with carrying one lens.  It is hard to pick just one lens for the entire day.  Keep in mind there is no room for an external flash unit.  The pockets are small.  The larger front pocket will hold at most my Canon battery charger with spare battery and a couple spare storage cards.  The side pockets are very tight and suitable for only a storage card or USB stick.Summary:  I don't love this bag, but it is a bargain and something to protect a single camera and lens from dents and scratches.  Every camera bag I own is a compromise.  I will be satisfied the day there is an assistant to carry all my gear for me : )

I seldom give a 5 star rating, but this bag deserves it.  This bag is very spacious and well padded with a medium size footprint.  Simply lift the flap and you have access to all your photographic gear without having to move things around.  Considering what others are asking for their camera bags this is quit a bargain.  As others have stated it will hold a camera body, flash, and several lenses.  There are even straps for a small tripod.  I have a few camera bags, but this will definitely be a favorite.

This is a small scrub brush looking for a purpose.  The one I received was missing a lot of the plastic bristles.  It is too large (5 inches) and the bristles too long for a hand & nail brush.  The bristles are not dense enough.  Rubbermaid did not design this to be a hand brush.  The Amazon product description does not agree with Rubbermaid's product description.The following description of this product was copied from the Rubbermaid Commercial web site:"Natural and synthetic fibers set in plastic block.  Designed to ease work when scrubbing tile and grout lines, floors, baseboards, walls and countertops".Where did AMAZON get their product description???You can get these at the Five&Dime stores for a dollar.

I had this split running down a ridge in the middle of my left thumb nail for several years.  It seemed like it would never heal.  I asked my doctor what to do about it.  He showed me his identical 4 year old split thumb nail and told me to live with it.  I did not want to live it.  I spent a lot of money on manicures, but nothing seemed to help.  The manicurists tried the glues, the wraps, the oils, and the super polish, but none of them had any effect on the split.  At times the split would almost heal itself, but never quite make it.  It would always split farther during a final attempt to clip the last of it.I purchased this clipper as a luxury not thinking it would actually help with the split nail.  I was totally bewildered when the Seki fingernail clipper removed the last of the split during the second clipping.  I lost sleep thinking about this.  What had changed?  I had purchased probably six different drugstore nail clippers over past year alone, but they were all relatively dull.  I tried three different manicurists over the years with no improvement with the split.  I came to the conclusion, the drugstore clippers and the manicurists professional nail nippers were dull and kept the split from healing by bending and contorting the nail during the cutting process.  The Seki clipper being extremely sharp there was very little bending of the nail which avoided additional stress on the nail and split.  The sharper edge allowed it to cut using less pressure.I am kicking all the manicurists to the curb for taking my money without solving the problem.  The seven year old split is finally healed.  The Seki clipper is truly a fine instrument and the company has made this new customer a believer.  I just order the Seki toenail clipper.I want to thank Seki for making an outstanding product.

I purchased the RCA universal (RCRN03BR) to control an Insignia DVD player.  I was very disappointed with this remote.  There are much better products available without spending more.  In the same low price range, I recommend the SONY RMVZ220 universal remote.PROS:1.  It will turn on the DVD player.CONS:1.  A couple of the function keys began to fail after 90 days.2.  The position of the 4-way rocker switch is too close to the volume and channel buttons.  It would move the up instead of to the right.3.  No eject button for the DVD player.  A bare bones basic remote.4.  The batteries are difficult to remove - poor compartment design.5.  Poor ergonomic design.  Does not feel comfortable in the hand.6.  Needs to be aimed precisely at the devices.

Call me crazy, but I purchased 4 different pair of lifting gloves in my quest to find lifting gloves that fit my extra large hands.  The Saranac gloves are the largest of the 4 pair of XX-Large gloves purchased.  The palms are a double layered suede leather.  The back of the gloves are stretchable synthetic material.  Overall comfortable fit.  The Saranac are the best fitting gloves of the four purchased for my big hands.The other gloves I purchased are as follows:Harbinger Power Series StretchBack Gloves - Black XX Large:  Similar to the Saranac gloves in construction, but not as large.Harbinger Pro FlexClosure Wash & Dry Glove (Black, XX-Large):  Similar to the Saranac gloves, but very tight fit on back side.Valeo Glove - Black XX Large:  These gloves have a slippery leather palm that is difficult to grip the bar with and have an extremely tight fit.

I have several of the cameras. They work fine for additional layer of home security along with my alarm system.  Calvin, a tech support at FOSCAM helped me with the setup so that the cams could be accessed remotely.  Now everything is good-to-go for monitoring the house when shopping or away on weekend trips.  The IP cams are an excellent value.  When the cameras are purchased directly from FOSCAM the tech support is free.  I purchased some of them directly from FOSCAM and some from Amazon.

The strainer is a kitchen tool positioned at the value end of the spectrum.  It is large strainer and sturdy.  It does have the potential to rust if used in water frequently.  I am beginning to see rust after only a couple of weeks.  I guess that is why the price is low.  It is an economical tool for those that rarely use a strainer.

The Lundberg Organic Long Grain Brown Rice is my new favorite.  The rice is a fresh non-GMO grain with a delicious nutty taste. It is amazing how different brown rice can taste depending on where it is grown.  Each bag of rice has a velcro seal - very nice touch.  I appreciate the Use-By-Date stamped on the box.  It is assuring to know you have a fresh product before opening the package.  I keep a container of prepared brown rice stored in the refrigerator for use as a side dish or a filler ingredient.  I like to toast the rice before boiling.  It accentuates the nutty flavor.  Brown rice is one of the main staples in this house.  It is an easy way to get healthy whole grains in your diet.

I have had the Manta Ray in my free weight collection for many years.  I would never attempt squats again without it.  It keeps the pain away from my shoulders.  I will put a towel between it and my trapezoid when using extremely heavy weights.  I use it to work my calf muscles too.  Every muscle in my body gets a workout while standing on my toes with a couple of hundred pounds on my shoulders.  You need every muscle to stabilize the weight on the bar.  The Manta Ray is one of my favorite free weight accessories.  It is built to last.  I have had my Manta Ray over twelve years - still looks new.The only reason I go to the gym is for the aerobic equipment and sauna.  I prefer my own free weight setup.Another great accessory is the AB-ORIGINALS Wings.  Great abdominal workout, if you have a chinning bar.  It is great to just hang there and take the pressure off your spinal disks after a heavy workout.

As all the others have said, you owe it to your health to read this book or watch the video.  If you follow the dietary guidelines the impact will be immediate.  You will see hugh changes in your body and energy level.  If you are going to be eating a plant based diet a Vitamix blender is a handy tool to have around the house.  I would never be able to eat as many veggies without the Vitamix.

I purchased the All-Purpose Pan Lid to cover my 14inch skillet.  It is large enough to cover the 14 inch skillet and allow steam to escape through the louvers in the lid.  It is a very light aluminum lid.  I consider it over priced at 15 dollars.  It is nothing outstanding, but it does the job.  No splatters on the range or kitchen floor.

I was drawn to this book after watching the videos Forks Over Knives and the followup video Forks Over Knives the Extended Interviews.  Amazon carries both of the videos.  Dr. Esselstyn describes his research on cardiovascular disease and the impact it could have on our future health.  His research indicates that given a chance over time the human body can stop the progress and sometimes reverse cardiovascular disease.  He believes it is a disease that thrives in this country, because of the Standard American Diet.  Dr. Esselstyn has called cardiovascular disease a paper tiger that can be eliminated for most people by their choice of foods.  Who knew erectile dysfunction was an early symptom of cardiovascular disease?  I will never eat another cheese burger again.I have counted calories all my life without success.  I removed all fat/oils from the refrigerator and pantry.  I have a green smoothie every morning for breakfast/brunch.  I eat whole grains for lunch.  I eat all sorts of cooked veggies (including potatoes) and grains for dinner.  I have lost 30 pounds in less than two months.  Yea, I am at the gym a lot more, but it is amazing to see the weight fall off so fast.  It took a couple of weeks for my taste buds to adjust to the food not having oil.  Now I look forward to the taste of starch instead of oil.This book and the videos mentioned earlier are highly recommended for anyone living in this country that is planning a long life.

Initially, I was reluctant to purchase such a large scale, but size of scale does not matter to me any more. This is hands down the best scale I have ever owned. It is quick and easy to use, the results are at eye level, and the platform is large enough for my big feet. I love getting a quick and accurate weigh. Two years after my purchase, I am still a happy customer. The scale has never been adjusted. If you are serious about a fast and accurate weigh this is your scale.

I am more than a little disappointed in this book created in the name of a person I truly respect.The source of my disappointment is not the quality of the recipes, but the ingredients.  My definition of meatless is no animal products - that includes dairy and eggs.  Cheese, butter, and eggs are condensed forms of everything I want to avoid in a meatless diet.  I expected to find outstanding plant based recipes with healthy substitutions for cheese, butter, and eggs.  Apparently, that is not the goal of this book.  This is not a book for people attempting to avoid dairy products and eggs.  There are precious few recipes in the book Meatless that are free of dairy products and eggs.  The recipes may be a good starting point, but you will have to find substitutes for the oils, dairy, and eggs on your own.  I do not have anything against eating meat.  If you are writing a cook book with the title Meatless then it should have recipes that are plant based without animal products.I am sure a number of people will appreciate this book as a transitional tool while moving toward a diet with fewer fried pork chops and greasy baby back ribs.  The book Meatless is for people that are searching for slightly healthier recipes.  I wish the culinary queen had written a book with outstanding substitutes for the foods that are causing so many health issues in this country - namely cheese, butter, and eggs.You be the judge. I recently moved into an apartment several stories up and at the far end of the corridor.  If that was not enough, my assigned parking is at the farthest end of the parking structure.  I mediately realized a collapsable cart was in my future.  Having read the Amazon reviews of this product, it seemed worth a try.  After using it a few weeks, the product seems durable and good enough for the price.  I have hauled  groceries, water jugs, and large water melons in it with no problems.  It folds flat for easy storage in the trunk of my mid size car.  It is a very useful product.  Yes, I would purchase this cart again.UPDATE 01/2014:  I am pleased to say it is still working.  It is used for every shopping trip.  I transport heavy items in the cart on a regular basis.  I have not had any issues.**  I would purchase again in the thirty dollar range with free shipping.  **

The Etymotic MC5's are hard to beat in the sub hundred dollar category.  After enjoying the Etymotic ER6's at the office for years, I decided to get the Etymotic MC5 earphones for my gym bag and have not been disappointed.FIRST USE:  The MC5's come with the smaller 3 flange ear tip attached.  If you have very small ear canals they may work for you.  I consider my ear canals average diameter and immediately switched to the standard size 3 flange ear tips which are included in the box.  The standard size is very similar in diameter to the old Etymotic 2 flange ear tips.  It is important to massage a drop of water into the flanged silicon ear tips during the initial use - think of it as ear lubricant.  You will probably only need to moisten the ear tips a few times.  They seem to stay lubricated after a couple uses.GREAT EARPLUGS:  The Etymotics are great for blocking unwanted noise like that screaming baby on the air plane or your noisy co-worker in the next cubicle.  These are best study aids on the market for students - wonderful silence in any environment.  They serve as excellent ear plugs.  Etymotics helped me survive a several hour flight from Puerto Rico with 4 sets of twin babies onboard screaming their lungs out during the entire flight.  My poor suffering travel companion's nerves were shot by the time we landed at Fort Lauderdale.  I was well rested having slept through most of the flight.ANDROID/ITUNES APP:  Etymotic has a free app called AWARENESS that will allow you to listen to your music and hear what is going on around you at the same time.  It is very useful at the airport listening for the boarding announcements and music at the same time.

I am accustom to better ear buds.  These buds are a joke.  The sound is muffled, but it does have bass - muffled sounding bass.  Do not waste your money.The build quality is terrible.  The cables are made of the cheapest materials.  Sony should be ashamed of producing this junk.  I would say these buds are worth about ten dollars.  These buds are alright for listening to audio books (speech), but not music.My Recommendation:If you are looking for pure sound reproduction checkout the line of ear buds made by Etymotic Research.  Even their cheapest buds have outstanding sound reproduction.

I have used the Chicago Cutlery Walnut Tradition line of knives for years.  In my opinion they were some of the best inexpensive stamped knives around.  I still have a set of them purchased twenty years ago.Unfortunately, the entire Chicago Cutlery Walnut Tradition line is not what it used to be.  Now they are just cheap knives.  The walnut handles are about a full inch shorter these days.  Only people with very small hands will feel comfortable with the new handles.  I guess the price of walnut wood is going up.  I recently purchased a couple of other Walnut Tradition knives and all of them had the new smaller handles.  You could still do a lot worse for the price.If you elect to purchase any of the knives in the Walnut Tradition line, I would strongly suggest you take the following steps.1.  Dip the handles in hot mineral oil once per year.  This helps seal and  protect the wood handles from water damage.  It will make them more comfortable - smoother surface.2.  When the blades appear to be dull realign the edge with a sharpening steel.  You will find the proper technique and angle (20 degrees) on their web site.  Never sharpen a stamped knife blade with a regular knife sharpener.

If you need a scratch resistant case for the Nexus 7, this one is ok for the price.  Nice finish and fits the Nexus 7 perfectly.  It turns on and off the tablet when opened and closed.  The price is acceptable at about fifteen dollars.  Having said all those wonderful things, I believe the Nexus 7 is tough enough to with stand normal use without a case.  If you want one, this is a good choice for carrying the Nexus in hand.  I use the case as a stand when watching videos while traveling.UPDATE 12/27/2012:While on vacation, I knocked my Nexus 7 (enclosed in case) off the nightstand and it fell onto a wooden floor landing on the bottom left edge.  The screen is cracked to the extent the Nexus 7 will no longer function.  I ordered another Nexus 7 this morning.  This case is good, but will not save your Nexus from damage during a fall.  I am lowering my rating two stars for lack of padding.

FINAL EDIT & SUMMARY - October 27, 2012:I have been using the Nexus 7 for a few months.  Overall, I am very happy with it.  The 4 quad processor is very quick, the apps open and close instantly.  There appears to be a good selection of apps for the Jelly Bean version of Android.  I am still waiting for a version of the Amazon app that will work with this tablet.  The device is made with high quality materials.  Normally, I use screen protectors and a protective case for my mobile devices.  I prefer to use the Nexus 7 uncovered.  The synthetic material on the back of the tablet makes it easy to hold and it would be a shame to cover that beautiful screen.  It appears to be a very sturdy tablet.  My only quibble, the packaging was so tight, I had to rip a part the box to remove the Nexus 7.  Good thing I like it, because returning the tablet without the original packaging would have been a major issue.I discovered the auto-rotate switch in the settings area.  It controls the visual orientation of books and things displayed on the screen.  It's default setting is "OFF".  When set to "ON" the display will always be positioned properly whether the tablet is positioned for landscape or portrait viewing.I considered returning the Nexus 7 when Amazon introduced the new Kindle Fire HD, but after serious thought decided to keep the faster and more powerful Nexus 7.  A few weeks ago, my lady friend purchased the 7 inch Kindle Fire HD.  It does not feel as responsive as the Nexus 7.  I am now a totally happy camper and raising the rating to 5 stars.

If you need a EF-S lens in the ultra-wide focal length, this is Canon's answer.  Be forewarned it has a very cheap plastic body.  This lens did not survive it's first international trip stored in a padded camera bag hand carried by owner.  I am in the process of shipping it to Canon's repair center, because the the auto-focus no longer works.  I am looking at a minimum of one hundred and fifty dollars and possibly more for repair and return shipment.Bottom line:  I like the optics, but really can not recommend this lens because of the ultra-cheap body.  When traveling, you need to store this lens in a rigid case.** Canon if you are listening, I would pay more for the same optics in a durable body.UPDATE:The lens is repaired and working like new again.  I would sell this cheap body lens if it was not one of my favorites.  It is great choice for ultra-wide work.*** CANON please make the lens body sturdier ***

Good quality construction.  Great buy compared to the pricey alternatives in the market.  I like the sure grip silicon handle.  The tines are forged steel, unlike some of the lesser quality forks that are stamped metal.
I use the racks for cooling baked goods and glazing cakes.  The glaze comes off in a second when exposed to warm water.  Cleanup does not get any easier.

Looking at the glowing reviews, I must have gotten one of the bad ones.  The turntable was built like a tank, but the platform was mounted severely off center and it had a horrible wobble.  I sent it back to Amazon.  There must be a bad batch of them with wobbly platforms that slipped past quality control.The design is fairly simple.  The cake stand has a heavy cast iron base.  The platform is made of aluminum which is mounted to a steel post that rotates in the base - bare metal to bare metal.  There are no ball bearings and it appears to need a good glob of grease type lubricant on the post to help it turn easier.I am going to try the Fat Daddio's turntable rather then risk getting another Ateco stand that wobbles.  I do not like the idea of picking up a much heavier cake stand and spending even more, but the Fat Daddio's has gotten fantastic reviews and it is suppose to have smooth ball bearings for easier turning.

All my life, I have avoided canned anchovies, because they taste horrible.  I  read some wonderful things about this sauce on the internet, but it is made from anchovies.  I considered it a real gamble to order a bottle of the Red Boat Fish Sauce.WOW!  This stuff is tasty and the flavor is so intense.  I do not know anything about Asian cooking, but this sauce is truly nectar of the gods.  A few drops of the fish sauce will add a truck load of flavor to your seafood dishes.  I use it to reinforce the flavor of fish with a milder taste.  I am finding it to be a very versatile flavor enhancer.  Yesterday, I composed a dressing for a green salad.  A few drops of fish sauce whipped into a little olive oil and rice vinegar produces a nice savory dressing.As a another reviewer noted, this is a finishing sauce.  I add it after the food is cooked.  I believe the quality of the sea salt in this product makes a huge difference.  If you want to add a savory flavor to your dishes, give it a try.P.S.I still hate canned anchovies.

I purchased this pastry mat from another retailer.  It will not lay flat.  Take a good look at the product picture.  See how the corners are curling.  It helps to wet the counter first and then put something on each corner to weight it down so the corners will not curl.I eventually tired of the games and purchased the Conimar Kitchen Helper Pastry Mat - sold by Amazon.  The Conimar is a much better pastry mat and will lay flat without the games.  It comes with a handy storage tube.

I already have a lot of wooden spoons and silicon spatulas.  I purchased both the silicon covered flat whisk and the balloon whisk about 3 years ago.Once a year, I pull them out of the drawer in an attempt to prove my money was not wasted on this purchase.These whisks have a very soft silicon coating on the beater portion that tends to drag on the non-stick surface of the pans. It is like you are dragging rubber against rubber. There is way too much friction to actually whip anything in a pan. It definitely does not work well in a mixing bowl - there is too much friction.PROS:- Soft silicon coating on the beater will not scratch.CONS:- Beater is way too flexible. It can not be used effectively to whip any ingredients.- Silicon coating is very soft and creates a drag against any surface which it comes in contact.SUMMARY:If you are worried about scratching your pans use wooden spoons and spatulas.

I purchased this whisk and the flat version 3 years ago.  Once a year, I pull them out of the drawer in an attempt to prove my money was not wasted on this purchase.These whisks have a very soft silicon coating on the beater portion that tends to drag on the non-stick surface of the pans.  It is like you are dragging rubber against rubber.  There is way too much friction to actually whip anything in a pan.  It definitely does not work well in a mixing bowl - there is too much friction.PROS:- Soft silicon coating on the beater will not scratch.CONS:- Beater is way too flexible.  It can not be used effectively to whip any ingredients.- Soft silicon coating creates a drag against any surface which it comes in contact.SUMMARY:These silicon whisks can not replace a regular stiff wire whisk.  If you are worried about scratching your pans use wooden spoons and spatulas.
The product is very satisfactory.  I use it for handling bread dough and picking up chopped veggies from the cutting board.  It is nice kitchen accessory.

This mat stays in place right out of the shipping container.  I pushed around  a few pounds of heavy biscuit dough as a test for the mat - no problems.No need to train the mat before using it.  No need to play games uncurling edges like with other mats.  No need to sprinkle water on the counter to help create adhesion.  No need to put weights on the corners to keep them from curling.  This mat works with out all the tricks.  It comes with a handy storage tube.I suggest using a plastic scraper rather than a metal dough scrapper, because the mat is made of a soft and flexible material.
This strainer is very small it will hold approximately 1 cup of material.  IMO the recommended pestle is too large for this strainer.  You will have more luck using the back of an old spoon.

I should have known it was too good to be true.  There is a lot of friction between the marble cylinder and the spindle.  The product description says there are "ball bearings" in this product - not true.  You are better off purchasing a very cheap wooden rolling pin, because this one does not roll.I love AMAZON, but there seems to be a real problem with product descriptions lately.  No one makes nylon ball bearings.  Ball bearings are made of metal.  This product does not contain any ball bearings.

A mostly enjoyable take on the vampire mythos. Certainly more old school than most modern incarnations. Still it has some interesting new twists philosophically such as St. Thomas Aquinas's speculations on Jesus's body post resurrection. Also introduced is kind of a D&D alignment which affect vampires. So there are evil vampires and saintly ones. Mostly this works plot wise and there is not the Buffy predestination towards evil character flaw.Mostly I enjoyed the story and the characters and it plays out as a solid action novel with both a bent towards humor and philosophy. There is a running gag mocking vampires from Twilight. The whole premise is interesting enough to want to see where the story goes in possible future novels.About two thirds through the book a new character is introduced and there is a bit of a transition story-wise that could have flowed a little better.

Totally love this set, especially how the light shines on them.  The four different colors of the bottom of the crystal angels add to their charm. These are very fragile, but can't wait for Christmas to decorate my tree for years to come.

Aesthetically this unit is rather ho-hum. Looks like something designed a decade or so ago.Still the non-slip surface and light weight makes this easy to carry around and the rounded edges help in that.During charging via microUSB you get a visible LED indicator for 25/50/75/100 percent charging.  The button on top will display the current charge percent indicators when not charging.The two different charging ports have different amperages. The 2.1 A port is suitable for iPads, tablets, and devices that will charge faster at this amperage. The 1 amp port is more suitable for smart phones, but not tablets.

There are some things when I run across them in a novel, movie, or even religious discussion immediately set off alarm bells for me. One of them is anything involving the Nephalem. It just never turns out well and most often very silly. Another is Constantine. Constantine gets blamed for a lot by a lot of different groups. At least with the Nephalem, it is something rather mysterious with little scriptural reference. When it comes to Constantine we actually have a wealth of historical information from Christian and Pagan sources. Still Constantine is often used to pointed to as a corruptor of ‚Äúpure‚Äù Christianity and the cause of the great apostasy. From Dan Brown to starters of new religions the start was not from history, but as a required plot line to justify what goes after.I was naturally delighted when I first found out Rod Bennett was releasing a new book called The Apostasy That Wasn‚Äôt: The Extraordinary Story of the Unbreakable Early Church. A semi-sequel to his wonderful Four Witnesses: The Early Church in Her Own Words. The appellation that somebody ‚Äúmade history come alive‚Äù is probably overused. Often I found that the author had made history interesting, but not fully alive to my intellect. Rod Bennett does make history come intellectually alive for me with his deft use of storytelling, historical writings, and the fruit of his research.The introduction starts with a stroll to a period while he was still a Protestant and coming across a place in Tennessee called ‚ÄúFields of the Wood‚Äù built up by a Preacher scandalized by the divisions in Christianity. Who was bringing back the ‚Äútrue church‚Äù and started a new congregation. This struck regarding how often this pattern has occurred. The person scandalized by the divisions who promptly create yet another division. The Bullwinkle-syndrome where the optimist church reformer says ‚ÄúThis time for sure!‚Äù as he pulls another church out of his hat.Rod Bennett describes the history of Preacher Tomlinson and this preachers own version of the Great Apostasy. This same pattern can be seen with the Latter-Day Saints, Jehovah Witnesses, Islam, and really most of Protestantism. Rod Bennett‚Äôs thinking about this preacher‚Äôs history led him to realize ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt I have, when it comes right down to it, a ‚ÄòGreat Apostasy‚Äô theory of my own?‚Äù This insight led him to studying church history and the reading of the Church Fathers. I think at this point it is mandatory to insert the Blessed John Newman quote ‚ÄúTo be deep in history is to cease to be Protestant.‚Äù Otherwise I could lose my Catholic blogger license.I was not unfamiliar with this tumultuous and exciting period of Church history. Warren H. Carroll covers this period quite well in one of his volumes of ‚ÄúA History of Christendom.‚Äù Still I found it contextualized better and I especially appreciated the lead up in history to Constantine and the Battle of the Milvian Bridge. The state of the Church and how between waves of persecution it was out in the open with various levels of toleration. Even with Diocletian there was originally some toleration before the worst of the persecutions began. It was all much more complicated than the incorrectly simplified history of Constantine being the first to grant such toleration. Especially the erroneous idea that he made Catholicism the official religion of the empire.He also paints the state of the empire with Rome depopulated and great cities like Alexandria lapsing from their Catholic faith. This historical backdrop sets the stage for such a fascinating piece of Church history. The rise of the Arian heresy by the priest Arius, the calling of the council, and the whole wonderful story of St. Athanasius. The story of Athanasius came so alive for me along with the conjecture that he had gotten involved with St Antony and the Desert Monks at a rather early period of his life. I often felt like I was reading a novel as this history played out. The real story is so odd and seemingly implausible that it only works as history.Rod Bennett really is a master storyteller and fully employs his skills in describing this period of history along with presenting the actual texts that we have. This is certainly a period of history with many surviving texts from those involved along with of course the Councilar texts. His subtitle is ‚ÄúThe Extraordinary Story of the Unbreakable Early Church‚Äù and this certainly fits the billing. The Arians had all the power on their side. They had most of the episcopacy of the Eastern bishops and the ear of the Emperors. The figure of Athanasius was unimpressive, but his mark on history wasn‚Äôt.I totally loved this book. So much so that no doubt it also goes on my re-read list.

For fairly low price headphones I found these to be pretty good with a mix of music and podcasts. The fidelity seems pretty good (to my older ears) with a little more bass than other inexpensive in-ear headphones.Most in-ear headphones provide sound isolation and I found these good for noisy operations as using a lawnmower and weed trimmer. My goto over the ear headphones were not good in this use case and these headphones were perfect for this.These headphones are bare bones in that there is no volume adjustment or other controls for either iOS or Android. Also there is not L/R indication that I could find.These headphones are a bit longer than other inexpensive headphones I have used and no doubt this increases the sound quality. But since they are a bit longer laying on a pillow using these headphones is not as comfortable as some other in-ear phones.

This product comes with a couple of components.1. Agility Shell: This is the case for the iPad Air 2 with the magnetic mount on the back to attach the the variety of Otter agility products. As you would expect from Otter this is a very solid case with a raised lip around the display. Access points to the lighting port and audio ports have enough gap that connecting should never be a problem. Baffles are placed in the raised lip to project the audio. If anything they seem to project the audio better.  The circular magnetic dock on the back doesn't really distract from the aesthetics of the case. The round hole reveals the Apple logo.Overall the shell by itself is a very good protective case with a non-slippery surface.2. Keyboard portfolio: This is a wrap around case that provides screen protection along with keyboard. This lightweight case with closing flap looks very nice. The agility magnetic dock makes it very easy to place or remove the iPad in the shell. This is the best system I have seen for doing this that both provides a strong connection to the case and is easily removable. In most cases I want to use the iPad free of the portfolio and dock it for travel or keyboarding. This allows me to do this with no problem. When closing the case a magnetic flap secures it.The weakest part of the portfolio case is that opening the case and folding for use.  There is a pull up flap that provides the foot rest for the iPad so that it does not slide further forward. This just does not feel that solid and interacting with the screen can move the iPad around. Also the viewing angle for the iPad is really not adjustable and I would prefer a shorter angle.A cardboard insert included placed on the portfolio shows that you can mount the iPad for portrait and landscape mode. While it is easy to do this with the magnetic dock to change orientation I found no way that portrait mode could actually be used with the keyboard. Other documentation does not reference this ability.The keyboard is fairly usable, or at list as usable as other iPad compact keyboards. I found it fairly easy to adapt to and there is solid travel on the keys. Works well with the new iOS 9 keyboard shortcuts and the Command key along with providing a home key. Function key provides media functionally along with cut/copy/paste.  Bluetooth setup uses the keyboard with the Fn key and a bluetooth key (9). There is also a dedicated power button along with using a standard micro usb port for charging.3. Wall mount: The wall mount comes with two pieces.  A mounting plate where you can either use the taped strips to mount on a wall or the two screw mounts. The magnetic dock slides over this plate for use. This provides a very secure mount and would look fine mounted in a kitchen or elsewhere.

When it comes to books on the Early Church Fathers there seems to be an increasing wealth of good books on the subject. One of my favorite books in this area is Rod Bennett‚Äôs ‚ÄúFour Witnesses: The Early Church in Her Own Words‚Äù. The reason I so loved this book is that Rod Bennett is a natural storyteller along with being a good historical researcher. His writing not only brought these men alive, but the historical era as well.So I was delighted to find another book on the Church Fathers that was as readable as ‚ÄúFour Witnesses‚Äù because of storytelling and grasp of the history. This book is Marcellino D‚ÄôAmbrosio‚Äôs ‚ÄúWhen the Church Was Young: Voices of the Early Fathers.‚Äù This book covers the period from Saint Ignatius of Antioch to St. Gregory the Great. The actual category as to the time period of early Church Fathers is rather loosely defined and subjective as the the end of it. Marcellino D‚ÄôAmbrosio offers a good definition. ‚ÄúThe Church Fathers are those great Christian writers who passed on and clarified the teaching of the apostles from approximately the second through eight centuries.‚Äù This definition makes more sense when you think of early ecclesiastical writers such as Origen and Tertullian as it does not rely on the writers sanctity or full orthodoxy.I am generally read in this era of history and so the stories of the men contained were not unfamiliar to me. Still I learned a lot more along with more being put into context. This book is much more than a historical litany of facts. The presentation brought to me a larger view and helped me integrate the information I already knew with the wealth of stories regarding these men. Plus with enough of their writings to want you to go to the sources and read more. This was totally an engaging read that will not just pass out of my memory in a fog of facts. When I compared this to Rod Bennett‚Äôs book I consider that high praise indeed and these two books together certainly have my recommendation.

As a powered USB 3 hub this is very compact and smaller than a deck of cards.Testing a USB3 SSD drive the tested data rates using "AJA System Test" were only slightly lower than the same test with the drive connected to a USB3 port on a MacBook Pro.As a powered hub I was also able to connect my iPad Air and it seemed to provide enough amperage to charge the iPad normally.USB3 cables can be rather thick and that is certainly true about the supplied cable which was as thick as many power cables. The light weight of the port itself means that the cable has a tendency to lift up the port and not to lay straight.The hub itself provide three ports on the front and one on the right side. The USB3 connecting port and power adapter are on the back. The power uses a wall wart so will use up space on many power strips.

As with other Amazon Basic cables I own, the word "Basic" is misleading as if these were low quality cables.Since Apple's lightning cables have a major tendency for the cable to fray even if you are careful in how you remove them, it is a good idea to go to other sources for certified Lightning cables.The shell of the connector is thicker and longer than Apple's cables giving you more surface to disconnect and connect the cable. The smooth shell is very similar to the feel of Apples's cable and the cord while slightly thicker feels much sturdier.These are quality cables and half the price of Apples 2 meter long cable.

Size-wise this scale is rather larger and heavier than most bathroom scales.  Although since this scale is rated up to 400 pounds, being sturdy is a good thing. Aesthetically it is rather pleasing with the curved white face with the scale numbers displaying through. Very readable.The main point to this scale is phone interactivity and it must use Bluetooth LE as I was able to connect to the scale via their iPhone app without pairing. I used the 2.0 version of the software which works with this scale along with other items from the same company.It does have Apple HealthKit functionality so that when you get on the scale and use the app the weight is recorded and entered into HealthKit data automatically along with date and time. Access to the scale part of the app is through the hamburger menu (funny for a scale) and one menu click. The app also gives statistics data along with other information. Although you can see this data via the Apple Health app also.The scale defaults to Kilo's, but when you turn on the phone app it changes over to pounds. I suspect this is related to the country you are in for determining this.It uses 4 AA batteries so you don't have to go looking for special batteries.

More like 4.5 stars. Normally I would want to place this book at five stars, but as good as this book is, his novel "Boy's life" is his five star book.This book take a cue from the Poe story "Fall of the House of Usher", but totally builds on it. The firsts half of the book is chuck full of atmosphere. You are dragged into an ever expanding mystery. Other elements introduced seem like they could not be really part of the plot but move to a cohesive whole.Throughout I was wondering if I would be satisfied by the conclusion. Would it answer my questions satisfactorily? Would so much mystery end in a dud? That was certainly not the case. Questions were answered in a convincing way as I did not feel cheated at all, really quite the opposite. I've read a bunch of his books this year and once again ponder why he isn't as well known as Stephen King. I like King a lot, but Robert McCammon is more fulfilling to me as a story teller. I've read seven of his books this year and am thrilled that I have so many more to discover.

Closer to 4.5 stars.I have always enjoyed stories about Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table. But aspects of the story as often portrayed made it more of a tragedy  than I story I could fully embrace. T.H. White's "The Once and Future King" is one of my favorite retellings, but the same story elements take some of the enjoyment away.So I was delighted to find a retelling that takes most of the familiar elements of the story and provides a different interpretation without totally removing those elements. The idea of a heir of King Arthur's living in almost modern times and being called for some destiny provides an interesting idea. The unknowing heir Blanche starts to find that everything she had believed and thought about the world was quite different than the reality. This is a familiar format in fantasy books to have a mundane enter a totally different world. Still this book takes these ideas and creates a story out of them highly worth reading. A world that gives you the best of the romanticism and idealism of Camelot.The story was a little slow in development as these elements come into play. Although quickly the story was moving right along. There was really nothing I did not like about the story and was glad to immerse my self once again into this legend. Better yet I loved the ending.I became interested in this book when I saw an entry from the author on the Superversive Blog "When Originality Is a Bad Thing", http://www.ljagilamplighter.com/2015/04/01/superversive-blog-when-originality-is-a-bad-thing/

The idea of an author interacting with his characters as he passes the 4th wall (a television related term) is nothing new. I first came across it in Vonnegut's "Breakfast of Champions." The excellent film "Stranger than Fiction" brought this idea to life where a man starts to realize he is a character in a novel and comes to interact with the author. Recently John Scalzi did a take on this in his novel "Redshirts."Still I was intrigued to see this concept taken to the Fantasy genre to see how it was pulled off. There has often been a segment of this genre where someone from the real world (or mundane world as Piers Anthony puts it) becomes involved in another world whether it is urban fantasy or a total world in itself. I've always enjoyed this type of story arc with the characters amazement and adaptation. So there is an aspect of this here.The framework of this novel is that student Sedrick is maintaining a fan wiki for an epic fantasy series. As a major fan he puts in lots of time into this site. Something happens and he is contacted by inhabitants of this world for help. We have here a situation that takes Tolkien's idea of "cocreation" in a fuller sense where a writer has created a world and the inhabitants are suffering due to the brutal nature of his world building and characterizations. Where rewrites and fixing of continuity errors can have drastic affect on real people.This is a fun idea and mostly it is pulled off successfully. How does an author respond when someone tells him about this? What are his responsibilities and the ethics involved? What can be done to change the situation. This and others are the problems faced in this novel. I find it interesting that the novels and movie I referenced at that start of this review along with this book all also have a comic edge. There is good amount of humor involved in this story as the characters resolved the situations they find themselves in. I enjoyed the story as these ideas were played around with along with other aspects.One thread of the story involves traditional book publishing and the rise of independent authors. Along with that rise is the increasing interaction between an author and his fans. I think of someone like Scott Sigler that built a fanbase online via podcasting his novels along with an author created fan site and tons of self-promotion. The wiki described in this book and the interaction between fans on the wiki regarding a story is quite accurate along with social media components like a subreddit list that acts as a forum. These play a part in the novel. Although I think the use of occasional wiki pages with character exposition interleaved in this novel was a bit overdone.The author calls this "Both satire and homage" to the implied "Game of Thrones." Still I thought the story stood on its own and that the satire aspect certainly lead to humorous aspects of the book.

Once again Lent is coming around again in it‚Äôs a annual cycle. Yet with Easter being a movable feast we still are always a bit surprised by the start of Lent regardless of whether Ash Wednesday starts earlier or later than average. Lent is almost something you can look forward to. We know we need that spring cleaning of the soul and that we have some work to do to get our spiritual lives untangled. Still if we think of an upcoming Lent at all we also know that we want to make good use of it.Yet once Lent starts we can hardly wait for it to be over. The saying ‚Äúno plan survives contact with the enemy‚Äù is often true of Lenten plans and we do have an enemy that would disrupt any plan towards growing in holiness. So exactly how do you maintain a good Lent? No doubt there are plenty of strategies to do so that we learn to adapt to our own personalities.I‚Äôve always found spiritual reading greatly helpful in this, but our moving inward must help us also move outward in the world. Fasting is very useful, but it also has to move into the dimensions of the spiritual works.So I was presently surprised to find an excellent book with all this in mind. Marcellino D‚Äôambrosio sent me a couple of his recent books including 40 Days, 40 Ways: A New Look at Lent. While there is a treasury of books with daily meditations during Lent, this book has that solid core while also being filled with practical suggestions. These suggestions help with concrete examples of how to live the faith. To externalize what you are learning. To take us out of ourselves.His personable style brings what he has learned in his own life through examples easy to relate to. This book is something to help challenge you through Lent and to make of Lent what you always intended but still fell away like a New Year‚Äôs resolution. Two to three pages a day makes reading this through Lent quite doable.I especially liked this points at the end of the book regarding Easter and the Easter season. Lent gets all the attention, yet it is the joy of Easter we are striving towardsAfter reading it I now look at the reviews and see that my own opinion was matched by many others whose opinions I trust, including my previous bishop.Marcellino D‚ÄôAmbrosio offers the neophyte as well as the seasoned Catholic a potpourri of Lenten reflections that are as engaging as they are practical. If you want to fall more in love with Jesus, then nourish yourself with 40 Days, 40 Ways!‚Äî Victor Galeone, Bishop Emeritus of St. Augustine, Florida

When I first came across Alice Von Hildebrand while watching Mother Angelica Live I was rapidly impressed with her. Her quick wit, intelligence, and common sense was a delight. Since then I have been interested in what she had to say. Around the same time I became acquainted with the works of her late husband Dietrich Von Hildebrand. I have by no means fully dipped into all his works, but I want to go further. His Transformation in Christ is a book I dearly love.When her biography of her husband came out The Soul of a Lion: The Life of Dietrich von Hildebrand I quickly attained and read it. Such an amazing story and an equally amazing man. You would think somebody who was a named enemy of Hitler would have his story more well known. There is at least a new book out called My Battle Against Hitler: Faith, Truth, and Defiance in the Shadow of the Third Reich.When I read Soul of a Lion I wondered about his later years since the story ends, as I remember, after his escape and ultimately ending up in New York. Some of this is covered in Alice Von Hildebrand‚Äôs new book Memoirs of a Happy Failure. While this autobiography does go into how she met her future husband and some of her life with him, she is mostly quiet on her personal life in this regard except when there are interactions with her students.What this book does cover is her life growing up in Belgium before World War II and her subsequent move to the United States during the war. The book starts out with her on a ship headed for New York that was threatened by a German sub with orders to evacuate before being sunk. I was quite interested in her descriptions of being raised in a very Catholic culture and the descriptions of her family members including the roles they played during the war. There were differences in both sides of her family that caused some tension.The large majority of this book covers her years as a teacher at Hunter College which is part of the City University of New York. This was to be where she ended up teaching philosophy throughout her career. Now having heard her speak I was aware of the difficulties she had regarding students versed in moral relativism as she taught the objectivity of truth. I just didn‚Äôt realize that this was a continual philosophical battle.What shouldn‚Äôt have surprised me is that this was rather minor considering even worse problems with the other faculty and those above her. The stories she relates regarding how she was treated by her fellow academics in such a pitiless back-biting manner raises your ire as she relates them. A Darwinian survival of the fittest where the fittest meant you had the right politics and sneer regarding subjective truth. Part of this was due to her being a women, but no doubt a lot of it was due to her being Catholic or really for being a faithful Catholic. Academics have no problem with Catholics just as long as they don‚Äôt believe that stuff. She describes how her education as taught by nuns little prepared her for such an atmosphere of prejudice and ill will.What I enjoyed most was her stories of students. It was quite obvious her love of teaching and her love of her students. There are many wonderful stories regarding the opposition she got and when the truth of what she was saying clicked with many of her students. Even stories of students converting to the Catholic Church despite the fact that she never talked about the Church at all in her lectures. Not all the stories regarding her students go well and some are rather sad. Still there were several that came into the orbit of her personal life along with her husband.
