Last year I read "The Rise of Theodore Roosevelt" by Edmund Morris, and after finishing it, could not wait to read the second volume in the series, "Theodore Rex," hoping it would be a worthy second act.Now after finishing "Theodore Rex," I can say with certainty that it does not disappoint, for Morris has given us a book that explains in detail why this extraordinary man is one of our greatest Presidents.The narrative starts on the day Roosevelt takes over the reigns of power from the assassinated William McKinley and ends eight years later when left the White House after refusing a third term that could have easily been his, and when he was barely past the age of 50.In between we are treated in detail to an onrush of great events: the building of the Panama Canal,the Russo-Japanese War and the peace negotiations that followed; the confrontations with the Trusts and the passing of the Food and Drug Act; the Panic of 1907; the coal strike of 1902 and the battle to get capital and labor to sit down to together and work out a deal; brinkmanship with the Kaiser's Germany over Venezuelan debt; an epidemic of lynchings in the South and an outbreak of discrimination against Japanese immigrants on the West Coast; the terrible injustice of the Brownsville, Texas dismissals (TR's worst hour), where black soldiers were kicked out of the Army without due process; the pacification of the Philippines and independence for Cuba; the conservation movement to protect natural resources and the creation of the National Parks; the expansion of American Naval power.  By the end of the book, we are given a vivid picture of an America fast leaving the 19th Century behind and hurdling headlong into the 20th.At the center of all this is Theodore Roosevelt, the man; an accidental President at a time when no Vice President who succeeded to the higher office had ever gone on to win a Presidential election in his own right.  That is until this human dynamo succeeded McKinley at age of 42.  Morris gives us a Roosevelt who is both a man of action and an intellectual of the first order; TR was a prodigious writer on multiple subject ranging from history to nature and politics.  And as I said in my review of "The Rise of Theodore Roosevelt," he was a man who thrived on challenge and was utterly unafraid of confrontation.  At the same time, he was remarkably free of rancor and bitterness; so much so that he could say kind words about William Jennings Bryan, a man with whom he strongly differed politically.In the pages of this second book, Morris makes clear what I think was the true reason why Roosevelt was such a success as President and why he prevailed against powerful opposition: he was a man who truly understood how and why the America of his day worked and had a clear vision of where he wanted to take the country.  Present political leaders take note, in fact I think Morris's book ought to mandatory reading for anyone who aspires to the Presidency.Morris also gives us a great supporting cast of characters: John Hay, JP Morgan, John Mitchell, Mark Hanna, Alton B. Parker (the most obscure man ever nominated by a major party for the Presidency), Henry Adams, Elihu Root, Philander Knox, Henry Cabot Lodge, General Nelson Miles, Kaiser Wilhelm, Tsar Nicholas II, Booker T. Washington, Alice Roosevelt Longworth, Oliver Wendell Holmes, a cameo by HG Wells and a brief appearance by Woodrow Wilson. Most poignant of all is William Howard Taft, Roosevelt's Secretary of War and chosen successor; a man who wanted nothing more than to sit on the Supreme Court.  The final chapter adroitly sets the stage for the tragic split that was to come in the years ahead.What I take most from Morris's book is how incredibly relevant the America of a hundred years ago is today; especially in the depiction of economic power and the extent it to which it would go to protect its influence.  In Roosevelt's time as in our own, great corporations were intent on buying politicians who would serve their interests and how anyone who dared stand up to them was branded as anti American and "socialist."  The Theodore Roosevelt who stood up and promised the American people a Square Deal would be right at home in the political thicket of today's politics.Edmund Morris is a master of the dramatic narrative and the fine art of making historical non fiction read like a novel; dramatic scenes jump off the page and once famous and now obscure personages come roaring back to life.Now, with two of Morris's books down, I can't wait to finish the series with "Colonel Roosevelt."

For decades I have heard the praises of Russ Meyer sung by such different critics as Roger Ebert and John Waters, but back in Meyer's heyday I was much too young to get in and see his films for myself; FASTER, PUSSYCAT! KILL! KILL! is the first Meyer film I've had a chance to view, although I've been aware of his work for more than four decades.  I well remember VIXEN playing at a neighborhood theater for two straight weeks back in 1970 and can remember admiring the poster for HARRY, CHERRY, AND RAQUEL in the lobby a year later.FASTER, PUSSYCAT,! Meyer's epic about Vegas go-go dancers on a murder and mayhem spree in the desert, is now considered his best and most famous work, and I was interested to see how well it holds up after all these years.Much about FASTER, PUSSYCAT! remains rooted in the mid 60's: things like Tommy's plaid shorts, Billie's mini skirt, sports cars drag racing in the desert, and lots of hip slang.  Then there is Meyer's leering attitude toward his buxom beauties, it all now seems to belong to a long gone time when boys still stuffed Playboys under their mattresses.But on both style and substance, FASTER, PUSSYCAT! was well ahead of its time in the way Meyer celebrates sex and violence; making it a harbinger of a whole new genre of movie making where sleaze and trash would become the hallmark of popular culture.  The America depicted in FASTER, PUSSYCAT!, one completely devoid of morality and common decency, beats NATURAL BORN KILLERS to the punch by 30 years.And the very uniqueness of FASTER, PUSSYCAT! makes it timeless in a way; there is no other movie that features female characters quite like Varla, Rosie and Billie.  These bad girls on the road are nobody's THELMA AND LOUISE; they are crude, cruel and take what they want when they want.  And woe to any fool who gets in their way.  Tura Satana is rightly celebrated for her nasty Varla, with her awesome body, razor sharp tongue and killer karate moves.  But I think she's matched all the way by Lori Williams's Billie, who showers in the nude under a water tank and has a most memorable drunk scene. Among the mostly hapless male actors, only Stuart Lancaster's pathetic and hateful old man comes close to stealing a scene from Meyer's lethal Amazons.As much as the sex, it's the violence in FASTER, PUSSYCAT that makes it stand out; most memorable is the scene where Varla beats Tommy to death in the desert or when The Vegetable stabs Billie repeatedly.  For me, nothing tops the sequence where Varla attempts to crush the muscle bound Vegetable with her sports car.Russ Meyer is long gone now, but his work lives on and his influence can be seen in the works of Tarentino, Paul Thomas Anderson, and even HBO's TRUE BLOOD series.  Not bad for a World War II vet with a great eye for the female form.  Check out FASTER, PUSSYCAT! KILL! KILL! and see what I mean; it's worth the time.

Having read GONE, I couldn't wait to read it's sequel,HUNGER, to find out where author Michael Grant had taken his characters and what he'd done with his fascinating story of Perdido Beach, where all of the people over the age of 15 disappear in a blink and the remaining children find themselves trapped behind an invisible barrier, while the rest of the world is...gone.  Oh, and some of the kids start to mutate and develop super powers such as telekinesis, the ability to shoot beams of energy from their hands, super speed, and the ability to heal wounds.  Did I mention the animals start changing as well?  HUNGER picks up the story three months after all the adults vanished and things inside the FAYZ (the name the kids give their peculiar exclusive zone) have gone from bad to worse.  The food is running out and the normal kids are turning on their super powered peers out of fear and jealousy. Then there is the disembodied creature at the bottom of a mind shaft outside of town; its gotten awfully hungry too, only it is hankering for the nuclear fuel inside the power plant just beyond the town limits.  This alien force has gotten into the minds of several characters already and plans to use them to in a scheme that would allow it to eat its fill and escape from the mine.  Author Grant stays true to form and has written another story where something is happening in every chapter; he frames each book in the GONE saga with a countdown-each chapter is simply titled by a number of hours and minutes-and each passing moment clicks down to a potentially catastrophic climax.  The tension builds as characters with both good and evil intentions (and some with a few shades of gray) square off.  And Grant has crated some terrific characters: School Bus Sam Temple, who finds his role as hero and leader an almost unbearable burden in this installment of the series; Caine, Sam's brother and deadly enemy, who plots to take control of the nuclear power plant; Lana the Healer, whose mind has been poisoned by the creature in the shaft; Diana, Caine's love and loyal lieutenant, who seduces a smitten computer genius into helping them; Brianna the Breeze, whose super speed powers are pushed to the breaking point; Duck Zhang, who can change the density of his body depending on his mood; not to mention Edilio, Quinn, Mary, Orc, Zil, and Albert. But the break out star of these books (if fan reaction is to be believed) is Drake Merwin, Caine's not so loyal lieutenant with a tentacle arm he can use like a whip; some female readers seem to think he's just a "bad boy," but it's obvious he's intended to be the one irredeemably evil character in the story.  As you get engrossed in the action, you sometimes forget these people are no more than fifteen years old-that's the kicker of the tale.  As I wrote in my review of GONE, I am more than a few years out of this book's intended demographic, but I found it to be surprisingly adult for YA fiction, especially compared to TWILIGHT or THE HUNGER GAMES.  There is a lot to like here for just plain old horror fans, like giant flesh eating worms and vicious mutated coyotes who can now speak.  I've watched interviews with Michael Grant on Youtube and find him to be a nice guy and wonderfully unpretentious and down to earth, the kind of writer who really wants to please his fans.  Let's hope that in his next book, LIES, we get some real hints as to what is behind the FAYZ and what the ultimate fate of all these fascinating characters will be.

I was 5 years old when JFK was killed and still vividly remember the black and white TV images from that day and the following, especially the sight of Lee Harvey Oswald being shot down on that fateful Sunday morning.  So imagine my anticipation when I learned that my favorite writer, Stephen King, was putting out a novel whose plot concerned time travel and the terrible events of November 1963 in Dallas,Texas.Now, after finishing the book's 849 pages, I can say that while Mr, King has written a book filled with many of his usual tropes, 11-22-63 is a novel of of great subtlety and restraint; nowhere does King go over the top in his quest for the big gross out; no monster clowns chomping down on little boys or buckets of pig's blood here.  Instead what we get in 11-22-63 could best be described as an epic version of The Twilight Zone, for in many ways it feels like King is channeling Rod Serling at his best.The novel's protagonist is Jake Epping, a thirty something Maine high school English teacher living in 2011, who through his friendship with Al Templeton, owner of a local diner whose burgers are ridiculously cheap for the 21st century, learns of a portal in time.  This handy portal is located in the pantry of Al's diner and once you step through to the other side, you are back in the year of 1958, where Ike is in the White House and Elvis is not only still alive, but thin as a rail. No matter how many times one goes through the portal and returns to the present (where only two minutes have passed even if you have spent years in the past), it is always the same day and year in 1958 on the other side of the portal, right down to the hour and minute; every trip is a complete reset.  Or so it seems.Jake is one of King's great everyman heroes in the tradition of Stu Redman and Clay Riddell from the The Stand and Cell respectively, which is to say Jake is a regular guy thrown into extraordinary circumstances who then rolls up his sleeves and does his best.  One day Jake is called to the home of his friend and favorite diner owner, where he is shocked to discover that Al suddenly appears to be many years older than he was only 24 ago and terminally ill with cancer to boot.  This sets in motion a chain of events that will send Jake back to the past on a five year quest to stop Lee Harvey Oswald, save JFK and prevent the Vietnam War.  This requires Jake to assume the identity of George Amberson, a high school English teacher with a murky past and an uncanny knack for making the right bet on the right winner at the right time.  His quest requires Jake/George to journey to Texas and build a whole new life in a little town outside Dallas while marking the time until he can step in and change the course of history.  What Jake doesn't count on is falling in love with fellow teacher Sadie Dunhill, and deciding that the past might actually be a nice place to stay and live out his life.But Jake discovers what his friend Al learned the hard way, the past does not want to be changed and will actively resist any attempt to alter its course.  I wouldn't dare give away the novel's twists and turns at its climax, but I'm sure most "constant readers" won't see it coming; just remember what I said about The Twilight Zone.Anyone who has read King knows he has great affection for the late 1950's and early 60's; and has a great ability to recreate those times down to the most minute detail, just read It or The Body to see what I mean.  In 11-22-63 he uses this gift of nostalgia to make a long gone America live and breathe again in the cars, the clothes, the music, the habits and the attitudes.Because, for the first time that I know of in his writing career, King is using real historic figures as characters in a fictional work, he pulls back somewhat on his characterizations.  What I mean is that no one is better than Stephen King in creating mean, sociopathic, hateful bastards (half the characters in Under the Dome could be described as such), but in 11-22-63 he never goes further than the historical record when depicting real life people like Marina Oswald, James Hosty, George de Mohrenschildt or General Edwin Walker, a right wing nutcase, but a rather dull personality if Youtube is to be believed.  King's Lee Harvey Oswald is not the personification of evil, but simply an abusive and delusional loser.For many baby boomers of a certain age, mainly those who were teenagers or young adults at the time of Kennedy's assassination, there has always been that great What If?  And it has become an article of faith among them that had JFK lived, there would have been no Vietnam War because he would not have escalated like LBJ did and America would have been spared the loss of all those names on the Wall and our country would not have splintered apart in the late 60's over the conduct of the war.  Somehow Camelot would have continued until the end of the decade, and all the hope, potential and optimism of the Kennedy years would not have been squandered; this notion has taken a powerful hold on our popular culture, for there is a reason why American Graffiti, National Lampoon's Animal House and Hairspray are set in 1962, the only year John F. Kennedy was President for all 365 days.But in truth, JFK was a tough Cold Warrior and very calculating politician, one who was ever sensitive to charges his administration was soft on Communism.  It is safe to say that Kennedy would have beaten Barry Goldwater in 1964, but after that the speculation is nothing more than seeing through a glass darkly, and it should be remembered that Vietnam proved to be a very hard nut to crack, a problem ultimatly resistant to all well intentioned western solutions.But I digress; 11-22-63 is a page turner in the best Stephen King tradition, a thriller with a sci-fi angle, while also a beautiful and bittersweet love story at the same time.  And for King fans there is a side trip, early in the book, to Derry, Maine and a couple of cameos by some favorite characters from IT, while a pertinent one from Christine turns up in the background as well. Let me say that if Frank Dunning and Jack Torrance were ever to meet, they'd discover they have a lot in common; even in fiction, to quote The King, the past and present do seem to harmonize.

This is a great little beginner book for the youngest of children. It is made of soft fabric and has playful voices that are activated by pressing the 3-D shape attached to the book. The voices identify things found in the book, saying things like "green circle" or "brown square" in a sing-songy voice. I like it quite a bit, and feel it would make a great gift to parents with toddlers.

These are little, floating bath toys for young children, and while sort of cute, they're not great. There are quite a few pieces to pick up after bath time is over, and I think most kids would be just as enthralled with a wet washcloth as with these toys., and would probably be more interested in playing with some actual 3-D animals and people toys than with 2-D faces, bones and flowers. Overall, I'm not real impressed by this particular toy, as it seems to be lacking in the fun department.

This is a high-quality, rugged floor mat that is just the right size to put in front of most front doors. (Even better, my front door was still able to swing freely over the top of this mat, due to its low profile!) The color is dark grey (almost black), so it can really be put just about anywhere, but I imagine it will most often find a home in mudrooms or near garage service doors. The thing feels like it would stop a bullet, so I have no trouble imagining that vacuuming stuff of the top of it will be a cinch. Also, because it is made from polypropylene, washing it with liquids will also be an option without degrading the material. So glad to have it!

I was very happy to receive a new laser measuring tool from Bosch as a review product. As the owner of other Bosch tools, I am very satisfied with the brand, as a whole, and am always eager to try out new things from them. I use a laser measurement tool (Bosch GLM 15 Compact Laser Measure, 50-Feet) when I am building project proposals for customers. I use it to take quick measurements of rooms, and it not only looks more professional than stepping off a room, it is faster and very accurate. While I was very happy with the measuring device I had been using, I had two issues with it that put me in the mindset to pick up another one:1. When I was measuring exterior projects, I could get accurate measurements for sections that were larger than the 50' measuring capacity of my tool, and...2. I really wanted one for both vehicles that I drive. Sometimes I would find myself half-way to a bid and realize that I left my laser measurement tool in the other vehicle, which was more than a minor inconvenience.Obtaining a second Bosch laser measurement tool should solve both of these issues. This one has a few more features, and can definitely measure farther distances, too, so I am thrilled with it. Time will tell if it can help with one other small issue I had with my other device: the red laser dot was sometime hard to see in bright daylight. While shopping for a newer, better device, I was on the lookout for one that had a high-energy beam that would still be visible in daylight on the exterior of a building. I am at the end of my exterior work season, so I may not get much of a chance to use it in that capacity this year, but who knows what the next month will bring? If and when I get to use it outside a few times, I'll be able to tell if I have the same issue with this one as I do with the other and can accurately update this review. Regardless, I am still happy with this product and am anxious to make full use of its available features.

A great box of inexpensive nitrile gloves that are great for many common uses. (In my occupation as a painter, I go through three or four sets of gloves each week.) There are some similar gloves in black from the same company, and I like those, too. I've tried lots of varieties of gloves from Ammex and they are all good products.

I got these gloves with my wife in mind. She teaches preschool, and those kids can be quite messy and disgusting! Whether she's cleaning up spilled glue on the shelf, picking up used Kleenex, wiping sticky food from a table, or scrubbing vomit off the floor, these gloves give some added reassurance and protection from all those kid germs. She was very happy to get a box of these to take to school and I'm sure her co-workers will be happy about it, as well!

A great box of inexpensive nitrile gloves that are great for many common uses. (In my occupation as a painter, I go through three or four sets of gloves each week.) There are some similar gloves in black from the same company, and I like those, too. I've tried lots of varieties of gloves from Ammex and they are all good products.

A great box of inexpensive nitrile gloves that are great for many common uses. (In my occupation as a painter, I go through three or four sets of gloves each week.) There are some similar gloves in blue from the same company, and I like those, too. I've tried lots of varieties of gloves from Ammex and they are all good products.

These are cute sippy cups for toddlers that have colorful cartoon animals on them, along with various letters and numbers. They are quite a bit larger than a lot of sippy cups on the market - and maybe a bit too large for young children. That's my only complaint about them. They work just fine and they are prettier than the average sippy cup. They are worth a look, but I'd more likely go with a smaller variety of cup than these.

Title: Hawkeye Vol. 4: Rio BravoPublisher: MarvelWriter: Matt FractionArtists: Chris Eliopoulos, David Aja, Francesco Francavilla (pencils, inks), Jordie Bellaire, Matt Hollingsworth, Francesco Francavilla (colors), David Aja (covers)Collects: Hawkeye #12-13, 15, 17, 19, 21-22Price: $17.99So, I guess this wraps up Fraction‚Äôs run on Hawkeye, and I am pretty sure that this is the end of the series, as well. If another Hawkeye series is launched, it will be post-Secret Wars, and who knows what it could look like by that point. With this being the end game for the series, I was expecting a good finish to the book. Did I get it? Mmmm‚Ä¶  not quite.This book has Clint‚Äôs brother Barney popping in, and the two of them seem to have an ongoing love-hate relationship with one another. The interactions between the two were good, and were probably the best thing about this book. Kate was largely absent from this particular volume of the series, but I can‚Äôt say that I missed her much. She has yet to grow on me as a character.The on-going conflict with the ‚Äútracksuit draculas,‚Äù of course, needed to be wrapped up, and it was. Along the way, Clint receives the beating of a lifetime, but ends up giving as good as he gets. The mysterious assassin character also makes several appearances. Somehow, despite having Clint at his mercy on several occasions, he manages to injure him instead of killing him, because‚Ä¶  well, it‚Äôs Hawkeye. Marvel isn‚Äôt going to kill him no matter what, right? He does end up with a permanent disability, though, because that‚Äôs what the current political climate is demanding ‚Äì more and more diversity. Instead of changing his skin color or making him homosexual, they decided to give him a disability. OK. Whatever. By this point in his career, he should have all sorts of injuries, so why not a disability? I can live with that. However, the nature of his new disability (deafness) made for some difficult-to-read comic book art. I get that the artists were trying to give the feeling of a person who can‚Äôt hear the people and sounds around him. They did this by lots of empty word balloons, confused facial expressions, and copious amounts of illustrations of sign language. Since I don‚Äôt know sign language, this was all pretty meaningless and hard to follow for me. It sort of failed in what it was trying to do ‚Äì at least from my perspective. I have no idea how a deaf person would react to it, but it would be interesting to hear about these pages from their own perspective.Despite the books‚Äô high points of action, humor, and suspense, I can‚Äôt say that the book thrilled me with its conclusion the way I was hoping it would. It was still a good book, but it just failed to meet my [admittedly high] expectations.I haven‚Äôt heard anything about new future projects by the Fraction/Aja creative team, but I hope this one wasn‚Äôt the last. I would definitely be interested in seeing more from them.Writing: 8/10Artwork: 7/10Cool Factor: 8/10Value: 7/10Overall: 7.5/10

Microfiber cloths are the best! I use them, on a pretty regular basis, at work, and I also use them to wash my vehicles. These are more appropriate for household use in the kitchen or for dusting, rather than for outdoor use. (You can always use them outdoors, of course, but they look too nice to be used outdoors.) The advantages of microfiber cloth are that it is super absorbent and super clingy. If you rub your hand across it, you can often hear a scratching sound as it grips all the little rough pieces of skin on your hand. It grips dirt particles the same way, making it an excellent choice for dusting or scrubbing. And because it is so absorbent, it holds more liquid than you would first imagine.I'm a fan of microfiber products, in general, and these cleaning cloths, in particular. They are a good value for the price.

The Jack Links brand of snacks is one that I often see at check-out counters at the home improvement stores. They always look very good, but they are so expensive that I rarely take the plunge and pick up a bag. True enough, they are incredibly tasty snacks, but it's hard for me to justify the cost of such a small back of food.Like any other flavor of Jack Links beef or chicken snacks, this one tastes delicious. They are just spicy enough to not burn up your mouth, but leave a good long aftertaste. Because they are so pricey, I can only rate them four stars instead of five. They are an indulgence that I usually have to go without. If you've got more disposable income than me, though, give them a try, because they taste great!

My biggest worry about this item was that I would have difficulty plugging it into a phone with a high-quality protective case on it. Thankfully, it still fit the port just fine even with my iPhone 6 Plus - Drop Tech V2 - Ruggedized Case - Black - Smoke covering the phone. The charger also fit snugly into the car power port and charges up the phone fairly rapidly. As a bonus, I can still use the USB port to run another charging cable to my kids' devices. The blue LED light is a novelty, to be sure, but it still looks cool, regardless. Overall, I am quite happy with this product!

Let me start by saying that as far as musical toys for kids go, this one isn't at all unpleasant. So many musical toys for kids get annoying very quickly, but I didn't find that to be the case with this one. The musical notes are neither ear-piercingly loud nor obnoxious in tone. They are simply notes from actual musical instruments that can be compiled to create a nicely-blended sound. I think the toy is great. It is well-constructed, not overly expensive and both educational and pleasing to the ears. I highly recommend it.

Both my wife and daughter tried out this new gizmo from Panasonic, and both of them found it was too painful for them to consider using on a regular basis. They both agreed that they would be more likely to use a razor than an epilator in the future. This was their first experience trying an epilator rather than a razor, and both were disappointed. I guess this sort of thing isn't for everyone.

If you are familiar with the GoodNites Underwear products, then you already know what these are and you already know that you will want to purchase some of these as well, so go ahead and do it. The cost of these refills outweighs the cost of time and hassle of changing wet bedding!

This is a really great product that should have been created a long time ago. My youngest is past the stage where he is wetting the bed at night (as long as he remembers to go right before bed), but I have younger nieces and nephews who can really benefit from these. They are a great transition from pull-ups to plain underwear, as they feel more like "big boy" pants, but they still offer the night-time protection of the pull-ups. I think they are a wonderful product that is well worth the price, and the re-fills aren't that expensive, either. I highly recommend these to all parents of young kids who have accidents at night!

As a general rule, I detest earbuds. They are uncomfortable, refuse to stay in place, get dirty far too easily, get tangled far too easily, and are kind of annoying. That being said, as far as earbuds, go, these are a step in the right direction. Designing these so that they go over the ear goes a long way to ensuring that they don't fall out of place as you move around. They are well suited to walking or slow jogging, at least. The sound quality is adequate, and the construction seems decent, if not anything spectacular. The price is not unreasonable, either. I much prefer these over any other earbuds I've ever tried, and that's saying something!

This is a backpack that is designed to take the place of a briefcase. You probably surmised as much by reading the name and description, above, but just in case you glossed over some part of that, I'm clarifying that for you, here. This is a backpack with a downtown commuting businessperson in mind. The backpack has no fewer than ten (10!) zippered compartments - many sized specifically for holding and transporting specific items, such as tablets, laptops, tote umbrellas, cellphones and standard portfolios. Inside it, there are even more unzippered pockets for slipping smaller items into. Throughout the entire backpack you will notice lots of thick canvas and padding. The entire thing feels very sturdy, and the zippers are thick, metal ones that you would expect to see on a heavy winter coat or sturdy tent. Overall, I am quite impressed with the construction of the pack. Empty, it will stand up all by itself on its markedly flat bottom - something few backpacks can do and something that makes loading it up even easier.I really like this backpack, but I simply cannot give it five stars due to one significant factor - the steep price. I have seen far larger, more spacious specialized hiking backpacks offered for far less money. In fact, you could purchase a hiking backpack and fill it with most everything you need for your trip for the price of this one "brief pack." It's a nice, specialized backpack, to be sure, but I don't understand the high price of it. It seems to cost at least double the price I would expect to see attached to it. At the extravagant MSRP it was given, it will not earn more than four stars from me.

Even better than the first, this all-new collection of cars and tracks is packed to the gills with great stuff. There are so many unlockables in the game to begin with, but all of the late DLC added even more new cars to the mix. This is a fantastic game with amazing graphics and REAL cars with passable physics and statistics. I can't wait to see what they come up with for the next edition of the series on the Xbox One!

Title: Moon Knight Vol 1: From the DeadPublisher: MarvelWriter: Warren EllisArtists: Declan Shalvey (pencils, inks, covers), Jordie Bellaire (colors)Collects: Moon Knight #1-6Price: $17.99Wow! What a great book! I have always enjoyed the character of Moon Knight and his weird origin and mental disorders, but I‚Äôve never read a Moon Knight book this good. Bendis did a great job a couple years ago with his year-long mini-series (Moon Knight, Vol. 1, Moon Knight, Vol. 2)starring the character, but these issues by comic-master Warren Ellis are just fantastic!Each of these 6 issues are written in a one-and-done format, so the entire TPB is a series of six loosely-related stories. Each of them is very interesting and unique. In the stories, Spector faces off against foes including ghosts, a sniper, a dead man, and a copycat killer. Each of the stories is a joy to read, and I can only hope that Ellis will return to the character at some point in the future to give us another helping.Declan Shalvey isn‚Äôt a name I was familiar with, but I have to say I really enjoyed his style of artwork. It was a bit reminiscent of David Aja‚Äôs work on Hawkeye and Iron Fist, but better. Jordie Bellaire‚Äôs colors bring it all to life just perfectly, too. Both the writing and the art on the book is more simplistic and elegant that what you‚Äôll find in a lot of books, but I found it to be almost perfect.This is (narrowly) my favorite Marvel book that I‚Äôve read this year, and certainly the best book Marvel published in 2014. I consider this book a ‚Äúmust buy‚Äù for any Marvel comic fan, and I really hope the folks at Netflix can put together a series based on this character and this specific material at some point, because it would be amazing as a TV series!Writing: 10/10Artwork: 8/10Cool Factor: 10/10Value: 10/10Overall: 9.5/10

I bought this GPS watch for my son who is a good runner. He is so good, in fact, that he doesn't have anyone on the team to push him anymore and must rely on his own self-discipline and goal setting to keep getting better. This watch does a good job of helping him meet his personal goals and keep track of his distance and pace when he is running solo. Though GPS watches aren't cheap, I looked at it as an investment for the future. If I can keep him running stronger and better and pushing himself to meet higher expectations, hopefully he'll be able to earn a scholarship one day.This watch is very easy to use, program, and charge, so my Jr High-aged son has had no problems working it and is glad to have it.

WWE action figures aren't really my bag, as I don't care for the show and all of its play fighting and drama. However, I can't deny that there are kids who would enjoy these things. Building action figures is nothing new. However, it has mostly been done in the past as a "collect-the-pieces-to-build-a-bonus-figure" sort of thing. Putting all of the pieces for one figure in the same package is a relatively new thing. At first it seems kind of silly, but then you realize that when you purchase several figures you can swap pieces between them - sort of like LEGO minifigs, but on a much larger scale. What concerns me is the ability of these pieces to stay connected over time. If you lose one figure, it's big enough to be able to find it. If you only lose an arm, though, that's going to be harder to locate by itself.I suppose that the characters will be fun to demolish as the kids play with them (gleefully dismembering the characters as they engage in violent wrestling matches), but how many times will they snap back into place before wearing out?The characters each come with some accessories that are unique to them - though not necessarily representative or indicative of anything the real-life characters wear in actual appearances. The characters also come with their own tattoos (claer stickers that kids can apply on the characters to bling them out. Again, I'm not real thrilled with the idea of promoting tattoos to children, but that is clearly what is going on, here.The price of these figures is a bit higher than similar action figures, though not obscenely so. They are OK for what they are, but not really toys that I condone for children.

WWE action figures aren't really my bag, as I don't care for the show and all of its play fighting and drama. However, I can't deny that there are kids who would enjoy these things. Building action figures is nothing new. However, it has mostly been done in the past as a "collect-the-pieces-to-build-a-bonus-figure" sort of thing. Putting all of the pieces for one figure in the same package is a relatively new thing. At first it seems kind of silly, but then you realize that when you purchase several figures you can swap pieces between them - sort of like LEGO minifigs, but on a much larger scale. What concerns me is the ability of these pieces to stay connected over time. If you lose one figure, it's big enough to be able to find it. If you only lose an arm, though, that's going to be harder to locate by itself.I suppose that the characters will be fun to demolish as the kids play with them (gleefully dismembering the characters as they engage in violent wrestling matches), but how many times will they snap back into place before wearing out?The characters each come with some accessories that are unique to them - though not necessarily representative or indicative of anything the real-life characters wear in actual appearances. The characters also come with their own tattoos (claer stickers that kids can apply on the characters to bling them out. Again, I'm not real thrilled with the idea of promoting tattoos to children, but that is clearly what is going on, here.The price of these figures is a bit higher than similar action figures, though not obscenely so. They are OK for what they are, but not really toys that I condone for children.

Everyone is used to bathroom spritzers that you spray after using the toilet. Probably most people have used an air freshener like Febreze Air Effects Air Refresher - Meadows & Rain - 9.7 oz - 2 pk or something similar. This is different, though, as it is intended to be sprayed the TOILET BEFORE you go rather than into the AIR AFTER you go. The stuff works, but it takes a bit of getting used to doing it in such a different manner. Maybe the reasoning is that it might not be healthy to be inhaling so much of the air-based stuff as you stroll through the bathroom? Maybe some people with sensitive noses have complained to employers? (I'm just speculating, here.) This stuff has a very strong scent to it, so you're definitely going to notice when it's used. Although there can't be nearly as much of it in the air as in the toilet, the scent is still quite strong in an enclosed area. It isn't a bad smell, just a strong smell, so this might not be the best choice for a very small bathroom.Overall, it's not bad, and I'd definitely be willing to try it again in some other scents.

As is the case with most any product made by OtterBox, this one is high quality. OtterBox build solid-looking and solid-feeling products that offer a high level of protection while still allowing full functionality. Some people complain, at times, that OtterBox products are too heavy. That is patently ridiculous. Those people are the worst kinds of pansies. You would have to be a person with some sort of serious debilitation to not be able to easily handle this product! With the case on it, your iPad isn't going to weigh any more than a medium-sized textbook, but with less girth.I have owned four iPad cases/covers to date - three of them OtterBox branded products. I have been happy with all of them. I have (including this particular case) three cases with attached keyboards. Of the three, this one is my favorite of the bunch. It connected easily and has a better feel to it than the other ones I own.I could really do without the wall mount, but it's a nice option to include. Some people are likely to find this much more useful than others. It really depends a lot on what sort of environment this product is likely to be used the most in. If you are mostly going to use it while lying in bed or sitting on a couch, it won't be very useful. Likewise, if you are only going to use this product while you are up on your feet, it won't come in handy. This is going to be most handy for people who will be using this product in a home office or kitchen nook/desk space.Overall, I very happy with this product and would highly recommend it to others. Just keep in mind that you may want to pursue a similar product that comes without the wall mount if you don't think you'll use it much. You'll save yourself a few bucks and won't have an unnecessary accessory to store someplace.

This is an excellent book for little ones - especially when they are old enough and strong enough to activate the sounds by themselves. This book is filled with simple images that correspond to several different sorts of musical tones that play when the attached small, padded music note is squeezed. This is definitely more of activity than a book to read, so don't think that you are buying a story book. This is intended to be a short introduction to various sorts of musical terms. I really liked it.

I would like this product a lot more if my nephew wasn't scared of it. I got it thinking that he would really enjoy a soft little puppet talking to him. (Kids like stuffed animals, right? So, of course, he would enjoy a TALKING stuffed animal, right? Wrong. He is scared of it and cries when I use it. Eeks! Well, this doesn't mean it's a bad product. I think the quality of all aspects of it is just fine. I'm only disappointed with it because my nephew doesn't like it like I assumed he would. I'll have to tuck it away and try it out again when he's a little older. First, I better get a good video of me scaring him with it though. That will be good material for me to tease him about when he's older!

So far, these batteries are working as well as I expected them to, which is to say adequately. They were less expensive than the name brand rechargeables, and this is the main reason why I chose to purchase them. I have installed them in cameras, Xbox controllers, and even small RC cars. They are working just fine. If I notice any issues with their performance in the long run, I'll modify my review at a later date. To date, I am satisfied with these batteries.

A bit more loose and flimsy that I was expecting them to be. The price was cheaper than some, but so was the quality. I'm pretty sure I won't be ordering these specific Mayday card sleeves again. They are fine if you just want something really cheap and basic. I'd prefer something a bit more refined, though.

This is a nice under layer garment that has a few noteworthy qualities:1. The size is as expected.2. It is insulating, while not feeling heavy.3. The thumb holes on the sleeves are larger than on some other tops, which means less chafing on the hands.4. Less expensive than most similar garments from the "sporty" companies.My daughter likes the fit and the look of it and is looking forward to wearing it on many cold Chicago days that lie in the near future!

This conditioner has a few different ingredients in the mix from the stuff I normally use, but it gets the job done, nicely. This conditioner smells great and works great. It definitely helped bolster my hair's natural waves and made it easier to work with when using the curling iron. It's worth taking a look at if you have some natural waves/curls in your hair.

This is an OK art creation project for kids ages 8+. Using different molds and blendable colored "clay," kids (or their parents) can make translucent peel-away window "stickies" that can be applied to any clean, flat surface. Likely this will include windows in their rooms, car windows, front home windows, bathroom mirrors, and refrigerator doors. The things stick surprisingly well and peel off cleanly - provided the hands that put them up were pretty clean to begin with.I think this project will appeal more to girls than boys, but there are probably some boys who will enjoy it, too. The price is maybe a little bit high for what you are getting, here, and some parents may not particularly want brightly colored objects stuck all over the place. Your own personal level of excitement or apprehension over the idea of this will contribute highly to your opinion of this product. Also, know that young kids will probably need some assistance with this activity.

I have been sampling quite a few products from Ammex Gloveworks, lately, and this is another one that hits the mark with both price and quality. My co-workers and I used these the other day while working on an exterior deck-staining project and we all liked them very well. I look forward to trying more of their products in the future. The gloves fit as expected and seem plenty stretchable before they break. Also, the price seems tolerable for the quantity of gloves you get in the box.

While I may, personally, hate quinoa, my nephew seems to think it perfectly palatable in this form. He readily eats it up without any issues. It seems to be a pretty healthy meal, too, so I had to give it at least four stars, despite my own personal aversion to quinoa.

These soft, light and pretty baby blankets are great for swaddling or simply covering your baby! They are machine washable, and come in many attractive colors/patterns. If you have a new baby on the way, they are definitely worth a look. They work well for nap-time and/or feeding time. If you are looking for even easier swaddling products, SwaddleMe has many to choose from that have hook-and-loop fasteners and those really make swaddling your baby a very easy process.

These soft, adorable baby swaddles are terrific! They are very easy to use, completely washable, and come in many attractive colors/patterns. If you have a new baby on the way, I suggest you give them a try. They are great for nap times!

These soft, adorable baby swaddles are terrific! They are very easy to use, completely washable, and come in many attractive colors/patterns. If you have a new baby on the way, I suggest you give them a try. They are great for nap times!

Mashin' Max is a 2-3 player game for kids ages 4 and up. In the game, each of the players chooses one of the three available color - each of which is molded to look like a different type of woodland critter- hedgehogs, bunnies or turtles. The object of the game is to leave the safety of your stump (starting area) and scurry around the forest (circular game board) collecting berries (white plastic chips) to bring back to your stump (safe zone). The big obstacle in the game is Max - a giant bear/monkey hybrid that dominates the forest. He is a violent beast who takes pleasure in squashing little forest critters with his giant fists. Max sits in the center of the circular game board, spinning around and slamming down his giant fists. If your little forest critter gets "squashed," you lose your stash of berries that they were carrying. The player with the most collected berries at the end of the game is the winner.Sure, this is a silly game, and it really isn't anything special, but kids will enjoy playing with it for a time or two, and it's always good to get kids off their screen/devices and into a socially interactive environment/activity now and then. I don't love the game but I don't hate it either. It's a typical sort of young children's game that has a quick play time, no strategy, and some moving parts. It's a fine game that ranks right in the middle of the road.

So, does this product really make your hair seem/feel/look younger? Meh. Not that we've noticed. My wife (age 43 at the time of this review) has very dry and very thick hair. She could go a week without washing it and it wouldn't look oily. She tried out this shampoo to see how it worked, and she felt there wasn't a strong difference between this shampoo and other shampoos she's been using. She didn't really think it made her hair any more youthful or full of vitality, anyway. It is fine as basic shampoo, but doesn't exceed our expectations in any way.

For a pack of 12 different colors, the price on this item seems fair enough. I recently purchased a dry erase calendar board to put up in my home, and I wanted each person in my family of five to have their own color of marker for their events. Buying this multi-color package was my solution for that. Expo is THE brand to buy for dry erase product, too, so I figured these would meet my expectations, which they did.

This is a nice rail cover that adds a bit of protection as well as a bit of color to a baby crib. Since one side covered with light padding still leaves three sides of hard, unforgiving surfaces, this is probably a product that you can live without, but that doesn't mean it's a bad product. The rail is the part you're going to be leaning over the most and the baby will be clinging to the most, so it's still a decent idea. If you want to spend a little extra on your nursery, go for it.

This is a somewhat silly game for kids that DOE NOT involve sitting around a table. In all actuality, this is more of an activity rather than a game. This activity involves safely traversing a laser-crossed path to get to a bomb and "defuse" it before time runs out. If defusing bombs and avoiding traps seems like kind of a mature theme for a game for kids, just relax - it's a plastic bomb that never actually goes off and the lasers are really nothing more than strings. You could really kind of set up a "game" like this all by yourself using yarn and some assorted clips, but this company thought to put it all in a box and market it as a game, so more power to them.This is a fun activity for a very short period of time. Kids will enjoy it the most if they are naturally creative. Kids who are glued to mini or large video screens most of the day probably won't enjoy it nearly as much as the kids who are very active and not addicted to devices. The novelty of the game will wear off pretty quickly, but it will last longer if two or more kids take turns challenging each other to make "rooms" or "courses" for one another to beat.Like I said, this is more of a play activity than a game, and it's pretty basic stuff, but there is some fun to be had with it.

Gale Force 9 has a reputation of being a company that does what few game/toy companies ever manage to do: make games based on movies or television shows that are actually appealing to gamers! Most games based on movies or TV shows are generally simple re-themes, and if they aren't they are too simple or silly to be any fun. GF9, on the other hand, has a good track record of making quality games that are fun and engage the brain. This is my first game from GF9, and I am quite pleased with it!Homeland is a hidden role game in which players act as government agents, terrorists, or political opportunists that each have hidden personal agendas. Throughout the course of the game, players will score points based on whether they accomplish their goals - namely preventing or causing terrorists attacks.The rules book is a bit lengthy, but part of this is due to the fact that is has copious amounts of pictures, illustrations and tips - all laid out in a clearly in large-font text. It will take a bit of digestion on the part of the person who is learning the game for the purpose of teaching it to others. Once players complete a round or two of play, however, the game is pretty easy to pick up and run through. Game play will typically last between 75-120 minutes. The game can accommodate up to six players, though a larger player count means that you'll have a longer play time and more down time between turns.The game has a nice theme that is relative to current world events, and even if you have never watched the show and are not familiar with it, it won't stop you from enjoying this game. Knowledge of the show is not necessary to understand or appreciate this game. The recommended age for players is 14, though I think 12-up is probably more accurate.Components are decent enough, and the cards probably won't be handled so much that you will require sleeving them. The game board is fairly large, so you will want a good-sized playing are to set up and play the game on.Overall, this is a good game that I have no problem recommending. After playing this game, I'm a bit curious to try out the Sons of Anarchy Men of Mayhem game to see if it's any good.

This is a basic waterproof quilted pad that is of fine quality. It is of similar construction, durability and price as many other similar products on the market. There is nothing particularly noteworthy about this (either positive or negative) product. I am satisfied with it and have no reservations recommending it to parents of infants who are in need of a product like this.

This is the fourth Epson printer than I have owned. It is replacing a previous model - the Epson XP-810. This printer does everything the former model did - print, scan, copy, fax, and it has just about the same footprint as the older model. It connects wirelessly without too much effort. Following the included instructions and the prompts on the touch-screen, it only took about five minutes to get it all connected to my home Wi-Fi network. (This may be easier for me than some, as I have done it several times before with other printers.Like every Epson printer I have owned, this one prints quickly and nicely. Lines and colors are vivid, and the printer prints pretty quickly - even when printing in color. I haven't owned it long enough to determine just how long the ink cartridges will last, but I suspect it will be very similar to my former printer. With that one, I generally spend about $100/year on ink cartridges. If that sounds high to you, don't be too surprised. I think this is pretty normal and you just have to face the facts that these ink cartridges don't come cheap.Overall, I'm very satisfied with this printer and I can't determine too many differences between this one and the previous model. That being said, I highly recommend this printer as a home use all-in-one compact printer. I have had great success with Epson printers and they are easy for me to recommend. Unless something happens to really thrown them off their game, I don't plan on ever owning a printer that isn't made by Epson.

This is a very sharp-looking formal watch from Invicta. It has the larger-than-average watch face that is trendy, these days. The watch band claps securely, and for me it fit just right. (For reference, I am a 6', 180 lb man.) The watch has a nice heft to it and seems to be solidly built.The controls on the watch are pretty standard for this type of watch, and fairly simple to learn to operate - so long as you at least peruse the manual that comes with the watch. It looks quite handsome when worn - especially if worn with white or black clothing. I tend to wear silver-colored jewelry more than gold-colored jewelry, but I like this watch quite a bit, and it goes very well with some of the more formal attire I own.

Compared to the original Campbell's Chicken Noodle that I am used to eating, this soup differed in many ways. The noodles, here, are larger, as are the chicken chunks. There are a few mushy carrots in the mix, too, along with a smidgen of celery, I think. Overall the soup is definitely a bit heartier, but tastes less salty than the common chicken noodle. It isn't bad, but it isn't great, either. I found it pretty average, so it gets only three stars from me.

Great luxury wristlet and iPhone 6 Plus phone case. Has multiple compartments for your ID cards, credit cards and or medical cards.I was recently offered the opportunity to try this wristlet and all in one iPhone 6 Plus case in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion. I jumped at the opportunity because I love the hot pink color and because I can never really find any stylish iPhone 6 Plus cases and much less one that has a wristlet combination.The case is a great high quality material that looks super expensive and cannot be beat for the price. It comes in a variety of different colors and bright and bold designs, a different choice for everyone.  It has the variety and beauty that I was looking for.Would also make a great gift for anyone that like myself dislikes carrying around a huge purse. I love the ease of hanging it on my wrist and keeping my hands free because I use a cane.I have other ULAK iPhone cases that I have purchased and I can honestly say that their products stand up to much wear and tear. They provide an extremely durable product at a reasonable price.**All opinions of this wristlet/iPhone 6 plus case are my own.

I'm in LOVE!!!! The fit is perfect!! It is made of a high quality material that feels luxurious against my skin. The colors are bright and beautiful.I recently purchased the Libian Jr. Tube Top at a discounted price during a special promotion in return for my honest opinion. I honestly wish I had ordered more of them in different colors.Great fit! Can be used casually, but can be also used elegantly.

Easy to use!!! I am in love with Dr. Song's Home Professional Tooth Whitening System. I recently received this kit at a discounted price during a special promotion in return for my unbiased review. I am so excited and happy that I received this opportunity!!!It is one of the easiest ways to whiten your teeth, that I have ever used!!! I especially like that it comes with pre-filled applicators, that takes all the guess work out of trying to figure out exactly how much is needed.Instructions are easy to follow and use. So far with only two applications, I can see a slight difference in the color of my teeth.In my opinion I would highly recommend Dr. Song's Professional Tooth Whitening System to anyone that is looking for a way to whiten and improve the color of their teeth.

I have 2 boys and I am always looking for things for them to do. It also feels like they have a school project every two weeks. So when I was offered the opportunity to purchase the Crafts 4 Kidz Liquid Chalk Markers by Impulseev at a discounted price in exchange for my honest opinion, I was super excited to get them.The Crafts 4 Kidz Liquid Chalk Markers comes with 8 bright, different colors and 24 labels that can be placed on just about anything.  The markers themselves work on glass, ceramic, chalkboards and any non-porous surface. Basically anyplace you can think of.I love the variety of colors and the ease of writing with them, but I'm especially impressed with the ease of cleaning it off, easy peazy like my son says. They are also great for kids to use because they are non-toxic, and most importantly they are dustless, which is great because both of my boys have asthma and dust is a big trigger.My boys and I had a blast using these liquid chalk markers to decorate our windows just for the fun of it and now they can't wait for the holidays so they can do it all over again.I would definitely recommend the Crafts 4 Kidz Liquid Chalk Markers by Impulseev!! Great for kids as well as adults!! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

I continuously color, flat iron and blow dry my hair, so it feels brittle and it seems to fall out in bunches every time I wash or just brush my hair.My pharmacist actually recommeded that I try Biotin when I ask him what I needed to do to help with all the issues I've been having with my hair.I have been taking this Biotin for a few weeks now and I have to say that I have noticed that my hair is falling out much less than before. I have also noticed that my nails have grown quite a bit this is one of the strongest quality Biotin that you will find.I feel that if I continue to take the Greenwise Products Biotin I will see much more improvement. I received this product in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion during a special promotion and I would recommend this product for help with thinning hair and hair that is falling out, it will also help with any nail issues

I am in no way a beginner with toys but I was extremely excited to try this Pyrex Tempered Glass Dildo. So when I was offered the opportunity to try it at a discounted price during a special promotion in return for my honest and unbiased opinion I immediately accepted.This is a great toy for beginners or experienced users. In my case I've always used silicone toys and this way actually my first glass/Pyrex tempered toy. Tempered meaning that you can heat or cool the toy to your desired temperature. You can warm it in the microwave or give it an ice bath if you like the cold sensation.  It is also great for clit simulation but you can use it as a butt plug if that's your pleasure.It is not a very thick toy. It is about 8 inches long, the head is more or less 3 inches long and the ribbed end is about 5 inches, totaling 8 inches.  The blue ribbing on the shaft is just beautiful. It gives it a classy look and it comes with a nice black bag so it can be put away discreetly (for the noseys).  But what I love the most of all is how easy it is to clean and keep it clean.I know if I enjoyed using it alone, I can't wait to use it with my hubby. I would definitely recommend this to anyone that is looking for a great toy, that is easy to clean and at an affordable price. A MUST buy in my book!!!

I have fibromyalgia and sometimes (a lot of the time) my hands don't work. Luckily I was offered to try this Jar Wrestler Silicone Jar Grip at a discounted price during a promotion in exchange for my honest opinion.So far I can't live without it!!! It has definitely made my life so much easier. It is super easy to use, you just put it on top of any lid and turn. It helps to get a steady grip and open any jar.I would definitely recommend this to anyone who has arthritis or any other health issues that makes it hard to use your hands and fingers. Thank you Jar Wrestler Silicone Jar Grip.

Summer is right around the corner and I am always looking for a water bottle that keeps my water cold and is easy to carry around. Lucky for me was offered this Stainless Steel Water Bottle with Carry Case from BruArcher at a discounted price during a promotion in return for my honest opinion.I LOVE it!! I have a cane and a purse, besides everything else my hands need to hold, so the travel pouch this water bottle has is a god send. It is a stainless steel water bottle, that has a large enough mouth to fit ice inside and keep my water super cold. It holds about 16oz., and the screw on lid is just as great as the carrying case you can clip it on to just about everything.I definitely recommend this Stainless Steel Water Bottle with Travel Case from BruArcher. I know that I'll definitely be purchasing another one because my hubby isn't getting mine.

Having a 5 year old son that just loves all types of toys, especially the loud and bright ones, I jumped on the opportunity to try this 3D Train by Techege at a discounted price in exchange for my honest opinion.My son just loves this 3D Train especially because of all the lights and sounds. It is made of a very durable plastic and has wheels on the bottom that help the train bump and go. The lights are great  fun and the train sounds are a little loud but it's something I can live with. The battery lid is not screwed in so you have to make sure the batteries don't pop out.I would absolutely recommend this for any child that loves trains.

My youngest son loves planes so when I was offered the opportunity to try this F16 Military Fighter Jet at a discounted price in exchange for my honest opinion I was very excited to get it for him.The plane is made of a very sturdy plastic that so far has withheld very well to all the tumbles and roughness of a 5 year old boy. It comes in a few pieces that are very easy to assemble, my son can put it together on his own.The only minor issue is that it is very loud but other than that I would absolutely recommend it to anyone that is looking for a great toy at a reasonable price.

I'm a person that is always worried about safety, especially at night since I am disabled. Lucky for me I was offered the opportunity to try the Bubba's Leash Light at a discounted price in exchange for my honest opinion, and I LOVE it!!!The Bubba Leash Light is just amazing!!! It comes in a pack of two, which is a great deal for the price!! It is super easy to attach to your pets leash and easy to turn on and off.It works on watch sized batteries, which makes it was to change it when needed. I find the Bubba Leash Light to be a multipurpose mini flashlight. I mean, you can attach it practically anywhere and to anything!! I have one of them on my set of keys, so I know that I will always be prepared in case of any emergency.It is a must get for anyone that walks their pets at night and is even great just to have on your keys for any type of emergency!! You will definitely NOT be disappointed.

One of my best friends just had a beautiful baby girl. So I was more than excited when I received the Choopie City Grips during a promotion at a discounted price in exchange for my honest unbiased review.I ordered the pink and grey chevron design and I have to say that I was so excited see it on her stroller. It is just so adorable and it personalizes the handle of the MacClaren stroller that she has.It is super soft and comfortable and you really no longer need to worry about germs because you can easily take it off and toss it right into the washing machine.  Best of all it protects the handle on the stroller from getting damaged from everyday wear and tear and protects your hands from getting all sweaty and cramped up from the regular handle.I would definitely recommend these for anyone that has a stroller or even as s baby shower gift.

I'm 42 years old and sometimes I feel like I'm twice that age. I was diagnosed with fibromyalgia, arthritis and I have three herniated/bulging disks in my lower back. So you can imagine my happiness when I received this product at a discounted price during a special promotion in exchange for my unbiased opinion and honest review.I wish I had gotten the Coccyx Seat Cushion by VIVE before.
