It doesn't have any strange type of smell and it super crunchy!!I know that Gucci enjoyed the new Natural, Healthy, Fat Free Dog Treats by Pet Healthy Holdings. So I'm sure that many other pups will definitely enjoy it as well!!

These are premium looking headphones that offer excellent sound. Love their unique look in exceptionally thoughtful packaging they came in. They have plenty of Pros:PRO:Beautiful high end and somewhat futuristic designSolid construction with aluminium accentsPackaging very clever and high endClear sound when playing music and making phone callsGreat price for the premium feel and designNEUTRAL:The fit could be better. They don't have a foam and I couldn't get them to stay in my ears without falling, but my wife's ears were fine, so they have very much "ear dependent fit" .Bottom line: Overall these are wonderful headphones if you have the right ears which something you have to buy to find out.

I purchased fanless 30W LEDs about a 1.5 years ago for projector fog lamps in 2014 Durango which were just a bit brighter then stock halogen but I was constantly looking for brighter options. I finally splurged on these thinking that being "9000 lumens" it would be really bright. After installation I was dissapointed, they turned out just a bit brighter, perhaps 10%. Also due to its design there was a dark line in the center of the projector lens. Overall though they are just as bright as 35Watt regular HIDs that I tried before. Still looking for that "really bright alternative".

There were no reviews when I bought it and these were the most expensive out of all available options, but it deter me from trying them out. These are made out 100% unbleached paper (made in Canada), unlike other options using polyester and glue. No harmful or toxic material used in these as far as I can tell and read. They don't fall apart or any weird smell when used in the hot water. Perhaps they cost more in comparison to other options, but you don't have to be rich to afford them. Bottom line the best healthy tea bags I could find! 5+

The iClever Intelligent 2-Port 4.8A 24W USB Car Charger with SmartID Technology is the best car charger I have ever used!Pros:* 4.8 amps of power shared between the USB ports and both ports supply max 2.4 amps*Very compact in size for its very high output of 4.8 amps*Very Solid build construction, appears to be made from aluminium combined with plastic*Excellent price*Grip to pull out or push in the car charger easily*High quality construction*Did not have any compatibility issues with my Android & Windows mobile devices*Blue LED when plugged inNeutral:* Only one blue led in one of the USB sockets, would be nice to have in both, but not a deal breakerI highly recommend this car charger.

This is actually my first multimeter and overall you can't beat the price for everything you get in it. It has enough features for someone who is new to multimeters without having too many options on the actual dial which could be confusing at times.It really can be used in many situations. It actually proved it's usefulness immediately when I was measuring current in the IP camera that was half dead. This multimeter made it so easy to switch to amps so I can read how many amps where being pumped through the ip camera.Pros:Easy to read and understandAppears to be quality buildEasy to useAutomatically powers off if you are not using it for a long timeNice standBacklit displayNeutral:Prefer different battery type instead of 9V, but not really a big dealCons:NoneYou can't beat the price for everything that you get in this product. A sample of this was provided for my honest evaluation. I'll update this review as I play more with it!

The product is very simple to use. Simply twist to turn it on and it shines. Looks even better when placed inside bottle as intended. I don't keep empty bottles handy around, so just I grabbed the only bottle I had available which was typical dark green bottle with some red wine remaining and inserted the light. It was daylight and I was somewhat disappointed by the results, but when I tried it at night in the dark using lighter colored bottle it looks really cool. Camping season is over, but I think it will have a great use for corking bottles and finding them in the dark. The battery seems to run a long time, but I did not time it yet. I will update this review once I play with it a bit more. The only thing I wish it was a bit more brighter, but overall this is a cool product and will work great for gifting. I did receive this product free in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion.

My first one I received had a defect, but Outback River support went above and beyond on this, so they deserve 10 stars. Company really takes care of its customers. Thank you!As far as the light go, it's the best I could find that takes single AA battery, very bright with multiple modes including red light. Great for camping and for one of those moments when you need to grab and go.

I was looking for the best and healthy lubricant and was excited to get this after reading excellent reviews. First of all, the ingredients listed sound anything but healthy, but most importantly this lube gave me irritation and itching for several days after use which I never gotten from cheaper lubes. As far as lube performance goes, it is excellent and like most said it has just right lubrication which lasts. I do agree with one review that mentioned this bottle requires two hand operation and when this stuff gets on your hand, you better wipe it off before touching partner. Anyway, for me it didn't work and I can't return this since it's a personal item, but I will keep looking for another lube

I bought these a year ago from another retailer and installed in 2014 Durango fog lights. They are just a bit brighter then Oem halogen but range is shorter. They appear to be slightly blinking when Ac is on. Not much else to add they ate just average for the price. I will be shopping for brighter set.

At first glance this a box with compartments and a lid, seems like quality made (in China) but I thought it had high enough barrier between compartments to prevent food from roaming around the box. Unfortunately, the gap is too much in this box to be useful, especially if you are planning to give this your kid as box lunch. Probably best for larger foods, but then compartments are quite small, so I am not sure what's the purpose of this then. Anyway, I have no use for this now.

First of all these are sold for 4x less at all Chinese sites around $7 for a pair @ Aliexpress. These are bright, but unforunately run too hot and could damage the socket, so only use them in the backup lights.

I prefer warmer water to swim and even in warm pools I used to get cold. I don't know why but I have not been considering this years ago. I bought this along with shorts and a vest. Perfect combination for any kind of water activity even on a hot 90 degree day.Quality seems to be good and I am 190 5'10" and I bought Large which fits me well, although maybe I would prefer a bit tighter fit.

These are spacer for AA to C. Eneloops work fine and this basically you save 50% getting these instead of official spacers for Eneloops. I guess the only negative it doesn't come with a kitchen sink...

I am impressed! Writing long messages on a smartphone is a chore for me and then I decided to try this portable keyboard. I actually ended up writing entire review using this keyboard while in a coffee shop and enjoyed the experience every bit. There was some getting used to period, but I was able to adapt quickly to this design. For the record, I usually type 80 wpm on a regular keyboard, on this I could reach 60 wpm with the test I've done. Lets get to the Pros:Pros:- Beautiful design and solid build quality. The back appears to be made out of aluminium and the front looks like a laptop keyboard- Keyboard keys feel good, almost like notebook feeling just a bit more compact- Bluetooth connection is excellent and decent range- Long battery life and I am yet to deplete it after a day of use- Carry pouch included (I like to keep my gadgets scratch free)Nice to have:- Wish it would have a stand to rest a smartphone against- The backspace button is a bit smaller which might take sometime to get used to it, but not something I would be too overly concerned- Lock for folding mechanism when using it on a lap- Flat aluminium back would be sleeker and possibly more stableOverall: This is a wonderful and clever designed travel keyboard. I could see myself using more then I thought I would. It really helps to reduce the time it takes for me type long emails on a smartphone by roughly 70%. Highly recommended!I will update this review once I get to use this product more extensively.

I've gone through several portable air conditioners and currently I have 8000 BTU SOLEUS AIR KY-80E9 (do not recommend), Delongi 12000 BTU from Costco and now this. I ended up getting rid of Soleus and now able to maintain comfortable temperature throughout 1500 sq feet with just 2 portable ACs.Cooling power:More BTU out of Global and it really does a decent job to cool and maintain comfortable temperature. I have about 450 sq feet space and was able to bring down temperature from 87 to 80 in about couple of hours. If I keep the unit on entire day and turn on fan only circulation for my furnace I was able to maintain 76 degree temperature throughout entire 1500 sq feet while it was 90+ degrees out. Although, take it a with a grain of salt, because not every home is the same.Noise:Global is only a bit quieter and there is an ECO mode in Global that could reduce the noise level. Also, I downloaded Android app called 'Sound Meter' and if I stand next to both of it shows 80-85 dbi. Bottom line, in my experience there are no quiet portable ACs.Fan power:Global moves more airDesign:Surprisingly the unit looks high end even though it was the cheapest I could get for 14000 BTU. It has touch sensitive buttons and nice sleek panel. Also the vent door is automatically opens/closes. Size wise it's only slightly taller then my 12000 BTU, but a bit thinner.Unlike what previous reviewer said vent hose is the same size as other ACs I've tried, no issues here. The window kit is not great. It has two attachments that you have to screw on and which are not adjustable and a bit short to cover any window  in my homeRemote holder is ok, I wish it was more secured to the unitWhen not in use you can plug the cord into the unit itself. Nice touchOverall, this looks, works as more expensive 14000 BTU units. Time will if it will last, but so far I like it.One negative is that the compressor makes buzzing noise (most ACs do that), but this unit has slight vibration in the buzzing which a bit annoying, but could be just my unit.
Ive tried Toys R Us brand as well some other cheap brands from I bought from various retailers and nothing beats these bubbles so far. For $10, it's worth trying

My review probably goes unnoticed, but in case someone does care about their Bluetooth speaker they should look elsewhere. I had Bem cube speaker for a few years now which I got for the same price ($30), it's a bit smaller then this and battery life isn't as great, but it sounds miles better then Anker. I don't care much about bass and surprised people actually think this one produces good bass. In my experience this speaker didn't deliver on the sound quality or loudness.On the positives, I do like microUSB plug and buttons location and battery life but that's about it.

The first time you try it, especially if you follow directions, you'll be disappointed. This stuff gets hard pretty fast. I have experimented with different approaches until I found one that is acceptable. Basically, whenever I need redo/reuse I warm up the water to 190 degrees and use heavy duty rubber gloves and keep dunking it in the water. I'd like to try this with a heat gun as well, because working with hot water gets a bit tiring because you constantly have to heat it up. I made real glasses for kids and it's amazing how durable yet flexible this material is. Highly recommend!

We all know the convenience of a microwave, but it has major drawback - the reheated food doesn't taste the same. Also using oven or reheating on the pan is just not always convenient/efficient, so this comes to a rescue. It heats up quickly and warms/cooks food on both sides. I used to reheat pizza and make grilled cheese sandwiches. Speaking of grilled cheese sandwiches on this cooker. I prefer to use only one slice of bread and cheese on top. This cooker crusts the bread at the bottom and melts cheese on top, something you can't do in a microwave. Non stick surface seems to work great, but my only concern is what type of covering it is. Considering it's pretty cheap no mention if what they used to make it I would have to assume it contains bunch of chemicals, but it's just speculation. Also, lack of the power switch is a minor annoyance in otherwise excellent cooker.

UPDATE: 10/29/2015I ended up getting a second one a few month back, it seems there were slightly improvements. My first one froze up a few times and gps stopped working, but otherwise still recording. There are no more firmware updates since May and looks like they are release new version 0827 & 0901.UPDATED: 6/11/2015I've been using this dashcam for 6 month now. It was first batch and the unit worked flawlessly. I haven't done any firmware updates and have not had any issues.  I just ordered a second one after not finding anything better for the price and compactness.UPDATED: 3/16/2015Presently IMHO this is as good as it gets for a compact dashcam with decent enough image quality and features for the price. I came from using BlackVue 500 (you can see my review) and most recently SJ4000. The only reason why I keep upgrading is I am always looking for the best IQ I can get for the price. I will not go into reviewing all features the cam has, you can get this from either manual or specs, just cover the main points that stand out for me:PROS:1. Image Quality 8/10. You can pretty much spend $100 or $300 and will not see any huge difference in IQ. As a matter of fact these newer A7 units combined with good lens will provide as good IQ or in some cases could even outperform slightly higher end devices  from FineVu, BlackVue etc...  0806 provides nice day time and decent night time picture that you can even make out license plates in some dark conditions. Still far from perfect but this is what I will have to settle until the next generation of sensors. It uses A7LA50 Ambarella which  you'll find in a lot of recent dashcams these days, (slightly better then A7LA50D used in previous generation 0801/0803) so they should all perform the same? Not always, also depends on the quality of the lens, sensors used etc... As an example check out sample videos for G90 with A7LA70. It actually looks just slightly better in the daytime, but at night time images appear darker.2. Design 10/10. I was looking for a compact unit without a huge suction cup which most dashcam use. It's quite compact unit and I like the new low profile dock. It's really thoughtful design too, there are 3 usb plugs where you can plugin the charging cable, two on the dock and one on the unit allows flexible placement of the dashcam on the windshield. Also it's nice that you can easily slide it from the dock without having to detach any cables. It does take quite a bit of effort to slide in and out, I rarely do that, so it's not an issue for me.3. Dual card recording. This is the first dashcam I've seen that offers dual recording of up 128GB cards each! Great for anyone who needs a long video log, also you can use the other slot to backup data in case you need to make a copy for anyone on the fly.4. Support. It's also important point to consider. I've bought dashcams before where it was difficult to either find a firmware upgrade or any support from the manufacturer. It's not an issue with the unit, the manufacture constantly updates the dashcam with new firmware which you can find at mini0806 website.5. Mine came with CPL filter that helps to eliminate the glare which is another feature that rarely seen on most other dashcams. I am not sure I will use it, especially for night time recording, but it's definitely a nice option to have.NEUTRAL:1. I didn't buy it for GPS, but it does have it and it seems to work ok. Signal gets locked in about a minute on mine on good days and other days I had it start after 6 minutes so it's YMMV. I like how you can embed GPS coordinates in the video. (UPDATE: They fixed a design issue with the GPS in latest batch, so it should lock much faster now)CONS:1. Build quality 7/10. The only thing I am not too impressed at the moment. The casing creaks, buttons have cheap feeling to them when pressing  and rotation of the unit is bit difficult. SJCam 4000 that I am replacing had overall better build quality.2. A few bugs, but that's expected this being a new release. For instance, it's showing mph, but the actual speed is calculated in kmh. (Update: Fixed)3. Screen is only 1.5" and resolution is not that great. Ok for changing settings, but reviewing videos is a painful process.NICE TO HAVE:1. I would like WiFi with apps support instead of LCD screen which is too small to use2. Higher resolution 4k would be nice with even better night time vision. Perhaps even 60 fps option.UNKNOWN:1. Reliability.2. Does it get hot? It gets warm as far as I can tell, but I can't really test it because I am in a cold climate. They did mention they improved the design by adding additional cooling vents vs older design on 0805Where to download latest firmware?I can't list links in the review, but if you search for "mini0806 Dash Camera - Home" you should be able to find the link to their  website, or look through comments.Why not get 0805 vs 0806?They both have identical hardware, but 0805 uses older design and has less features: different mount, no dual card recording, no CPL filter, can't mount it up side down, different lens angle 120 vs 135 viewing angle.BOTTOM LINE:As of today this is my favorite dashcam. I have been using this cam for over a month and once I mounted it I forgot it's even there. With such low profile mount I was able to mount it close to the headliner behind rear view mirror so it's completely out of my view. Other units I've considered/researched BlackVue DR600GW-HD and  SJCAM 5000+ (also with A7 Ambarella) they both offer wifi option. Both of these cams are higher priced especially DR600GW-HD at around $300 and based on the video samples I've seen it doesn't seem to offer any improvement in the IQ for the price.

I got a black version. The back is not glossy, it's matte which is perfect, however the rim around it is. The cutouts are very even and for all buttons which is the only TPU case I found so far. The fit is snug. Bottom line this is an excellent case. The only negatives is that it's kind of plain, I would've preferred some texture, also it actually feels a bit slippery, but time will tell.

The router has nice and clean web interface albeit lacks some advanced features that you find in other routers, excellent range and decent throughput. Considering that UI is very simple looking and lacks some advance features that competing products have, I believe Dlink is targeting different crowd with this. Don't expect DD-WRT level of customization or even what Asus AC routers have to offer otherwise you'll be disappointed.I am upgrading from Netgear R7000, technically they both have identical specs in almost every aspect, except CPU. Which is slightly better on Netgear (BCM4709A vs BCM4708A). In most professional reviews Netgear and Dlink performed very similar and perhaps Dlink was close behind but in real world usage it feels quite the opposite. From my experience Dlink DIR-880L offers slightly better browsing/streaming experience, seems like the optimized the firmware better, although the throughput is marginally better on Netgear. The 5Ghz band range is about the same on both, while Dlink has a bit of advantage in 2.4Ghz band.My network consists with about 18 devices, lots of IP cams, tablets, pcs, smartphones, smart tvs two network attached storage units (QNAP), wifi thermostat that cover 2500 sq/feet. This routers performs excellent, without any need of any extenders which I had to use for my R7000 in 2.4 Ghz band.In terms of firmware the router lacks: limited to 15 rules for port forwarding/virtual server, no mac filtering, can't select type of encryption to use AES/TKIP, there probably other things that it doesn't have, but I don't have the need for those.For the price this is an excellent router and while I have above average user needs for my network this router performs well in my environment.

I've used Nilkin case for Z1 for a year and it was excellent, actually hold up pretty well after over a year of heavy use. Although, the case cause some wear and tear to the phone, the dust behind left imprints on plastic and the silver around the phone rubbed off a bit. With Z3, I am putting extra layer of protection to the back, but I don't think there is anything can be done to protect the sides. So back to this case. It looks like with this Z3 version they added a bit more protection on the corners, but otherwise it looks the same. I picked up brown color, but it's pretty dark and looks like black anyway. The only disappointment was when I found out the case didn't work with Sony dock, but it worked perfectly with the dock I used for Z1. Which btw was better dock anyway because you can just slide it and it fits perfectly especially with Z3. See picture
It's a lid and looks like a good quality. I bought it use with 12" Tramontina fry pan and it fits, although not the perfect fit as I would've hoped. There is a just very slight gap

I bought one and just like everyone else I found out that handle was a bit too small, but I kept it any way. Recently ordered another one (From Sotabletop seller) and to my surprise they shipped a new version with longer handle, looks like Bormioli listened to complaints and fixed it. See picture. The width is the same though, I wish it would've been slightly thicker. Another thing is I didn't care for was the ice container which is screwed to the lid and makes the lid too dip, so when you fill the jug almost to the top the part that used to attach ice container is submersed in the liquid. I might cut this out, but I wish it was better designed.Otherwise, this is the best glass jug I found so far. Great balance when full and pouring liquids and no spills. Also as a bonus it looks beautiful.

I decided to buy this remote instead of using smartphone app to control one of my bulbs. What got is exactly that's pictured. Feels good in hand and good quality. Buttons are touch sensitive and it's not something I prefer, but it's easier to wipe it clean when it gets dirty. The controls are responsive and don't lag at all. Range is not amazing, but it good enough for my use. I only have control the bulb from 10 feet. Occasionally, when the remote doesn't get used for a while it stops responding, but it only happened a few times. I've only had it for a month and batteries seemed to be fine. Anyway, if you got one of those bulbs from Mi Lights this is a nice addition if you don't want to use smartphone apps.

I bought two. At the sale for $12 they were seemed like am amazing deal, but... First one failed to work at all with fresh set of batteries, second one worked for a few minutes, jammed and died. Disappointing in otherwise good looking toy.

Bought this costume in 2-4T size for my 2.5 year old, who is about 35% height/weight wise and it was a good fit. The quality is good for the price, nothing scratchy or itchy. The only complaint is that if the actual hood is not worn, the whole cape tends to twist to the side, with the opening sliding over the shoulder.
Very cute and unique design stickers. These stick great to clothing/onesies and look nice in those monthly baby pictures.

I was looking for a decorating solution for the tile wall above our fireplace that didn't involve drilling holes in the tile to hang something. These vinyl stickers were a perfect solution. They're very easy to apply and provide enough flexibility to be creative with the design. It's been almost a year and they've stayed put, even with some hot air coming from the fireplace.

If you're buying this to maybe hide a less flattering waistline/muffin top with all those tiered ruffles, think again. While the top itself is pretty cute, the middle ruffle tier hits right above the belly button and does not help with any cover up. However, if you don't need to hide/cover up any imperfections, this top does run true to size and the lace scoop neck looks great.

I bought this as a gift and was concerned about sizing after reading some reviews. However, the fit is very flattering with a nice fitted cut, not like your typical baggy t-shirt. Good quality cotton and a cute print make this a great gift for any photo enthusiast.

These are great quality, lightweight summer sandals. Sturdy back for ankle support, soft leather insole and very convenient velcro straps to adjust width. I was initially concerned about velcro coming undone, since it's not a hook and loop type strap, but this was never an issue with a very active 3 year old.

When I saw this pump I thought it was perfect. Looked nice and functional. I've had it not even a year and the blue cap started showing stains which you couldn't get rid. Unacceptable for a soap dispenser.

I've gone through many front door mats, some were pretty, some were a bit more function, but none of them lasted. This one has plain black rubber looks, but it has two things that I wanted. It's not slippery and it has drainage holes. It's also heavy and doesn't move. Overall I like it and I hope lasts me a long time.

After Melvita brand stopped making Men's after shave I wanted to find another alternative that easy on the skin and not too expensive. By accident I found this product and while there no reviews I decided to give this a shot. After a year of use I still like it. It appears expensive, but the bottle still last me after a year of use every other day. It smells good, nothing too offensive and wife likes the smell. I do 4-5 pumps and it is quite oily and runny when you first put it on, but absorbs well and doesn't make your skin look shiny. I have no irritation and skins feels moisturized. Highly Recommend it!

I have been using this a for year. Have a lot of trees on the new property that needed maintenance. This fit the bill and features that I needed. I've used up a quarter of oil on this already and it hasn't skipped the beat. The chain appears to get lose overtime and you have to keep it tight, but otherwise no other issues. I wish it was bit lighter because holding it on the extension is a bit tiring after a few minutes. Also, I didn't realize this initially when I was trying to cut log, but it was just going painfully slow, but it turned out that chain goes in one direction only.

Installed this for garage door entrance and was using this for a year now, so far no issues with reliability or failure. It's compact and built well. Hold feature is excellent. Can't go wrong here if this what you want.

I've had trouble finding water glasses/mask that work for me. I really got tired of water glasses that are too small and leak water constantly but these turned out comfortable to use for extended time. I have large nose and they fit perfectly, been using them for a year and no leaks so far.

I've had trouble finding water glasses/mask that work for me. I really got tired of water glasses that are too small and leak water constantly but these turned out to be great. I have large nose and they fit perfectly, been using them for a year and no leaks so far. I have tinted version and they are fine for indoor pool use as well.

UPDATE 1/6/2015: It's been a year now since I got 4 of these compact cams. Two of them used as baby cams. I bought them for $170, now you can find them as low as $100. Even though Hikvision introduced security features for the Chinese firmware cams where you have deal with firmware hacking to get English language they are still the best IP cams with rock solid firmware and excellent IQ. I have been running them on version 5.1.0 for a long time, but recently upgraded to 5.2.0 and I was surprised to see that IQ was improved at night. I also purchased other Hikvision domes and they are pretty good as well, but I still prefer these compact cams for indoor home use. Keep in mind if you purchase Chinese version and you will want to upgrade firmware it's not a straight forward process, but there are guides available in many IP cam forums.ORIGINAL REVIEW:I went through many IP cams over the years (Just sold all my Foscams) and I didn't consider this brand for a long time for one simple reason they did not have compact wifi cam until the introduced 2432. I bought one about 5 month ago to try out from Aliexpress. It has Chinese version firmware, but there are language selections and it's set to English. I didn't expect much, but after playing with it I was more then satisfied with this camera and ordered several more.Pros:Excellent IQ.Firmware is stable with lots of featuresWiFi very stable and far reaching. I have total of 5 cams running at 1080p resolution and 15 fps.Free smartphone apps! See below.POE in a WiFi cam!Wide angle at 2.8mm about 100 degrees. Excellent for indoor coverage of small rooms. It was difficult to find a compact cam with a wide angle before. Hikvsion not only offers 2.8mm, also has option for 4mm & 6mm lens as well.Microphone has excellent sensitivity. Nothing like a Foscam.Bandwidth control is excellent. You can select specific region of interest (ROI) which will produce the best IQ while compressing the rest of the image.Motion detection works flawlessly and sends out email alerts to gmail account. It only sends 3 images and you can't change that.Cons:Unable to disable front activity leds, I am using electrical tapeHikvision implemented protection starting from 5.1.2 firmware for its Chinese cams so that when you upgrade to the firmware you no longer can select any language other then Chinese. There are hacks and workarounds available however.Speaker while pretty loud, doesn't work well with two-way audio. I get echo for some reason, perhaps that could use some improvementAndroid Apps:Hikvision offers free apps for most popular mobile platforms and I am using several of them. Their free Android app (iVMS-4500) is good if you want two way audio, but the usability of that app is not great. Specifically with zooming in/out. The best Android App for this cam (and others) is Tiny Cam Viewer. Recently developer added h.264 and audio support for this cam and it works beautifully. Do not bother with IP Cam Viewer app which not only looks dated it also has performance/feed quality issues with HD cams where image quality doesn't look as good as the either Tiny Cam Viewer or native Hikvision app.Windows Mobile App (iVMS-4500)The recently added this app and it looks and works great. Unfortunately they did not add zoom functionality.Windows PC Tools (iVMS-4200)I am using this on a Windows Tablet and it i pretty good app for being free to manage/view/record all your Hikvision cams. It appears to have memory leak issues as after awhile it just slows down.The previous reviewer cons really are not cons.1. Night time image is excellent on 2432, but because it has single IR it is actually weaker then multiple IRs on Foscams, so the coverage is less. You could get external IR and you'll be amazed at the IQ.2. Email alert with gmail account works fine, Running on original firmware 5.1.03. WiFi is what sold me on this cam. It's been the most reliable and far reaching wifi. It depends on the router, so perhaps the reviewer didn't have a good rounter. I am running Netgear R7000 and I have 5 of these cams connected at different distances.

I am disappointed with this new cargo bag from Thule. Based in the picture it looks like it should hold shape, but what it is actually is just a nylon bag. So you have to stuff it fully for it to hold shape. It does look like it's a tough material, but I haven't tried it even once and I can't comment on its water resistance. There are plenty of other bags like that that are cheaper, I was just looking for something better.

I always do extensive research for every single item I purchase and my choice fell on this grinder. I was simply looking for coarse salt grinder and the bottom line I like it, but  there are some improvements I would like to see.For instance, I wish the light would delay by half a second second before turning off. Also, I really don't like the cap at the bottom. It would be nice to not have to deal with it by removing it every time when you need to use it. Otherwise, great stuff!

What I was looking for is a compact humidifier that would humidify the air above me instead of entire room. There are tons of options from very cheap ones to expensive, but I really wanted one that also had an option where I can plug in any bottle to it. The advantage of that is I can fill up bunch of bottles and have them ready for the next day instead of filling up daily as I currently do even on my bigger units. Also, makes it easy to replace them when they get dirty.  So it was compact + your own bottles + made in Korea was the selling point for me.I got the unit pretty quickly and hooked it right away. It's pretty simple to use. Fill up the bottle add the attachment to the bottle and turn the knob. My initial reaction was how little steam it was generating, but after awhile the amount of steam has increased so I had to actually dial it down. In the end I was quite impressed with the amount of steam it puts out. Essentially I thought this unit would be enough to humidify the air in front of me, but it actually managed to increase humidity in a small room by 5% overnight.What I don't like is the faint blue glow, I wish there would be an option to completely turn it off. Not everyone likes to sleep with the lights on.Overall Excellent!

This is an honest review from someone who has just tested a few highly rated antennas (DB4E, ANT751, HDB4X, Mohu) and this one.First, the positive, for which it gets two stars is that I really like simplistic and modern design and I really wish I could've kept it, but let me tell you the story...For years I used DB2 antenna which is ugly, but compact and it was kept indoors. I lived within 15 miles of the broadcast towers on the hill and was getting great signal for all channels I needed. I recently moved and of course that prompted me to setup antenna again, but it turned out to be not as easy task as before. My new place is within the same 15 miles, but this time it was at the bottom of the hill so I had to experiment with different spots to get the antenna to work . So, I figured it was time to test a few antennas and try out which one performs best. The short story long Winegard performed worse then cheaper antennas.In comparison to DB2 (Same as Eagle Aspen EASDTV2BUHF for $18 on Amazon) which was getting 20 channels and not even amplified this one was getting 16, ok, not bad, but that's $20 antenna vs $100 which requires amplification. I've tested it without plugging an amplifier and got only 9 channels. Bottom line, save your money, no miracles here.

I have owned 9821 V1 for a while and was looking for better options. 9826 was released a few month ago overseas and only now made it statewide at a higher premium price. 9826 is not a direct replacement of 9821, there is also 9831, but it's the only one available for sale in the US. So is this one better then 9821?PROs:1. Excellent and actually improved image quality over 9821. It has a new sensor with 960p resolution and it doesn't disappoint, there is very little noise and images are quite clean and sharp. Day or Night, looks beautiful. If you use 960p image is 4:3 format, there is option to use 720p for a wider picture.2. Improved design, overall this one looks nicer. Same size as the rest of Foscam PT cameras which is on a large side.3. Zoom lens is a nice addition, although not as wider angle lens as 9821 or especially the new 9831 (not available yet).4. I am using this as a baby cam and built-in speaker/microphone work well, but not quite as loud. Also, there is just no way to control sound levels.CONs:1. Firmware is still far from being perfect and you will run into bugs there and here and some features not fully working. Especially latest firmware where the camera would drop fps and show ghosting with IRs on. (1/2/2014 Ghosting addressed in latest beta) For recording I would probably use some 3rd party software. It's getting better though, at least they added support for "hidden SSIDs" with latest update.2. Same issue as 9821, but 9826 takes extra time to display picture then my other IP cams. Especially annoying when using Android apps. That doesn't matter if it's on wireless or wired. For instance it's 3 am in the morning and your baby cries, you launch the app if you are using it as a baby cam and you want to see picture immediately at night and not wait 3-4 seconds before it connects. These extra seconds are really annoying.3. No zoom presets.4. Expensive at full price. I bought it for $195 during holidays which I think is reasonable.5. QA is not very good still. I have two cameras with different hardware issues that require replacement. If you are lucky you may get a perfect one, otherwise be prepared that you might have to exchange it at your own expense.6. Zoom lens a bit noisy. Might be a concern if you are planning to use it in a baby room7. Focus is fixed and if you have a blurry picture there is no way to adjust it. It's a hardware defect that requires replacement.Issues specific to my cameras:1. My first camera exhibits strange behavior with PT angle button movements where camera stops responding when pressed. It comes back after a minute or so.2. My second camera came in defective with a blurry bottom when zoomed in and IRs on. I had to exchange for a new camera at my own expense. 1/2/2014: New Replacement arrived, again with blurry lens with IRs on and zoomed in. Waiting for resolution from Foscam.If you do buy this camera, expect you'll run into bugs with the firmware and make sure to check if you have any blurriness in the picture when using zoom and IRs on. I have 2 cameras with this defect already.I've been doing extensive research and monitoring IP camera market over the years. Tried dozen different brands at my own expense.Update 12/28/2014: I no longer own this camera I've switched to another brand Hikvision, so I don't have any latest update on this camera.

They still have no real competition with their latest cameras specifically 9826 or 9831. I really hope someone can tell me otherwise.
I don't know how they perform because they wouldn't fit me properly. You probably need to have smaller then average nose to fit those.

I agree with everything positive, but keep one thing in mind that after a year of daily use the fan will rattle. This is my second unit that does that. Very unfortunate in otherwise excellent looking space heater.

I am usually early adopter in routers, but learning from my previous experience  I've decided to hold of before trying the latest one from Asus. I waited for 4 month after release to see if they would workout any issues. Finally, I bought one last week and coincidentally they had new firmware available the same day 12/20. I've upgraded the firmware and everything seems to run excellent until the next morning when 5Ghz band degraded to unbearable performance. So back it goes.... If they can't get the most obvious basics right I have very little confidence that the rest works as intended.In comparison to Netgear R6300V2 which I currently have:RT-AC68U has external antennasRT-AC68U has nicer web interface with many options and configurationsRT-AC68U does NOT offer more range or more throughput, actually it felt lacking hereThey both have pretty much identical hardware (dual core 800Mhz, USB 3.0 etc...)I really liked admin interface, it looked modern and professional with lots of options. I might revisit it again perhaps when it's in a bargain bin with hopefully stable firmware by then. For now I would not bother wasting money on this, especially if you already have AC router.

I bought this for home use thinking it would improve my range over existing R6300v2 router using 2.4Ghz band.  The setup was easy, although make sure you have the same firmware as the control software you are installing to save you from a headache. My unit shipped with 2.4.5, but the controller software I downloaded was the latest one 2.4.6, so I ran into all kinds of trouble, in the end I read one of the forum posts  that suggested to make sure the two matches. Once I did that, it solved all my issues and I was able to configure it easily.Now to not so special part, I really thought that Long Range would mean a long range, but I walked around with Wifi Analyzer comparing signals from my router and AP and R6300 that were placed next to each other and the both had nearly identical signal in all spots. Download speeds from NAS were unimpressive  as well, with R6300 showing much better transfer rate. So, I am not sure what people are raving about it about this being long range.I guess this has real advantage where you want to deploy multiple of these units and you can easily manage them with the interface, but one of these doesn't make any sense.

I've owned Windows RT tablet from the launch and it was quite limiting in what you can do with it, so I was holding out for a long time before upgrading to a better tablet that runs full Windows and not expensive.Initially I bought 8" Dell Venue (which is quite popular), but quickly realized that screen size is not going to work for me while working in Windows Desktop mode. Luckily this one became available locally at MS store and i quickly made the jump. Here is what I think:PROs:Handsome looking tablet, although pretty much just like any other one with the bonus of replaceable cover/batteryFeels like a premium device, but the back appears to flex a bit.Has full size 3.0 USB port. Nice!HDMI works as you would expect and can output on external monitors just like any other laptop. I only tried 1080p resolution, so I don't know yet if it can go higher then thatBattery is great, but I didn't time it if I am getting 10 hours yet, but it was at least 8 hours that I used it. To fully charge it took at least 4 hours.1080p youtube streaming works ok, there might be some stutter, but it's still watchable1080p playback/streaming of mkv test files on wireless was really smoothWiFi gets very good signal and it's a dual band.CONs:Expensive accessories (dock or keyboard)It gets really warm at the top where the back camera is after intensive useNEUTRAL:I wish this was available 5 years agoI would like a bit more ram as 2GB could be limitingPS. I've considered Asus Transformer T100 as well, but dim screen and slightly less performance was a turn off for me. Overall, V11Pro is excellent tablet for the price, especially when Amazon had a deal on it, just hope they ship my 2nd one soon.

A lot has been said about this tablet already, so I won't repeat everything. It's well designed, beautiful screen, fast, light, good price point and most importantly runs full Windows 8. It can play 1080p youtube videos smoothly, I haven't seen any tablet do that in the past. Battery life is quite amazing for such a small and powerful tablet.Flash is there which I haven't seen on a tablet since Android stopped supporting it. Tried a few old school flash games and they played smoothly, but most of them require either a mouse or a keyboard to be useful.The only frustrating part which I also love is the actual Windows 8 desktop, it's just not designed for such a small screen and I find myself hitting tiny buttons several times (FYI I have average fingers). Also, keyboard doesn't automatically popup in the desktop mode, so you are required to do extra clicks to either open it or close it. Occasionally you will be stuck in full screen mode of some sort (like at the end of CNN video with ads at the end) and the only way to get back is to either click the next video and then minimize it or kill the process in the task manager. Also, got stuck in full screen Chrome and I had to kill the process as well. I just wish it had physical back button instead of Windows Metro which I don't see being used that often.Wifi is great as well and you can stream full 1080p video files from your share such as NAS smoothly.Overall, it's a wonderful device and possibilities are endless. I see it getting more use then a 7" Android tablet that I have.I love it!FYI: The tablet name is VENUS, according to the sticker on the back.
Great deal on this, although a bit longer then 30". I would get this for a 32" door. Now I need to figure out how to make even cuts.
Excellent game, I wish it was a bit longer though and more challenging. Although not much replayability. Definitely worth the price

Excellent item. Was looking for a premium case for my new Z1. This item is almost perfect. It has cut out for all ports, including the magnetic charge port, it's flexible to be removed and feels like a premium device. I do wish it had more protection on the corners, but I guess it would make this less flexible.

UPDATE 10/15/2013After testing and using R7000 for about a week, I've decided to stick with R6300 V2 version. The reason behind this was there were no noticeable performance difference that's worth paying the premium price. If you already have R6300 v2 or perhaps another AC router that you bought this year, don't expect this would offer groundbreaking performance or range.Here I have comparison with R6300 V2 version:Performance/Range: Pretty much identical for regular use. I walked around the house comparing signal strength and in some cases R6300 had better signal and in other R7000, but overall they performed quite similar. An some cases R7000 showed just a bit faster connection (Mbps) at longer distances, perhaps due to external antennas, but transfer speeds (MB) were about the same as R6300.Specs: The specs are quite similar and the only difference that I noticed is the cpu on R6300V2 is 800 Mhz dual core vs R7000 1 Ghz dual core. For reference the original R6300 v1 had 600 Mhz single core. R7000 does have external antennas, but they don't really offer extra range as you might think. Perhaps it's just gives a user an option to upgrade to a higher dbi antennas.Power usage: Both use between 8-10 watts.User interface: Identical, no new features that I could see in R7000. Yes, it's easy to use and everything , but I was expecting something new. In contrast Asus RT-AC68U offers a lot more features in its UI.Noise: R7000 makes some static noise which is more noticeable then R6300, but it's only noticable within 2-3 feet from the router.Bottom line is this is a decent router and probably good for someone who wants the latest and the greatest or upgrade your aging one, but don't expect mind blowing performance over any existing routers that came out in the past year.ORIGINAL REVIEW:I currently use R6300 v2 as my main router (you can read my review in the profile) and while it's still new I really wanted to try the latest crop of high performance routers. Initially I preordered RT-AC68U, but after reading SNB test it looked like Asus still hasn't learned the lesson and still releases excellent hardware with problematic firmware. Another difference between the two RT-AC68U uses 800Mhz dual core process while R7000 has 1Ghz. Despite minor specs difference R7000 came on top in most of the benchmarks. I quickly picked on up at local brick and mortar store and was ready for a test.Initially impressions were this is quite a large router, although probably the same size as R6300 v1. The looks are subjective, and it most likely will be sitting in the closet anyway, so really doesn't matter. I really like that it has external antennas which means I could technically upgrade those if needed. Setup looked all too familiar from R6300 which is a pro and con. As a pro it was easy to setup, but on the other hand it didn't seem like offered any new features. I also noticed a few bugs on the way, but nothing major so far.I've did my usual download test from NAS to my laptop (Envy 17) at the same spot. R6300 was getting about 10 MB/sec while R7000 showing 19 Mb/sec. This looks already to a great start, but I need to wait for signal to settle until making any judgments. Even though the signal and Mbps connection showed pretty much identical to R6300. So range wise it doesn't seem like there is any improvement.Test setup: using identical settings in both routers and both are placed in the same location which is about 20 feet away through several walls. Also testing on N clients primarily, so I don't know how it performs if you use AC card yet.

I've been researching different toilet seat covers that would work for our 2 year old and Bemis seemed like a popular choice, but I was reluctant to buy one due to reviews about durability and that toddler seat easily gets detached. Then I found TopSeat elongated during my search which looked like it would be much better choice, but round option was no where to be found for sale. I've contacted the company directly and to my surprise they were able to sell me one directly.I got the seat very fast and upon opening the package I could tell this seat cover will last a while. It feels solidly build and the toddler seast doesn't come off (unlike in Bemis). I didn't find any instructions in the package, so it took me extra 5 minutes trying to figure out how to mount it and I actually got it wrong first time.After the seat was mounted our toddler gave it a test run and enjoyed the experience from the first try. The seat opening is just right for our tiny toddler. Unfortunately, there is no soft closing for toddler seat.  Also, I prefer seat covers with foam as this one is a bit harder to seat on, but I knew what I was getting. Perhaps there is always room for improvement.I will update this review on durability if there is any change.

After comparing numerous flood lights this came up as a top choice for the price. I really like the design of the light and amount of brightness, although it's not as bright as I thought it would be. bit I don't have a big area to cover, so it was enough for my purposes.  I also got RAB light to compare which is slightly more expensive. With RAB I like the fact that I can put any bulb in there. The bluish LED from this security lamp isn't that pleasing to the eye.The lamp was easy to install and motion detection works flawlessly. Time will tell how it will hold up the winter months

I bought these after trying out different eye wear for work around the house, crawlspace, attic etc where I had to deal with dust and hot environment. These ones didn't have any issues with protecting my eyes such as fogging up or being uncomfortable and they are priced just right.
The reviews are spot on, so I won't repeat. These were super comfortable from the first moment I put them on. No leaks that I could detect. Highly recommend.
I am not sure why this has a lot of positive reviews, aside from great price this one doesn't last. You could probably get one use out of it. Spend $4 more at Home Depot for a more durable one.

Update: 11/28/2014Handles separated on all most used pans and became unsafe to use. Replacing this with Tramontina brand which is made in ItalyUpdate: 1/8/2014I am still using them because I am not ready to plunk another 200+ on a set. I didn't expect that, but the handles started to crack in the most used pans, although they still function, we'll see how long they last before they completely separate from the pan. The coating is still ok.Original Review:I've had these for two month and I regret not returning them when I still could. Perhaps the coating is German, but everything else feels like designed in China. First of all the lids, they have cheap feeling, especially the round handle which also traps water on the inside. Same goes for the pan handles they are the worst design I've seen. They get hot, also trap water on the inside which which makes noises when the pan gets hot and the logo already fallen off on most the pans. I hope the coating at least will hold up.

I was really excited to receive this light. Unfortunately, mine appears to be defective. The motion sensor is not really sensing any motion. I could be jumping within 3 feet and nothing, it will only turn on if I wave the hand right in front of the motion sensor. The light is pretty bright for a solar light, but I am still hoping for more brightness, can't wait for their next version which I was told in a September. So, I am only going to take one star off and that's for a poorly written user manual. I rarely read manuals, but I had to read this one to see if I can find a solution to sensing problem and I just couldn't understand most of the wording there.

I used get cheap TPU cases for around five bucks, but decided to splurge a bit this time and got the white version of this premium case. It feels and looks like a premium case, although the fit may seem a bit lose, but it's manageable. I went for the white version, so it doesn't show any fingerprints. It has nice cut outs for ports that are frequently accessible. The only thing I wish is they cut out the holes for the pins to use on the dock. Overall, good case.

This review is for DIR-868L.UPDATED 5/24: After testing it for a few days I decided to stay with R6300, while I liked the design of 868L, web interface and feature set it just didn't deliver the same (or better) bandwidth/range as now a year old Netgear R6300.ORIGINAL REVIEWLove trying out new routers, so I bought this one so I could compare to my trusty Netgear R6300 that I owned for almost a year (you can see my review for R6300 in my profile)My needs: Improve performance for all my N clients in 2.4Ghz & 5Ghz bands. I don't own any AC clients to test the speeds.Initial thoughts:Design. I like the tube/cylinder design which is a bit unusual to see it in a router. It's difficult to compare to the size to R6300 (which is big already), but it is pretty tall and round.Performance. I setup the same settings as my Netgear and started testing various things. I've placed the router at the same location and . It's located 3-4 walls, ~27 feet on 2nd floor.- Signal strength. Good to Excellent, 4-5 bars 120-180 Mbps. R6300 is the same, but shows occasionally goes up to 300 Mbps which does make different in file transfer- HD Youtube streaming 1080p. No difference noticed in buffering or playback- Pages load the same on both routers- File transfer: Transferring 10GB file from NAS 868L averages at 6MB/sec vs R6300  at 10MB/sec.- Firmware appears to be more stable then R6300 was at lunch, but I didn't try every single feature- The 868L has dual core ARM processor which is much much faster then 600Mhz processor found in R6300, but I didn't notice any difference in performance and I do have about 20 wireless clients that some stream HD content, although not at the same time.Not so hot.- While playing with it for a few days I noticed that 868L offered shorter range and performance then R6300- Nexus 4 and some no brand tablet signal strength shows a bit lower then R6300 does using in the sapots. Also both devices constantly lost connection to 868L.Conclusion: While this router is still on revision 1.0 the performance may still be optimized in the future updates, but currently it doesn't offer any advantage over a year old AC routers.

I've owned all popular trackball mice and this unfortunately not that great for extended use, despite the reviews. The ball is small and thumb gets tired after a while. I also game a lot in FPS multiplayer a games and the response time using thumb isn't as great as I thought it would be. I can game much better using either Microsoft Explorer or Logitech Trackman.

This is the ONLY gadget that I kept for over a decade. I've replaced all my gadgets dozen of times over the years and this trackball stayed with me. Still works like new, but I dread the day when it could actually break and there is no replacement available for reasonable price.SOMEONE PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE MAKE THE REPLACEMENT OF THIS MOUSE!!!! EVEN SOME KNOCK OFF WILL DO!!!

I own Trackman for about 6 years and Explorer for 12 years and my favorite one is still Explorer. Since both are discontinued I decided to find another alternative and based on the reviews I got this one. Unfortunately, this is not as good as the the other two. My main issues with this one is that the ball is smaller, buttons are hard to click, especially the right one and they are loud. Overall, it's ok. Really hope that someone builds replacement for either Trackman or Explorer.

I was excited to receive this camera. When I opened the box, it looked like a quality made cam, but my disappointment came later when I saw image quality. It was just below average for so called "HD camera". Considering the price I would probably deal with it, but then my next disappointment came when I found out there is no way to turn on/off IRs. Which basically means forget about using this camera when pointing out of the window, unless you put the tape on it. The interface itself is awful looking, although administration menu is not bad. To view camera in IE you'll need ActiveX control, so no surprises here, but for Chrome/Firefox you need QuickTime plugin which I didn't like either.  At this point I would stay away from this one for now. Perhaps Tenvis does it better next time.As an alternative, I like Dericam H502W ($85 on ebay) or Foscam FI9821 (135 on amazon). They are not without faults, but definitely better then Tenvis IProbot3 in most aspects.

Led projectors are getting smaller and brighter. This unit has a nice balance. It's portable, yet bright enough for occasional use. Also, it's a nice bonus that it has built in battery.Pros:PortableBuilt in battery (although at full brightness it lasts only 20 minutes)720p resolutionShort throw lens. You can basically get bigger picture then regular projector from the same distanceBuilt in standCons:Still noisy, but not as bad previous LED projects that I've tried (LG mainly) Perhaps, ECO mode (there 2) would be less noisy, but I didn't buy it to run at half brightnessDesign is nice and simple, but the plastics make it feel cheep eventhough the price isn't.Wish List:More lumens wouldn't hurtContrast could be improvedWould love 1080p versionNeeds a carrying caseI will post additional thoughts once I have more time with it. Stay tuned

I've used this tool to clear out some old sand ground in the shower. I had to work around 40 titles and it took me about 8 hours total. I've never removed grout before and it was the most tiring home project I've ever had to do in a day. Even though this was a better tool then a saw, at the end of the day wished I just spent extra and used a Dremel tool instead. This tool is sold for 30% cheaper in HD.

When I go on vacation I like to bring my movies with me and since most hotels/resorts already upgraded to flat panel TVs with HDMI port this device works perfectly for travel. This unit is compact and I won't be upset if it's lost or stolen. It's not restrictive in formats it plays up to 1080p resolution. Just bring a hard drive and you can use your smartphone as a remote control.Unfortunately, it's not going to replace my main HTPC media streaming solution (Mac Mini w/ Windows 7) at home, but if I had secondary tv that needed streaming capabilities I would probably use this.

... but falls short in a few areasPROSHardware is beautifully simple.Easy SetupRemote while busy very functional and being able to control my tv's sound and on/off was a nice surprise.DEAL WITH ITWhile the hardware has dual core 1.2Ghz cpu the device felt a sluggish. Takes a while to boot and switching between apps is not satisfactory smoothUser interface is rough. Vizio needs learn a thing or two how to build functional user interface for big screen TVs. What's point of so much real estate when your icons are taking 1/3 of screen.Play store, while available, seems to miss bunch of apps. Specifically, I was looking for MX Player and other player apps. All were missing. I didn't bother research if I had to hack something to get them to work. Just seems like a no brainer that they should be available by defaultLimited support for file formats. Expected from specs, but I thought I could find a workaround.XBMC is not supportedPerhaps next revision will get things right. I am also hoping that someday one of the Google TV device will let you watch OTA TV from HDHomerun device.Alternative: Cheaper Android sticks (Such as MK802 III) offer more features and full play store for less

UPDATED 1/14/2015Today this is no longer the best car DVR. The image quality is now considered subpar and reliability of the unit has been questionable, occasionally it would stop recording and require reset. I've switched to newer and cheaper unit which outperforms this for half the price Mini 0806. It doesn't have wifi, so you'll stick with LCD screen, but IQ is much improved, especially at night. If you prefer unit with wifi I would recommend SJCam 5000+. Also downgrading this review to a 3 stars.UPDATED 4/12/2013Upgraded to latest firmware 1.0.5, but didn't notice any new features or improvements. Also switched to using 32GB card and now on a few occasions it wouldn't record. I have to unplug the camera power to start recording again. WiFi feature maybe selling point, but I haven't used it in 2 month. The video feed is choppy and with delay when using live view feature. I covered silver accents with black tape, looks tacky, but at least it doesn't stand out as much now.Virus issues: There were reports that there is a virus on the sd card from this seller. I have not had this issue because I purchased this from another source, but prior to upgrade my blackvue to 1.0.3 I've actually formatted the card, so I don't know if I had the virus or not.I've been using different DVRs over the years, mostly Chinese made, this is first Korean DVR and this is the first one that actually I really like and it addressed most of my previous concerns:THE GOOD- Compact, simple, non distracting design and solid quality feel- No built-in display, it's substituted with WiFi connection to your smartphone which becomes DVR display. Love this feature! Keep in mind there is about 1-2 second delay in the live image. You can also stream live video to a browser without using any apps, simply by entering the following url in the browser (without spaces) h t t p:// 192 .168 .8 .1 / blackvue_live.cgi.- Excellent daylight quality- Low profile mount, but see cons- Parking mode motion sensor, haven't tried yet- Bunch of venting holes for hot climates, I haven't tried it in the hot weather, but it doesn't seem like it would have any issues as previous model- Voice notifications, fun to have at first, but I would rather turn them off- Extra wide angle, you will most likely see the A pillars in your car. If you turn it facing inside the car you will see the sides of the front windows which may be handy, but the image doesn't flip over.- Very easy to view your recordings on a smartphone. (I only tried Android app)- Included wire management clips, nice addon- IR sensor to turn on/off microphone. Interesting feature, but I don't see any practical use to turn off microphone.THE NOT SO PRETTY- Night quality still has plenty of room for improvement, but overall it's definetely better then most cheap DVRs I've tried- Some minor user interface glitches in the Android app, hopefully will be resolved in the future updates- A bit pricey when there are plenty of HD cameras that cost less- Silver accents are noticeable. Blackboxes should be All-Black-Boxes, but nothing that black tape or marker can't fix.- Design does not allow you to move the camera horizontally- No built in battery, there is however some sort of capacitor that serves purpose of allowing the cam to save the file correctly when there is no power.- Standard bitrate is a bit low at 7000, but with some modding (search forums) you can increase it up to 15000- I've been having mixed feelings with the mount. On one had I understand the stick on clip design, but I prefer non permanent solutions, like suction cups. Also removal of the DVR is a bit cumbersome. You have to first unplug power then click the button to unlock and only then you can remove it from the mount.- It does get warm a bit to the touch, but venting holes help to cool it down fast after powering down.

I purchased this speaker on a spur-of-the-moment Groupon deal for 1/3 of the retail price and didn't expect much out of it, but after getting one I regret not getting more for presents and here is why:- When it first arrived and I unpacked I was surprised how compact it is. I even put it my baggy pants and was walking around with it, but that's not my daily routine- It has nice rubbery surface and feels solidly build- Pairing was straightforward and I was playing music on it from my smartphone (Nexus 4) within a minute of unpacking- Although, I rarely listen music loud (I am a good neighbor) I had to crank this one up just to see how it handles and it sounded quite nice without distortion- There is no much bass, but what do you expect?- Someone reported a short battery life, so I did test of my own and I think it lasted about 4-5 hours, but that would also depend on sound levels. I'll try to do more tests- Bluetooth distance was pretty decent too. I was able to walk around 1500 sq/feet town home and the speaker didn't lose the connection even when I was on the 2nd floor- There is not much negative to say about it. Perhaps if they made the power button somewhere else other the the bottom and wish the logo would be matching colorI am amazed how much sound is packed into this size. I have Yamaha Bluetooth speaker NX-B02 from 2008 which is probably 3x the size/price of this and Bem is just as loud and clear.

... at least at the moment that is.THE NICE:Build quality and design is very nice. Feels like a high quality device.Stand is excellent addition. I wish all tablets had built in stands.Beautiful screenExcellent performanceUSB portNOT SO NICE:User interface usability is just seems awkward. I constantly have to remember what swipe to do to perform certain actions. Perhaps it comes with the experience, but I found some swipes are non intuitive.Lack of appsBrowser is limited use. It's not a full featured IE browser that you would expect. No activex or flash here.THE POINT:I played with it for a weeks on and off and other then showing off to friends and occasional browsing I just don't see how it would fit in my life. The apps are lacking quality and quantity at the moment. I couldn't even find a decent IP Camera app that works. In the end I always go back to my Android table. It's not as good in terms of design or as fast, but it always has an app that I need.TO KEEP OR NOT TO KEEP THAT IS THE ?Unfortunately, I don't think I will be keeping it, but like most waiting now for PRO version of this when it comes out.

I've been searching for natural, over the counter cold medications and this was one of the brands I've tried in Whole Foods. I was pleasantly surprised that taste is far from disgusting and most importantly it's been helping me to reduce cold associated symptoms. But as always YMMV.
