I've been on the look out for a perfect case for my Sony RX100. Just wanted stylish design and most importantly convenient removal. The case fits RX100 just right, maybe a bit tight, but I didn't have issues with removal or inserting the caemra. It does add some bulkiness, but that's expected with this type of case. My main gripe was the closing mechanism. I was expecting this case would have a magnet, but it uses button which requires some pressure. In the end I found identical design on ebay that uses magnet and costs 3x less this this case, although it wasn't leather like this one.Overall Ok case for the price.

Love these. I've tried different cheaper alternatives, but they either failed or didn't offer enough coverage. I finally bought 2 of these about 2 years ago, one of them failed after a year, but I got a replacement the second one seems to run solid. One is for bathroom and another one is for garage. Excellent coverage and performance. Works with LEDs and Florescent lights.I rate this an excellent buy!

I should't have probable expected for them to perform as good as headphones that are 2-3 times the price, but they are decent. I am using them mainly at gym and I am no audiophile but the sound is a bit flat. Despite that they are comfortable and very light and won't fall of out of your ears when you jog.I rate it an OK buy.

Purchased it on the lightning deal, but even at that price I wouldn't recommend this product. Below just a few highlights:Image quality was below average, not HD by any meansLens angle was too narrow, so it was difficult to setup to get entire picture to fit.Design was ok and I thought it was a bit too big. Loved the stand though.IRs were a bit weak, but that's expected given they are only 4 of themWireless signal was decentUser interface was easy to useSetup appeared to be straight forward without any issuesProbably ok to use this camera for baby monitoring, but I am still giving this products thumbs down.

6/13/2013 UPDATED entire review based on latest firmware update 1.1.1.13**REVIEW**THE GOOD:1. Video Performance is excellent due to using h264 compression. Even when on wireless and running at 720p @ 30fps I get smooth motion2. Web User Interface. Excellent! Very fast and easy to use and most importantly clean looking. You can toggle IR on/off.3. Colors appear accurate4. Excellent coverage for built in IRs.5. Wireless signal is excellent. I am about 20 feet away with several walls on the way from the router and get strong signal. There has been numerous issues with WiFi disconnection in earlier builds, but this should be addressed in .12. It also depends on the router that you are using and I have not had disconnect issues with Netgear R6300.6. Built in speaker is a nice feature to have, but see cons7. Lens angle is good at ~70 degrees, I rarely us PT feature in cameras, so extra degrees always nice to have, but extra angle come with slight distortion at the edges.8. Image masking is working well9. Works in IE/Chrome very well after downloading browser extensions.10. Setup was straightforward11. Works well with IPCamViewer for Android. Most functions can be controlled via app.12. You can upgrade lens on this camera. Although it will void warranty.13. Able to set default position after restart with the firmware update14. Using IPCamViewer for Android app and it supports all camera functions needed.15. RTSP stream is now available after firmware .11.I CAN DEAL WITH IT:1. Most important thing on any camera is the image quality and I really had high hopes for this one. Prior to the firmware update (2/1/13) I was highly disappointed with the image quality but Foscam has listened to the feedback and addressed IQ starting with firmware .10. It's not a groundbreaking improvement but for the price of this camera it's decent2. Expected from the specs, but lens is not bright enough (F2.4 aperture) for night time viewing through the window without IRs. My Zavio F3206 with F1.8 aperture can handle this much better. Obviously if you do turn IRs on the camera and try to see through the window you won't be able to see anything at all. The workaround for me was to buy external IRs (about ten bucks) and put them outside the window. (UPDATE: You can upgrade lens yourself)3. Limited video settings (can't do custom exposures) so not much image control other then color, brightness, sharpness.4. 2 LEDs in the back camera that you can't turn off. I had to put a black tape over it.5. Manual focus ring a bit difficult to turn and because there is latency on the displayed image it will take a few tries to get the picture perfectly in focus6. Zoom up/down (should be called Zoom in/out) is a bit difficult to use. You have to right click on the image and then select zoom in/out and there is no control over how much you can zoom. So you have to click 52 times (yes I counted) if you want to zoom in all the way in and again 52 times to zoom all the way out. It should really be a slider on the left where all other image control settings.7. Can't seem to purge the log it creates which is in just couple of days already at 14 pages. Clear/Reset button would've helped.8. Issues with sending motion detection emails, it works a bit better in latest update, but still needs work10. Update .10 Added mjpeg stream via url, unfortunately it's limited to VGA@15 fps.11. Camera will not work in mobile browsers (iPad, iPhone, etc...). You have to utilized apps for that.12. Camera is actually larger then most other PT cameras and I really don't like the design.13. Can't control volume on speaker or microphoneOH THE HORROR:1. Prepare to deal with the firmware issues. There are a lot of features that are either incomplete or don't work as advertised, before buying this camera visit Foscam forum to read the feedback. I am personally sticking with the camera in hopes that Foscam will address all major issues in future updates2. As of firmware update .12 & .13 camera doesn't work with hidden wireless SSID. It appears it worked in .10 update3. Camera occasionally locks upMY IP CAM BACKGROUND: I've been testing various "HD" (at least 1MP) IP cameras over the years from brands such as Axis, Trendnet, Edimax, Zavio, Dlink and Zyxel, but stayed away from Foscam mainly because it had low resolution sensor and awful looking web interface. Foscam changed this with the introduction of FI9821W. Overall this is an ok entry to "HD" PT camera for the price.SETUP: Setup itself is not much different then any other IP camera on the market. If you never done this before probably best to contact technical support to save you from frustration, but if you setup IP cameras in the past it should be no brainier. First connect the camera to the router using the Ethernet cable, insert the included CD in your PC and use the search tool to get the IP address and Port of the camera. Double clicked on the IP address found with the search tool which will open up a browser. You will need to install plugin/extension/activex control (depending on the browser) before you can see live image. Login with admin account. The rest of the settings needs to be customized to your preference and if you don't know what you are doing again I would suggest to get in touch with the technical support. At the very least you could go to wireless settings and connect to your wireless network.CONCLUSION: I think this camera will deserve a solid 4 when they finally address most of the issues. When I bought this camera I couldn't find anything else for the price with the feature and extra resolution and Foscam has been consistently releasing firmware update that addressed some of the concerns, including image quality.Review based on firmware 1.1.1.13Other cameras that I use:My current favorite camera is Zavio F3206. It has bright lens and full 1080p resolution, doesn't have IRs though or PT, but picture and bright wide angle lens make up for it. Also, I use Edimax 7110PTn & 3115n. First one is PT camera like this one, colors are not that great, but has been a solid camera for baby monitoring and cheap 3115 is actually pretty decent one too for day light indoor monitoring. Dericam H502W is a good alternative but image quality a bit lower then on FI9821.

I won't repeat everything that said here because I agree with most positive comments, but I do have one major issue with the headphones. I have normal size ears and head and they become uncomfortable to wear after about half an hour. For the price you pay this is an unacceptable design flaw. Returned!

Some reviewers have called this an air purifier, I want to be clear this is an aromatherapy diffuser, it does not process, clean, or purify the air. It is also not a humidifier, this is a tabletop device that I can grasp with one hand- despite the ironic name 'Mammoth,' and should be used to introduce pure grade essential oils into the atmosphere for space conditioning.We purchased the Mammoth Allie in Brown Wood- which is a finish, not the physical material it is made of, and this particular unit (there are several styles/shapes/tank sizes) is very easy to use. It reminds my of an onion in shape and the top half lifts off quite easy to reveal the inner tank. For the size the 4.5oz capacity is very generous and allows for up to 3.5 hours (based on our time, the brand says 3 hours) on continuous mode. The one setting continuous stream seemed a bit heavy at first, but we found that elevating the unit a little higher allowed for the best expansion of particles and aromatherapy impact. For this little unit we only introduce 1, 2 drops make of pure grade oils, per tank.While the 'wood' finish looks great in detail from anything 5 feet+ out, it is a shiny plastic frame- but thankfully no operational lights. This, paired with the fact that it will auto-shut-off once the tank is empty, makes it great for bedroom diffusion and night treatments. It is also reasonably quiet, with only a very faint bubble or gurgle heard now and then. In all, it looks great and functions well. We received a product discount in hopes we wold share our honest opinions, which we have done.

As some have noted, there are a lot of 'discount' reviews on here, which I know tends to make people skeptical. It can be frustrating when reviews do little more than repeat what the product listing says and highlight those listing points they think are most attractive. I can tell you I have used this product extensively, multiple times a day, in many scenarios, since it was delivered. While the bottom line is that I would buy it again, and even buy it as a gift, there are some things I noticed that are of note on either end of the spectrum.Using the product is indeed easy- The cord stashes away in the base with a little wheel to wrap it up. The cord, about 2.5', overall seems short but is more than ample in length to  plug it in as needed for use. Keep in mind that the base heats the water in the kettle and the kettle can be removed and used freely outside of the tethered/plugged in base, so the length of the cord is of little consequence in most instances. Keep in mind this shorter cord allows it to stash away nice and neat in the base when not in use.Simply fill the kettle with a minimum of 2 cups of water, or a maximum of just over 7 cups (there is an internal etches Max Fill line.) Set the kettle on the plugged in base and press the toggle switch down. It will illuminate orange- there is no other visual way of knowing the kettle is on. Keep in mind, for safety needs, that there is also no way of knowing the water inside has been heated once the light is off. The kettle is equipped with an automatic shut off function that is supposed to turn the unit off (flip the switch) once the water boils. I've found that this proved temperamental. It first I was filling directly to the Max Fill line and the unit ran for almost 20 minutes before I manually shut it off. The water, which takes about 7 minutes to reach boiling, was clearly boiling.After some back and forth with the brand we determined that moisture near the internal sensor was causing the auto-off switch to work temperamentally. I found, on my own, about 5 cups will boil just fine and shut off on it's own without any issue. To help ease the concerns with the auto-off on a full kettle I've been told to allow the unit to entirely air dry, open, overnight, between uses. Also, keep in mind that boiling multiple pots back to back could, potentially, cause the auto off to work wonky- though the brand assures me this is the rarest of cases.On the topic of safety- I do like that this kettle is primarily cook touch. The handle never gets warm. The base of the kettle (exterior, outside, plastic) does get warm (not hot) to the touch. One thing I do wish this kettle had was a way to lock the lid for transport and additional safety around kids. As this design stands the kettle will pour if tilted (which is needed to release steam,) but the top lid will easily pop up if the handle button is pressed.Some reviewers have noted how they love that no plastic comes in contact with their water- this is true. The stainless steel design is indeed very fluid and the stainless steel lid a great touch. I do want to note that the steam from opening the lid with the boiling water (which I'm sure would not be a common thing to do) did seem to melt the plastic on the outer rim near the hinge. And, by melt, I mean that it became tacky to the touch and took on a fingerprint imprint.This kettle is something we use daily for multiple uses- from beverages to even making instant potatoes for dinner- I love that I don't have to pull a pot out anymore, and I still have water leftover for an after dinner cup of coffee. I honestly, seldom put it away- it sits out on the counter nearly day in and out. Because we have used it so much I have noticed that our hard water has left hard water deposit build up on the very bottom of the kettle- this especially happens when the water gets below 3 or so cups.  The deposits don't scrub off, but will quickly remove if you swish a little vinegar around the bottom, no big deal! We received this product at a discount in hopes we would share our honest feedback, which we have done to our best ability. Please drop us any questions, we love to answer!

This is a very slick 2-way for the price- We picked this up for use with our system at work (security on the marina,) and I was initially hesitant to buy outside the company's radio system. Naturally, the handhelds we use at work are quite pricey, and only approved in pairs. I was unsure if we could get the channels working, but figured it was worth the investment, and I'd simply return it if I couldn't. This being said, it was indeed a pain to pair it with an existing channel system due to the fact that our network had a physical password and security built into it's own setup. What was required essentially was to reset the existing system and start fresh with a new network paired to each of the handhelds. However, it is possible to do so- My best suggestion for encounters like mine would be to skip the very thick, detailed (which is good, but a bit overwhelming) instruction booklet and go online. You will fairly quickly find walkthroughs and even videos for pairing different systems.Of course, that was my initial intended use, and experiment- if you are looking for campaign or recreational 2 way 'home' or 'casual' use, you will find it is a lot easier to pair frequencies and connect to a channel. It's highly unlikely you will have the advanced network protection worked into the back end of my workplace, professional, setup- in this case, follow the instructions provided with the radio (this one, not the one you want to communicate with) and you should be good to go in minutes.This radio is sold individually, which is nice because you can add it to an existing setup (again, in most cases it is easy) or buy odd numbers if needed. They really are reasonable to get an entire operation going for quite a reasonable price- I'd highly suggest them for hunting parties! This unit also comes with an earpiece- which to me is not too exciting, and just an extra bonus, a charging dock, and a built in flashlight function. The flashlight is reasonably bright and has a wide radius of reach, which pairs great with the very bright visible (3 color option) screen background.Some other functions we've enjoyed include the voice command confirmation, 128 channel capacity and dual band operation. With a PC cable it can be programmed, for more advanced needs, but none of our existing 2 way cables seem to be compatible so you would have to order one through the brand or here on Amazon. The clarity is very strong, and interference through obstructions (such as land masses and across the marina/water) is minimal. I would suggest buying an extra battery- or perhaps just another handheld unit for the cost, as the battery life seems to be a little less than the suggested 12 hours, so you would have to keep it docked for charging purposes (which seems about 2.5 hours) or swap the battery out for a 24 hour rotation. We received a discount in exchange for our honest opinions, which we have provided here.

We've invested in a few of these now and really appreciate that they come with the bonus cutlery. We don't have children in the home, but we do watch our nieces and nephews often, and I pack lunches for myself from time to time. However, what we really buy these for are large gatherings, holiday celebrations, and meal donations. If you are involved in a church potluck or soup kitchen, these are wonderful for sending warm meals out to the many outstretched hands that come by. They are generous in size with very deep pockets and the dividers make portioning simple. With the snap on lids we find we can pre-package dozens of meals and reheat them on a moments notice.The BPA free plastic is very thick and sturdy- the base tray does not seem to flex or bench when holding onto an edge and full of food- we eat directly from them often and even reuse them. I especially like how the clear lids don't seem to get scuffed up or cloudy after cleaning. Most of my reusable food storage looks dingy after a few uses (especially with red sauces and microwaving.) These have held up quite well- though I should note they are very hot to the touch immediately after microwaving (though microwave safe.) We've also used these for freeze ahead meals- and so far only 1 in our set has cracked, which I suspect is because it was not allowed to reach room temperature before being pried open.When it comes to storing liquids, such as a sauce in one compartment, the lids do snap fairly airtight but we have noticed some spilling in transport- try to keep these upright at all times, and do not fill liquids more than 2/3 the cavity height, you shouldn't have an issue. I'm giving this for stars for the minor issue with compartment spillovers in transport (which we have avoided by filling less) and the sheer heat the containers give off to the touch after heating. I would also like to see these come in larger bulk numbers, but that's a request, not a complaint. I received a product discount in exchange for my honest thoughts, which I have provided.

We've had this for 6 weeks now and I've been very critical on it's performance and versatility in an attempt to provide the best feedback possible- when shopping I noticed many of the reviews were black or white- Either the product doesn't work with their setup or it works exactly as planned with not issues. When we first set it up we ran into a few issues others had noted- it was not immediately compatible with our Windows 10 PC, 2 of our 4 devices tested gave admin setup errors, and in one room of our home it seemed the connection would cutout inexplicably. However, the devices which did connect immediately and functioned clearly with the adapter worked beautifully without issue.Troubleshooting was my natural next step- it seemed unlikely that the device was 'faulty' when it worked so well in one room, and with certain devices while it does not work so well with others. First, I should say that the company has very quick troubleshooting assistance, though only a few of our communications solved actual issues (which were instructions errors on our part.) Outside of their troubleshooting, the unit functioned pretty much the same in each situation as it had before. Great here and on those devices, temperamental on others.While the aim of this product is not to enhance your WiFi speed, it is a natural assumption that it would increase the speed or quality of service in areas of your office or home where the WiFi from the main adapter is otherwise spotty. This being said, it did result in a triple speed boost ( 30mbps to 110mbps,) on our oldest and most difficult hardware. I am noting this hear because we did find, in testing, that it does seem to work more efficiently with equipment running on Windows 7 backwards. Our newest PC and laptops seemed to be the most temperamental, but are also the ones with the most programs and security software, etc. The only device we could not get to work fluidly (as a constant running connection for hours and days on end) is our Lenovo Yoga Pro 2. While we connected just fine, and device recognition was simple (After the Windows 10 drivers,) it just seemed to require to reconnect to the server more often than any other method of WiFi in our home.While this might discourage some- it seems the company is more than willing to troubleshoot or accept a refund/return, should the device not satisfy. We see no need to pursue that because it does work, and work exceptionally well, with our older laptops and PCs. We frequently MMORPG game which takes a lot of bandwidth on multiple devices (several people playing off our connection at once) and in one of the rooms the user used to have to re-log about ever 30 minutes. Thanks to the D-Link adapter we have a secure, stable connection to game on- which means we don't have to huddle together in the living room if we don't want.In all, it does look modern and cool (which is not exactly a reason to buy an item like this in our opinion,) and is very easy to set up, and highly compatible with any device we would want to seek a more stable and flexible connection from. However, if you are experiencing issues with new technology and hardware production post 2013, you might want to consider looking into your router as I'm not sure this will be of much help. I received a product discount in exchange for my honest opinions and thoughts, which I have provided.

I bike to work for my primary method of transportation and I regularly wear sunglasses and earbuds when biking. For me these were the perfect solution to simplify the number of things I have to pack up each day- AND they are slick enough to be worn while patrolling the marina at work. Not only can I listen to the radio, I can also accept calls while biking and walking around.When these first arrived I already knew what to expect from initial 'setup,' and the film was indeed a pain to remove, as I had to pull out the included screwdriver to remove the screws and lenses- I did try to remove the film without doing this, but there was still a portion trapped beneath the plastic frame. I have to say the biggest annoyance with these glasses is the need to use a screwdriver to simply swap between the yellow and polarized lenses. Of course, this is likely in part due to the fact that the lenses also flip up- which is a feature I love and use often.The glasses come with a case- it's pretty sturdy and basic for sunglasses bought on Amazon- it has a cheap plastic clip and is a little bulky but the overall shape protects and fits these glasses with no problem. Speaking of which, I am very happy with the compact footprint of these when folded up- they are also lightweight and comfortable to wear. However, due to the positioning of the earbud arm they are not compatible with my in car visor sunglasses clips :(The build is a fairly cheap plastic, they're definitely not designer, but they work very well for their intended purpose. There's a little bit of a learning curve on operation, as the glasses have minimal controls but several applications. I only discovered that I could use these as a remote camera shutter on my smartphone on accident! I also took a few tries to figure out how to reject incoming calls, though the audio is fairly clear in and out despite the mic being exposed to wind and surrounding noise.The earbuds could be rubberized or more comfortable in general. I don't much care for the cheap scratchy earbud cover, though they do the job. You can head the audio coming out of them when their on, which is to be expected. You can choose to wear the beds just hovering around the ear, or with the bud tilted in and resting further in the ear (though never in entirely like traditional earbuds would.) I used to have issues with my earbuds falling out due to sweat while biking, but this eliminates that problem and gives me the option of allowing surrounding sounds (such as traffic) in for safety purposes.In all, these do the job well. Sound quality was better than expected and it pairs quickly to my smartphone- One note- it does appear on my phone as a bluetooth keyboard device when scanning. Battery life is good- I've gotten just over 5 hours of continual play on a full charge. They also are easy to wear with a helmet on, and sliding in movement and sweat (on the bridge of the nose) is minimal. I received a discount in hopes I would share my honest experiences and thoughts, which I have done. If you have any questions please feel free to leave them here.

I am always looking for new knives, especially large chef style cutlery that can help process vegetables and large ingredients for family meals. I recently bought a new cutlery set and self sharpening cutting black with 3 open spaces for my own knives. That's where this chef's knife comes in- it is the perfect size for my 'Chef's knife' slot on my new block, and it has such a wonderfully natural weighting it feels like I am hardly putting any effort into cutting at all! Not to mention the blade arrived very sharp (with no sheath, so you will definitely want to have a black to house it in,) and the stainless still blade spans near 8" with a very fine tip for precision and thin slicing. So far we've used it on potatoes, onions, pork roast, tomatoes, and leek. I cannot stress enough how comfortable this is to chop and even dice with- and the handle seems to be slip resistant, which is great when working with wet ingredients like tomatoes. I would definitely invest in more knives by this maker, and even consider gifting one! I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

1:35 Mins I've seen a lot of DIY security camera and nursery camera setups in my day, many of them running several hundreds of dollars, so I was very skeptical of the quality of this camera for the price. That being said, it had great reviews, so we decided to give it a go.Setup was easy to accomplish, once we settled the minor issue of the power cord not being long enough to keep the unit powered AND have the LAN cable reach our router....I suppose this is a freak occurrence of our house wiring and furniture setup, so it's hard to fault the camera. In the end, we solved the problem by using our own, much longer Ethernet cable. Once everything was connected properly, the app on our phone scanned the bar code on the bottom of the unit and quickly paired the camera to our viewing account.We immediately noted that multiple cameras could be viewed through the one account, and that we could even set up temporary or 'guest' passwords for remote viewing by multiple people. This is especially nice from a security or childcare perspective where multiple parties might want to access a feed. The fact that we could toggle or change the guest passwords as needed is a wonderful bonus- sometimes you have someone house sit, or such, and only want them to temporarily have access to the feed.The power cord is kind of kinky and not very pretty- however, the white color is likely the least obtrusive. Since we, personally, don't use it for security, the cord being visible isn't a huge concern to us. Others may want to use the included mount and run the power supply along the wall for long term or security use. The camera itself is not very discreet either- it's not something you'd be hiding in a plant or toy to spy on people without their knowing, and doing such would limit the mobility of the camera and feed, which is such a big selling point. It is also audible- not loud in operation, but detectable in moving. The motor makes a rather noticeable noise when turning (something the cat has already picked up on.) I like this, however, because I usually know when someone is viewing the feed.So, since it's not compact, makes a little bit of noise, and the power source is not the prettiest- the camera itself actually makes up for those things ten-fold in ease of use, clarity of image, and an intuitive app. We were immediately impressed by the clarity of the live feed, and even still images, or recorded video. In fact, my father, who has a very expensive home monitoring system is looking into installing a few of these. He says they "trump the company's surveillance feed by a long shot."One thing I do wish I could do sometimes is pan the camera down just a little bit more....but mounting would surely fix this problem. Until I invest in a few more I like being able to 'plug and play' from one room to the next, so it is what it is. The camera, otherwise, does nearly a 360, so we try to face it in a corner to sweep down the hall and into the two major rooms of our house.While you can set the camera to motion detect, and even record (to SD or to your app) it will only record in 30 minute chunks- That is the smallest time period it will record upon sensing an 'incident.' Using the app remotely is intuitive and a breeze, however, simply swipe the screen up or down, left or right, to watch the camera pan in real time. We notice about a 5-7 second delay on image transmission to the app screen. This is not a big deal in most cases, but would not make it suitable for especially young infants, where choking and time to react would be of the highest importance. For all other monitoring needs it is more than acceptable in our opinion.Through the app you can toggle live sound feed on/off and even talk through a microphone on the camera. I have actually held conversations with people in our home from  remote location. It's not exactly Skyping but the image is clear and the audio works to communicate. My main issue there is that the feedback from my voice is very obnoxious and loud on my end (and muffled,) but, clear coming out of the camera.We use this camera a LOT for night streaming- Often I'll hear something crash on the opposite end of the house, and, instead of getting up can flip to the feed and see it's just the cat. The video is very sharp, and I can easily capture stills that are highly legible. In all, we couldn't be more pleased with this unit. I highly recommend it to anyone looking to add home security without complicated operation or setup, and flexibility of use. It is great to be able to keep an eye on our home from anywhere with our smartphone! I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. Feel free to drop us questions!

We chose this photo prop set mainly for the quantity of props and the variety- we loved how colorful so many of the props were. We mainly intended on using them for school carnivals with the kids as they go very well with a face painting station. To set a little photo station up we took a big cardboard box (Think refrigerator or water heater) and clipped some fabric to it for our background. We then laid out all of the props and let the kids go to town. With 'digital' film the possibilities are endless and the kids really love hamming it in front of a camera. Here are our observations about this set. I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.*The props were very easy to punch out of the sheets. There were no issues with tearing and the perforation was clear and defined.*There are 2 pipes in this set. One is attached to a goatee- we cut the pipe off of the goatee as, personally, it wasn't appropriate for the kids.*You will have to assemble this props, glue is included but in our opinion not the best method for attaching the props to the included sticks. I would suggest using a piece of tape across the stick, and overlapping onto the prop. This seems to offer the most secure option, but is not the easiest when dealing with the smaller props. For smaller props with thinner edges, we used hot glue. Only a few of our props came apart after an afternoon of rough kids. Even then only a reattachment was necessary.*As far as the sticks go, we found them sturdy enough to support even the larger props, but a bit on the short end, even for the kids. We wished the sticks were a little longer.*The prop sizing is just right, a little over-sized for the kids, which makes it comically hilarious, and just right for the adults.

We own over a dozen different cutting boards from butcher blocks and traditional bamboo boards to decorative and polypropylene boards. They all serve various purposes. The thought behind acquiring this one was the slender depth (which will store well between appliances or even hanging on the wall, and the convenient handle, which can aid in transport when we take our 'cooking show' on the go. We do a lot of cooking at friends and family's houses during various entertaining events and having a light weight, yet durable, cutting board is essential.As far as bamboo boards go this is pretty basic- We loved the generous size/footprint, which allows for the processing and storage of large quantities of ingredients all at once. The outer edge is lined with a divot that acts as a drip catcher for juices. It is not too deep, though, so you will still want to rinse it off now and then- take note the etched border only appears on one side, so make note of which you prefer to use for your meats or fruits/veggies and use that as a reminder.We noticed this cutting board is fairly resistant to staining- typically some of my cheaper bamboo boards seem more porous and tend to absorb colors from fruit juices. While I haven't noticed any accumulation of stains yet you can easily care for your bamboo board by sprinkling some coarse salt on it and scrubbing with a lemon half. This will usually remove the majority of staining (while acting as an antiseptic.) We also noticed very little splintering or separation from the bamboo swelling on the first few washes, which usually indicates a high quality cutting board. I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

3:48 MinsI wasn't quite sure what applications I would have for this product when I invested in it, but I knew that it was something I'd find use for, if I had it around. It's just that sort of unique crafting product that is there when you need a unique, truly one of a kind, gift. While I think I'll be using it primarily to play around with miniatures and action figure/model molding, I could see someone using this to craft jewelry pendants, earrings and such.Do not expect to pick it up and be able to use ti right away- While the instructions are pretty straight forward, you will want to have a candy thermometer on hand to measure your water, as well as a cup of cold water for your fingertips and hard setting, as well as containers that do NOT ever touch food. While the product advertises itself as biodegradable I do not want to be ingesting it and when the product is superheated it WILL stick to the interior surfaces of pots and pans. We thought we had our pyrex measuring cup thoroughly cleaned and the next time I poured cold water into it a bunch of plastic flakes came bubbling up to the top! I suggest investing in a cheap muffin pan where you can pour the hot water in (since it is heat resistant) and 'melt' several small portions in different colors all at once- and even have a reserve for cold/fingertip water.My next tip is to go slow- a little goes a VERY long way. The great news is, it's pretty much impossible to waste the product because you CAN always reheat it and mold it again. Keep in mind that a thick mass of the material, hardened, will take longer to soften, and not soften as evenly, as the tiny equal pellets.This took me 2 attempts to get the hang of, as I initially didn't heat the water enough to melt the pellets- You will notice right away the pellets becoming translucent if you have the right temperature. Your water should not be actively steaming (if it is, it is too hot to handle and you should allow it to sit a moment before reaching in as the pellets will stick to your hands and the container/vessel.) Daub your fingers in the cold water prior to manipulating the product and don't be afraid to re-submerge part of your creation in the hot water to allow it to become more pliable once gain.While the product does seem indestructible, I have to say that I found adhering the different pieces was easy when warm, but not so strong in the long term. My poor minion's glasses busted off with the first good fall :( I'd love to see more tutorials and tips to help work with smaller or detail pieces. If you have traditional vinyl working tools, they will help with etching and some shaping and are worth investing in if you plan on playing with the product again and again. One thing I'm not sure about is how the company plans on selling more product, since it is so easy to re-purpose and reuse from one project to the next!Oh, and a bit of insight, the black, blue, and purple pellets all look the same- I'd like to see the company put an identifier on the vial (such as a colored cap or sticker) so it's not so hard to differentiate between them. If my review has helped you in any way, could you please click on the like button! I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I have mixed feelings about this one, because I think the name and the concept is really cool for beer enthusiasts, but the execution is not so much for the casual drinker. That is to say I wonder if these will become more of a conversation piece than functioning tool in my entertaining line-up.First impression is that these would have angered me for the 'original retail of $35,' but they are fairly reasonable for the current (at time of this review) $11 asking price. With the holiday gifting season fast approaching these have viable use as a novelty gift that is also functional, to a point. That is to say these are in fact Stainless Steel outer shells to a cheap foam can koozie inside. The bottom is made with the thinnest of the foams present in the product, which I fear will fray quite quick with the rough use of my friends, and outdoor use (by the pool, whatnot.) However, the open/light bottom does allow for air flow and make it easier to clean the product- just note all moisture wicking dos eventually begin to drip down through the hole in base.As far as sizing, these do work with standard cans, tall cans, and bottles. Bottles seem to have a bit of 'slosh' room, but not enough to make them top heavy or tippable. The stainless steel surface is slick (but, obviously, collects oily fingerprints quick.) I was a bit disappointed by the readability of the logo- I thought it would be etched, but it's more 'brushed' on. The logo isn't quite centered (a little crooked) on one, and I do wish the 'Beer Keg' was more legible, because that really doe add to the novelty value of an item like this.Does it help keep cold beer cold- In my opinion, yes. More so than a traditional can koozie sleeve? No. In fact, tighter 'shell' like koozies seem to work a little bit better, but, again, I consider this a novelty item for a beer lover or entertainer, so it's not a big issue for me. It's my personal opinion that anything over $15 for these would mark it at 3 stars, but the current price is a good value for the functionality and build, thus landing it a 4 star status. I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

We aren't really what you'd call Big Bang fans, but we'd seen this around the net in various memes, and I've always thought this was one of those 'If I could put it on a bumper sticker,' type things. When I saw this 2 sided shirt I was stoked to see it came in 'fluffy' sizes. As a 5'9" 240lb male I typically by 2xl shirts; which are often $5+ more expensive for the 'extra sizing.' This shirt was the same price for a small as a 2xl #winAs far as fit, it is a little narrow around the waist than what I normally wear, but not tight by any means. I think this is due in part to the nice (thicker yet soft) material. I was also happy to see that the screen printing was the nice 'thicker' layered kind, yet didn't peel or tear during wear. The inner neck has a tag-less label that reads 'Big Bang Theory,' and the quality is exactly what I would expect for official merchandise. As far as the screen printing, we can't see any deviation in alignment, the words on the back seem to run straight, and centered, on my back.This has been a great buy and remains a shirt I get plenty of compliments on! If my review has helped you in any way, could you please click on the like button!  I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Originally I found the idea of these a bit niche- I don't go around dropping GoPros in coral reefs or precarious places (like off bridges) so I don't have an everyday application for them. Then Jay (who works as a security guard at a marina) dropped his $500 phone off the docks while trying to tie up a wayward board, while on the clock. Even a Lifeproof case cannot stop life when the tide is rolling and you've got 30'+ of sea-foam green water. So, we initially invested in these for use with the Lifeproof case-I have to say I wish these had some sort of application for smartphones (IE came bundled with even a cheap sleeve) style waterproof case for modern smartphones, because they have proven themselves so useful. Yes, they are bulky, but they do not hinder his work, and are only in use while out ON the water, and they attach to pretty much anything with a loop- including the 2 Way Radio handsets. They are also very bright, which make them easy to spot, even at a distance (say when the water is carrying precious electronics away) and can also be added to the dock key ring to make the duggie stick or keys floatable in a pinch. We've even found application to throw something out to someone on the water where this made the item easy to skim off the water.Naturally, where these will come in most handy is for recreational users (vacationers, those with a pool, those who camp.) In fact, I used these heavily on my recent cruise with my water proof camera (And even to help strap my camera to my person while ziplining!) The extra wide, soft, foam strap is very light and easy to wear for extended periods (say leaning over a cruise ship in a glacier inlet?) I could barely feel my hands while on deck, half the time, and knowing that my camera would be easily spotted if it (or I) went over board was great for piece of mind. Of course these also came in use while in the solarium pool, on deck.I've dropped phones and cameras in the water enough by now, with these straps on, to feel confident. The first few times (for testing purposes) I didn't want to let go of the strap- but I'm reassured that these are indeed going to hold my camera/phone up (we've tested up to 9oz, without issue- and have found we can use BOTH straps on one device to support more weight, if needed. In all, these are a great investment to keep on board of you boat or vacation near water- for the price, why not have the option to protect your gear around water? ** I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. If my review has helped you in any way, could you please click on the like button!

First of all, I want to say, for the current list price (At time of this review, $12.99) this product is a bargain. If the only thing it did successfully was play clear music through the car stereo via Bluetooth connection, I would find it worth it's price. That being said, it does also allow for Bluetooth calling through your car stereo, a feature that is, perhaps, a little less effective (more on that later) but still functional and an added value for older cars, or cars with failing Bluetooth systems.I have to say I haven't used an FM transmitter since my 1985 Chrysler LeBaron, and I am always amazed by how few people know these exist. To put it plainly, if your car has no Bluetooth capability, this is how you can stream audio files (like radio, phone calls, MP3s) from any Bluetooth capable device (MP3 players, tablets, smartphones.)You can indeed set it up straight out of the (minimal) packaging- but I had  'duh' moment when I realized I couldn't have the transmitter paired to my Bluetooth device AND change the transmission frequency/station at the same time. The default is 87.5FM, and my car does not read below 87.7. It took me a while to realize I had to un-pair my phone and the transmitter to use the buttons to toggle the station pre-set. If paired the buttons will only make or decline calls, change the frequency volume, and switch through tracks.To help adjust the clarity of the unit you can range the transmission volume/frequency down and up 1-30. Find a clarity that is sharp, then adjust the volumne on your car stereo directly to the desired listening volume.The LCD display on the front is very easy to read in just about every lighting situation, even direct with the moon roof back, and there are a few simple features that add bonus functionality to the device such as the ability to angle it at any direction (to fit within your car's console/dash) configuration, and dual USB ports so that you can still charge from the cigarette lighter port while using the transmitter. As far as making 'hands free' calls, yes you can talk through the stereo system, thanks to a mic receiver on the front of the device, but you will have to fumble with the small buttons on the end to accept or end the call.I have had a few accidental hangups (Whoops) because the buttons are so small and so close. In addition, my cigarette lighter is located very low on the passenger's side and the mic picks up a decent amount of interference. It is usable in a pinch (an important call comes in while driving and streaming music) but I wouldn't choose to use it as a Bluetooth call device in any other scenario.Again, this was easy to set up and use out of the package (instruction included but not needed in the end,) and works great as an FM transmitter. I love listening to my Amazon Prime library while cruising around town- it's so nice not to have to listen to commercials on the radio anymore. Even better, the clarity is sometimes sharper than the local radio station! I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. If my review has helped you in any way, could you please click on the like button!

It's hard to fault this as anything other than what it is advertised as- a 'flexible' (it's in the product description) PVC magnifier lens. This means it will bend and distort if not held with both hands, or in a structured grip. It also does not have any form of lighting system, as it is intended to be an easy to store magnifier one would keep in a magazine, book, map guide, or stashed in a purse. It does just that with magnification of up to 3X (which is not a tremendous amount, but  practical everyday use amount) and suitable for very fine text, or in addition to the use of corrective lenses. That is to say it will not replace your reading glasses.Hold the magnifier .5 to no more than 5" away from the surface you are trying to read, while ensuring it is flat to minimize distortion or disruption. We found that about 4" is the sweet spot for maximum magnification with total sharpness/clarity. We especially enjoyed the black border around the outer rim, which helps define the beginning and end of magnification- We have had others without borders and it becomes a pain to keep track of your reading place without the flat, defined, edge.This is a very portable, lightweight yet durable, magnifier we keep with the magazine pile. I am looking at buying another for my grandparent's who travel a lot and often have trouble consulting menus and maps while on vacation. For those wondering, this material could be trimmed to pocket or credit card/wallet sizes if desired- fairly easy- just be sure to sand or tape the edges, which can be quite sharp when cut. I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. If my review has helped you in any way, could you please click on the like button!

I received this product for free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.I was supposed to provide my feedback direct to the manufacturer, which I did.The only feedback I can provide at this time, is that the product I received (which was originally pre-launch) kept powering of our Samsung Galaxy s4s in both sizes (in and out of the case,) I assume due to pressure points. For original iPhones, we had no issue in this aspect.

We've recently begun cutting dairy out of our excess diet and it's been a challenge to find dessert or snacking options that excite the sweet tooth while still satisfying. Popsicles have been the solution- In particular coconut or almond milk with crushed OREOs- pure heaven! But I digress- In the past we have had to store glass tumblers in our freezer door to help our popsicle molds set- and that sometimes led to a big mess then the pressure of squeezing them all into a glass caused the caps to burst (never fill your popsicles higher than 1.5" below the rim.)While I could go without the funky swirl coloring, it is nice to have each one be a different flavor as it cuts down on arguing with the kids and even allows for multiple flavors/variations with easy exterior identification. The stand included in this set is a must have- I searched high and low on Amazon for a stand for this style of popsicle mold and only found one option sold by itself. Save yourself time, effort, and money and invest in a set like this so you are good to go immediately. That being said, this stand is a little tricky to clean, and the plastic concerns me as far as wear and deterioration being pulled in and out of the freezer (extreme temperatures.) We did have ours fall once and the weight of the frozen pops combined with the force left a small crack in the corner.The molds themselves are standard (compared to my 2 other sets by 2 different brands,) I find Sunsella has the deepest lids, but these are just deep enough to eliminate spilling in the event they are tipped- and these can be frozen at an angle or on their side (which we do to make half/half popsicles sometimes.) The lids are a little bit of a pain to clean so I suggest soaking the entire mold and you will want to invest in a wire brush to get down to the very inner tip. Cleaning these with any cream based pop is more difficult than juice or sugar based options. Regardless, the fact that the lids are attached to the molds is truly the best park of this product. We've lost 4/12 of our lids on OTHER brand's sets, so this really does extend the live of the product, and even add reuse-ability for homes with kids who may not eat an entire portion in one sitting. I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased review, which I have provided.

Note: I am not a medical professional and nothing contained below should be considered medical advice, these are merely my honest insights and personal experiences.I have suffered from Lactose intolerance since I was a pre-teen, to the point I have gone portions of my life without dairy at all. While there are several options to help ease Lactose intolerance (daily pills with extended 12-24 hour relief, and capsules that are taken just prior to eating,) the price range varies dramatically. Which is funny because most of them have identical ingredients- it's only the brand name or method of application, (capsules, tablets, chewables,) that changes.Keeping up with this condition can be costly, unless you intend to cut lactose out of your diet entirely- and symptoms and severity vary from one person to the next. For me, I have never been in the position to drop $35 a month on the daily pills that offer freedom of eating whatever I want, whenever I want it. Having a tablet such as this, where I can take 1 or 2 prior to dairy consumption, is economical and logical for me. With 180 tablets, even if I take the maximum suggested dose of 2, that's over a 3 months supply for me (closer to 4 or 5.)However, like I mentioned, severity of symptoms does matter- Keep in mind the single tablet dosage of this product is 3000 FCC ALU of the Lactase enzyme. A typical dosage is actually 6000-9000, so if you are taking just one, you might not see much relief if your symptoms re severe or your diagnosis is fresh. Keep in mind that people who regularly eat dairy with lactose intolerance my also build natural lactase production and naturally decrease the severity of symptoms over time. I, personally, have been taking 2 immediately before ingesting lactose heavy products.My original intolerance was classified as severe- through the years the symptoms have lessened but not to the point that I would willingly consume lactose without some sort of enzyme support. The results would be quite interuptive and even painful the following day. These tablets do just what I nee and have replaced a bigger name brand on my shelf (the ingredients are identical!) which saves me money. I also like how easy these tablets are to take, it really is a no brainer for those suffering from lactose intolerance. I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Jenna here- These are $9 fashion sunglasses, and you should expect such when ordering them- Personally, I like that because I need a wide range of fashion frames for various occasions where kids or potentially extreme activities are involved. I don't want to wear my $130 frames, for example, somewhere where they might be damaged, lost, or forgotten. These are just the trick for a day at the theme park and, while the plastic frame is thick and this can make it feel on the cheaper side, I also feel the plastic frame will hold up to more abuse and makes for the perfect pair of thrashers.The lenses themselves are actually of seemingly higher quality than the frame itself, and block out the sun quite well with a moderate tinting effect. I can read crisp and clear with them on, and they are great for driving.The main drawback for me is I have a wider temple and they tend to feel tight when worn for several hours on end- and don't enjoy staying put on my head when pulled up and rested on my hairline. I store these by hanging them off my tank, or in my purse as a result.The little rhinestone detailing is quite cute and, despite skepticism as to how long they will stay put without falling off, the little gem detailing seems to still be quite in tact. Overall the design/style is very cute and, in my opinion, worth the current $9 asking price- I would, however, like to see them a little wider in the bridge. I received a product discount in hopes I would share my honest thoughts, which I have done.

A lot of my friends and family only know Matcha from modern day coffee house beverages, or 'green tea' ice cream after a sushi dinner. For a while now I have been trying to explain the textural and palette difference in REAL quality matcha flavor and tea. A true green tea powder will often demand a pretty penny and appear fine ground (almost like a corn starch or confectioner's sugar) and have a beautiful leafy green hue. The aroma should be slightly sweet but pungent and just a little is required to make a 'shot' of usucha.This is NOT a product for baking- though one could certainly do so with great results, you will be spending an arm and a leg and the true richness of the genuine green tea powder will likely by lost and baked off (a true shame.) This is a matcha for drinking, and should be done with room temperature to luke warm water (never hot, as you will burn the tea and ruin the flavor, giving it bitter notes.) I personally prefer a few drops of of coconut milk in my koicha. For a foamy product you can use a small battery operated frother, or a super fine mini wooden whisk- stainless steel manual whisks tend to leave the matcha flat.In all, this is a true treat- Kenko has brought me back to treasured memories of sipping koicha in the sun room of my school-mate's obaasan. I am grateful to have had the chance to try this product at a discount, and will be ordering more quite soon.

This product seams (pun intended) to get poor reviews for quite glaring manufacturing issues in defective products. I can't say we recieved a defective product, so I can only speak to our experience, though it does appear it might be a gamble. I can only hope the customer service is good and quick in replacing the item if needed, as the 2" patch really won't do much but repair tiny punctures (as from small rocks or thorns.)It should also be noted that the ball, inflated, is closer to 32" in diameter- and comes closest to 48" uninflated and flat. It's still quite big and fun, but a good foot short of what most might expect based on the product title and description.If you're wondering can this be inflated by mouth? Sure, it can. It took a healthy adult 70 full breaths and about 15 minutes to fully inflate. Be warned, the spout is on the larger side and a it's bit of a pain to open the valve. My fingers got sore from pinching long before my lungs got tired of blowing. Personally, I'd suggest an air compressor with wide nozzle, but it certainly is possible to fill it with lungs alone, and not pass out :)Note: You will likely never see it taught/inflated full. We were able to get it quite full but the process of closing the valve does allow are to escape and it seems air does/is slowly (and I mean minuscule) leaking over days and time (which could be due to heat and expansion.) Regardless, it retains it's bounce and buoyancy- and flies through the air with ease. In fact, we like to keep it a little softer so the small hands can grab and grip it easier- otherwise it goes flying in all directions when a kid tries to pick it up!We bought this not for a pool or the beach so I was a bit worried about the potential for puncture, as we wanted to use it outdoors for the daycare kids to play with during active outdoor time. So far it has survived several hours of outdoor play with some pretty rowdy kids ranging ages 4-12. It's flown into bushes, even bounced on the ground, and even had children lie across it. I think, like most inflated things, it will have a shelf life depending on how it is treated. Accidents happen, especially with kids and inflatables, and I already feel I've gotten my money's worth with the many uses and hours on end of play we've gotten from it so far. I received a product discount (but paid more than a few bucks) for this product in hopes I would share my honest thoughts, which I have done.

There has been some debate as to whether this looks like a lion head or not- It's my best opinion that it does when fitted to the right size animal or a short hair cat. Yes, the hair is not as fluffy a 'mane' as one might like, but keep in mind that this is intended to go on a pet's head and is fairly warm/weighted/thick already. I'd also be concerned with pets who might spook or flail with this if the hair was much longer who knows what it could catch on! That being said, here are my thoughts:*This is advertised as a cat/dog hat- so keep that in mind, that (if it is intended to fit a cat, it is intended to fit small dogs.) The measurements are accurate and t fastens by a 2.5" velcro strip under the chin. While you likely could get this to fasten on a medium breed dog with a slender face I think it will look a bit silly and less like a lion, as one reviewer noted.*As far as fit- We tried this on our 10lb indoor adult cat- it fit her better than the 4.5lb Maltese dog (she's all hair.) I had to fasten this at the very edge (Tightest) of the velcro strap and even then it seemed to move/slide quite a bit on the dog. With the cat it was snug and secure and even in rolling and rubbing stayed put quite well.*It's built well, except our left ear seems to be inverted/turned a little outward so it looks a little silly from different angles. I wish the ears with both forward facing but I'll assume this was a factory error- it doesn't detract from the hood too much. Otherwise the material and sewing is great- it is warm enough to wear Trick-Or-Treating or for just a fabulous evening about town. The inner fleece-like liner tends to slip forward and make itself visible now and then, so you may want to ensure this is all the way tucked back before strapping it on.*Some pet hoods/hats have a tendency to come down too far in the back and obstruct leash/collar/harness performance. We were pleased to note that this is cut a little high in the back so you can efficiently walk your dog without any issues.*Not really a review note but as a tip- Expect cats to 'freeze' when clothed, especially when their ears are covered. IF you plan on getting photos of a cat that isn't pissed off then you will want to ease the cat into wearing the hood by placing it on the cat for a few minutes, several times a day, over several days, and reward the cat with treats upon removal. Dogs who are not used to wearing costumes/clothes will likely have the opposite reaction and want to flail about to knock it off. The Velcro is secure but also (which is good for safety) able to be removed or pulled off by the pet in an emergency.We received a discount, but paid more than a few cents or dollars, in hopes we would share our honest thoughts, which we have done. IF you have any questions please feel free to drop us a comment!

I've wanted a donut pan for quite a long time but am limited to the amount of storage space in my kitchen since I tend to go a little wild with crazy pans and molds for special occasions I'll only use once.... This donut pan was a great investment but now it has me wanting to invest in a literal 'pan' from one of the more established kitchenware brands. Don't get me wrong, there are many great uses for silicone baking bake this produces full sized donuts and can get a little flimsy when full of hot baked donuts and has had a few issues, over 8 baking cycles so far, with cleaning even. There are an overwhelming number of glowing reviews, maybe because it does what it is supposed to and people are simply so tickled to be making donuts at home? But it's not without some things worthy of note:*This silicone donut mold is freezer safe and good for temperatures up to 450F- In our experiences anything over 400F has caused non stick agents to bake onto the silicone. This created a slick grease layer that doesn't really soak off but can be scraped off with a Brillo or fingernail.*It performs wonderful in the freezer with no issues no stick wise....Out of the oven with several various types of batters I've lost some chunks in even fully cooled donuts. We did find that a light flour dusting has proven most useful on this particular pan. Clean and dry it thoroughly between batches or invest in 2-3 to allot for full size batches.*It's silicone and fairly long so it doesn't have much rigidity when handling the wet batter and taking the hot donuts out of the oven. Always handle the silicone baking pan on top of a cookie sheet or baking pan for safety.*The mold/pan has discolored a little (brown) since the initial use but it is overall still quite operational. As I said, it works and does the job but I think I'll be investing in a more substantial traditional style pan since I plan on making many more donuts!

We have a Keurig in our home but often crave the taste, and scent, of freshly ground coffee brewing; or the experience of serving a pot to friends and family. If you entertain a lot then a  French Press like this is definitely the way to go for stylish serving with maximum flavor and impact. This particular press is great for those new to the concept of French Pressing as it is simple to operate and offers flexibility in serving portions (with a maximum of 8C/ 4 coffee mugs output.)Our first french press was made with chrome accents which looked slick for about 2 washes, the stainless steel frame of this press not only keep the device looking great wash after wash, but also allow the glass beaker to slide out for easier washing. Another nice feature you don't always see on entry level presses is the plastic lid liner which prevents the coffee from coming in direct contact with the stainless steel when pouring, and protects your fingertips from the heat.As far as french presses go, this one if very straight forward, but the American conversions seem to be missing from the internal messaging/instructions. While you will want to adjust the grounds based on your blend and desired strength, in general you should aim to use about 4-5 TBS of grounds. Place the grounds at the bottom of the empty glass beaker then add about 3/4 C hot water and stir (you will want to use an iced tea spoon or wooden utensil to get to the bottom and properly agitate the grounds.) Next, add the remainder of the water (approximately 2.5C) to the beaker, stirring again, and allow the mixture to sit for about 4 minutes. When you are ready to serve plunge the press downward to strain the grounds and allow for a smooth coffee experience.We were quite pleased with the double screen filter and it's ability to keep, even finely ground, coffee grounds out of our cup. The result was an exceptionally smooth drinking experience, and the resulting cleanup was equally simple. However, after several uses we have noticed the plastic handle seems to require some tightening, thus our 4/5 star reviews. This is simple enough to fix, but not something you'd see with higher end units after such few uses.In all we are very pleased with the coffee quality and easy of use for the price. This has proved to be one of the easier to clean units with have owned, and the conversion issue is a minor note for anyone who has brewed French Press style before (especially giving that the perfect cup of coffee is more of an art than a science.) I received a product discount in hopes I would share my honest thoughts, which I have done.

We were a little skeptical when ordering this, simply because there weren't very many reviews and there were a lot of similar styles and brands to choose from on Amazon. We needed something to tote around selfie sticks, cameras, sunglasses, passports, Sd Cards and more while on our Alaskan/Canada cruise and the number of pockets and pouches, along with the compact size and one shoulder use, was very appealing.When this arrived we were fairly impressed with the build and material quality. It is very lightweight when empty, but the seams are are quite reinforced and the numerous zippers and latches keep your things in place so they are easy to locate when you need them, and secure when you don't. One thing we did quickly note, however, is there is no pouch to store/hold a water bottle. You will notice in photos there is a side pouch that looks like a drawstring bottle holder but it really only fits a sunglasses case or smaller smartphone.The overall visual styling is pretty slick and something we didn't feel geeky about while toting around as tourists. It actually complimented the majority of our accessories and clothing and was unlike an of the other bags and totes going through ship security daily- so it always stood out.There's over 12 pouches/pockets/cubbies to organize and stash stuff in with this tote ranging from the largest main bag compartment to very tiny zipper pouches on the inner flap. In addition the main flap (which folds over the front and clips in) is a secondary security for the inner compartments which have their own zippers. This was especially great for keeping our contents secure when we needed to retrieve something from one pocket without having to open or exposure the valuable electronics in another. We cannot speak enough to the utility purposes of this tactical bag.The main chest strap is also very wide and well reinforced with stitched detailing, again adding to the tactical appeal and styling, while making it very comfortable to wear (even full) for long periods. We especially liked how easy it was to sling down from the back to the front with minimal maneuvering. This made access in tight crowded spaces quick and efficient. Not only did this hold up through extensive daily use of slinging, zipping/unzipping, clipping/unclipping, and extreme weather (including rain with impressive waterproofing) we have yet to note a seam begin to give or a zipper begin to stick. This was a great buy and we are thrilled we had the chance to review it in exchange for a small product discount.

Despite being available through Prime this took weeks to arrive to my house as there seemed to be an inventory issue at the time I ordered; this wouldn't really be worth nothing if it weren't for the fact that the nature of this product is something that people might be buying out of immediate need and hoping to have in hand within a few days to repair something in particular. If you are looking to have this laying around for general occasions, then the slow Prime shipping shouldn't really impact you.Let me start by saying that I was impressed with the storage case this came in and the slick design of the actual product. This being said, the next thing I noticed was the extensive, very fine, print and warnings included. You have your basic 'don't point the LED in your eyes' but there are also a lot of cautions about the liquid product becoming aerated and to only use this in a heavily ventilated area (which can be hard to remember since there is no offensive odor.) In addition, you will want to wear gloves and work over a disposable drop cloth/surface because there are numerous warnings about how to clean up after spills or skin contact.As it turns out the day after this came in the arm of my glasses ripped off the frame and I had a perfect opportunity to give it a try. General use is pretty simple, clean the surfaces you wish to adhere by sanding and wiping, then apply the Bondic solution to bridge the gab between the broken halves/pieces and apply the mounted UV LED light directly to the seam for 5-10 seconds. Bondic works by primarily bridging the gab between two halves/a seam through the curing process of the liquid (plastic like) compound. Once hardened/cured the solution can be filed down for an even seam and smooth repair. It is fairly translucent, with a light yellow tinge when cured.For us this product worked very well under tug tests and to repair odd fabrics such as leather, plastic and wood- the majority of the resilience holding out on plastic repairs, which we could not re-fracture after repairing.This being said, the actual Bondic pen is messy, very messy for a product with so many hazard warnings! The top drips constantly, and if not stored properly will drip as soon as the cap is removed, making a mess. The LED light is a little bit of a paint to turn on/off and I dislike that I have to turn the potentially drippy Bondic pen end upside down. In all, this product seems to have some interesting applications but is more of  bridge than an adhesive and requires some more finessing in the product application aspect of the concept.I received this product for free in hopes I would share my honest thoughts and experiences, which I have done. If you have any questions please feel free to drop a line.

I ordered this for my tween niece who is all about the attitude and the texting- Her bed is a riot of color and stuffed animals and I knew this would make a great addition.The first thing I noticed was the lack of any tags or labels. It came in a bag with no choking hazard warnings and, while I personally cut the tags off of toys before I give them to my nieces and nephews I'm not sure how this can be sold without care or warning labels? Why is their no material information? The lack of tags also gives it a sort of mass produced 'cheap' feel which is a shame because the quality of the embroidered details is actually quite nice.As other reviewers have noted this is not a perfect circle. While I don't necessarily notice pinching I do see points where the outer seam seems to be stitched tighter than other areas.The embroidered face is very well reinforced and seems like it will hold up to a lot of snuggling and abuse- I don't have any fears about an eye peeling off.The material is of decent quality and soft to the touch but the batting (filling) seems a little lumpy which doesn't really compliment the exterior seam stitch-work, In all this is a pretty cute throw pillow for the average tween. I received a discount on this item in hopes I would share me honest opinions, which I have done.

This is going to sound silly, but don't mistake the brand name, combined with the listing photo, to mean you will get both mats shown. The brand is Two Meows, and you are ordering either grey or lime green :)In any case, we have 1 indoor cat-  1, small, harmless looking, tuxedo kitty. And she is a DIGGER. She loves to kick up sand like a mole tunneling. We've had to house her litter box in a special piece of furniture (cabinet) and make her our own extra large litter box from a storage tub, simply to help curb some of the aftermath of her waste disposal efforts. As you'll see in the before photo, I actually started lining the cabinet with wrapping paper because all of the pet mats we found were too small, and all of the fabrics we had on hand tended allow the movement of sand from paws to the outside of the box.When this mat came in I was thrilled with the large size. It was actually larger in width and length than the cabinet footprint (and this is not a small piece of furniture.) It did have a medium strength (rubber?) odor that has dissipated within a few days of unpacking. The bottom of the mat is fairly smooth- so it doesn't grip well and will bunch if one the flood and nudged or stepped on by human feet. For our needs it is int he box and stays put. It even wraps up the side and back to help trap any sand that gets knocked around in cleaning.The top surface is textured with grooves. It reminds me of a good bath scrubber- it traps sand like nobody's business and is even minimizing the amount of sand being tracked outside the cabinet! Our cat is usually picky about the surfaces she'll walk on and she has accepted this mat with no issues. I love it because I don't have to clean out wrapping paper weekly- The mat holds quite a bit of scatter sand since the scrub pockets are deep. When I need to clean it I take it outside and beat it- We'll be hosing it off for the first time soon. I really love how durable it is and expect it to hold up for years! We received a product discount in exchange for sharing our honest thoughts and experiences.

I did a bit of research on the benefits of garlic supplements before I began taking this- Many may not realize that garlic's most potent byproduct, Allicin is actually an enzyme reaction that dissipates quite quickly after the garlic bulb is cut into or disturbed. This is the ingredient/reaction from consumption of large quantities of garlic that is scientifically associated with the benefits of lower blood pressure, decrease in clotting risks, and immune support. Because of the manner in which Allicin is released it is widely accepted that 'fresh garlic bulb' equivalent supplements do not actually contain a measurable amount of Allicin. The best way to obtain the results of Allicin is through an Allicin Powder Extract.When choosing a garlic supplement  keep in mind that very few 'garlic' supplements contain Allicin (because of the way Allicin is created as a byproduct and enzyme reaction within the garlic consumption process,) and your decision of which 'Garlic' supplement to take will ultimately not burn down to that specific garlic byproduct. If you do research you will quickly see genuine Allicin is really only obtained through direct consumption of fresh physical garlic, or through processed Allicin SPECIFIC powder supplements. Once you understand this, should you still choose to take garlic supplements for other benefits (non Allicin related,) and find that the 1000mg Fresh Garlic Bulb Equivalent in these capsules is a good option for you- then you can continue to read about the product's experience and performance.Keep in mind these capsules are not Vegan and do contain gelatin, which is standard for capsule formats. These are, however, non-GMO and organic. The supplement also contains parsley and chlorophyll to help mask the odor and garlic burps you might find with other supplements. There may be some potential health benefits from these ingredients in addition to that of the intended garlic. I found the small green capsules very easy to take and the 2 month supply a modest size for the price. While I have not noticed any direct fluctuations in my blood pressure (my hopeful intent) since taking these, I plan on finishing the bottle through and updating with any perceived results. I did receive a product discount in hopes I would share my honest thoughts and experiences, which I have done. I am not a medical professional and nothing within this review should be taken as medical advice. Always consult your physician before taken any supplement, even the natural ones :)

My mother is a property manager at a 55+ retirement community. When she moved into the management unit she inherited a rather large garden full of lawn gnomes. She quickly learned that it was a point of pride for residents to collect and display unique gnomes though-out their lawns and gardens. When her birthday rolled around I knew I wanted to find a gnome that would be different than the typical red capped smiling faces. I debated long and hard between this gnome and one that was mooning with a bird on it's bum. Airing on the side of not offending any of her residents I decided to go with this guy. He has just enough punch to be unique and sassy without taking things too far.This arrived in a plain cardboard shipping box wedged between two molded pieces of Styrofoam. It was fairly lightweight and made of resin with a hand-painted job. I do agree with some of the reviewers that the detailing seems a little sharper on the listing photo, but that is likely just a case of strong lighting and contrast adjustment more than anything. The place where the paint job shows most is on the back of the gnome, where the jeans are hap-haphazardly painted over the chaps. I don't find this bothersome, however, because 1. This is quite an affordable gnome, 2. It's not a 'collectible' gnome made by a well known brand/artist, and 3.
