I don't even have to think about it.My daughter swears *only* Luzianne teas when she makes her (simple syrup based) sweet tea, but I had never tried it before this purchase.  I normally used PG Tips, which makes a wonderful hot tea, but not so much for iced tea... This cold brew turned out perfect the very first time I tried it.  Now I put it out on the porch, one big tea bag in filtered water in a sealed glass carafe and by break time it is ready... Add a little stevia and lemon slices... So fresh every day... better than bottled.Bonus... I've cut out all cola products from my life and saved $$ in the process.

These are beautiful, but getting that ribbon wound round the invitation correctly and staying in place was a nightmare.  I eventually gave up doing it their way and decided to double up the ribbon, twist it a bit and glue it to the band, then offset the pearlized bow and forget about the X shape... Good grief. However there is PLENTY of ribbon to do whatever you desire on that band, so be creative. The little pearl bows are not so great, be prepared to hot glue them back together because they seem to pop apart very easily, but they sure are pretty once they are together properly.Printing was insanely easy.  I downloaded the Word templates off the Wilton website and they works perfectly in every way even though I am running Open Office for Mac instead of Word - It integrated seamlessly and produced a perfect invitation on my laser printer..  I was very pleased with the printed invitations.  They all turned out great.  I tried using Wilton's online template, but I found it fiddly to work with and unreliable in printing... the Word templates were so much easier.Be aware that the little pearl poking up inside your envelope will raise the postage quite a bit because they need special handling and can't go through the machine... but the happy part of this, is that the post office has some gorgeous wedding stamps that are the exact amount you will need for this size/shape/weight of envelope.

I bought these (and the large sized barrette too) on the recommendation of my daughter because metal barrettes break my hair so easily.  Out of the two sizes I purchased, I prefer these small ones better just because they are so versatile and really do hold quite a bit of hair... I have long hair that I pull the front up and clip at the back crown of my head.  It turns out perfect with these.I am middle aged and even though these barettes are good for children, they look great on a woman of my age too...Classic look, very pretty. (see my uploaded photo) .. No breakage that I have noticed.Bottom line... They are quite soft and pliable... hold well without any pinching or pulling or breaking. My hair stays in place and managed all day long.

The best part of this set is that silicone mat, I've never used one before, but in my mind it ought to be an essential item for every glue gun... I had dozens of little bows and flowers and ribbons and organza bags to decorate as wedding favors.  I glued the flowers and the bows and laid them on that mat.. they cooled there so nicely and didn't stick.  Then I rolled the mat into a tube and put it inside each little organza bag so we could glue it all together with no mess and no fuss and no sticking to themselves.  They looked great... easy and fast.  We did the whole wedding decorations and items very quickly with very little mess.  But I could have used two of those mats (grin)This is a nice medium sized gun that has a precision trigger and gets really hot.  So much better than the teeny gun I had before.  I'm glad I bought it.  The stand isn't the greatest but it's better than the wire stand on my old gun. I think it will last a long time and I'll get lots more use out of it.

I bought this for my daughter who is a beginning knitter.  I have made several of the BSJ and she wanted me to teach her and her dorm-mate how to do this simple little jacket so they could give them as gifts to friends who were new mothers.She came home from school and we never got around to knitting, so I bought this DVD as an alternative that she can do on her own time... she loves it and has already completed one little sweater in time for a baby shower she was invited to.  It was easy for her to rewind and go back to see any technique that she had questions about (without calling mommy!)I did watch this DVD myself before I sent it off to her and it is absolutely perfect.  Meg is such a loving and patient teacher who makes the knitter feel confident in their technique and their project.  She makes it seem easy for anyone, because she shows some common mistakes, she laughs them off and shows the knitter how to easily fix the problem without any care or fuss.... Plus the scenery out there in the woods with her yarn and the birds singing away is just lovely.  It's a peaceful and sweet DVD that is good for anyone wanting to learn this pattern.

This is a wonderful set to try out the Knitter's Pride needles before you commit to a full expensive set that you may or may not like.  I applaud the company for putting this unique idea into the marketplace.  This helped me decide exactly some of the features and styles I did and didn't want when I shopped for a new set of interchangeable needles.... I also purchased the Comby 2 set elsewhere (not Amazon)... That set is also worth a look if you are in the market for new needles.I'm not going to say exactly which needles I liked and which I did not like because that is such a personal preference for each and every kntter.  Even my daughters and I disagree on what type of needles and features we like, so it's impossible to say one is better than the others.... I can say that I am glad we tried out these samplers and I do wish that more companies would follow Knitter's Pride's lead and make needle and cord assortments for knitters to try out, and play with, before they invest in a full set.

A friend recommended this pillow.  I already had a (very expensive) neck supporting memory foam pillow, but I was still having neck pain and back pain every morning because it was uncomfortable to me and held my head at a weird angle.  I'm sure my other pillow was meant for a back sleeper and I am a side sleeper.  This pillow is perfect for sleeping on my side... either side.I have been using this pillow for months now and I love it.  I never wake up with neck pain any more and that is great.I do find myself flipping the pillow a couple of times a night because of the warmth factor, but that's just my personal preference for a cooler pillow.  This one seems to trap heat a bit and I like the fact I can just flip it over and it's the same support and comfort level on both sides.  It's easy on my neck and cradles my shoulder exactly as it should.... When this one loses it's memory, I will buy this same pillow again.However, the smell of the new pillow right out of the box is horrendous... I ended up putting mine on the dryer rack and running it on the "no heat" setting for quite awhile with some Bounce sheets, and that helped.  I suppose you could get the same effect by placing it near a fan for a couple of days.  It just needs aired out.  Mine doesn't smell at all anymore.

My property backs up onto some state land that has a large feral cat colony back there (please do not suggest I contact the authorities - been there, done that, city county and state, nobody cares). Three to four times in the kitten season, I try to trap and spay/neuter/inoculate as many as possible on our fence line so OUR property and yard is not overrun with stray cats who wander in if they get too overpopulated in their colony.... We have been doing this for many years now. Plus I try to get as many young kittens out of there as I can, so they can possibly be tamed and adopted.... even so, lots of the ferals I trap are just too unhealthy and have to be put down, which is sad. It seems to be a never ending problem for us.  Feral cats are wiley and fertile creatures.I think the Havahart is the best trap out there right now. We have tried plenty of other brands over the years and Havahart is the only ones I keep using and buying. I got this particular trap from the vine program and have "field tested" it for the past two weeks and it has performed well. This model has trapped two problem cats we have not been able to catch in our other traps which made me insanely happy because there will be no more midnight yowling and fighting from these two overly aggressive toms.Bait... I just smear the cheapest, stinkiest, moist cat food I can find over the plate and it has done the job nicely.  I try to put plenty of food in the trap in the mornings I set them just because I might not go check them until afternoon.  Then I set them all off before dinnertime so I don't accidently get a skunk (ick).I have to say I love the big handle. It's sturdy and there is no danger of hurting your hand. But I worry a bit that some people might not take the care to wear good work gloves when they are handling this trap just because the handle is so easy. *You should ALWAYS wear work gloves when handling a trap*.My favorite feature is the one handed setting lever. No more fiddling around with the plate or messing with the little pegs that have to be lined up just so. It is quick and easy to set up and go.  The only problem I have with this lever mechanism, is that I could not set and leave the trap with a covering (small wool blanket) on it like I sometimes do in rainy weather.  I'm still considering some kind of tenting option for fall weather.I like this size... It's perfect for both cats and kittens.  The plate on this one seems quite sensitive, but time will tell if it triggers for tiny kittens, I'll update the review and adjust my stars once I know.  It is currently the wrong season for trapping the little ones (and just in case you were wondering, we always let the obviously nursing mothers go free).I only found it triggered and empty once, so that seems pretty good accuracy compared to some of my older traps I use.  I am well pleased with this trap.

I received 113 dice with 16 full sets and only one lonely D4 left over.Out of the mix I only had one duplicated color set.  Somehow I doubt these bags are so random as they claim to be just because I had such an extensive and balanced "mix"... but this is fine with me because I am well pleased with the color variety I got, and they will be great gifts.All these dice are seconds and I did expect that, but they are all playable and readable.  Some of them it is difficult to decide why they were being sold as seconds... Just an occasional smudge or teeny bit of paint missing, not a big deal at all.  There were no chips or broken pieces.  All the dice were smooth and feel nice in the hand.  I've seen sets for sale in gaming stores with worse problems than any of these dice had.  I would buy these again.

I had fond memories of reading this book as a child and I was happy to see it re-released so I could share it with my children.  The book is so much better than the movie (even though the movie so well loved).  I had the pleasure of reading this edition aloud to my teenage boys (who complained at first when I asked them to indulge mommy, but they ended up listening to the whole thing and enjoyed it).  This classic, well written story is as timeless as ever, and I am happy it is being re-introduced to a new generation.I feel like this book will never lose it's appeal (unlike many of the modern *blockbuster* YA books being released)It is obvious from the ads in the book that this edition was published to promote it's companion book Chitty Chitty Bang Bang Flies Again and these vine offers were timed for the release of Chitty Chitty Bang Bang and the Race Against Time.  I'm interested enough to buy both the Boyce/Berger books.The illustrations are good.  I know some reviews don't like them as much as the original 60's edition of the book, but these are charming, not over done, and they add to the story.  Overall I think this new edition is great.

It looks like it would be a good time, but not so much.  It's not awful, but it's not mind blowing either.  The beads are not as intense as they ought to be and there is no vibrating head on the shaft part.  The rotation is nice if that is all you want and the vibration is good for the front, but if you prefer vibrations inside and out, this is not the toy you want.It works, it's well made and confirmed water-proof.I like Doc Johnson Lucid Dream 48 Squirmy Vibrator, Purple, it's a simple design but does the job.  And if you like the same fingers on the front vibrator that this one has, Doc Johnson Lucid Dream 32 Squirmy Vibrator, Red has the exact same front (which is lovely) with an additional vibrating head on the shaft.  I own both these and like them both.  I bought this white one to mix it up a bit, but it's not ever going to be one of my favorite go-to toys.

I specifically got this for my disabled relative.  She often complains of being cold and achey when she sits still and I thought this would take care of her.  This wrap is the size of of a large bath towel and it fit on her lap and down her legs perfectly and keeps her toasty clear to her toes.  The low setting is warm enough for her and I know it won't burn her.  The wrap has never overheated or become uncomfortable for her and the timer works perfectly.The bonus for her is that the kitty now comes to snuggle in her warm lap and she is enjoying that company very much.This wrap has amazing cuddly softness... Softer than I thought it would be.  I did have to wash it once, I followed the instructions and that turned out just fine and came back just as soft as it was originally.  I like the fact that the cord disconnects from the wrap and occasional wipe-up is easy.  This wrap has worked very well for our needs.

I had a little Biore party with my daughters and we had lots of fun comparing how disgusting and full of little spikey pore gunk our strips were.  It is odd how much time we spent looking at the strips after we peeled them... eww[...]  The strips do a great job, they stung just a little on me and my skin was a little itchy afterward, but both my daughters were fine and didn't experience any irritation at all.I like the way the nose strips fit our noses.  I used the other strip my forehead and a half a strip on my chin, so obviously I would prefer a combo pack that would include twice as many facial strips.  I will buy these again.UPDATE JULY, 2013... These are still five star strips and they work well, but if you can find the Ultra strips, try those.  I have older skin and I think they get my teeny blackheads cleaned out better than these do, plus they added Tea Tree oil which feels really fresh on my face.

I bought this for it's anti-inflamitory properties, I have taken it for a week and so far all is well.  Time will tell.My major problem with this, and I don't think this is made clear on the product page.... The directions state 2 capsules, 3-4 times daily.  Two capsules provide 1000mg of Graviola.... So, according to the directions, you should be taking six to eight capsules per day, which means one bottle will last between 16-12 days...

This was a light read, it went very quickly, humorous, well written, with cute illustrations.  I have so enjoyed the adventure of Tibby and Fibby. (and Caroline and Wendy too)I too have lost a precious kitty friend before.  He disappeared for an entire year, and yet somehow, he found his way home, showed up on the porch for breakfast one day like he had never been gone.  I couldn't believe it.  I am still mystified over where he went for such a long time, how he got lost in the first place, and how he found his way back.  I loved that this author chose to find out about her cat's disappearance and to track her cat to see a glimpse into a cat's world.  I think it is something we all wonder at times.I also currently have a (collar-free) stranger cat who comes right into my porch every morning, eats with my cats, gets petted for awhile, then he parks himself on the swing cushion with my Calico, and they sleep there all afternoon.  Around dinnertime he disappears again, and I assume he goes home, where his owners probably wonder where he has been and what he has been doing all day... After reading this book I am planning to send them some kind of note so they know what a boring life their baby actually leads in my yard.Overall this was a delightful peek into the lives and habits of the felines we love.  I am planning to buy several copies of this book to gift to my cat loving friends.

I bought this for a 12m baby that was coming over to my house to visit for the holiday.  She loved it.The colors are bright and inviting, the crinkles and noises are not annoying at all and actually kept her attention, everything was well attached and the fabrics were interesting to her small hands.  They are easy to cuddle and carry and easy to clean.My Princess does not have a white ring attached to her head at all and I am kind of pleased that she doesn't.  Princess got 5x as much play as the Pony did, but that's OK.  If I had it to do over again I still would have purchased the set instead of the Princess alone....  It's a cute set.

I bought this brand as a more affordable alternative to the organic raw sugar I usually used in my Water Kefir and it turned out great.  I am well pleased with the results.  The flavor is quite strong and very molasses like, so if you don't like that taste, take a pass on this product.  The texture is quite different too, but it dissolves nicely in liquid so that is not an issue.I also started using this on my morning oatmeal and occasionally in my tea and I love it.  I have yet to try it in baking and I probably won't because I am sure the molasses taste will overpower whatever else is in there.  Overall this is a good product and I will buy this brand again.

I'm not really sure how long this paint will last because as I was removing the plastic (which is very sturdy), specks and tiny bits of paint came peeling from many of the license plates.  It's not enough to make them unrecognizable, but it's enough to make them look like they are not fresh and new.  I expect the board to have a similar fate once the plates are turned 20-30 more times.  Since this will not be played with too often, this is not an urgent problem.  It is not a real issue, just a minor annoyance.This is a nice big board, the elastics seem to be tight and secure and that is a nice feature because there is nothing to get lost and the pieces stay in proper play when they are turned.  I love that, because there are no arguments over which side is up.  I don't really like the 'who saw it first' aspect or the team play, so we use it as a cooperative game instead of a competitive game.  I suppose if I had to redesign this board, I would make the plates slightly smaller so that more of them would actually fit on their state, instead of so many of them out in the ocean with arrows pointing into land.I think this is probably the best made license game out there right now.  The parental frustration factor on this game is close to zero just for the simple reason that riders of ALL ages can easily play, the entire vehicle can be involved in the fun, it can be put away and picked up later with no loss in game progress and the pieces never get lost.  Easy to stash away in the car pockets.  Do not get the magnetic games.  Get this one.

I bought several of these to hang along my office window to catch the morning light.  I have had them up for 10 days now.  These are a nice size, heavy, well cut, about as big as a golf ball and the color is not too watery... it looks very nice in the sunshine.They look so pretty and sparkly hanging there, pink and shiny and beautiful, but for the most part these balls fail at sending out the prism rainbows onto my walls like I wanted and expected them to.  The few sparkles I get are very small and not very bright.  I have tried them at different levels on the window and at different times of day without any different results, so I have just decided to hang them there as a beautiful decoration and love them as light 'catchers' instead of light 'diffusers'....I did not receive any little crystals attached to mine, so it must be different sellers send different versions of this crystal.  Mine came in a sealed, small, white box with about 2 feet of thin red cord.

I got two of the Lilac in my pkg instead of one Raspberry and one Lilac.... This kind of upset me because different colors would have been cute to differentiate between mine and a guest.  The description is not clear that you get one OR the other and have no choice of which one it's going to be.These are much stiffer/sturdier than I anticipated also. They fit nicely on a straight sided mug but not so well on a teacup (mine have a bit of a scallop shape down the sides which would not be a problem for a softer plastic or silicone).  So, instead of using it for a tea treat holder hanging from the side of the cup, I have started using it to neatly hold the wet teabag..... it's still useful, just not for what I wanted it for.

My property backs up onto some state land that has a large feral cat colony back there (please do not suggest I contact the authorities - been there, done that, city county and state, nobody cares).  I try to trap and spay/neuter/inoculate as many as possible every summer so OUR property and yard is not overrun with stray cats who wander in if they get too overpopulated in their colony.... We have been doing this for many years now.  Plus I try to get as many young kittens out of there as I can, so they can possibly be tamed and adopted.... even so, lots of the ferals I trap are just too unhealthy and have to be put down, which is sad.  By now, I consider myself somewhat of an expert on traps and what works and what doesn't, and I LOVE this trap!I think the Havahart is the best trap out there right now.  We have tried plenty of other brands over the years and Havahart is the only ones we keep using and buying.  I got this particular trap from the vine program and have "field tested" it for 12 days now right next to our regular traps and it has performed very well.  It is certainly different from the older models I own.  This has some features on it that I actually prefer to the older traps we have been using. (please see my uploaded photos of side by side comparison)I have to say I loved the handle right from the start.  It's big and sturdy and there is no danger of hurting your hand.  But I worry a bit that some people might not take the care to wear good work gloves when they are handling this trap just because the handle is so easy.  *You should ALWAYS wear gloves when handling a trap*.  But it sure was nice having that big handle with solid metal underneath while trying to carry a angry struggling cat to the garage... So much easier to keep control of the trap than the old wire handle.  It wasn't swinging around wildly and nobody got clawed or hurt, including the cat.My favorite feature is the one handed setting lever.  No more fiddling around with the plate or messing with the little pegs that have to be lined up just so and might trigger with a strong breeze or a mousey passing by.  It was quick and easy to set up and we never once found it triggered and empty just because some critter was sniffing at it from the side and set off the plate by accident.  It was also SO much easier to release the cat into the carrier we use for transport.  I just butted the two openings together, pulled the lever and emptied the cat out just as easy as can be.  Way less trauma for the cat too because we weren't fumbling with the lock while the cat was twisting around banging into the door.  It was so much more pleasant for all of us, including the trapped cat.  I may start using the trap itself for transport just because it was so easy to release, but I like a solid bottom carrier in the car because they always manage to defecate during the car ride to the vet.  I'm still considering that idea.The only problem I see with the lever, is that we could not set and leave the trap with a covering (small wool blanket) on it like we sometimes do in cooler weather or in rain.  That seems to be the only real downfall of this design.I like this size... it was big enough that the kittens we caught felt safe enough to go in and get some of the delicious goodies inside and yet it was small enough that we didn't accidentally get a skunk or a raccoon, which is something that happens occasionally.... The plate was sensitive enough that we caught 2 tiny kittens who looked to be about 4-5 weeks and were quite small and light.  Normally we catch them at about 8-12 weeks when they are a bit heavier... I was pleased that we got some young ones because they often get away without setting off the trap and they are the ones who benefit the most from being caught and socialized.... the older kittens are harder to tame and less likely to be adopted.I like this trap so much and it has been so effective for me in the few days that I have used it, that I am planning to get a couple more with the easy lever and donate the other small traps I have to the animal shelter in town.

This product is certainly unique.  I have not seen anything quite like it on the market, so I was anxious to try it.I don't (yet) have regular hot flashes during the day, maybe just a little twinge of one here and there.  My big problem is waking in the middle of the night feeling like I just sat in the sun for an hour.  I normally get up and take a cold drink or grab a cold washcloth to take care of it, but that doesn't always help, and it sure disturbs my sleep.I have used this product for several days/nights now.  I put it on my bedside table, and when I wake up overheated, I go ahead and apply it to my neck, upper chest and wrists as the package recommends.  It does have a cooling sensation right away in those areas and I found if I calmly wait instead of getting up, it actually does seem to help and to cool me down faster than I would have been able to do with just the damp cloth on my forehead.  Maybe I will try a combination of both in the future.I like this type of roller too!!  It rolls easily, it is wide and cold... it applies the gel smoothly and evenly.  It has never been messy even when I am fumbling with the tube in the dark.  I also like the fact that it is designed so it has never caught any of my tiny skin hairs in the roller.  Quick and easy to use.The on and off twisty cap is great.  But I do wish the *on* letters and possibly the large arrow too were a different color or marked in a different way so those of us who need glasses up close can actually see which one is lined up, or to be able to see it lined up in low light situations.  That would be nice, especially since this is marketed to mid-life and older women.  Or possibly have the little clicker inside the twisty cap have a different sound for on?Do remember to turn the cap to off and roll out the rest of the gel before you put the lid on though.  That can be messyThe smell is pleasant, feminine, not overly perfumed and it does not linger.  It does not dry out the areas I apply it to like some of the sprays on the market right now.  I like that the tube is small, doesn't leak and would fit easily in a purse or drawer.  I will buy and use this product again.

I love my Jeep and I love my Pandora bracelet, so I was happy to find this cute little 2 door Wrangler hardtop... just like mine!!I love the CZ headlights... You don't really notice them until you really look, but it's a nice detail.  It fits my Pandora perfectly, no issues there.My biggest problem with this bead is that it rides upside down ALL the time, all I ever see when I glance down at my bracelet are the tires.  If I want to show this particular bead to anybody I have to turn it over.  I wish they had designed the hole in a slightly different place so it would either spin or stay upright instead.... balanced it differently or something.But of course, this is a "Jeep thing" and I try to laugh it off.... Whenever anyone asks to look at my various charms, I joke that that whoops, I 'rolled my Jeep', then I flip it over and show it off... but then as my friend is looking at the other beads, the Jeep rolls wheel side up again... It is slightly annoying, but not annoying enough to make me take if off my bracelet (yet)

Received this in a timely manner, with a coupon for a % discount on my next order... nice!The stones are well set, plenty of shine and light comes through.  The color is very true to my actual aquamarine ring, not too blue and not too watery looking.  The stones are very translucent, shiny and real looking.  The settings seem tight and secure and none of my stones are set off-kilter which pleases me very much.As a previous reviewer said, the bead is slightly larger than a genuine Pandora and the center hole is HUGE compared to genuine Pandora.  It shows that size difference in the product picture, but it didn't really register in my brain until I actually saw it on my bracelet.I do wish the hole was a little smaller because the bead tends to flop over a bit and poke up over the other beads occasionally when I am wearing it, but I suppose if the hole was smaller it wouldn't catch and reflect the light as well as it does, so I kind of understand why it is this way.... And I anticipate when my bracelet is full it might not wobble about as much as it does now.  It will still poke up when it is laying right close on my wrist, but I'm not sure if that is such a bad thing.

I bought a couple of these to keep my desk accessories tidy.  For some reason things get borrowed off my desk and don't get put back into the proper spot, these little caddies ought to help with that..  This is a perfect small size for pens and scissors and such.  One of them even holds my ergonomic stapler perfectly.The command strip is clear, so the surface behind the caddy can be seen clearly.  It sort of looks like the cup is floating on the wall and it sort of disappears.  So far they are all holding tight.I like these so much I am going to buy one to hold pens at my house.UPDATE March 2013... The clear command strips gave out, one of my caddies dropped to the floor, and chipped a huge chunk out of the bottom.  That one still holds my stapler just fine (but not pens) so I decided to stick it back on my desk hutch with a regular white command strip I had left over from a big hook.  I love the look of the clear ones, but I am not sure they hold as well as the classic strips under daily use.

It's about as good you can get for not being a genuine Pandora, and it's WAY better than one of those cheap generic beads.  It's pretty and fits my bracelet well.  Similar in size to the glass Pandora beads, maybe a teeny bit larger, but not enough to really notice.The bead I received is not as well done as the one in the photo, but it's still OK.... the design is not gloppy or blurry and the colors are vibrant/beautiful... exactly the same shades as seen in the photo.  The inner silver piece doesn't poke out too far, it's smooth and lays nicely against my other beads. Perfect as a filler/spacer bead between two silver beads...

I placed this on the sidewall under my desk, sort of up and back where it is not obvious to people walking near my area.  I don't have room in my desk for my purse, so I used to keep it near the side of my chair where it was always in the way of my feet and chair wheels. Plus it was where it could be tempting to others to take a peek inside if I was not right there... This has never happened, but it could, given the fact our clients are often unattended in the lobby area.Now it is out of sight but still accessable when I need it.  It's not on the floor or hanging from a drawer or plopped on the desk or countertop.... It's not in the way of my chair either. I like it having it's own spot.My purses are average size, with a big strap or double straps, usually loaded with all sorts of heavy/bulky stuff... this hook has held up nicely for awhile now even though I am fairly sure I have surpassed the weight limit a couple of times.  I expect it to keep holding for some time.... Bonus is no damage to the office furniture.UPDATE June, 2013... I have hung my big purse on this hook 5-6 days a week for the past year and it is still holding tight with no sign of coming loose.  I know my bag weighs close to the limit of this hook so I sort of expected it to prematurely fall off, but it's all good!  I am well pleased.

I have never written a review for something like socks, but for these I am making an exception.I wear a size 7 shoe.  These fit perfect.  Reason for review is that these socks were comfortable from the moment I put them on.  Normally I don't like to wear socks, but with these, I wore them all day into middle of night and they were still comfortable.No stretching, no sweating, no sliding around in shoes, not tight.  Just perfect!Love the variegated black/white color.  Have worn them with black shoes, black/white and white.  Really a very nice color blend and I could not be happier with the quality.  At $12 per two sets of socks, not exactly low price, but so definitely worth it!!

I didn't really want to rate this item.  For others it might be perfect, for me, just didn't work out.I thought about keeping it.  I cut a piece of cardboard to fit the bottom to keep it from collapsing.  Didn't look great, but it worked.  However, and this is the main reason I returned it:  None of the child cups I had fit in the drink holder.  I could BARELY fit a water bottle in one of the pockets.  Both pockets were different sizes, so only one could actually be considered a drink holder.  Too difficult to get the cup or bottle into it, so I knew the kids wouldn't use it.If they made it so the bottom was firmer and increased the size of BOTH drink holders, and a divider added, would have been a fine product.  As it is, I returned it and found one that had exactly what I wanted.

Worked perfect!  Bought this for a long car trip that we went on with other families.  Our car did not have a DVD player, so we brought along the iPad and purchased this headrest mount and it worked great!  Had no problems placing the iPad in or getting it out.  The bottom did move about some, but only if going over a bumpy road.  I'm only mentioning that because someone in a review said they attached a band or something to the bottom.  I can see why they did that and it is a great idea.  However, we found we did not need to do that.  Very glad I found this!One more thing:  I did had the iPad 2, but it started acting weird, fading in and out, so I bought a new iPad air 2.  Mentioning this because both iPads fit in this holder.  I bought a Snugg case for the new iPad and for my old iPad I had case very similar to the Snugg, and again, they both fit in this headrest mount.

Bought this for a recent long car trip bringing along a five year old boy.  It stayed on the seat without moving around.  He was able to put his books, his Kindle, snacks, stuffed animal and other things in it.  He loved that he had his own 'space' for his things.  It kept everything in his reach, and from moving around on the seat.  Very convenient and well made.I purchased a different brand prior to this, and drinks would not fit in it.  So I returned that and purchased this one and very glad I did so.This one has nice mesh pockets on each side, and each hold a sippy cup or a bottle of water.  Note:  the pockets are not actually pockets, they are placed to put cups, meaning they are 'open'.  However, my fear that the water bottle would slide down did not happen.  Drinks stayed put.  Two large sections, helped divide food and books.I keep it in the car at all times now, between two booster seats.  Another nice thing about this, is that it does fold up if you want it to, but it does not collapse if you don't want it to.  Stays put.

I don't have this item in front of me, nor can I give you the exact model mobility carts I purchased them for, but I can tell you these worked perfect for our needs.I recently took four disabled people to a theme park.  We brought two scooters with us, one was a Shoprider Cooper, and the other was very similar in size, but a different maker.  We also rented two mobility scooters at our destination, both of which were larger scooters, yet still 3 wheel.With the Cooper we already had one bag, so I purchased three more.  The bags fit all the scooters without problems and I am so glad we had them.  The baskets in most scooters are very small.  With these bags, we were able to put jackets, purses, kids spare clothes, etc...  No problems with getting them on or with them staying on.  Very well made.  The one we already had, we purchased a few years back and it is still in fine shape.So whether for your own mobility scooter or for a future rental, this really helps out a lot.  We brought the extras home and will save them for a future trip.  Money well spent!

First off, I do not claim to be an expert on car seats or booster seats, and others have left much more detailed reviews.  However, I thought I would add in my opinion to further help someone who is trying to decide on a booster seat.The measurements are approximately:  outside edges: 18 1/4 wide, by 16 1/4 deep.  The area where you actually sit, from inside of arm rest to other inside of arm rest: size is 9 and 3/4 wide, and widens out a little at the leg area.Why I like this booster seat over ALL the others I have purchased:First, it is really sturdy, feels and looks like quality and at a very affordable price. (in my opinion).Second, the CUP HOLDER!  Yes, that's in caps for a reason.  If you have never purchased a booster seat before you may not get why this cup holder thrills me.  With other boosters seats I have purchased, the cup holder has either consisted of an area with a piece of elastic holding (or in reality) NOT really holding the drink in place.  Kids lean over, there goes the drink.  Kids get out of seat, there goes the drink.  Or they have holders that stick out to the side.  Same problems along with they are usually shallow.THIS cup holder is to the side, but it does not stick out, and it is a molded piece of plastic that is deep.  I tried it out with sippy cups, cans, fast food cups, water bottles, etc...  They all fit in there nicely, enough depth so that the cups etc... did not fall over.  For that reason alone, I am sold on this car seat.That said, it really is sturdy, looks nice and from what I have been told, is comfortable.  I purchased several of these for three different cars.  For three kids, ages 4, 5, and 7.  These fit in both Honda and Toyota cars, and a Honda minivan.I have purchased other brands/models and none of them lasted very long.  Those covers are just sort of 'there', whereas with this booster seat, it has elastic all around it.So due to the quality, the cup holder, the way the cover is on (and yes, you can remove to wash it), and the price, this is a winner!I purchased both the Pierce (tan/black), and the Sailor (blue/black)

I have several pairs of these glasses as does my husband.  Handy to keep in my purse, or my pocket, or a small carry clutch.  I have them stashed around the house for when I want to grab a pair of glasses, that I might have to store in my pocket.  Perfect for putting in your pocket to go walking if you might need a set of 'eyes'.They are very well made, and very clear.  No blurriness and I have yet to have them get scratched up, and haven't had any break on me yet either.  I have taken these on car trips, theme parks, out to dinner, you name it.  I always get asked where I bought them.I have them in different colors, but I think I like the red the best.  Not as red as I had feared.  Very subtle.  They are smaller than normal size glasses, so I don't use them for all day reading.  But I don't like to put regular size glasses in my pocket.  So these suit their own purpose.

These tweezers don't work the same as normal tweezers.  The point is very fine.  However, for crafting these are excellent.  Helps to hold a small piece of fabric, or paper, or buttons.  You squeeze to pick up an item and then release so that the item stays in place inside the tweezers.  Also helpful for when you are handling something you don't want fingerprints on while doing crafts.Not much more to say except they work as they should, which is great!

This is one of those items where I wish I had known about it YEARS ago!Have you ever tried to put a key onto your key ring and had a difficult time?  This tool does the trick!I have also used it for attaching split rings to jewelry,as well as badge tags to key rings.  The purpose I originally bought it for.  I've used it on very small split rings, as well as key ring standard size.  No problem with any of them.  The smallest size was the most difficult due to where I was placing them, but the tool had no problem opening it up.I now have two family members asking for one of these on their holiday wish list.  (One of whom makes fishing poles)I would not want to do without this tool, it seriously is so helpful and well made.
Very cheery, fun flag.  Good color and has lasted through the summer.  Love it!

I just received my order today so not sure how long lasting these are, but I thought I might be able to offer some help to those who might be having some issues.  First, I think it might depend on seller, so I'm not saying that all orders received will work.  But from experience with using solar lights (tiki), I might be able to help.By my experience with the tiki solar lights:  After removing the plastic strip, you put the battery back in, and sometimes it can take a day or so for the battery to get charged.  All depends on how much charge the battery had before shipment and how much direct sunshine you have in your area, because these are solar.  Second, I have used both rechargeable batteries in my tiki lights and regular batteries.  Rechargeable batteries are the best because they last so much longer and if you ever need to recharge them yourself (like in winter time), you buy a charger.  Again, with the tiki lights, you can also use regular batteries and the lights will (or SHOULD) go off when it is light outside.  Or inside, if you have a lot of lights on.Now another experience I have had with this very type of light string, but not hooked up to solar.... the light strings I already had, use strictly batteries and they don't last long.  Using regular batteries without a solar panel will really eat up this light string.  So if you are using regular batteries, OR rechargeable batteries and do not have the solar panel in direct sun, you might have to keep replacing the batteries a LOT.Mine worked right from the box after removing the plastic.  I still went ahead and placed it outside to get a full charge.  It's very pretty inside the mason jar, and I do plan to order more.  I hope this helps.If it quits working, or any issues, I will update this review.  10/8/2015

I haven't taken a photo yet of any loaves I have baked, so I'm not expecting a lot of 'helpful' remarks from people.That said, I LOVE this pot!!  I love all my Lodge cast iron pots, but this has become my favorite.  I have been using it almost every day to bake a loaf of Artisan bread.  I use the basic recipe from the book "The New Artisan Bread in Five Minutes a Day: The Discovery That Revolutionizes Home Baking", 2013.Using the recipe from that book, and this Dutch Oven, I haven't baked a bad loaf yet!  The recipe calls for just over 6 cups of flour (I use the weight instead of cups, but stating to give you an approximate idea). I use half of the recipe for one loaf.  I place baking parchment in the pot, push it down, cut to fit up to the edges, place the dough in the pot to let it rise, place pre-heated lid on the pot, and I cook it that way at 450 degrees for 32 minutes, then remove the lid, and cook for 13 more minutes, remove the parchment let it sit in the toaster oven until it cools.I have a Breville Smart Toaster Oven, the largest size (and I think is the MOST AMAZING appliance ever!!).  This pot fits in it just perfectly!  I had purchased this same pot in a larger size for my regular oven, but got tired of heating up the house every time I wanted a loaf of bread.  Using this pot in my Breville has turned out to be perfect.  I have fresh bread when I want it, and my house doesn't heat up and it uses little energy.  I never wash the pot, as I always use baking parchment (From King Arthur flour).  Not all parchment is equal when comes to baking so do your own research and buy what you feel is best.  I am not an infomercial.  Just trying to give people an idea of what worked for me.So to answer some questions, this pot with lid will fit in a very large toaster oven.  It will cook a perfect size loaf of Artisan bread (round shape, and approx. 3 cups of flour).  Bread turns a nice golden color, isn't soggy on the bottom.I just purchased a second one as I keep having to give one away every time I bake a loaf.  With two pots, while one is cooking, the dough for the second loaf can be rising.  I have been doing without a second pot, but having that extra will help this coming winter, when I have 3 families all wanting fresh bread.  Which by the way tastes SO much better and SO much fresher than a local grocery store loaf and if you don't feel like driving, all you need is flour, water, salt and yeast.  Easy items to keep on hand.  Also, it makes a very good loaf for stew, soup, chili, and sandwiches.Sorry for what seems like a bread review.  Just wanted people to know how well this bakes bread.  I'm sure it would cook other items just fine, but I have only used this size for bread.  It is a very decent size pot that sits on my gas burner just perfectly.

Just like with the Liliane dish towels, I am very impressed with these handkerchiefs.  I purchased them for my dad, as he is always asking for them at Christmas or his birthday which is coming up soon.  He always has a couple in his pocket, and he doesn't like to use tissues.I had a difficult time finding them locally last year but was able to at the last minute.  Plain old white hankies, and not great quality.  When I saw these, I didn't hesitate to order them.  I love that they have a pattern without being fussy.  The colors are perfect.  The quality is wonderful.  Not overly thick and not super lightweight.  Really the perfect Handkerchief material.  Very nicely packaged!!I received a code to buy at a discount, but I would like to emphasize that I do not leave glowing feedback for items unless I am seriously happy with the item and that I have a need for it.  I have purchased many sets of Liliane kitchen towels at full price and I tell myself every time I use one how wonderful they are and how I am very happy to have found them!!!!!I will be ordering more of these to give my dad for Christmas.  I might just order a set for myself as well, to keep in purse or car.  Great when you don't want the lint from tissue on dark clothing!!

UPDATE:  Had the family over to swim and they tried these out.  I'm upping my review to FIVE stars now.  Older people in their 70's, younger toddler kids, all loved this item.  Said it was much easier to get on it, much easier to keep your balance on.  So this item is a keeper!!!I have the Aqua pool saddle float from a different maker.  It has a shinier finish, very well made, but can get uncomfortable after awhile and not so easy to balance on.This float does not look as pretty, not shiny, doubt it will hold up as long.HOWEVER, it works better!  Much easier to board this thing and stay afloat.  Almost like sitting in a chair.  Doesn't require the almost constant balance adjustment.I am upset that I ordered one, then the price went up by $5.00 a piece.  I relented and purchased 3 more.  Now the price went back down.  AND most upsetting is that it is being listed on Amazon, sold by Amazon, yet two different prices.  So do a search of this WOW float and look for the best price.  It changes throughout the day, daily basis.My rating is based on the float.  My warning is so that you can find the cheapest price for this item.  I expect it to last a couple of summers and if so, worth the price.  Kids will have fun with them.

I am not a professional piano player.  I taught myself, and then took a few lessons, so I am not an expert.  The only reason I am leaving a review is for others like me who simply want a nice sounding piano.  Since the cost varies quite a bit and there is a wide variety available, it can be difficult to narrow down a decision.So my take on this piano is: I love it!!I had a Kimball acoustic piano that was over 25 years old.  I had it tuned twice, but couldn't justify the cost of tuning it every year since I was the only one who played it and then not all the time.  We moved a few years ago and I insisted on moving the piano with me, I didn't want to be without a piano.  After having it moved, what a mistake.  VERY HEAVY to move!!!Then I never played it, because it was badly out of tune.  MANY years ago I had a small digital piano, didn't sound great or play great, so I didn't want a digital piano.  However, I came to realize that the reason why was because it was a very cheap old digital piano.  They have really improved the quality over the years.So I gave away my acoustic piano and bought a Kawai.  Beautiful piano, loved all the features, but it just didn't sound right.  My husband agreed, we brought in friends who DO KNOW HOW TO PLAY VERY WELL and they also agreed, just sounded like an out of tune acoustic piano.  Which didn't make sense.  So we boxed that piano back up, sent it back to Amazon and purchased this Yamaha.  WOW!!!Seriously, night and day sound.If you are into serious classical music, and/or are very picky about the sound, then don't buy a piano online.  Do like others have said and go try them out in a store if at all possible.If you have always wanted a piano for personal play, or to replace an old acoustic, then you might be very happy with this piano.  All digitals sound different just like acoustics.  But digital pianos shouldn't sound like they are out of tune and this Yamaha doesn't.Summary: if you are on the fence trying to decide on keeping an acoustic piano or simply buying a piano for the first time and don't know if you should go with acoustic or digital:  Go with a digital piano.  Weighs so much less.  Takes up less space.  Doesn't need tuning.Another reason I liked this piano was due to the base.  It has a more finished look to it than other bases out there.  Less like a digital on a stand and more like a piece of furniture.  It's easy to play, sounds beautiful, I couldn't be happier with it.

This is excellent!!  Wish I had found this one years ago!I read a review that stated if you purchase well bound books, you will not have a problem with keeping them open.  To me, that is not a practical statement.  If you want a certain cookbook, or any book, and it comes bound a certain way, you either buy the book or don't; but you can't (usually) find it in a different (better) binding.I have SEVERAL cookbooks of all sizes.  Most of them I have a difficult time keeping open.  I have tried everything, including even flattening them as much as possible by pushing on the spine, putting heavy objects on them, bending them backwards.  YES!  The Horror because I love books.I have used cookbook holders in the past, but not all, so I can only base this review on my experience and most importantly on the product itself.It works!!  I have tried it on my America's Test Kitchen books, my bread books, most of my big thick heavy books or the ones I had the most problems with.  This this works, seriously!  I will try to include a picture or two of it with one of my thick cookbooks.  Hopefully it will load.Okay, here's the thing.  It does not cover the entire book.  If it did, I would give it higher than five stars.  It will however hold a book at any page.  You know how some big thick books might open in the middle pages, but in the beginning and end nothing keeps them open?  This gadget does just that.All you have to do to change a page is pull the plastic towards you, move page, push plastic back.  Simple!  Takes not much more effort than flipping the page and having to try and get it flat again.  No matter what size book, the holder doesn't fall forward or backward, it is very steady.  Even my husband said "WOW, that's pretty cool!".I do wish it were bigger.  If they come out with one bigger I would buy it because I would love for the entire book to be covered.  But until they do this a must have for me!

Don't waste your money!  Useless item does not work at all!  I tried it in various music books and cookbooks did not work with anything!Also, here's a note:  Right after I posted this negative rating, my reviewer ranking TANKED!!  It seems that Amazon does not appreciate honest reviews.

I think I'm like many people who have or are thinking about purchasing this.  I hate getting batter all over the muffin tins.  I just don't like the mess.What I like about this: Pour batter into this dispenser.  Use one hand to pull the dispenser lever and the other hand to push the batter around with a skinny spatula.  You pull the lever, release the batter, stop pulling, move to next spot, pull the lever.  As you get closer to the bottom or if you have a thicker batter, use the spatula with opposite hand to guide batter down into the hole.If you can use two hands like that, you will find this is a dream to work with.  Really easy to clean, just pour soapy water into it, and open lever, turn upside down, back again.  Yes, that requires work.  But so does washing whatever you use to pour the batter.  I have scoops, very messy.  I've tried straight from bowl.  Very messy.This is not perfect, but it does work.  I haven't had it leak yet.  I have not used it for pancake batter, just for cupcakes.  The thicker the batter, the longer it takes to release it and the more work it takes with the second hand using spatula.  But out of multiple times, making two batches per, I have maybe just a couple of spots where I missed the mark in pouring.  Would not make cupcakes without this in the future unless I had too.

**Update same day: I received an email from a Kawai rep and he was very cordial in trying to help me figure out the problem.  In the end, he offered to put me in touch with a service person if that was what I wanted.  He could not figure out by way of email how the problem might be solved.  I do understand the limitations of that.  However,  I am stating here for others to know,  is that there apparently is no patch; he had not heard of a problem like I am experiencing.**I originally was going to purchase the Casio Privia 860, as I had a chance to play one that belonged to a friend.  However, I did some research and decided on this Kawai CE220 instead for a few reasons.  The size on this is bigger than the Casio, and I wanted it to fill the space that I used to have an acoustic piano in.  Another reason I chose this was due to the mechanism.  From what I read this model Kawai should last up to 15 years as opposed to the Casio and others made like it.  There were also a few more bells and whistles, so I figured give this one a try.I loved the sound of the Casio 860, and the look of it.  If it had been larger I probably would have still gone with it, especially at almost half the price.  After receiving my Kawai, I wish I had.  And here's why....It's a digital piano.  It's not supposed to be out of tune, but the one I received is.  The sound is off, the lower keys are off tune, and some of the chords are not harmonized.  The only way I can explain it is that is simply sounds out of tune.  I am not a professional musician, but I can hear an off pitch.  I had two friends take a look at it who are musicians and each of them confirmed that the sound was not right.  Both suggested I see if there was a patch for it, and asked if I did a factory reset.The answer is, I did do a factory reset, and that helped, but it didn't fix.  When I first received it, several of the upper keys were just horrible.  After the reset, those keys sounded better, but it still sounded like an out of tune piano.So.... I called Kawai directly, to see if there was a patch for this model.  Both phone numbers are out of service.  I sent an email, no response as of yet.  I called the company I purchased it from on Amazon.  I called five times, each time has me on hold for 3 minutes, then switches me over to leave a voicemail.  So I left a voicemail.  And sent an email.  No response.It worries me that the numbers for Kawai are not in service and that the company I purchased this from does not have anyone answering the phones.  When I was originally overcharged on sales tax, it took a few days to get that adjusted.  Since there is a limited time frame to return this, and since customer service for this piano seems lacking, I am returning it and will be purchasing the Casio 860.If you aren't into serious piano playing, meaning a casual at home user, both pianos seem very similar to me.  It depends on style of piano and what type of bells and whistles you want.  I personally just want one that doesn't sound like an out of tune acoustic piano.  It seems I got a lemon.  Others seem very pleased, so I wish I had gotten one that sounded right.One more note, one of the pieces of the stand had a slight crack in it.  No biggie but just to note.  You can't see it, so if piano had sounded correct, would have kept it.I gave it three stars because it is a nice piano.  If it had sounded 'in tune', I would have given it four.  I didn't want to rate lower because it is a nice piano. If it is working properly.

Just received this music book yesterday and love it!  There are a variety of songs, the print is big, the pages bright white.  The print goes well into the center of the book, so you have to press down hard on the spine at each page to get it stay flat and therefore readable.I own MANY music books I have collected over 40 odd years.  I have found that bound books do not stay open the thicker they are.  With books like this you really have to NOT try and keep them in AS NEW condition.  You have to flatten them out and sometimes use a clamp.  I wish all music books came in a spiral binding.  Sheet music is fine, but books need a spiral binding.That said, you can flatten this book out so it will stay open.Also, the version I received is the 2005 version.  It has about 60 less pages than the 1999 version.  It is still available as USED on Amazon, and yet Amazon is combining the reviews for both versions.  The newer version has less songs and has a blue cover.  The older version has a beige cover.  Same Characters on each.  Later I will post a photo of the table of contents.  I really hate it when a music book is available for sale but there is no listing of songs.  That's why people are buying music books.  There are a ton out there!  Most people are looking for a combination of the level of playing and the songs.NOTE: I tried to upload two photos showing the table of contents but for some reason Amazon is not allowing my photos to upload

Great assortment of colors, gives me a variety for various projects.Each roll is supposed to be 60 feet which is 20 yards.  So for the price you are getting 240 yards total of ribbon in 12 different colors.  I said supposed to be, because I actually did unroll an entire spool just to be certain it was indeed 60.  (No, I do not have too much time on my hands, but I was putting off a different project so I spent useless time doing this.) Also, because the rolls looked so small, it didn't look like there could be 60 feet on the roll.  And there wasn't.  There was 59 and a half feet.  I'll take it.If you need a lot of ribbon in one color, this is not the purchase for you.  Yes, you can definitely purchase larger rolls for a very good price.  The point is, this is an assortment.  So if you wanted a little of one color, a little of another, you can purchase this assortment and not have to purchase larger rolls of each color.It all comes down to your needs.  If you want a variety of colors and don't need a whole lot of one particular color, this is a very good deal.I purchased this assortment for two parties I have coming up.  I wanted different color ribbons to tie onto balloons.  I also have larger spools of ribbon as well.  This assortment will allow me to add more color.  I also plan to use these for package tying.These are basic curling ribbons.  Not high gloss or anything different.  Plain old curling ribbon.  If you can find the color you want at a local dollar store, then go for it.  I have purchased some at the dollar store that run $1.00 for 400 feet.  So that would be $1.80 for 720 feet as opposed to this item that is approx. $9.00.  They usually sell them in a lot of 4 colors.  Sometimes pastels and sometimes brighter colors. I like this assortment because it has the variety I was looking for.Very pleased with this purchase and would buy more if needed.

Review based on having for a short period of time.  However, here is my opinion so far....I am comparing this to the Hurrycane.  I purchased the Hurrycane for my dad last year.  He liked that it stood up on its own as opposed to a regular cane.  He liked the base of it because it felt sturdier than a regular cane tip.  However, it didn't always stand up, quite often it would fall down.His Hurrycane recently broke, so I did some more research and decided to try this Hugo Quadpod instead.  I am SO GLAD I did!  He loves this cane so much more than his previous Hurrycane!It stands up so much better than the Hurrycane.  He also loves the handle on this cane better.  In fact, I did too.  Right out of the box, my first impression was that it was a really nice handle.  It widens out toward your palm, so it gives you more area to place your hand.  He said that made it so much easier to use.  The Quadpod is very nice.  Not too large, not too small.  He doesn't trip over it, which is what I was worried about at first.  it is larger than the base of the Hurrycane but not as large as the base of other types of Quad bases.The con part:  It doesn't fold and his Hurrycane did.  So I purchased the Hugo folding cane and the Quadpod base and thought I could put them together.  I didn't read much about it before purchasing or I would never have ordered them.  You cannot put a Quadpod base on a Hugo folding cane.  Just to be sure I called the company and they confirmed that.  So that was a somewhat expensive lesson for me.I gave the folding cane the base to someone else and purchased another Hurrycane.  That one will be kept in his mobility cart and the Hugo Mobility Quadpod will be the one he uses regulalry.It costs less (than the Hurrycane), is sturdy, has a nice handle, and stands upright better.  I hope someday they will make one like this that folds.

LOVE these Wilton Icing bag ties!!I do not have a need for these on a regular basis, but occasionally I do want to use an icing bag for cupcakes, or cakes, or deviled eggs, things like that.  I am not the most adept at using pastry bags.  I hate filling them, I don't like to get frosting on my hands.  I almost always end up with frosting/filling coming out the top.It required a lot of effort to hold the bag, manuerver the filling, and direct the filling where I wanted it to go.  With these ties, I placed it at the top of the bag and did not have to worry about the filling oozing out the top.  I was able to guide the filling down the bag and use the other hand to direct the flow of the filling.  Before I always felt like I needed a third hand.I debated as to whether I would really use these, wasn't sure if it was a luxury, or a useless 'gadget'.  SO GLAD I BOUGHT these!!  Wouldn't want to use pastry bags without them anymore.Easy to use!  Just wrap the band around the bag, and loop the arrow through.  I only had to wrap it once.  I wasn't able to slide it down the bag, but I didn't need to.  I just wanted to ensure that the filling didn't leak out.  I used these with bags thicker than the Wilton bags.  Here is a link if you want to take a look. DayMark 115436 18" Hand-E-Grip Disposable Pastry Bag with Dispenser (Roll of 100) Those bags worked perfectly with these ties!

I don't have a need for using these bags on a constant basis, but when I do want them, these will be excellent!I have used the Wilton bags in the past.  While they are nice bags, they are not as thick as these bags.  I have had problems with seams bursting on the Wilton and they required constant refilling.I just purchased the DayMark 18" bags for the first time.  I wasn't sure if they would be too big or even if I should go larger and purchase the 21" bags.  I already had some 12 inch Wilton bags, so decided to splurge and buy these in the 18" size and I really am glad I did!I used these for whipped cream topping and they worked perfect!  Held an entire double batch of homemade whipped cream, more than enough to frost 24 cupcakes (with some left over for tasting purposes of course).The bag was sturdy; the whipped cream went in easily and straight out through the tip.  No breaking of seams, no refilling needed.  I used a Wilton tip and coupler.Side note:  I also purchased: Wilton Icing Bag Ties.Wilton Icing Bag TiesThey worked with these bags perfectly!  I have had problems in the past with frosting getting past my hand and oozing out the top of the bag.  With those ties, I just placed one at the top of the bag, and then used one hand to squeeze the frosting and the other to guide it.  Didn't have to worry about frosting oozing out so made the job MUCH easier.The bags are in a box like you buy cling wrap or foil.  You roll out the first two bags, detach one off of the other and detach it from the base of the bag connecting it to the roll, very easy to do.  It's like a square that is divided.  You can leave the second one attached to the roll, or you can detach both and tuck one into the box.  I'm stating this because others have asked if they come out one at a time.  No and yes.The bags are NOT like the same shape as a Wilton bag (which is a banner pennant shape).  These have an angle to them.  Very thick.Summary:  VERY GLAD I PURCHASED these!!!  Also, like a few others also stated, you could if you needed to, wash and reuse.  But then you could buy reusable bags if you wanted to do that.
Beautiful bags, great quality.  Using as favor bags for a small work event.  Each can hold up to approximately 7-9 pieces of individual chocolates.  Looks very pretty!!

As another reviewer stated, this will bleed all over your other clothes.  I washed this with black pants, dark blue, etc...  It left purple streaks all over everything.  And that was after it had been washed a few times.  The amount of lint this leaves in your dryer is a LOT!!!!!!!  Gets everywhere!!  Shirt has lost so much fiber it is really thin.  So hence, the one star.  Too bad, I like the top.  I actually purchased this in two colors for myself and two tops for family members.  Now I feel horrible having bought these for them.

Not nearly as gold as it looks in the ad description.  Has a sort of bronze gold appearance, so if you place it next to something shiny gold, like jewelry, or gold foil paper, it looks faded?  pinkish?  bronze?  Not sure the color.  Just know it does not go with other gold items you might be planning on using this with.  If you are using it alone without placing next to something gold, it might look okay.  VERY thin.  It was a waste of money to me.  Someone else with a different use for it might like it.  Just my opinion.

Just okay.  Very expensive for what it didn't really do very well.  This was my first purchase of this item, so I have nothing to compare it to as far as a different 'batch'.I would not buy this product again.  I gave it three stars because the cake did release, but personally, I have used Pam baking spray that has worked better.  Something I don't like to use anymore because it contains Lecithin.  Which is what you are not supposed to use on non-stick pans.  And even though non-stick pans are supposed to be non-stick everybody knows they aren't always.So I purchased this not knowing the ingredients but thought Wilton would be a good choice to find something that would release cakes better.  I was wrong.I also purchased a different product at the same time by Wilton: Wilton Cake Release.  I was hoping that might work, so I ordered both products at the same time hoping one would do the job.  The spray worked much better in my opinion, and easier to work with than the Cake Release product.  It also didn't leave the gooey texture on the cakes like the Cake Release product did.HOWEVER, it too contains the Lecithin.  So they both worked, but quite honestly, not any better than Pam brand BAKING spray.  That is a baking spray that has the flour in it, same thing as the Wilton, only half the price.Since I am not fond of greasing/flouring pans, I will stick with the Pam baking spray.  Same ingredients, works just as well, half the price.

Just okay.  Very expensive for what it didn't really do very well.  This was my first purchase of this item, so I have nothing to compare it to as far as a different 'batch'.It was VERY THICK!!  Almost like trying to pour out somewhat melted shortening.  It took quite an amount to get enough to spread it around the pan.  After baking, it left the cake with a gooey texture, and didn't release the cake very well.  I would not buy this product again.  I gave it two stars because the cake did release, but personally, I have used Pam baking spray that has worked better.  Something I don't like to use anymore because it contains Lecithin.  Which is what you are not supposed to use on non-stick pans.  And even though non-stick pans are supposed to be non-stick everybody knows they aren't always.So I purchased this not knowing the ingredients but thought Wilton would be a good choice to find something that would release cakes better.  I was wrong.I also purchased a different product at the same time by Wilton: Wilton Bake Easy Non-Stick spray.  I was hoping that might work, so I ordered both products at the same time hoping one would do the job.  The spray worked much better in my opinion, and easier to work with than the Cake Release product.  It also didn't leave the gooey texture on the cakes like the Cake Release product did.HOWEVER, it too contains the Lecithin.  So they both worked, but quite honestly, not any better than Pam brand BAKING spray.  That is a baking spray that has the flour in it, same thing as the Wilton, only half the price.Since I am not fond of greasing/flouring pans, I will stick with the Pam baking spray.  Same ingredients, works just as well, half the price.

My husband purchased the Lady small size pink for me for Christmas and I love them!!I had purchased a different pair on Amazon last October from a different maker and they did not work at all, did not do what they claimed, couldn't even hold a cookie sheet.  So I returned them.  I was hesitant to buy another brand as they all looked similar, but really wanted something that could handle the heat.I do a lot of cooking with cast iron, as well as baking with various pans.  I was always getting burned when cooking with my cast iron.  The pans are heaving, and I kept hitting my hands on the oven burners, etc...So my husband bought these for me and I have to say it is one of THE BEST GIFTS I have ever received.  I had used these gloves to remove my hot cast iron pans from the oven.  I have used them for cookie sheets.  And lately I have used them for removing my very hot pan from my pressure cooker.The heat will get intense if you stand there holding the hot pan.  But it doesn't get hot just removing pans and moving them around.  Long enough to cover my wrist area.  Not too bulky, slide on and off no problems.  I have yet to drop a pan with these, which I cannot say the same for regular pot holders.These are my go to gloves every time when I bake now.  I will probably buy a second set for when the first set needs washing.  I lost the instructions for washing, so I washed with other pot holders and towels, then dried them flat.So if you are looking at a lot of different brands out there, quite honestly, this brand really works well.

I read quite a few reviews before purchasing these gloves and it seems like there was a variety of reasons why people wanted them.  So my first suggestion would be to do a search of the reviews for this product with what you need them to accomplish and go by those reviews.MY REVIEW is based on the need I purchased it for, which might not be the reason you need them.We have a pool with a leaf skimmer that needs to be emptied on a regular basis due to quite a few trees.  In order to empty the skimmer you have to put your hand down into it, which means very cold water.  It was so cold that our hands would freeze very fast, making it almost impossible to clean the skimmer.  Searching for gloves that weren't too tight or too loose, that provided a good grip and help with the cold, is very difficult.I took a chance on these, gave them to my husband and said TRY THEM PLEASE!  He was skeptical, but they worked.  Quite often I hear him telling me how much he loves these gloves and how did he manage without them.So they work for our situation.  Putting our hands into freezing water during the coldest months, and even the warmer months because the water is still chilly.  No more feeling like we were getting frostbite.  I can't attest to how they work for other situations, but if you have to plunge your hands into buckets of ice water, this will help.
They are okay, but not worth $27.00.  Fit good, but material is very thin, not sure how long will hold up.  Glad I didn't pay this current price!

I have no idea why I felt I needed a miniature Bunny in a Leaf Boat.  I love miniature settings, houses, etc, and when I saw this I just had to buy it.But it wasn't until I purchased this that I wondered why the Bunny is in a giant leaf?Oh well, doesn't matter.  This thing is so darn adorable and VERY well made.  Like other reviewers, it is a real nice quality item.  No mispainted areas, doesn't look cheap.  I would love to know the maker of this item so I could search for more made by them.  I have seen it sold different places, but have never seen the name of the actual maker.It really is adorable just sitting on a shelf.

Update: one month later:  Shoes are in trash; just started falling apart.  Worse than any shoe I have purchased for the boys yet.  I was wrong, boys did not outgrow them before coming apart.Original posting: The boys loved these boots, fit true to size.  However, they have only had them since Christmas and the boots are already fraying.  Don't think these will hold up for a long period of time, but since they are growing fast, they will probably outgrow these before they fall apart.

It is a very nice top, very comfortable and fits true to size (to me).  However, the front is VERY sheer.  So I guess it depends on your modesty level.  Cannot attest to how it washes, as I returned it.  I am only leaving this review to help others who are on the fence about purchasing.

Will purchase more of these for the future.I bought these for our holiday cards, as well as for homemade cards I make throughout the year.  These are a great price, and nice quality.  Really class up any card you send.  The seal sticks well, had no problems with them staying sealed shut.Much better quality than most envelopes that come with boxed cards.

Purchased for a gift for someone who loves butterflies and takes their lunch to work every day.  (Purchased the bright all over butterfly print).Upon receiving I was a little apprehensive, as the bag was very small (folded up) and lightweight.  So I opened the package and opened the bag and I was impressed.  It seemed very well made, beautiful vibrant colors, exactly as described.  Zippers worked great, no problems.Perfect size to toss in a wallet, lunch bag, a book (or Kindle), magazine, sweater etc....It's not too large, but not too small.  Great for a few items to go shopping or to work or wherever.Would purchase more as gifts or for myself.

I don't always review the clothes that I purchase on Amazon, but I feel this one deserves a review.  Please don't slam my review as not helpful, I'm only trying to give others an idea of how this top fits, since there are no other reviews as of this posting.The outer top and the tank top portion are completely separate, only connected by a small string at each shoulder.  You can leave them connected, or cut the string, your choice.I purchased both the black and the red versions of this top (as well as the solid tank in a different listing), both wash well, and fit the same after washing as before.  Note, that I washed them in warm water, and removed while still slightly damp though almost dry.I love tank tops but most usually have huge armholes, so I have a love/hate thing going on.The reason I purchased this style was because I could wear the tank top, then toss on the outer shell if going to a meeting.  It dresses up the casual tank style.  I purchased this during the winter knowing I will wear it come Spring/Summer.  It is lightweight, can be worn separately.  The armholes are not huge on this top, covers nicely.I purchased this during the winter because last summer I needed outfits to wear that were dressier than a plain shirt but the weather was over 100 degrees and I was miserable!  This gives the effect of a cardigan or blazer over a top.  It doesn't look like you are wearing a tank underneath unless the sides move away from body, but it still looks nice either way.  You can wear the tank alone, or the outer part with a different tank or shirt.  Both are very lightweight, making a perfect hot weather outfit.  Another note, the tank is NOT see through, so for a modest covering this is perfect!Perfect for PTA, court, casual evening out, meetings, etc... And you cannot beat the price on this!

I Love this sweater!!  Wasn't sure if I wanted to pay this much for a sweater simply because of the cat, but I just couldn't pass it up.I ordered this Cat design and another cat design by this same maker.  Comfortable, washes well.  Really cute design.  Have worn and washed it a few times, still looks as new.  Looks great with blue or black jeans.  Not heavy, not too light either.  It's not a sweater that will keep you warm in the snow, but it is a nice fa/winter/early spring sweater to go out in.  I will keep this company in mind for future purchases.One of the things I really like about this sweater, is the way it looks like a sweater over a blouse without the bulk.  I wasn't sure if it would wash well, but it sure does.  Dresses up a plain pair of jeans.  Just love it!!Just to note, and I am not the best at describing clothes, but it is not form fitting, nor too blousy.  Just sort of hangs straight down.  Doesn't hug the body or float away from it.  Hope that helps somebody.
