Millennia from now, people living sustainably on this planet could look back with wonder at the insanity of the notion that everything had to grow, and with gratitude toward those who gave their fellow passengers an awakening smack to the face.Here's one small place to start.

Which came first, the oil business or the war machine that protects it? Who started this madness, the military that consumes so much of the oil or the corporations that distribute and profit from the filthy stuff?An answer of sorts can be found in Timothy Mitchell's book, "Carbon Democracy: Political Power in the Age of Oil."Western oil corporations were never strong enough, Mitchell finds, to monopolize the flow or stoppage of Middle Eastern oil without major military and financial assistance. So, they began talking about their control of Middle Eastern oil as being an imperial interest. When "imperial" went out of fashion, the phrase shifted to "strategic interest."Early in the 20th century, the Anglo Persian Oil Company discovered that its oil stank. It contained high levels of sulfur, and people wouldn't burn it for illumination. So, the oil company enlisted the British Navy, as a customer. In fact, it pretended the Navy was a major customer for a few years until it actually became one. The British empire thus developed an interest in protecting the company's control of the oil of what is now Iran, in order to fuel the new ships of the Navy -- a navy designed to protect Britain's imperial interests.The Royal Navy had another reason for shifting to oil-burning ships, according to Mitchell. Coal miners were developing the annoying habit of going on strike, effectively flicking off the light switch on the empire and all its toys. Coal mining involved more workers than oil drilling, and the movement of the coal, once mined, was more easily blocked en route. Coal, and the ease with which it could be sabotaged, was a driver of democracy, whereas oil would be its enemy.Mitchell also describes British support for the Zionist settlement of Palestine in the 1920s as motivated by a desire to create a population in need of protection, protection that would involve controlling the flow of oil from Iran to the Mediterranean. Well, ... that and a population to serve as protectors of the pipeline. In 1936-1939 the British created a force of armed Jewish settlers to guard the Haifa-Lydda railway line -- a force that would form the nucleus of the army that seized control of Palestine in 1948.Also in 1920 Winston Churchill proposed winning hearts and minds in what is now Iraq by bombing the place, to which the British secretary of state for war objected thus: "If the Arab population realize that the peaceful control of Mesopotamia ultimately depends on our intention of bombing women and children, I am very doubtful if we shall gain the acquiescence of the fathers and husbands." Such logic would no more stop Winston Churchill than it would Barack Obama.Come the second world war, and it was the turn of U.S. oil companies to win subsidies from their government to develop production in the Middle East ... to meet the needs of the U.S. military, which in turn would end up viewing the bulk of its needs as consisting of wars to control that oil whenever CIA coups wouldn't do the trick. Immediately after the 1945 talks at Yalta, the United States wanted to move forces from Europe to the Pacific, and to refuel planes in the Middle East. That need motivated President Roosevelt to meet with Ibn Saud. The agreement with Saudi Arabia regarding its oil followed. By the time a U.S. air base was built in Saudi Arabia, the Pacific war was over. But the oil companies had learned that for them every advantage lay in talking about their work as if it were somehow in the "strategic interest" of the United States.Next came the giving and selling of mountains of weapons to the dictators of the Middle East, also justified as "strategic." The real explanation for the dramatic rise in such sales in the 1960s, according to Mitchell, was that the oil-rich dictators had more money than they could spend on anything else. They might have invested in improving the lives of the people of their nations, of course, but much of that spending would have flowed to third nations. With weapons, the United States could remain the sole provider, or at least try to. It could also enrich its weapons companies. Oil companies actually opposed selling weapons to Iran and argued for ceasing to back Israeli settlements. But weapons companies won out every time.To the extent that the oil companies started the cycle of killing people with war in order to kill the planet with oil, they did so through the power of connections (even if fictional) to weapons sales. The British Navy drove the demand for Western dominance of the world's oil supply, just as the U.S. military today consumes vast quantities of the oil it fights its wars over.In fact, if we go back before history, and ask the question of which came first, wars or the weapons with which to fight them, the answer is fairly clear. The weapons came first. They were developed for fighting lions and bears. They were turned against humans when the lions and bears had been effectively reduced or eliminated. Intense agriculture, used to feed the warriors who would not feed themselves, and to provide them with their weapons, served the purpose later served by oil extraction.It was the military that came first. It is always the military that comes first. And it is the military that pushes relentlessly to own the last word as well.

The Florida Sun Sentinel has for many years been rather unique, as a corporate newspaper with a regular columnist who's actually good, and I don't mean just good for the context, but actually worth reading even if the masses of South Florida weren't reading along.  Happily, they are.Stephen L. Goldstein has just published a book, also worth reading, called Atlas Drugged (Ayn Rand Be Damned!)  It's fiction, often hilarious fiction, aimed at debunking the notion that Ayn Randian "free-market" trickle-down crapitalism can coexist with basic human decency.  "This is a work of fiction," says the back cover.  "But any resemblance to actual events, locales, or persons, living or dead, is entirely intentional.  The names have been changed but, hopefully, not enough to protect the guilty."In fact, while the book takes rightwingerism to an extreme, it blends in plenty of elements from reality.  Imagine the most outlandish carrying of so-called conservatism to its logical conclusion, and abandoning New Orleans to a hurricane, or watching a fire department stand by while a house burns (because the owner didn't pay the proper fees) fits right in.The opening scene is basically a CPAC conference set in a world in which normal had become one of today's CPAC conferences.  The speeches of the fascists who populate this book ought to echo in the reader's head when he or she later hears the speeches of actual politicians, because the former are just slightly exaggerated versions of the latter.The heroes of the book are part Occupy Wall Street, part Anonymous.  People march by the millions.  They organize and inspire.  They shut down all the department stores owned by a particular plutocrat, simply by "shopping" en masse, without actually buying anything.  But other tactics, from stunts involving animal dung (you have to read it) to hacking into the sound system at important events, rely on a small, secretive band of super-heroes -- too much so, I suspect.  A real revolution is more likely to come through a combination that relies more heavily on popular action and less on the secret heroics of beings who fuse together Julian Assange with the Yes Men and MacGyver.I also wish there weren't quite so much nationalism in what is after all a fantasy of an ideal future at war with a kleptocratic dystopia.  But if you're going to go all in for the founders and the red-white-and-blue, it would have been better to remember the one thing the founders got most right that we have most forgotten: you don't give a single individual power.  You can't solve tyranny through a presidential election, replacing a bad tyrant with a good one.  You have to divide and check power, reducing the president to an impotent executive.  In fact, one would hope that after a couple of centuries we would be able to at least fantasize about moving further toward direct democracy, and away from monarchy.Be that as it may, it's not as if "Atlas Drugged" is going to move people in the direction of pinning their hopes on presidential candidates more than they already do (a physical impossibility).  It is, however, going to deservedly and comically drag through the mud of its own making the disgustingly stupid idea that greed and selfishness are the smart way to be kind and generous.  The result, I hope and expect, will be a greater ability to spot the absurdity of the political philosophy being satirized.  If THIS is where free-market principles lead, if the catastrophe carved out by the job-creators in this book is what we're consciously attempting to arrive at, then we'd better reject as absolutely evil many of the assumptions and claims we encounter every day in the rhetoric and the policy coming from our politicians, including of course -- this being reality after all -- both of our leading candidates for president.

These books are wonderful. I powered through all 3 in 48 hours. The characters are well-developed and interesting. The story is very good and kept me intrigued. So happy I finally broke down and purchased the first book.
My husband purchased this for a class he is taking. He quite likes the book, finds it interesting, likes the format.
Needed a strainer. This fits well in my hand, isn't overly large, and stores well. Thank you.
My son purchased these. He is very happy with them. He uses them to make liquid for his vape. I wish he'd stop smoking, but people are going to do what they are going to do.

Read all 3 of the books within 48 hours. Excellent series. Very interesting characters. Great story that goes at a steady pace. The battle scenes tend to be a bit long for my liking. My only regret is that I found the books to be so good that I couldn't put them down and read them so quickly.
These are nice once you can get your family used to using them. I think we just prefer tongs. They clean up well.

This is quite a big gadget and storage may be an issue. One star off for that. The handle fits well in my hand. The potatoes fit well in the cup. You cannot use this unless you peel the potatoes as you will be left with a huge mess. The potatoes come out smooth. Clean-up is minimal. Happy with the product for the most part.

Terry Goodkind is his own worst enemy. This book plods and plods. It rehashes events and information instead of really giving you anything new. If you read "Wizard's First Rule" and then this one you can see just how badly the characters and story have deteriorated. It is sad that such great characters have dwindled into repetition. Very boring book.

Fine, stick straight, color treated hair. Doesn't really give my hair any lift. My husband said my hair looked dirty. I had to apply it several times during a day to get any kind of lift, and that collapsed within 10 minutes. My hair felt gross and gummy. Turned my hair into a bit of a rat's nest. I will not be purchasing this gain.

Fine, color treated hair. My hair is fine thus it is limp. It is also stick straight. The Aquage Uplifting Foam actually works. I do get volume, and that volume stays until I wash my hair a couple of days later. I had my doubts. I did apply too much of this the other day, and my hair felt a little gummy. I have not noticed that this product has dried my hair out. I am quite happy with this and will purchase it again once the can empties.

The smell is light. The cream goes on well and soaks up well. It does not cause my skin to break out. The jar is huge and a little tends to go a long way. I have noticed no discernible difference in my skin. I will use the jar until it is gone, but I doubt I will purchase this again.

Leaves a lot of residue behind. This is great enough at removal for me to ditch my Philosophy Purity Made Simple. In the long run the Pond's doesn't last nearly as long as the Purity Made Simple. Although the Pond's does leave my skin soft, it has made no discernible difference in what my skin looks like. This has not caused my skin to break out which is a plus. I will continue to use the jar to remove eye makeup but doubt I will purchase again. Thank you.
It's twine that I will be using at Thanksgiving. Looks durable, there is a lot of it, the price was good. Thank you.

Purchased 2 of these in preparation for the holidays. My apple pie turned out very well indeed. The crust baked evenly and thoroughly. Clean-up was easy. Pan also freezes well. I have purchased multiple USA Pans in the last year. None have disappointed me.
Lid fits very well and is made of quality material. It is a very good price. Have ordered 2 more. Thank you.

This thing is huge. Purchased it to get the flour out of my fridge, and I wanted something bug proof. This takes up a lot of room in my small pantry, but the container is worth it. Very well made, sturdy, easy to see inside, and stackable. Only thing I am not happy about is having to order the lid separately. That is kind of stupid. Have ordered 2 more of these in different sizes. Thank you.

Very entertaining book with interesting characters. The pace was steady with only a few areas that seemed to bog down. I quite liked the characters and hope they are more developed in the next book. This was an engrossing book and relatively easy to read. For me that means I finished it in 24 hours. It was nice to see female characters with wit, intelligence, spunk, and spark.
Purchased primarily for Nintendo 3DS memory. This was a birthday gift for my gamer son. Gamer Son says it does what it is supposed to. Man of few words.

Purchased as a birthday gift for my artist son. He says he likes them. I saw a couple drawings he did using these watercolor pens. I wasn't all that impressed with the pens as the drawings did not look like watercolors. However, Artist Son is the one using them. Says he likes them, that they do what they are supposed to, and he's happy with them.
It's a textbook. My son needed it for a college class. He liked the e-book version enough that he also wanted the hard copy. He says it is well-written and very useful.
Will save me money in the long run as my flameless candles eat through batteries like nobody's business. Easy to charge, easy to use. No problems with them thus far.

Works well although I do not use it often. I keep this in my Jeep Wrangler as a courtesy to those who use their gadgets more often than I do. Also, my iPod ran down one time too many thanks to not turning it off. That was a dire day indeed as driving without music stinks. It's not the prettiest USB charger, but the price is right, it does the job, and really...it's what's inside that counts.
Roll well, shiny, and easy to install. I have only had these for about 2 weeks so cannot attest to rust. They replaced rusty ones that were 3 years old. Very pleased.
Excellent price. Very happy with these. I have a Grubby Gus in my household. This toothbrush, and heads, have tamed a bit of the grub. Easy to replace.

Nice heft and quality. Markings are clearly etched although I do wish they were a tad deeper. Fits well in my kitchen tool drawer. I hand wash these and have had not problems. Cannot attest to dishwasher. Very happy with these.

Did a bang-up job sharpening all my knives: Rachael Ray, Rada, ones older than time, Pure Komachi. Makes the knives so sharp I had to go around the house and notify each family member to be careful. Fits well in my kitchen tool drawer (aka junk drawer). Only takes a few minutes. Nice quality so far.

Purchased this as a birthday gift for my artist son who says he never has enough paper. Problem solved. His eyes bugged out when he saw what a monster this is. It is sturdy enough to hold on the lap to draw. Lies flat pretty well with no pages flipping up in your way. The watercolor maker pens he's used in it thus far  have not bled through nor feathered. The book is heavy so toting it around for adventures may be a bit of a problem. Does fit in his backpack/art bag.

Hefty, clearly marked, fit inside my spice/herb jars. I do wish the markings were a little more deeply etched. This is a nice quality set, and I do not foresee replacing it anytime soon. Family is thrilled they can see which measurement is which as this replaces a dollar store plastic set I had for 10 years where the markings had long rubbed off. I knew which was which. When they cook they can have a say in what tools the kitchen needs.

Used this to trim the corners of paper for my Filofax inserts. Does a really good job most of the time. Sometimes a corner doesn't cut clean. Minus one star for that. Cannot put more than 3 sheets of Filofax paper in the cutter at once. Cutter has a nice heft to it, easy to use, sizes are clearly marked.
Fabulous. Took my doors off using this kit. It was really easy to use. I love having a set of tools for a specific purpose that my husband cannot abscond with. I keep these in my Jeep in a Molle bag.

Nothing but trouble. I purchased 2 of these. Within 2 nights one of them just stopped working. Fresh batteries did nothing. Had a replacment sent out. Within 2 nights the motion sensor setting stopped working. Sending it back today.The light output is fantastic when it works. My entire family loves the concept. Unfortunately the ones I received have issues. Very disappointed.
Product featured is not what I received.

So happy I ordered this on Prime Day. This arrived charged up. It has proven to be very, very handy in the last couple of weeks. Purchased primarily to clean up after my 4 lovebirds who love to toss things through their cage bars. They are super messy! This vacuum has worked wonders getting into crevices the regular vacuum cannot. It is very handy to grab off the charger. A plus is that my golden retriever loves to be vacuumed with this and thinks the noise means good times. Who knew? This is easy to clean. This charges up from nothing pretty quickly.

Reads like a snarky "Hunger Games" point of view which, given how poorly "Hunger Games" was written, is minus points. I did not realize this was a YA book until after I had finished it. Good story with a nice little twist here and there. I'll buy the sequel. Entertaining, fast read. Kind of over the "only people 20 and under can save/understand the world", but that is what's trendy right now, I suppose.
Fantastic price. Purchased to go with my Zebra Mini Mechanical Pencil TS-3. Won't need to buy lead anytime soon. Great deal.

Purchased to go inside my Filofax Personal sized Original. It is a fantastic pencil. Writes well, fits very well in my hand, no issues with size. The eraser is tiny and not the best, but I strike through items anyway. Very, very pleased.

Beautiful quality. This was a birthday gift for my artist son. He is very happy with the sharpener. Loves that it is so easy to change sizes. Item ships from Germany and was very quick. Arrived well before deadline. I am very glad that I ordered this.

Fits my Miele Onyx vacuum. These attachments have been doing a terrific job on our computer monitors, inside the CPU, and on the various USB outlets. Very, very pleased. They also do a good job getting the nooks and crannies in my Jeep.
Excellent quality with quite a bit of heft. Removed my other keys due to weight and bulk in my pocket. Very happy with this.

Excellent quality and look very, very nice. However, I did return these as they did not fit the rings on my Marimekko shower curtain from Crate and Barrel. Too bad because the rings look stellar. Very disappointed.

Model Number: P-FD256TBOP-GEI purchased one of these PNY 256 GB Turbo 3.0 USB Flash Drives when they first hit the market. After using the flash drive for a few months without any problems; I purchased a second. I also recommended this flash drive to my IT department. They now have several of these PNY 256GB Flash Drive that are used for desktop backups and restores. With the heavy use that these flash drives get I would definitely say that they have all been tested to be fast and reliable.I noticed that there were a small handful of reviewers having problems understanding how to use a flash drive. Here are a few facts about USB flash drives. Most all USB flash drives come formatted in the FAT32 files system so that they are compatible with all operating systems (old and new). FAT32 only supports files of 4GB or less. If you plan on copying files larger than 4GB, it‚Äôs EASY to reformat any USB Flash Drive to another files system. The most common file system to use today is exFAT, which is supported by Mac, Windows, Linux, Chrome OS, and more. The exFAT file system will give you increased file transfer speeds due to larger cluster sizes, and exFAT will support files as large as 16EB ‚ÄúExabyte‚Äôs‚Äù (or 1 million TB). You can also do a web search for the term ‚ÄúBenefits of the exFAT File System‚Äù, you will find tons of great reading if you choose to do additional research.Additionally, when reading reviews, take in to consideration that anyone can post something even if they don‚Äôt really understand the product or how it works. As a consumer, be careful that you don‚Äôt let an uninformed product reviewer detour you from making a good purchase. Notice that the large majority of reviewers gave this product four to five stars, there is a reason for this.PNY has a long history for producing fast and reliable Flash Drives. If you are thinking about buying a large capacity USB Flash Drive, this is a great deal, and you won‚Äôt be disappointed with what you will receive. The sliding cap, and Red LED file transfer indicator were an added plus.If my review was helpful to you in anyway, please click the "Yes" button below. Thanks, for Reading!

However, sometimes I just don‚Äôt want to take the expensive camera out, and lug around all of the accessories and lenses. Therefore I bought this camera.From the time I pulled it out of the box I could tell that it was build extremely well. The 42x Optical Zoom (24-1008mm) and 24mm Wide-Angle lens is incredible. For that same capability in a SLR you would pay a ton. I really became impressed one I started taking photos. Because of the size and versatility I find myself in more situations to take incredible shots, therefore this camera is quickly becoming my camera of choice when I go out. And for those that don‚Äôt understand the Zoom Framing Assist technology, this is a great feature. The frame assist really does make it easy to track your subject while using the extreme telephoto. If you have never used extreme telephoto without a tripod before, then you know what I mean (sSHaKyyy BuSiNeSsSs)!Although I never considered shooting videos on my other cameras, I find that the 1080p full HD video on this camera has come in handy a few times while at a ball game. In fact, I would have easily paid a hundred dollars more for this camera.If my review was helpful to you in anyway, please click the "Yes" button below. Thanks, for Reading!

I bought this Dell Venue 8, 16 GB Tablet (Android) Directly from Amazon 5 months ago. I don't like to write reviews before I have time to really test a product out. After five months of having this tablet, I can sincerely say this was a great deal! I purchased a few other brands of Android tablets at the local Electronics Chain store before getting my hand on this tablet. After comparing several models, and brands, this tablet, it had a clearer screen, and overall seemed to be built really sturdy. I'm not saying this is the very best android tablet out there, but for the price that you'll pay for others, compared to what you'll pay for this one. This is an awesome deal. Whenever I purchase an item, I compare every single detail. On tablets I compared the RAM Speed, the CPU Clock Speed, the screen pixels and more. This tablet best out the rest as for best bang for your buck.And don't worry that is ships with 4.2 Jelly Bean, and not the latest 4.4 Kit Kat, as soon as you boot up this tablet for the first time, simply go in to settings and then upgrade to 4.4 for free. You can upgrade quickly and without buying anything. It's completely automatic (see screenshot). I wish the manufacturer websites would tell you that but they don't. I had to find that out on my own.Another little handy perk about this tablet, it didn't ship with a bunch of unwanted demo apps that couldn't be removed. There are some tablet brands out there that ship with pre-installed demo applications that cannot be uninstalled. That was very upsetting to me, therefore I was very happy when I found out this Dell tablet did not ship with these types of non-removable demo applications. Based on this purchase, I would definitely buy another one of these tablets as technology evolves.If you feel this review was useful, please click the "Yes" button below. Thanks!

I was first introduced to the Happy Morning Toothbrush with Xylitol while at my dentist. My dentist hands these toothbrushes out to each patient, to quickly brush their teeth before sitting in the dental chair. All you have to do is quickly run these toothbrushes under the faucet for a second and start brushing. The Xylitol coated bristles quickly foam up like toothpaste, and allows you to effectively brush your teeth.I was so impressed by this innovative idea that I went home and searched for them on Amazon. I was very happy when I found that Cutting Edge International, LLC was selling these disposable toothbrushes. I now keep a few of these with me at all times. I leave a few in the glove box of my car, if you at work, in my gym bag, and I put a few in my inside coat pocket before going out for the evening.These are super handy and very effective disposable toothbrushes. The taste is just like what you would expect from toothpaste. I definitely recommend these.If you feel this review was useful, please click the "Yes" button below. Thanks!

I purchased the ‚ÄúTranscend JetDrive Lite 130 128GB Storage‚Äù after running across it while searching for 128GB flash drives. Wow, what a fantastic find!!The Transcend JetDrive Lite 130 is an inexpensive way of increasing your storage, and is a great concept. I just bought a new 2014 MacBook Air with a 120GB internal hard drive thinking that this would fulfill my laptop storage needs. However after uploading all of my digital photos to my new computer, I soon realized that I didn‚Äôt have much storage left on my hard drive. I tried inserting a SD card in the side of my MacBook Air, however it stuck out to far. I also tried a mini USB flash drive, which also stuck out more than I liked. Additionally, I don‚Äôt think they make a USB mini flash drive any larger then 64GB, if they do I couldn‚Äôt find one.The Transcend JetDrive Lite 130 128GB Storage was the perfect solution as well as the least inexpensive option per gigabyte. The JetDrive allowed me to double my storage space, and it sits completely flush, leaving no chance of being caught on something and being broken off.The read write access times of the JetDrive are pretty good, with 95 MB per second read and 60 MB per second write. These read write speeds are actually fast enough to run virtual machines directly from the Transcend JetDrive. I have a 32 GB Windows 7 virtual machine and a 16 GB Linux virtual machine running directly off of the JetDrive. If I were to store both of these virtual machines on the native internal hard drive it would need to take 40% of the 120GB internal hard drive which I would not be able to do without removing all of my digital photos. Placing my virtual machines on the JetDrive was a great option.You can also use the Mac operating system to encrypt the data on the JetDrive just like you would the internal drive. The JetDrive is more reliable and sophisticated than a standard SD card or USB flash drive because of the ‚ÄúBuilt-In Error Correction Code (ECC)‚Äù. The Transcend JetDrive mounts and dismounts automatically when you turn on or off your MacBook.I have used Transcend storage products in the past and have always been satisfied in the value and quality. For anyone who wants to add another 128GB to their MacBook, the Transcend JetDrive products are an incredibly great buy.If you feel my review was useful, please click the "Yes" button below. Thanks!

Today I received my ScreenPals Computer Reading Glasses from the seller, ‚ÄúIdeal Eyewear‚Äù. The seller shipped the glasses in a nice box and they arrived right on time. Ideal Eyewear also described the glasses adequately, and they looked exactly as pictured. The lense power chart that the seller provided was very helpful.When I first put the glasses on, I was a little concerned that they might not be durable because of their feather lightweight. However after wearing them all day today, durability is not a concern of mine at all. In fact these glasses are very durable, (which is great).I chose to give these glasses a really good test ride and wear them the entire day while on my computer. Then I took the glasses to another level and wore them while driving home. The light amber tent was very effective at softening the glare from the midday sky while driving. I also noticed that the glasses offered an additional benefit. The light amber tint actually has a visually warming effect, just like the warming filters that you would use on a camera. This visually warming effect had a positive influence on my mood. I felt like I had more energy today and I felt more upbeat.Now back to the intended effects of wearing these glasses. As computer reading glasses, these are absolutely perfect. By being rimless and lightweight it is extremely easy to forget that you're wearing the glasses. I had less I fatigue at the end of the day. When I did finally take off the glasses at the end of the evening and look at my computer screen at home I noticed that black text on white background weren't near as sharp as they were when viewing through these computer reading glasses. These classes absolutely remove the entire glare from your screen, which then causes the black text to sit flat on white backgrounds as if it's on paper, rather than a computer screen. I like these glasses so much that I'm going to order another pair right away before they run out. Thanks for offering these, Ideal Eyewear. Great product ScreenPals.If you feel my review was useful, please click the "Yes" button below. Thanks!

Autel makes a great OBD-II reader for the price!! The MS309 does everything a DIY (Do It Yourself) mechanic would needs it to do. It's well made, easy to read, does not needs batteries (powers off your car's ODB-II connector), and best of all, it's under $30. In my opinion, this little device is well worth the money, and a must-have for every toolbox.

Hi, Please allow me to tell you about my buying experience with this AmazonBasics 13.3-Inch Laptop Sleeve. I bought this sleeve for my new MacBook Air. After about a year of normal use, this laptop sleeve is still holding up very well. The zipper has extremely smooth action and there doesn't seem to be any abnormal wear-and-tear to this laptop sleeve. This is well worth the $9.99 I paid for it. After owning this sleeve, I would not hesitate to fork out twice the price if I had to buy one today. This is a very good quality product, and for the price, it's a GREAT buy! ...Thank you for reading. I hope that my review was of some help to you!

The case was exactly as described. In fact the quality was better than expected. The surface is very nice, and also keeps the aluminum case from being cold. If there's ever those rare situations where you put your MacBook Air on your lap and it's cold, you know what I mean. The case eliminates that problem. It's like having a warmth barrier between you in the laptops surface.If you feel this review was useful, please click the "Yes" button below. Thanks!

For the price, this shaving kit is fantastic. It's made from a good quality full-grain leather with a deeper ply than I expected. The zippers are sturdy. The stitching is well done. I've seen Dopp kits in department stores selling for triple the price that were not its equal in terms of construction.

In 2013, I published an extensive review of several orthotic inserts. Of all the insoles I have tried to date, the Superfeet brand are by far the best for me. I use the Copper DMP in most of my shoes, Black 3/4-length in my dress shoes, and merinoGREY in my boots (which normally have a deeper toe box). Besides offering the support I need to combat my plantar fasciitis and overpronation, Superfeet insoles provide me with a more consistent feel across everything I wear, allowing me a greater range of footwear than my tender feet would otherwise permit.

The odd shapes, and the odd bounces they produce, are great fun. I purchased these as prize giveaways for a summer kids program. Children really liked the unusual shapes and colors and had a lot of fun guessing how they would bounced off floors and walls and themselves.
I purchased these as giveaways for a summer kids program. They were a huge hit. Very substantial in the hand. When bounced, the flashing light is bright even outdoors and lasts several seconds.

I have owned several Fjallraven pieces over the years and loved them. Needing a parka, I was excited to see the Sarek Trekking Jacket on deep discount. When it arrived, I could see why it was discounted. The collar and hood design are inexplicably bad. The hood is oversized to the point of looking clownish. The collar, which is integrated with the hood, thus spreads so wide and stands so tall that when zipped all the way up, the collar stands higher than one's chin. It's a shame, too, because the rest of the jacket is so well done. Oh, well.

Because my existing wallet had no coin pouch, I purchased this wallet for travels in Europe and Asia where coins are more commonplace than in the US. For the price, the quality and features are fine. Unfortunately, its length is too short to accommodate certain foreign bank notes. I returned it and purchased from Piel, a Spanish leather goods maker, a wallet that met all my needs perfectly.

My Bogs do well in the worst weather but are made for winter temperatures. My SWIMS are great for warm days but only in light rain. I needed boots for warm weather downpours that could protect my trouser hems without overheating my feet. So I ordered these and a pair of Tretorn Wings, both in navy. I kept the Tretorns only because the navy color was darker and flatter (more of a matte). In other respects, the two pair were quite similar. Both are styled simply, with prominent white trim at sole and opening. The Tretorns have a wing tab at the back of the opening to help tug the boots on. Though the Vikings lack the tab, I didn't really miss it, either. The boots were easy to pull on and pull off. Both the Vikings and Tretorns run long and a bit wide, as previous reviewers have noted. Though I normally wear a US 13D, I ordered US 12D and found the fit fine. Both  pairs of boots have inconsequential insoles that are easily removed to accommodate my insole of choice for boots: Superfeet merinoGREY, size F. With the Superfeet in place, I had no trouble maintaining my normal pace and stride while walking.

The fur is soft and warm, the leather ply thick and supple, and the external placement of the seams provide more comfort for the fingers. I also liked that the glove extends up the wrist farther than most gloves I've worn. After wearing these one day, I retired every other pair of gloves I had and bought more Fratelli Orsini.

I gave this as a Christmas present to my nephew who is eleven and a Lego fanatic. He and I have built dozens of models together. This is one of the best I've seen in terms of detail and motility. However, it is not a model for newbies or young children. It includes significantly more pieces than a comparably-sized Lego model contains. And a higher proportion of the pieces are single-purpose, making it harder to improvise different configurations, if so inclined. My only complaint, and it is a minor one, is that this model lives up to Cobi's reputation for especially tight fits. My nephew had some trouble getting a few pieces to interlock fully. Nevertheless, this is a fantastic replica of the WWII-era Sherman tank, the pieces interoperate with standard Lego blocks, and my nephew and I will be purchasing more Cobi models in the future.

I needed new winter boots for my mile-long daily commute on the sidewalks of Chicago. After reading several review sites (e.g., Outdoor Gear Lab) for direction, I settled on Bogs. I like the simplicity of the barn boot style: no laces, seams, or tooling to trap muck or allow seepage. I also like the assertive lugs on the outsole: they provide excellent purchase on slush and ice. Though I doubted the boot would be as warm as advertised, it is. I've worn them several days in sub-zero temperatures, walking in excess of 30" at a time, and my feet stayed warm and dry from beginning to end.And comfortable. These boots come with a removable insole that is decent. However, I replaced mine with Merino wool Superfeet insoles and find the boots to be as comfortable as my Merrill hikers. I can maintain a normal walking gait and speed, too -- something I could not do with my old mid-calf boots. A prior reviewer mentioned discomfort with the side holes. They cause me no irritation (though I fold my trousers into the boot to avoid getting them wet or dirty) and they make it easier to carry filthy boots safely.Tall slip-ons are difficult to take off and this boot certainly is. I've since purchased boot jacks for home and office to limit the ridiculous yoga needed to remove them. Difficulty varies with the size and shape of one's foot and the type of sock worn. While I can remove them without mechanical assistance, it takes a few tugs and twists even when wearing cashmere/nylon socks (I have a low-arch 13D foot).

I'm privileged to live just a few blocks from St. James Cathedral in Chicago. Though I'm not a parishioner, I attend several music performances throughout the year. For most churches, Advent is the high point of their liturgical season. This is especially true for St. James. The choir is magnificent -- one of the best I've heard in the Chicago area -- and performs in an acoustically satisfying (if aesthetically challenged) cathedral in the River North neighborhood.Having heard the choir perform this Advent program live, I can vouch that the audio recording captures the sound very well. I play it every December. It never fails to pull me out of the holiday rush into a sacred state of mind.

As a kid, I was a yo-yo junkie. In the decades since, I forgot most of what I learned. Now a soon-to-be-grandpa, I figured it was time to get back in practice so I'm ready to start teaching the little one when s/he's ready to learn. The FAST 201 is a great sleeper and well-balanced. It's light years ahead of the Duncans from my youth and feels better than the Yomegas I've tried. I keep it in my work bag and practice with it on conference calls, in airports, and other odd places. Sounds odd, I know, but it's a great way to keep the mind and body fresh.

It worked just as advertised. I now have easy access in my work bag to all my gadgets and cables. It's especially useful on planes. Where I once had to pull my entire bag from under the seat and rummage around for the items I need, now I just yank the Coccoon from a side pocket and I have everything I need. Please note the organizer is heavier than you might expect -- you will notice the added weight in your bag -- but it is sturdily made and seems like it will hold up a long time.

As a long-time Rick Steves follower, I rely on the RS titles heavily. We've used his guides on Great Britain, Spain, and Italy to enrich our travels and each title came through like a champ.On the whole, this was true for the Ireland guide, too. With it, we found some great pubs, added Kinsale to our itinerary (and loved our dinner at Fishy Fishy), and skipped Blarney Castle. Yet there are a few coverage gaps that keep me from giving it the five I usually award RS guides. Two gaps, in particular, are worth noting.Rick gives the Beara peninsula an "honorable mention as a distant third choice" (p. 202) to the better-known Dingle and Iveragh peninsulas. Yet Beara is the equal of Dingle in terms of natural beauty and is far less touristy. Even in summer, you can drive Beara all day and pass only a handful of vehicles, giving you ample time and space to explore its sights. We thoroughly enjoyed our two days and one night in Beara and were surprised it is mentioned only in an insert on pp. 202-203.We also found the chapter on County Clare thin. It mentions nothing of the trio of heritage attractions at Bunratty, Dunguaire, and Knappogue Castles. While medieval banquests and open-air folk parks are aimed squarely at tourists, they attract a great many travelers and are conspicuous by their absence in the guide. We went to Bunratty after reading the Trip Advisor reviews. While the dinner show was great fun, the folk park was a waste of an afternoon. I wish Rick had told me so.There are other gaps besides these (e.g., Ashford Castle gets a mention but Dromoland Castle does not even though both are considered two of the best heritage accommodations in all of Ireland). Still and all, the title was a fantastic aid for our family on our holiday in the Emerald Isle.

I should have paid more attention to the dimensions provided in the description. This clutch is quite large. I was looking for a small, eye-catching clutch that my wife could use for dressier evening events. On another site, I found better pictures of this bag. It has a great color and texture. Yet it is so large it seems like a shoulder bag that missing its straps. If you want a high-capacity clutch, this would work well.

Based on other reviews, my wife and I bought this tablecloth for our dining table. Though the price seemed high, we are impressed by the quality and thickness of the covering. It has a generous layer of vinyl backed by poly-fleece that feels like it will last a long time. The color is not flat but mildly textured and looks much better than its picture indicates. It is also sewn in three pieces (with the two seams are parallel chords each roughly half the radius away from the diameter) so that there is no center seam. This is good. As thick as the tablecloth is, a center seam would be a problem for centerpieces, chargers, or trivets placed on it. The seams do run closer to the edge, so they may be a problem for a couple of place settings but that is an easier problem to handle.

Both in content and layout, this bible is great for older children. As other reviewers mentioned, font size and leading are generous and a great aid to newer readers. The sidebars and special sections help students identify and understand important themes. Sections such as Who-What-When-Where-Why condense key facts memorably. I was initially concerned how the notes would play in our Methodist congregation because Crossway published the Grow! Bible in collaboration with Calvinist publishing house Concordia. However, the notes are even-handed and appropriately broad for school-age readers and gave no pause to this diehard Arminian.

Having plantar fasciitis, I need a supportive sole even to putter around the house. Orthaheel slippers worked well for me. Sadly, Orthaheel build quality is not what it was; my last pair didn't hold up long with only light indoor use. So rather than purchase another pair, I looked at other brands. I researched umpteen models but couldn't find a summer-weight orthotic slipper that had good reviews. Back to the Orthaheel site I went. There I read about the slides and decided to give them a try.While not the same as slippers, and I'm still hunting, these slides give me good support and are easy to kick on and off. Like any slide, they make an annoying flip-flop sound on hard floors and have a tendency to slip off the foot if you're not careful. That said, they are cool, comfortable, and durable.

I get many compliments on this panama. Though not a true hat-guy, I like to wear a hat on special occasions. In colder months, I wear a grey felt wide-brim number (think Orson Welles in Citizen Kane) that was my grandfather's. I bought this panama to have something for warmer months. It is easy to shape so so I didn't need to have it professionally blocked. The materials and workmanship seem to be high quality, too. Note: The hat runs large. I bought a size XL to fit my 7-5/8 head, per the sizing instructions, and had to return it for a size L.

With my large noggin, finding sunglasses to fit is never easy. I usually wear Maui Jim wrap-style models for their great fit. This sunglass case accommodates my Banyans and Peahi models perfectly, offering enough room to situate them easily, but not so much room to allow them to rattle around inside. The exterior covering is sleek yet grippy, and the interior lining is nice, too. I would definitely buy this model again.
